title: ASTRONEER

review: Yet another early access sandbox space game? Yes. While these appear to be the next trend I have to say Astroneer is a very strong candidate in the category to become something amazing and excel. I'd rate it higher than I did Osiris New Dawn which I really enjoy as well. Upon starting your first game you are welcomed to a beautiful landscape of a foreign alien planet. Honestly beautiful doesn't even describe how the game looks and feels. The colors the weather the ambiance all come together perfectly and really immerses you in this game. It feels like a trip and you're suddenly peaking wanting to experience this vibrant and vast world. Just watching the stars and planets rise on the horizon will keep you entertained by just how well done it looks. So aside from the graphics what sets this game apart from the plethora of other early access space sandbox games? The actual sandbox. You are able to shape and mold the landscape to your will in almost any way you want. The terraform tool is something that puts Minecraft to shame it left me awestruck multiple times with how good it feels to dig just a simple hole. The cave generation is absolutely stunning. You will travel for miles in caves and thankfully with the tether system you will always have a line to get back home. You will lose hours without realizing it playing this. The survival is not a constant nag expect for oxygen which you will lose rather quick without the tether system. Honestly though the tether system is a great thing and takes the concept of putting torches down in Minecraft to mark your way back and just amplifies that by ten. Astroneer has a very unusual tranquil feeling to it at least for me even with the constant danger of sandstorms hurling huge rocks that instantly kill you and oxygen demands I never felt pressured. Playing this felt the same as Minecraft back in Indev before anyone knew about the game and talked about all the secrets. Just a beautiful serene experience and it's almost impossible to think the developers think this is a pre alpha. The developers might have lofty goals but they've already hit gold.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I LOVE the multiplayer aspect for this title. I REALLY hope they fix the stability with vehicles in multiplayer and address the ease issues getting to play with your friends because I was really bummed out when my friends and I couldn't play this together. There's so much potential here. I'm glad it's alpha and not beta testing phase. There is still a lot to work on but it's really fun.My opinion the gravity needs serious work with how it appears to be using a single thread to calculate which slows down processing and increases latency. Dev side of things I hope that they do make the game more stable and MP friendly and that they give that update the glory it deserves because that fundamental functionality is what's going to keep people and what's going to send them away.Can't show nothing but love for this title at the moment but that may change by the time it launches! CROSSING MY FINGERS!

title: ASTRONEER

review: IntroAstroneer is a survival game in space and the plot is... hmmm as of 0.9.0 not a single spot of plot. So as of now you're just launched (meaning you're put on a capsule and it was launched ) ) on a planet and you just need to survive. It's not my first survival game so I can definitely state that any game of this type has (or chooses) some sort of key feature along with it evolves. In Astroneer you may modify the terrain quite easily and for sure you'll do it a lot this is the key. I've built roads a park for my vehicles and bridges not a single structure just by modifiyng the soil. When you're satisfied of the location you may also place your base and enrich it with different machinery (not structures) they're used to gather/process resources and ease the exploration. A generic planet is filled with a lot of space wreckages which you may discover and loot. Finally it's possible to build a shuttle and fly to another planet and do the same.Pros+ Modifying the soil is very useful and entertaining + Oxygen paths are a really wonderful idea to better organize the exploration + Very rich environment Cons No NPC No lore it's just gather resources soil working gather advanced resources Game progressing kills instead of enhance what you've done this is worst in a survival in my opinion. Examples oxygen paths are wonderful but as soon as you'll build vehicles oxygen paths became useless Very rich environment but the game progressions restricts your will of explorating something machinery will give you resources and with no lore and no NPC why should you bother adventuring in a cave? The wreckages contains just resources which you may obtain from the machineries The evident advantage in exploring a new planet is different exploration discoveries type (i.e. bones instead of wreckages) Very basic not interactive fauna Not hierarchycal research system is just a click and select what you wantConclusionThe real pro of this game is the learning curve in a couple of hours you'll learn to do/manage everything. Unfortunately as of now the game has some contradictions (i.e. should I spend hours exploring for resources while in minutes I may gather them with machineries?) and the totally absence of lore renders it empty. Anyway it is an alpha so in my opinion the devs just tried to do a playable space world generator and from this point of view they succeded. It's also true that a survival doesn't need a strong plot but the total absence in my opinion is a con (i.e. why a planet should be literally filled with space wreckages? Bad pilots? ) ). The really bad thing is how the progression kills your previous efforts very very bad (and frustrating) for a survival.If you need to choose which game to buy maybe it's wise to put this one in wishlist and follow it for future developments and as of now you may buy Empyrion which is in a more advanced development stage and definitely more rewarding.Instead if you don't mind to spend hours in flattening terrain just for flatten it (or to simulate a road) or explore for the sake of exploring then you may buy Astroneer and even have fun with it.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Great game

review: Indeed this game is very early access. Whereas the game mechanics are already quite convincing and the whole scenery basic gameplay etc appears to be well developed there is a huge lack of content. I am not sure if the game is worth the money I spend on it (20 EUR) right now but if the developers keep on creating content this will turn into an awesome game experience. Since the devs seem to be super active and very transparent in their development process I would still recommend this game for space enthusiast survivalists and everyone in between. Nonetheless its worth mentioning that after 10 16 hrs or so you will have done everything thats possible in the game.

review: I'm giving this game a thumbs up it's interesting and the idea poses some unique challanges that can be rather fun. unfortunetly the challange drops off significantly when you discover the research for the fuel condenser and trading post. At that point the only challange is finding new research to add to the things you can make for any materials just condense 8 hydrazine and send away for it on the trading post it requires only energy to produce the fuel so you set up a few solar panels and you can produce as much as you need. the devs have some interesting challanges if they want the game to be fun for more than an hour or 2 per save.

review: I really like the concept and art style for this game and I had some fun playing it with friends. However I just didn't have fun in the long run with this game. review: no mans sky what it could've been
title: ASTRONEER

review: Astroneer can be a very promising title! With interesting mechanics nice scenery and the option of multiplayer it definitely got me interesting. The first 10 15 hours of figuring out the gameplay and discovering your first planet are very fun. Unfortunately the fun and excitement ends there... Once you've researched everything and cruised through the surface of the globe everything becomes repetitive with a slight twinkle of variation. Flying to different planets does not change much about this. Given that I've enjoyed the hours I've put in so far I'll give Astroneer the thumbs up. It has potential to go far but in order to become a full fledged game it needs some big additions e.g. storyline sense of progression greater variation and I would even say NPCs. This game can surpass Subnautica yet at the same time turn out to be the next No Man's Sky. Please don't be the latter!

review: Pretty AlrightReally well thought out game very fun. The game is even better if you have friends to play it with. On the downside there are a few bugs like falling through the map and landing on the other side of the planet (yes it did happen and I survived off of sheer survival skills and oxygen veins through out the planet) loss of items while crafting and the batteries leaving texture mesh when moved. Once past these few bugs the game is well polished and is extremely fun! Highly recommended for PvE players.(P.S. The soundtrack is A W E S O M E!!!)

title: ASTRONEER

review: Astroneer is a terrifically fun game and I really hope the developer continues to produce quality updates for it. It has more content in it as a 'pre alpha' than a lot of early access and beta games that I've played in the past and it's ludicrously simple and fun.Yes there are some issues like crashing (primarily if you're playing multiplayer single player is very stable) and some wonky bugs like very rarely falling through the world when you get out of vehicles. And there's a finite amount of content in the game although there's enough IMO to justify its $20 price tag. There are also some basic features that you'll find in many games like a save management system that just aren't here.But the environments are gorgeous the play mechanics are intuitive and enjoyable (I especially like the fact that there's no UI it really helps with the immersion factor) and the graphics and animations are styilized but fun and beautiful. The fact that there are already multiple planets available (albeit with similar threats and resources available) is great for a game this early in its development.This honestly is what I think No Man's Sky intended to be on a smaller scale but with the potential to achieve what NMS probably won't. If you're into exploration/crafting/survival games I highly recommend picking it up to help out the developers to build this game into something amazing.

review: I'm only a few hours in so take my opinion with a grain of salt. For an EA game it's surpisingly stable and solid on a fundamental game engine level. I've had one CTD and I've lost a few materials to bugs. I've also glitched through the map plenty but that's a simple fix when the entire map is terraformable!I would say I've gotten as far as the mid game at this point and I know there are quite a few advanced features I have yet to get to. That said there is a lot of obvious room for expansion of crafting recipes resources tools buildings etc.After everything above I am highly pleased with Astroneer so far and I am already a die hard fan and rooting strong for the devs to keep expanding such an already well made game.

review: So far after almost 5 hours of coop play the experience has been pretty awesome. There are a few bugs that have gotten us like a disappearing truck no idea what happened was driving along and bam I flew out of the truck and then it was nowhere to be found. There has been some fall through the planet bugs. And I've had a few issues where my terrain tool simply stopped collecting (however that seems to resolve itself if I collect organics). Matchmaking through Steam works pretty nicely but the in game mechanism for connecting is a little raw and uninformative. Once I get an invite when I click the invite the main menu interface launches again and I am presented with the same sort of launch screen as I had in single player. The only indication that it is now in multiplayer is the home beacon visible on the in menu planet. And the only way I've currently found to end the game is to actually launch to the planet and then hit Escape. There is no 'end game' option from the main menu. This IS early access there WILL be bugs.All that aside the gameplay is otherwise very stable and solid (EDIT unless you're playing co op). Performance is really good. The artwork is great IMO. It's all about the lighting and sound. Things that need detail have detail. The rest of it is filler and they make it work very well. The sandstorms are great. When the rocks fly at you even though they are simple cubes the sounds and lighting make me feel like they are large rocks hurtling my way. Not entirely sure how much content is here yet but it has kept us busy to this point and we can't wait to see how it progresses.UPDATE my friend and I have put in a good effort and amount of time playing coop mode. Lots of bugs primarily for the client player. At first most of the bugs are workable and simply a bit frustrating at times but nothing earthshatteringly horrible. However we have come to the point as we advanced and began exploring the planet and solar system in vehicles that the client play was just too buggy. Rather than make an emotional statement the game sucks we decided we'd seen enough for now and can wait for another round of bug fixes and updates. Such is the story of an early access game. Have all of the bugs we have exerienced already been reported? check time to wait for the devs. That's the way EA goes. You're not buying into a finished product it's very early access. If you want a finished game don't buy it yet. If you want to help support the devs and be able to provide valuable suggestions and criticisms? Definitely recommended.Awesome fun great experience (althought a bit frustrating as a coop client)!
title: ASTRONEER

I have a feeling it will be a fully featured space crafting/building/exploring game in the future that will take many of my hours...

review: In Early Access and it's already 10x better than NMS this game only has room to improve. The DEVS seem to be very involved with the community and roll out with updates pretty regularly. Of course there are going to be a few bugs here and there but it really is not a deal breaker. I am excited to see more content as they develop into quite the hidden gem most people haven't heard of. The game does throw you onto a planet without any information into what to do but that's what makes it fun your first time around. You'll find ways to improve base layouts planet exploration and creative building creations. The fact that this game has a MP is 100x more advanced than NMS plus it's much cheaper. The MP can get a little quirky for the host but it should be resolved in the next update according to the DEVS most recent streams. There are performance issues that also will be addressed in the upcoming update.I highly recommend the game if you do want to wait for a sale that's up to you but it's worth the price tag and the hours you probably felt just flew by.

review: I played the game only 15h but I have to say that it is simply great for pre alpha status. Clearly 20 for early access may be a lot but for the developer is also done much to get it in beta and later in 1.0. So there is something to do with other early access game developers. If you like games with space and want to experience this feeling as it is (single player) on a planet the game is best served with this game. Atmosphere is the musical background or the wide plains the view is offered to the one as soon as a huge mountain has climbed. Just awesome. I do not regret this purchase. The bug's which I have found so far and hanged me on the wall do not disturb as I already said it is PRE ALPHA and thus not yet finished the next patch can not expect moreP.S. BUY PEOPLE !!!P.P.S If you find typing errors keep them!Ich habe das Spiel zwar erst 15h gespielt aber ich muss sagen dass es für Pre Alpha Status einfach genial ist. Klar 20 für Early Access mag viel sein aber dafür wird aber seitens der Entwickler auch viel getan um es in Beta und später in 1.0 zu bekommen. Also es tut sich was in gegensatz zu so mach anderen Early Access Spielentwicklern. Wer Spiele mag die mit Weltraum zutun haben und mal dieses Gefühl erleben möchte wie es ist allein (Single Player) auf einen Planet zusein der ist mit diesem Spiel bestens bedient. Atmosphäre sei es durch die Musikalische untermalung oder der weiten Ebenen der Ausblick dem einen geboten wird sobald man einen gewaltigen Berg erklommen hat. Einfach genial. Ich bereue diesen Kauf nicht. Die Bug s die ich bis jetzt gefunden und mir an die Wand gehängt habe stören nicht da ich wie bereits sagte es ist PRE ALPHA und damit noch lange nicht fertig kann den nächsten Patch schon garnicht mehr erwartenP.S. KAUFEN LEUTE!!!P.P.S Wer Schreibfehler findet darf diese behalten!

review: I had a lot of fun faffing about with this. But presently at least that is all it has to offer.I'd not call this a game i'd call this a play scape. We can play games of imagination in it but it is not itself a game to play really. You go to other planets because they are there. You work the crafting system because it is there.But presently it's like early days of minecraft as a play scape place to faff about but lacking the personal creative building aspects of minecraft.There is only "exploration." But without a need to as i said you go out to see what is there just because you choose to not because there is any need/game drive to. It s just for personal sightseeing. However there is not much of anything to find out there yet beyond terrain palette swaps mostly. As a play scape it s kind a cool. For $20 and 28 hours of enjoyment I m not going to complain about &lt $1/hr entertainment costs. Ran smooth though kind a low FPS for its visual fidelity and didn t crash for extended play sessions. But do be warned it s not likely going to feel like a game as it has little to no driving systems or goals to achieve. Comes off bit more as a tech demo than a game if you see what I mean. And until significant content updates come along I can t say I m likely to log any more hours in it.As i can't say what kind of game it wants to be and as more of a tech demo than game i can't really recommend it.But will get back to this as things progress.

review: Good Times for a Short Time This game took over my life for a day but for one day only There just isn't much to do yet. I spent my time running around a planet doing the following gathering one of 10 crafting materials finding researchable blocks or orbs of materials underneath plants in the caves using the crafting materials to build the best equipment for gathering building a self sustaining base with batteries solar panles and wind turbines Then I built the best ship in the game and travelled to another planet. and repeated the list. But once I had researched all that there was to craft from the first planet all I found myself doing on the new planet was trying to a better layout for the base. There was no drive to continue playing anymore. I had everything.It took me roughly 8 hours and some change to get all that there was to offer at this stage of development. I recommend this game if you want to waste a good day just exploring and researching and playing with the cool tools you can make to gather and explore better. I didn't ask any friends to play with me because I wanted to be sure that it was fun before I forced them to buy it and by the time I was ready to go ask them to snag a copy. I burnt out. My hopes is that in a future update there is more to do. The exploring and gathering is actually the most fun I've had in any such game that builds its experience around it. It's paced perfectly. But there just currently isn't enough to bring you back after you already research it all.

review: EDIT RIght after typing my review a patch downloaded and I just tested it my Core2Quad issues have been resolved and it's playing with very good frames on that system with the 1050ti! GREAT job Devs. Just played this for 6+ hours straight. After trying to launch to play on my living room setup (and failing) I moved onto my desktop which is a much more powerful system. Living room Core2Quad Q9550 8gb DDR3 1050ti crashed right after launch (sometimes before). Tried all the fixes nothing worked. Hopefully they iron it out. EDIT They did and it's awesome but the controller/camera needs a bit of tweaking. Overall very happy!)Desktop i5 4670 24gb DDR3 R9 290 crashed only on the first launch. Never again after that in six hours of playing.Overall this is a very fun game even solo. I slowly figured out how to play as I went along eventually building a rover then skipping the truck and shuttle for a Spaceship. Launched and landed on several planets all very different looking but like NMS samey. There are no enemies to fight just a few plants that spew poison clouds (but can still kill you). There's grass to be mowed and collected for use in generators and there are many options to provide power and oxygen. You'll struggle at first but it's a fun struggle. I've had a lot of fun for 6 hours and the game is worth 20 dollars for sure. That said I played NMS for 60+ hours and I honestly really like that game for what it is and similarly enjoyed GRAV for many hours. This game feels like a cross between No Man's Sky GRAV and Scrap Mechanics and in some ways is better than all. NMS has more polish and feels like a more living universe maybe. And GRAV's combat is a bit more fun. But the environmental effects and hazards make this game a lot of fun. There will be tense moments. It definitely feels like an early access indie game. But in a good way.It seems the devs patched some things right off the bat (none of which helped my situation at first) and hopefully we'll see that continue in the coming days and months. (EDIT There was a patch waiting as I wrote this review that resolved my issues amazing job Devs.)I'm giving it a thumbs up but steer clear if you're running an AMD CPU for now. I hear there are some problems with those currently. However my AMD GPU had no issues running very nicely with my i5.Even though the game is simple looking graphically it seems to be proceedually generated (the two starting planets I tested were quite different) so the look of the game from trailers fool you into thinking the system demands won't be high. I expect there's a lot going on beneath the surface. No pun intended. I experienced a lot of frame loss especially on new planets and when my base got pretty large. I feel that on a game this simple looking (no/barely textures) it shoudln't be hard to run at max but again there's a lot going on and weather effects etc probably hamper that. Unreal Engine is notoriously a glutton for resources besides. (Re ARK.) Hopefully we'll see some better optimization soon. (Typically I was getting 40 80 FPS at 1440p though and the slow down wasn't enough to frustrate me much as it only happened rarely. It's very colorful the music is a great match for the feel and look of the game and the audio fx are suitably cool silly and spacey as well. I quite like it so far going to try to talk my gf into playing with me tomorrow now that the Core2Quad issues have been fixed.Good job devs. I'd love to see some creatures to fight and some silly/fun weapons perhaps a monitary system or something to save for in the long run. I found that the drill for the truck really doesn't do a hell of a lot compared to your own multitool and it fell off my truck a lot. At any rate I love it so far and can't wait to play multiplayer. I will certainy be putting many more hours into this little gem!

review: As I was playing Astroneer I was thinking about a million things i wanted to put in my review for the game. hear me out here i understand this game is currently in pre alpha but let me start by saying the amount of content currently in the game is very underwheling... but considering that this still IS a PRE ALPHA game its really impressive.Theres alot of potential in this game and as i was playing it gradually became more and more clear that this game has alot of work to be done yes there are bugs here and there but nothing TOO gamechanging. A few examples of some bugs i came across are things going through the floor (RARE) player going through the floor (not so rare lol) everything about the "drill head" and this one time when i built a smelter right on top of my big pile of things they all despawned and i was immidiately sad JUST TO NAME A FEW.PROS (even though its in pre alpha) everything feels clean cut and nice.quality single player experiencecoop works exactly how youd want it to no bscrafting system works goodrewarding and addictingthe whole conceptCONScontent (obviously... not even a con really)bugs are to be expectedlag spikes when entering planets and sitting in anything at all trucks shuttles whateverthat drill head attachment honestly all in all i think this game is just an amazing idea that has been put into the works that just needs that extra push to go from a good game to a great game. i hope the devs dont let this die because ive seen such good ideas for good video games fall into the wrong hands with garbage developers. to be honest i dont know who these devs are i probably shouldve checked before i made this but take good care of this idea. if youre reading this astroneer will go as far as you want it to goi really really enjoyed this game so far and i hope that the developers use all their success wisely since this game has become increasingly popular in steam this game can be the new big thing forsure....genuinely excited to see where this game goes

review: Hot on the heels of the hot mess that was No Man's Sky Astroneer aims to be in part what NMS claimed it would be. The difference between these two games is that Astroneer states what it plans to be as a game and then promptly meets those goals.A rather delightful little game Astroneer invokes the serene and peaceful atmosphere of Minecraft through excellent musical pieces while boasting its own adorable isometric art style that is capable of a quite surprising beauty. Only close to five hours in I've spent most of these hours on one singular save file and played both solo and with a friend. Both experiences were enjoyable and the game in its current state is a very promising sign for the future its heading in.It should be noted in my experience anyway that the game isn't particularly challenging by any means. Arguably the most challenging thing about Astroneer so far is inventory management because the backpack has very few slots to begin with and if you equip a battery and an oxygen tank the way I did for extra exploring freedom in small doses you have even less space to play with. The game also doesn't appear to offer a great deal of diversity presently or perhaps I was just generated a terrible planet with one singular dust storm that likes to blow by every now and then sometimes throwing a rock in my face in the process. Environmental hazards trip you up once and then never do so again unless you simply fail to notice them. Being able to shape terrain at your whim is an incredibly fun mechanic but it does lend itself to leaving you a lot of power over the environment and thus nullifying any threats of the environment as you learn how to avoid them. (Which normally involves just digging the whatever it is up and stealing its Research nodule.) Astroneer is a fun game. It's full of a good potential and carries an endearing charm even in its current state and I was able to happily spend two to three hours in one session alone with my partner just seeing what we could build where we could go and what we could break. (Tethers are your best friend if you want to move heavy and large objects. Trust.) I would hesitate against recommending it for its current price tag because it is a little repetitive and as much fun as I have with it I don't feel like the game has enough features to boast about for it to warrant being so expensive. That and it's also early access and regardless of how much I like a title I would always hesitate to recommend purchasing an early access game these days.But is Astroneer a bad game? No. No not at all. It's a lovely little game full of promise and charm and once it has just a bit more content to help bulk out the experience it will come with my full recommendations completely.

review: Astroneer is what you should expect from a modern sandbox exploration game. It's as much a survival game as survival mode Minecraft which is to say not really that much about survival at all and more about the experience of exploring the environment and building up your base. As of writing this review the game is still in early access a fact which is reflected in the longevity of the experience. If you're looking for something to play for a very long time with the expectation of having a lot of new tech to build then maybe hold off on buying until later in the development cycle as the sense of progression does kind of flatline after you build every structure and vehicle to your liking.Despite the genuine fun I've had going on expeditions for extra resources there isn't much to do in the current lategame with the collected surplus. I feel as if I've discovered most of what the game has to offer but it definitely leaves me wanting more which can only be a good thing for an unfinished game.I should note that I have not had any experience with multiplayer.

review: Astroneer 9/10Note This game is in a pre alpha state and may change blah blah blah.Astroneer is an intresting game which includes blueprints multiplayer vehichles exploration of a randomly generated open word solar system mining which can lead to rinse and repeat weather an intresting power and oxygen system with tethers and base building.The game consists of four characters to start off as including 2 skinny white space suits looking slightly diffrent a larger whit space suit and a larger orange space suit. Upon choosing your character you will launchoff what seems to be a space station onto an empty planet with only remanents of satelites and dead astroneers who came here before you. After being shown the controls quickly you will most like come across compound or resin (resin is used for base expansion while compound is used for crafting most of the in game objects.) after coming across these ores you will probably expand your base and begin improving. After so much time you will most likely have a research station which can get materials and blueprints when given unkown objects. There are many thing to research such as a winch oxygen tank drill shuttle seats rover battery generators filter dynamite etc. You can either make these objects at a printer or a vehichle bay which you have made. To make objects such as these you must collect copper alluminum which have been given diffrfrent names in their raw and materials like that to smelt. you can encounter storms which hurl rocks around and are one of the four current ways to die (the other three are falling poison gas and spikes.) You can create walls go inside a cavern or enter a vehichle/ habitat to survive but these storms do not last long. You can also obtain energy for yourself and modules you have made by catching wind or the sun by using the appropriate machine. The current goal in this game is to survive and expand. In caverns you might come across plants which spit poison gas spike you or just sit there luckely the plants are easy to identify from each other giving you a warning. thanks for reading my current review and sorry for putting things out the second they pop in my head.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Right now this game has a lot of issues/bugs to be fixed. And as such not everybody would be willing to buy the game. The game idea is awesome and from what ive heard and what is being speculated this game should have an awesome future.But again the current game state is not all rainbow and stars it has massive frame drop issues that need fixing. Im sure that the devs are working on it and im patient enough. Would i recommend this game sure. Note that the game doesnt have much to unlock and explore as of now (can finish pretty much everything within a couple of hours even found a zebra ball).So if you have the patience to wait for the issues to be fixed sure buy it. If not just wait for beta. Great game though.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This game feels very unique and overall just a pleasure to play. LET ME STRESS I WILL NOT COMPARE THIS TO NO MAN'S SKY THEY ARE VERY DIFFERENT GAMES. (Though on a general level I enjoyed Astroneer much more).Pros Dynamic unique enviorments. Runs and feels very smooth. I encountered NO bugs on a pre alpha. Beautiful soundtrack that REALLY captures the feel of adventuring in space. Tons of planets to explore. Very nice Devs if you guys see this then good job ) A day/night cycle that gives the game life. Overall very fun and entertaining.Cons In its current state there is not very much content actually here. (But the content that is present is amazing). The building system sucks it usually builds to a place very headache inducing and you can only build little platforms. (YOU CAN'T BUILD BASES) WTF. Although to be fair you can shelter inside of your landed ship or dig a cave and put stuff in it. To explore until you get a rover you have to string up teathers which gets SO boring. Not much to actually craft and build. Only a tiny amount of rescources to collect and use. Micromanage powering systems up constantly. Rover control is trash. For the current lack of content the $20 price tag is a bit steep.Neutral Factors There is no hand holding you have to figure everything out for yourself. There is a menu that shows controls but nothing about how the game works. Some people prefer this and some hate it but it's important you know you'll be self taught. You will spend a lot of time micromanaging your series of platforms.Notes To add or fill to a terrain hold alt. This will save you so many headaches.

review: Astroneer is a game of exploration and base bulding. You can travel to different planets and find really cool things they have hidden within them. You can build lunar rovers to drive around and you can build shuttles to travel to the other planets. You can do complete terraforming of those planets meaning you can remove add or flatten the ground. My experiences with it have been much fun and enjoyment. Being an Early Access game of course it has bugs glitches and other issues sometimes but it's still being developed. I'm not upset over the problems because like i said they're still working on it. The look of the game while playing is beautiful and to not have a full fledged gaming computer it plays great for me. I highly recommend it to people that like games similar to Astroneer. To me it is well worth the money and time invested playing it. I've always wanted to play a game like this and thank you to System Era for creating it!

review: For an Early Access release the game has a lot for you to do which is nice having played many games from Early Access on Steam. Framerate does seem to be an issue after playing for a while but from what I've seen it has to do with placing tons of Tethers down in the game (They keep you connected to your base so you have constant O2 supply). Simple fix is just use them early on to find cave systems and spelunk a bit till you can build yourself a vehicle. I haven't gotten far enough yet to travel to other planets but my 4 hours on the starting one have been amazing. The random sandstorms that hit are tense if you happen to be a bit far from base making you scramble either for a nearby cave system or digging a hole and jumping in. Overall for the initial release this game was nicely polished which surprised me. Controls for a game are probably the weirdest aspect of the game vehicles especially but it's not at all hard to adapt. I should say I haven't tried it with controller just yet. If you have 20 dollars to burn and want a more peaceful look at a survival game Astroneer is mighty fine right out of the gate.

review: Product received for free. Firstly I did recieve this game as a gift from a friend of mine. Take that as you will. If you don't wish to read the whole thing here is the short version. Like exploring? Mining? Minor Crafting? Well buy it. Personally I recommend it if you like those 3 things especially if it involves space exploration.In the games current state I would say ask yourself if it's worth it. As you can see the game is in it's Pre Alpha stage meaning bugs here and there and lack of content. I also recommend if you do get it to have some friends to play it with cause while playing it alone can be a relaxing experience playing it with friends is one of the better experiences I have had with it. While lately the new content in updates has been minor if any at all but as someone who went through a year of game design and programming it is not an easy task to make a game. The work the team is getting done is making the game a more enjoyable experience. My cousin and I got this game a few months ago deciding it would be worth supporting (We are both huge fans of space exploration) so when we got it we instantly fell in love with the art style. The songs that play are quite enjoyable as well and really add the the immersion of the game. Now to wrap up my rambling here are some features currently present in the gameFeatures Exploration Crafting(Simple crafting but still) Mining Online Co op(Up to 3 other people) Terrain adjustment(can also be included with mining)Now while that may seem like a list of things you would do in Minecraft this game I feel provides a more relaxed atmospheric experience also a major component of my enjoyment came from the ability to explore different planets.So again it is all on you do you want to support a Pre Alpha space exploration game If yes buy it if no don't if you still aren't sure watch the videos or look up some online. Get an idea of what goes on in the game before making the decision to support it and again it is much more enjoyable with friends.
title: ASTRONEER

review: What a wonderful little gem! It has a beautiful art style playful audio and a child like sense of wonderous exploration on a planet you gradually come to call home. There's just something lovely about cooperative exploration and building.It IS still early in its development cycle so you'll likely cap out at some point having seen all the in game content so far. Do yourself a favour and pace your gameplay. This is a great proof of concept but it's shallow at the moment.

review: Unfortunately there's no escape from comparing this game to No Man's Sky so I'll just go ahead and say that yes I've enjoyed Astroneer a lot more than No Man's Sky from what little I've played of both games. The fact that this game ran fairly smooth despite being in pre alpha on my computer is a big plus.A few issues that I have with the game in its current state as of 19th Dec 2016 This is acknowledged by the devs but rover handling is fairly awkward and tends to spazz out occasionally. A single rover is easy enough to flip back if you mess up however if you ever decide to hook multiple rovers together like Mark Watney did in The Martian then you better make sure you drive as carefully as Mark Watney in The Martian otherwise you might find yourself dismounting every 30 seconds to flip your trailer back. Building is awkward to place and snapping is a bit erratic. I also don't think there are any ways to demolish a building once it's built in the current version so some level of pre planning is required. Some of the automatic snapping can also get annoying. For example I like to attach solar panel to the front slot on my rover however if I drive my rover's front end close to the vehicle bay the game automatically detaches the solar panel to make room for recharge cable. A minor inconvenience but a still annoying. Some of the early game materials are a bit luck based to go longer distances you want a rover which requires a vehicle bay which requires 2 aluminum easiest way to get aluminum in very early game is from spaceship wreckage however wrecks tend to be a bit spread out so if the two wrecks closest to you don't contain the 2 aluminum you need then you'll just have to build a long tether chain to get to the far away wrecks.That's about all the bigger issues I have with this game in its current stage as far as I'm aware the devs are fairly engaged with the fan base so it's quite likely that these issues will go away in future builds. For the moment I have to say I've had fun with this game. If I'm being absolutely honest here its current content alone cannot justify its current price tag however from what I've seen of the devs this game likely will reach a satisfactory level of completion in a reasonable time frame and I am cautiously optimistic about its future.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Even though the game crashes for me like every 15min this game is Awesome! I haven't come that far in to it but so far with everything you can explore... its really amazing. You should give it a try but wait untill it gets more stable.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I'm writing my first steam review in 7 years of using steam because of this game. I got Astroneer 3 days ago and already have 25+ hours logged. The game feels a lot like the alpha stages of minecraft. There is huge potential here and the game already has tons of fun content. The terrain deformation and manipulation is amazing and is hardly ever buggy. The Oxygen and Power mechanics work cleanly as well.Yes the game is in pre alpha. There are a lot of bugs. Multiplayer is unplayable on other planets. Your save file could be corrupted in multiplayer and become unplayable (maybe temporarly). Vehicles sometimes hilariously flip 8 times and launch into the sky never to come back. Despite all that it's the only thing I wanna do. In addition the devs are making frequent contact with the community and updating us on whats to come. Just today there was a live stream from a dev making a new discoverable crashed spacecraft. This game already has near the content of No Man's Sky and it's in pre alpha.This game is completely worth your money right now. Considering there will almost definately be a price hike get this game now before it's $40. In 6 months this game will be the new minecraft if the devs stay on top of their which I'm convinced they will after scouring the web for all their content and posts.*LIGHT SPOILERS FOLLOWING*In terms of content there are numerous structures modules and vehicles to research and build. As people have stated it wont take you long to see all the buildable things in the game. However there are also different planets each with different types of resources in different rarities. On Tundra the ice planet for example there is lots of rocket fuel just sitting on the surface to be mined. Theres a radiated planet an arid planet an exotic planet and a barren planet (the moon). Each has different plants trees terrain weather patterns and other unique details. For instance on the radiated planet since it's so close to the sun has faster day night cycles but its very windy. Easier to use wind power instead of solar. Theres also a pole with constant sunlight. These are just examples of the deeper world behind the content. Its very easy to become immersed and watch hours fly by. Yeah there's a lack of content but for pre alpha the worlds are abosuletly incredable. I cant stop playing this game. Seriously if you like minecraft or thought NMS would be cool buy this game you will not regret it. Okay back to building my subterranian warehouse..
title: ASTRONEER

review: This game is brilliant and just what I have been waiting for. Why?Preamble Well for the longest time now I (and my gameward comrades) have been waiting for something quick and fun to play rather than Rocket League now don't get me wrong I frickin love Rocket League but its been quite a while now of endlessly smashing the ball about and arguing about whos going to stay in the goal so to have something to pour some time into which isnt over in 5 minutes comes as a welcome relief I think in the Astoneer we may have found a lump of gold! Why Firstly it is very visually stimulating the graphics are balanced just right between cutesy and practical and this lends to the fun Gameplay. Its not quite "visually stunning" but goes a good way towards being fully convincing and is sufficiently pretty to keep you fully engaged from standing on a plato and viewing the vast valley below and gazing up at the stars and other to be explored planets above to wandering deep into the depths of the "earth" within the vast cave systems the visuals are pretty dam good and do a great job of conveying the experience of what its like to be alone on a atmoshereless planet although any of those in doubt about the visuals should bear in mind that the strengths of this game lie within the intoxicating good gameplay.The Gameplay is great (did i mention it was fun?) just the right balance between quizzical and testing that lends to extended periods into the early hours for "just got to do this first then i will definately definately go to bed". The bulk of which will be exploring which there is an exuberant amount of in order to progress and which is fun and interesting.The games progression rate is very well balanced in my view from the early days of locating compounds next to your base in "Eureka" style moments from which you then learn to craft new buildings and facilities. This progress inevitably encourages the desire for "more stuff" and generally gravitates towards the production of far reaching air/power lines around the "local" area in order to facilitate more efficient collecting of a sufficient amount of materials to fabricate indeed more machines is very rewarding and the sandbox nature allows you to progress at your chosen rate and doesn't force anything onto the player. Inevitably you will end up collecting enough resources to produce that mobile lander you wanted from the start and it will seem great but then you realise it needs more storage you need a trailer!! (out you go again!) Then additional vehicle tools to help harvest the resources (I will go to bed in a minute.....) you will be absorbed with the conquest of land and apparent never ending requirement for more resources the great thing is these are fun to collect and look for and is the essence of the game. Playing single player is great and you can achieve all the things you need on your own however if you have a couple of buddies and if you can get a team of you working together then this quickly ramps up the progression speed and the enjoyment factor another couple of notches (understatement detected!).My own experience of the game went a bit like this.Friend sent a link to the game saying "Buy This" I buy it and download then meet him on the planet all within 15 minutes or so. I ask ...Q "What do I have to do?"A "Search for Composite so we can make a doobry"Long story short about 6 hours later we step out of the orbital lander craft on the other side of the planet this would have been great however we failed to bring sufficient amount of fuel for the return journey this was a massive oversight on our part but our goal had been to get into space pretty much since we started out 6 hours previous. In between the link being sent and ending up on the other side of the planet we had a whole heap of fun collecting exploring innovating crafting and dying and would 100% click the link again.Super excited to see what the Alpha Beta and final game bring to the best "Pre Alpha" game I have ever played...
title: ASTRONEER

But from what I've been able to see it has been amazing with lots of places to explore and things to createJust be careful when buying this game at this stage as it has plenty of glitches yet some are quite hilarious others are just annoying e.g the fps issue

review: This is honestly the best game i have played in years. I bought and downloaded it and suddenly my internet went out at about 11 pm. I totally forgot about the game for about an hour trying to figure out the problem. After i found out i would get the internet back at around 5 am because my isp was fixing something i decided to boot up the game. I thought i would check it out for ten minutes before going to bed. 10 minutes turned into hours and suddenly it was 7 am. I had totally forgot to go to sleep and my internat was now back yay. I wanted to finish up and go to bed bud suddenly it was 8 pm. I had to force myself to shut down my pc and quit the game. TL DR Best game i have played in years would recomend it to everyone.Only issue is massive fps drops when placing a lot of tethers. One of the devs said he was working on it so if you are reading this review a couple days after launch it probably isn't an issue.

review: I played someone elses version of this before I bought it so I have an additional 30 hours.This game is an example of how amazing No Man's Sky could have been if they had focused on maybe a few dozen or even a few hundred planets and making them all unique and interesting. Everything is so polished for a pre alpha and it just sprung up with little to no hype so the expectations were nonexistent. The fact that you can stick anything into any slot whether it's a production module or your backpack or your rover it all just works. the scenery and atmosphere are gorgeous and make for some really awesome moments. I love how the planets are actually spherical and you can see the curvature of them when you climb high mountains. Multiplayer is the finishing touch and although I haven't played with anyone else yet I have seen enough videos online to know that it's gonna be great when they add more features and possibly pvp.TLDR This game is worth every penny

review: Summary ASTRONEER is a beautiful game that shows immense promise. Unfortunately that is all it has to offer at this time.In depth The presentation of this game is wonderful. Its visuals are colorful and stylistic. The sound design especially the music is simply sublime. These elements combine to create a world that evokes curiosity along with a child like sense of awe.The User Interface (UI) is among the most intuitive I have ever seen in a game. Everything follows the principal of "what you see is what you get". Items are stored as themselves attached to containers and the player character's backpack in a manner similar to a peg board. The character's oxygen meter is depicted as a clearly visible blue bar on their backpack. Energy is shown as a glowing yellow fluid like material that drains upon use. There are almost no numbers shown in the game or any kind of abstraction at all for that matter. This contributes to the atmosphere by keeping things purely visual and not distracting the player with the details behind the game's mechanics.Gameplay is where this title falls short. There simply is not enough content at this point to justify its price. You wander about the planet you start on and gather resources. You use resources to build the dozen or so structures available as well as four vehicles. Later you gain the option of traveling to nearby worlds which while aesthetically distinct only present a slight change to gameplay. You can morph terrain as much as you please explore and build the structures described earlier. That is all. Unlike many similar sandbox titles (e.g. Space Engineers) building is clearly not a focus of the game so I do not see much outlet for creative expression. Similarly once the novelty of a world has run out there is little point to exploring every nook and cranny of it.In short the game looks great and plays well but there just isn't enough to hold your interest for very long. I cannot recommend buying this game at this point because of that. Perhaps in the future when (and if) the game matures my opinion will change but as it stands I would recommend you hold off purchasing it for now.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Pre Alpha Realease Review In it's current state this is simple but God the potential of this game is insane. The game is gorgeous no story to speak of save the small excerpt that it's a gold rush set in the 25th century. But honestly that is all it needs. There is no reason to dig deeper it's actually solid I am sure it may be expounded upon further down the line but until then I think this is sufficient. I like this excerpt from the developersOriginally posted by SES Reshape terrain as though it were made of Play Doh. It didn't occur to me but they abouslutely pulled that feeling off it feels like you're a sculptor. This game is art it is your art it is the developer's art I say let's enjoy this journey with the developers together. I know I will try to regularly assisst them in making this a great game and I hope they get all the support they need I don't want to see this project die (knock on wood). And a last parting note I want to say as I looked around the game I saw passion written all over it as an aspiring game designer this is what I want to have one day in my games boundless passion for the world that is created. Phenomenal job SES you are on my radar for good. I will update my reviews on this as it is developed I hope they make magic happen.

review: This game is really fun 9/10 but theres one main problem for me this game NEEDS a MAP or an arrow pointing to your base. I was out exploring for research things and I fell in the largest cave I think exists in the game I was in a truck and had 3 new researches so I wasn't leaving it took me an 1 hour and a 1/2 to find them. So im in a cave tring to dig a tunnel to get my truck out and I had to search 15 mins to find a place near the surface(based on the color of the ground) I then end up digging out at the top of a mountain which is my fault and not supposde to happen but then I can't see my base icon. So im on a mountain and I have no orientation of where I am it then took me 2 hours to find my base and i wasn't gonna kill myself. I had some rare resources and multiple new researches. So during those 2 hours it was very laggy (I rendered a MASSIVE amount of terrain) and barely keeping up with my power needs for the truck and I run into 5 sandstorms where I can't do anything because I can't see.

review: LOVE IT
title: ASTRONEER

review: Let me start off by saying this game is extremely fun with freinds.With that being said playing alone is still enjoyable. For an early access game (which I'm always iffy about early access) It's everything I was hoping for. The soundtrack is beautiful by itself but when combined with the visuals it becomes so much better. One of my favorite things are the sunrises in the game. If you catch them at the right time you'll witness something spectacular. Wanna build a giant land bridge to that mountain way over there? Go for it. You want to build a garage/hanger out of dirt for your vehicles? It can be done. There's a lot you can do.Unlike some other games once I've done everything I can in one save starting a new world still feels fresh and not repetative. And if you have friends playing along and keeping you entertained during the game it gets so much better.It's really easy to get use to the controls and start adventuring.Now onto the bad.The camera inside of tight caves can get bothersome at times but it's nothing too serious. And the only time I've encounter major bugs is when I was playing in my friend's world. Though that could be a connection issue and not the game itself. So be aware when plays with friends. The driving controls for the rovers can get quite annoying as well.SET DOWN BEACONS FOR THE LOVE OF GOD. There's nothing more frustrating in this game than setting out in your fancy new rover with a second small rover attached with a crane and drill head AND GETTING LOST. I spent two and a half hours trying to find my home base. I eventually found it but the moral of the story is set up beacons and tethers to avoid that headache. Hopefully in the future we'll get some type of portable map system or something relatable.There are times this game can repetative such as finding every element and nothing left to do with them. Though I'm sure with being early access more resources and elements will come out in future updates.All in all With the updates they've been pushing the visuals and soundtrack and all the bugs I've seen I firmly believe this game is worth the price. And I'd highly recommend it to firends.For me this game comes in at a solid 9 out of 10.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This game is fun but there's not a whole lot to do in it yet.I've also been encountering some bugs so i suggest waiting a few more updates before buying it.

review: After watching a few YouTube videos on Astroneer I decided to buy it on release day. We all know what early access means or we should know before purchasing. Bugs and 'weird' gameplay are to be expected which the devs iron out. Been playing for 1 hour so far and I can honestly say that this game is awesome! I haven't come across any bugs other than I got stuck inside a printer table for a few seconds lol. Frame rate runs at a solid 62 fps and at 60fps with VSYNC on (hasn't dipped under 60fps as yet).So in a nutshell a super polished early access game that shows great promise!My Specs i7 6700k16 gig 2133 RamMSI GTX 970 4G Gaming graphics card.

review: bought the game put 13 hours in day one... do i really need to say more? No but i will. Are there bugs? yeah. Does it need more content? yeah.Does the music sound like Human music? very much so lolNeeds to be optimized? of course its early access.The inventory system is exellent.The crafting animations are an excellent touch.The vehicles are a lot of fun.My only 2 real complaints is the lack of danger through combat or from a survival aspect. i will give it that im still not far on the first planet but some combat would be fun and mix it up a little more. 1.Maybe a more cartoon/mario style combat where we use our guns to lob objects at things. Something that fits the more nintendo like style youve adopted. That way we are not just minning to craft bigger things to mine deeper... we could build bigger things to fight bigger things or even just to defent our base from bigger things. Just dont do Mobs. a monster as rare as wreckege would probably even be a bit much...2.As for the survival part i think the plant matter could be used for food as well. at least tier 1 food paste. then work up to some type of greenhouse or potted plants. The oxygen SHOULD be water. then we could use the extractor to get O2. instead of it just lying aorund like ore... idk wtf tyou guys were thinking on that one lol. missed opportunity there. The power on the ground and from the dangerous (if you can really call them that...) plants should be something radioactive or exotic and be a more rare resouce. Possibly hazardous to handle and take special equipment.All in all i can tell im gonna love this game.

review: Honestly when I bought this game I thought to myself like omg this game looks so fun but in my mind i felt like it was going to be one of those games that looks fun and shows all this cool stuff but you cant really do all that but when i played this game it was amazing. Yes the game has some bugs like falling through the world and not being able to see some stuff sometimes but dont let that get to you. the game developers will fix those bugs so dont hate the game cause it has bugs or dont get it cause your friends say there is too many bugs and the best part in my opinion is the multiplayer feature. me and my friend were playing this and having so much fun even when we die to debra(ignore spelling if its wrong) and fall through the world. This game has it own thing for everyone. So pls tell ur friends to buy and play with you and dont think the game is not worth $20. The game itself it really good and yes i agree $20 is quite alot but when u get into the game you wont even seem to care about how much money you payed for the game. Now that my comment is ending i want to say i give this game 9/10 cause you cant save your character on your friends world in multiplayer and trust what i say. I know ive said alot of pros and cons but the cons are going to fixed no time and the pros just show im not lying and the game is really worth your buck and the time you spend on it. Ive already spend 10hrs in the past 3 4 days. Cya and ty for reading my commend all the way ik its a long one but i really enjoy this game one more tiny thing(ik i said i was done) if you think this game is ez just wait till you get deeper into the game and they will add mobs soon but there are plenty of things that kill you already.

review: So far this game has been great. I havent had any crash or framerate issues yet and it runs very smoothly. I have seen a few minor bugs that are slightly annoying but no gamebreaking (some are prettty hilarious though). The art style for the game is very simplistic yet still very interesting and at times even beautiful. I love the unique style of "GUI" that is used as I haven't seen it executed so well in any game I've played before. I know that all the people at System Era are working hard on this game and can't wait to see what the future holds for it!

review: I have been playing this game for a while now and am still suitably interested. The game itself runs pretty smoothly with few major bugs pretty good for a pre alpha. Only issue is the sandbox begins to feel lonely as you are the only sentient being on all of your available planets. I hope the developers add creatures to have to face off against. You will find that you figure out most of the content quick which can leave it feeling rather redundant. It's like minecraft in space without monsters (yet hopefully).

Other than that it's a pretty good time. Looking forward to more content in the future.

review: Incredible game! Very pleasing visually great soundtrack interesting but not too complex gameplay. It's cool how there is literally no instructions or tutorials but you can still progress. For advanced info there is a great wiki on gamepedia. Totally recommend!
title: ASTRONEER

review: I might not have a lot of playtime as of writing this but im really enjoying the game so far. It looks beatiful and exploring is a lot of fun. My GTX 660 runs the game fine a couple of stutters every now and then but i have yet to experience severe framedrops or visual glitches etc...There are hardly any video options yet You can adjust the draw distance of the foliage resolution fullscreen yes/no and vsync. The rendering of objects still needs work since thin ground on cliffs for example isnt loaded when further away while the plants on top of it are making it look like theyre stuck in mid air.But then again its early access for a reason. The gameplay is pretty solid already though. Its up to you wether you want to spend 20$ on this yet. Id recommend you buy it and at least give it a shot since it really deserves it.I also heard of a free demo in the windows store or something so uhh... If there is one go get that first. P
title: ASTRONEER

review: I'm not usually a fan of crafting/survival games. But this game is charming fun to play and instantly addicting. For a pre alpha game it is pretty stable and no major bugs cropped up during my play.Gameplay is intuitive and you choose your own difficulty/experience by how you play. The world is fun to explore and present reasonable challenges. The only thing I'm not sure is the depth of gameplay but I haven't explored the research path yet.On the technical side the game runs very smoothly on a GTX 1070 1440p. I had issues with resolution until I changed the Astro.exe to disable DPI scaling and manually changed the resolution in %USERPROFILE% AppData Local Astro Saved Config WindowsNoEditor GameUserSettings.ini.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Fun game recommended. I've encountered a bug when ever my oxygen is recharging it goes into a sort of feedback loop of sound. Like when you have a microphone and speaker too close. So far that's the only negative I've found.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I'm only getting started but already I'm really liking this game even if it's in alpha and a little rough around the edges. I had a tense experience as I fell down a hole in my journey to find some resin. It was both exciting and scary as I was trying to find my way out of the ground. I found a jackpot of resources and research items but had to pass on a lot of them so I could keep mining oxygen and power. Then I fell down yet another level and figured I was gonna die alone in some cave but I kept moving and was finally able to get back to ground level only to realize my capsule was no where in sight. Luckily I had mined enough oxygen to have enough time to be able to run around some mountains where I was thankfully able to find my capsule. Now It's time for a cigarette break to calm my nerves.So yeah I'd recommend it

review: Even though it is early access there are some improvements the developers can work on and I have a few. One is that my game continually has a massive lag spike but it seems like the game crashed and I cant close it unless I use task manager. Two Sometimes your character can just somehow glitch through the ground and you can possibly die because I died once from that. And lastly can you improve the recharge on the station thing because I got a fuel condenser and powered it up once and got my fuel and then when I went to recharge it it didn't want to recharge I even tried getting new stacks of power. But anyway I love the game and it is so fun like I've been waiting for a game like this and its finally here. I tottaly recommend this game even though there are some bugs and glitches that can be fixed. The "negative" message up the top is for the developers. )

review: while the game itself has some little issues here and there.it's a great game with a good potential(i'm not good at explaining so it might be a bit weird)you start off as one of four astronauts launched onto a planet when you land your first priorities are collecting resources to build up your base and not wandering to far off your base or you will suffocate. dont worry your base has infinite off that stuff.when you get your base a bit up and running it's time to search deeper. the underground is filled with usefull resources like aluminium and copper. it's alsof filled with poison/spike plant that want to kill you.once you got that stuff it's time to research a lot of research.and before you know you are on your way to build multiple bases on multiple planetspros base building exporation deformable terrain (need a bridge? make one) random structures like crashed spaceships with loot or a huge solar panel to use active/listening developerscons fps issues for some people (w.i.p.)even if you don't like early acces it's worth to atleast buy and test the game if it looks interesting.and if you don't like it then you can always refund it
title: ASTRONEER

review: I am not an accomplished gamer (I cut my teeth on ZORK and Atari) and you can take my thoughts and easily ignore them but all together I like this game. It appears on the surface to be a juvenile program but once you play it for a while you see the subtle unwritten threads of possible quests and puzzles lurking in the final finished version.Controls are a little confusing some time like where is the "fill" button on the controller when you have taken out half your landing site. But mostly all activities are smooth and seamless. Graphics are outstanding.Beta needs to start developing a story line to tie together all the main areas of the game. That is in orbit underworld and normal world plus all the research items you find. Looking forward to that.
title: ASTRONEER

review: First of all I highly recommend this game. It's definitely worth the money. It's everything No Mans Lie should have been. You can watch Youtube for true reviews and gameplay so I'll just talk about the few down falls this game has. The end game is non existent. Once you've built a couple bases on a couple planets you really don't feel like building anymore. There just isn't enough variation in base building and no enemies whatsovever to defend against. The atmosphere and environments are PERFECT but there's no enemies other than some plants and those are easily avoided. Your biggest enemy is falling in a hole or glitching through the ground.What this game needs is some enemies and some base defense. Some walls to put up around your base. More base structures. Some weapons. A climable rope to traverse holes you find. A new storm type or two. And just a lot more craftables. Bridges Housing Floors Doors Lights etc etc.This game has so much potential but like every other Early Access game I feel like this is about all you're going to get. If they would just add the things I mentioned this would literally be the best space game out there. Until Star Citizens release of course.Anyway if you're listening devs add some aliens (Include a scary giant alien that walks the planet) some guns some settlement building stuff and a couple new storms (Lightning with EMP and maybe a Radiation Storm)

review: Astroneer is a very robust immediately interesting execution of the "sandbox exploration" genre I've been having an amazing time of exploring discovering things and making my own fun.That last part is I think the most important. Any fun you get out of this game will be the fun you make for yourself.This game is in pre alpha and is at the time of this review $20. This is a lot of money for an early access game. To be honest if you have played this game for 5 hours you've more than likely seen 90% of the content on offer. There really isn't that much to the game at this stage in its development so if that worries you maybe wait.As well this game is very buggy trying to use vehicles is a hassle it's not uncommon for your character to phase into the ground and idiots online are constantly using bugs and exploits to do increasingly stupid stuff (making podracers getting infinite resources etc)That being said the developers are constantly updating it and I've already put a ton of time into this game. I am finding it to be a lot of fun and I can only imagine the shinanigans this game will get me into once I convince some of my friends to play it with me.If you've been considering buying this game and are just looking for a review to verify your tastes ask yourself if the above complaints matter and happy exploring!All hail the zebra ball.
title: ASTRONEER

review: "Pre Alpha." I love that in the early access description for this game. I've played full release games with less content and less fun.Once I saw that the Steam Awards were available I immediately hit this one for "The Labor of Love." I can't remember ever being so surprised by a game. I didn't know what to expect and at first was really wondering what the point was. Run away from base.Get more materials.Place more tethers.Get further away from base.Before long I finally found out about vehicles. About research. About the caves. This is a game that for me unfolded into something just too fun to notice the time I had spent.Sure there wasn't an end game 'goal' that I even knew about. It didn't matter. It's a game it's fun. If you like exploring the unknown in a 'true' survival horror game (where the enemy is only the environment and your own carelessness) then I am sure you will enjoy it too.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Amazing game. Love the idea of extracting resources and building a base. Travelling between planets in search of rare resources and artifacts keeps you coming back for more. As it is still in pre alpha stage there are a few glitches mostly in multiplayer mode but with regular patching the game keeps getting better and better. My friend and I love playing open world games and Astroneer provides just that. Always fun to plan out a proper base layout for maximum productivity solo and sometimes with the help of friends. With the presence of caves it truly feels like there is second and hidden world in every planet waiting to be discovered. I guarantee that most will lose track of time as there is so much to explore and discover. I truly hope the developers introduce new features resources artifacts and newer planets. I just can't wait to play the end product. A great game!

review: First of all I cannot compare this game to No Man's Sky. The only real similarities are the mining and the space/interstellar theme. Astroneer is more in the tip of a space themed Minecraft. For an early access pre alpha game it runs flawlessly. No frame drops or crashes whatsoever. The visuals are gorgeous as well as somewhat cartoon ish which is actually fitting. I started up the game and what I initially hated was the lack of info. However this is a development choice that I have quickly come to love. You are thrown onto a planet and forced to figure out how to mine build a base manage your oxygen and travel to new worlds. This made it much more exciting whenever progress was made. The game brilliantly makes players work hard to get started however it does not feel like a grind. It just feels like discovery and learning. Definitely reccomend this game. My only concern is that after a few hours I begin to wonder what the point in all of this hard work is. The game states that you are one of many people looking for their fortune in a space gold rush. I think that a currencey system as well as purchasing things with said currency would make all the work more understandable. As of now there isn't too much of a story or overall purpose but it is undoubtedly hours of fun and I'm excited to see how the game develops. It's really off to a great start.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This game is definitely more than it seems.For a game in Early Access it's amazing how I still can't find the boundaries and limitations of development for the amount that I have played.This game throws you in with little instruction. This brings such an amazing sense of nostalgia to when I played Minecraft as a child. Making a torch was such a big achievement that I will always remember just like learning how to make a research station.This game is truly a lot more than it seems. Being able to travel to different parts of the planet the weather system and the general complexity are things I would never expect in an Early Access.TL DR This game is incredibly fantastic and indepth for an Early AccessIf you want a calming exploration and development game this is worth every cent.Multiplayer is simple easy and a whole lot of funBest thing i've gotten this Christmas besides a fresh new pair of Retro 3 True Blue Jordans GET IT

review: I've found this game to be a wonderfully relaxing but nonetheless very engaging experience. Its mechanical foundations are already quite solid and show great promise for the future. While in a reductive sense you can exhaust the progression (in terms of the 'tech tree') quite soon that just forms a basis to then branch out explore and establish bases on other planetary bodies. There is a decent amount of environmental variety and even just exploring for its own sake has been fun.It isn't without issues for sure. For example performance declines over time. With 16 hours on my current save my framerate is now down to 30FPS (a poor look for an i7 with 16GB RAM and a 980ti). But even in the short time I've owned it the game has been regularly updated.

review: this game is lots of fun if you like the ideas of survival games and exploration but don't want to spend hours on end with it. Astroneer is tons of fun with challenge to make it ingaging but not stressful. I definately suggest getting this game if you think you'd like itI only have two complaints. One is that the game currently is buggy. Vehicles constantly move through floors making you lose precious materials if you are unfortunate. That of course can be patched but currently as it is in early access it has not been fixed. The devs as I've seen so far have a great community focus as they have hot fixed some problems so this could be already patched when you are reading this.My second problem is with the research mechanic. You find pods around the world and bring back to your base using some energy you will discover a new crafting recipe. Once you've researched an amount of a certain type of them it will give you rare resources. I can never get the habitat recipe which is required for more bases. I get things like drill heads filters winches and everything else but I never get this essential recipe. I hope this can be patched in some way in the future or at least some direction on how to get new recipes. This really stops my fun of the game quickly.At the moment I would give a 6/10 though fixing these bugs and adding more content could bring it higher. I'm excited to see what they bring.
title: ASTRONEER
