review: If you're into free roam open world sandbox style games with no strutured missions/objectives then you will probably enjoy this game. The game starts a lot like Minecraft does. You're dropped off into the world with little to no guidance. It isn't hard to figure out though. Resources are easy to spot and it's obvious you need to use them to advance. Gathering resources and building up your base are pretty fun for quite some time. Eventually you can make a spacecraft to go to another planet and continue making more bases.The problem with this game is the lack of enemies. I hate to keep referencing Minecraft but if you've played it on peaceful (without enemies) you know how boring the game gets. The only thing that can kill you in Astroneer are plants that emit toxins falls from heights suffocating and storms which throw debris. These can all be EASILY avoided. So without any enemies there isn't any real difficulty. And after some time the game starts to get boring. Now if you're looking for a relaxing game this is perfect. I enjoy playing it while watching Netflix. The game runs well. It's straight forward and easy to jump right into which makes it a good game for a younger gamer.I do recommend the game but before you buy it understand it is still in its early stages. With the lack of enemies the replayability isn't too great. However if you're into the free roam sandbox style you will get your money's worth out of this game.
title: ASTRONEER

review: It's a fun game with great promise but there simply isn't enough content to warrant a 20 price tag. My friend and I have played for 5 hours and we're done. There's nothing left to do.The game is still riddled with bugs too. Either wait until there's more content or skip this title.
title: ASTRONEER

review: What a great little game.Full disclosure I paid full price for this game at the time I bought it ($19.99) and learned of it through my discovery queue. I'm writing this with 4.8 hours on the record.This game is so fun. Think Minecraft meets Spore space stage meets what No Man's Sky should have been. The controls are VERY easy to pick up and are very smoothand intuitive if not for taking a bit of getting used to as they are sort of odd. But certainly nothing you cannot learn.I've only unlocked some basic stuff so far but I'm having all kinds of fun. It's certainly a very simple game but that's the joy of it I feel. It's simple yet complex. It makes no promises to anyone and puts you immediately into the action. Very minimal game. The low poly graphics of the terrain are pleasantly done and it's a pretty small game to download. There's no real enemies I can think of so far just some passive flora that seem to act in self defense if perturbed. Oh and the windstorms. Bit scary there as you get hundreds of cubes falling/flying from the sky. It's a forgiving game it's fun to play and there's not even that many bugs for being in pre alpha. Not that many bugs at all really.Few things I'm not a fan of but none of them are game breaking more minor improvements. Sometimes the terrain editing bugs out a bit and leaves artifacts if you're not careful. That I'm sure the developers are looking at. The rover controls are....Weird. They're WASD but it's always relative to the camera. So if you are kind of looking at the rover and you're wanting to back up cause you're against a wall you'd hit S right? Well no S will keep driving you into the wall if you're looking backward. Really weird and I guess it could work over time it's definitely something that'll need some getting used to. The only other thing that kind of bothers me is there's quite a bit of choppiness during transitions but as an 8350 CPU user that might be my own fault. And again it's early alpha.Other than that I really can't think of any improvements maybe more will come as I discover more so we'll see there. Honestly the biggest thing I can appreciate in this game is the work that is put into the game play not necessarily the graphics. The graphics are NOT unpleasant in fact it's refreshing to see a game that puts just the right amount of cartoony ness into the graphics while still keeping them crisp. Another thing is that it doesn't seem to promise much. It's not creating illusions of grandeur whilst in actuality failing to deliver on the promises that the advertising made. Maybe the developer learned from the folly of No Man's Sky. But you see it here the description is plain "A game of aerospace industry and interplanetary exploration." That's it. There's no words or dialogue in the videos no promises made other than basic gameplay mechanics. The developer delivered the game in a way that allows you to discover for yourself. And that's something that very few games enable you to do now days.In game there's work to be done sure. Collecting resources keeping safe from the windstorms and building and supplying your base with power. But it doesn't feel like a grind. There's always something new around the corner. For the $20 I paid for it this has been great for the first 5 hours and I only expect it to get better.Great and refreshing game highly recommend if you enjoy open world games and making your own way.

Very little gameplay (for now). As this is in early access this is very likley to change. Anyhow for the time being once you have everything and once you have everything there is little more to do than explore and horde resources in your many bases.Despite these issues I think that Astroneer is capable of becoming a great game. I just hope that we get some form of performance update soon.

review: TL DR Charming little early access game with promise. 8/10.PRE ALPHA REVIEW WILL UPDATE WHEN THE GAME DOESSo far this is an amazing game. We've all seen the joke reviews of "what No Man's Sky should have been" (and if you haven't scroll down I swear they're there) but I disagree with that. This game is different from NMS in many ways though I admit there are some similarities in the concepts. Where NMS was a game that was more about the sheer cosmic scale of things ASTRONEER is more of a focused experience. What follows is a review where I will try to mention NMS as little as possible.So far as I know (I only have two hours logged and have only left my starting planet once in that time) there is only a single star system for you to explore which is literally Infinitesimal compared to NMS. However that's not to say that it's a small game at all in the two hours of my gameplay I've probably explored less than a tenth of a percent of the first planet's surface let alone the massive cave systems that perforate the landscape. The planets are decent sized and there are quite a few of them in each system.There's also a really in depth (for pre alpha anyway) crafting system that allows you to build vehicle assemblers 3d printers smelters et al. One of the things I'm looking forward to as this game goes on is seeing what new stuff we're going to be able to build.As for story there is none. AT. THIS. POINT. According to the ASTRONEER road map trello.com they plan to add story elements in before the final release. I'm very interested to see how that pans out but that's about all there is to say about it.The graphics are amazing especially for a pre alpha build. There are a few hiccups (specifically when getting into and out of vehicles on uneven terrain but it's easily fixed by deforming the terrain around you) and framerate drops (landing on a planet drags it down) but it's a pre alpha so it's going to get better.The sound is great. Enough said.To sum up this game is already off to a great start and I can't wait to see where it goes from here. My only complaints can all be chalked up to being a pre alpha game and hopefully they all get addressed before 1.0 drops. Altogether at this stage I give it a 8/10 with high hopes to bring that up in a few months.

review: My experience with the game is a positive thumbs up with a BIG helping of a reminder it's in early release. If this was the final concept of the game it would be thumbs down and I'd be wishing for a refund.It has all the stability to be a great game if they do something more with the end goal which i'm glad it's still has hope while it's in early release. It has a solid feel to it but on to other thoughts.Right now you research mine resources and then travel to other planets to mine the same resources. Sure they can make it longer/tougher to research so the game can't be finished in 8 hours but the end result is the same. I wouldn't recommend the game to others with out some true challange/goal being introduced.I do have issues with controling the charactor with the mouse/keyboard and don't get me started on driving the rover but there are not game breaking for left or right handed people.I also want to make clear I only got this game due to a friends mixup and I'm going away from buying games in early release in 2018. Been burned with to many dud's in 2017 industry never learns that they hurt themselves more getting the fast cash then the long game plan. Hope steam is also reading since im tired of being bombarded with indie trash where you can see the developer is pushing trash for cash. My love of gaming is slowly being destroyed.

review: This game took my life my wife and my job. I now bend to its will and it tells me what to buy at the grocery store.In all seriousness this is a fantastic game. A lot of people have been comparing it to what No Man's Sky should have been and I feel like that's correct to an EXTENT. When they add flight etc then yes. It will be what NMS should have been.For being an Early Access game it's surprisingly bug free. Maybe it's just me but I've had only a few small issues that were taken care of promptly. There's plenty to keep you occupied for several hours but in all reality there isn't much to keep you coming back (like Take On Mars) yet I still come back. Maybe I'm broken. The game is incredibly relaxing. It's nice to come home after a long day of work and relax collect some oxygen pebbles and all that.You can terraform the terrain into anything you want. That's one of my favorite features about this game.All in all get this game if you enjoy these types of games. You won't be disappointed.I'll update this more as I think of more things to add. I just woke up so I'm still a bit tired )

review: This game seems promising. Even in pre alpha the gameplay is fun without too much grind. The devs just released the roadmap which I always appreciate when investing in an early access title. What the game primarily is at the moment You can explore planets looking for resources and tech to research to grow and expand a pretty basic base. Use resources to build basic but fun to drive buggies and trucks. Use resources to build a rocket. You don't directly control the rocket but just use it as a way to get to other planets. Kinda like a menu but with actual movement. Worry about energy and oxygen. You use tethers at first to keep a lifeline of oxygen to your base. As you progress you get a bit more indepentent but don't expect huge hour expeditions at first.That is pretty much at at the moment and I haven't tried multiplayer but I have no doubt it would be fun. Give this one a try if you want to go a currently short but fun space adventure!
title: ASTRONEER

I like to refer to it as Yes Man's Sky ) It's a good game as it stands. The main framework is there and it's updated constantly. I can't wait to see what it becomes. It's already multiplayer so they're beating No Man's Sky by a long shot lol

review: I was suprised by how fun this game is building researching exploring and modifying your environment (terrain) is primarly what this game is all about at this point. The colorful landscapes are fantastic and unique while the storms are great to look at and experiance. The sky is out of this world. Excellent foundation to build a very interesting game on. Base building is simple interesting but somewhat linear (you just place finished objects which you are able to build right away or through research). I have not experianced a frame drop while playing the game for a few hours but a friend did experiance a considerable frame drop.Considering the game is in early stages of development my suggestions for imrovements are 1. more indepth base building (e.g. being able to build complex structures to live in make a single planet a more permanent home while being able to build ships for e.g. gathering resources on other planets or setup secondary bases in case your main one gets wiped out by a disaster)2. more relaistic life experiance (e.g. what about food what about dehydration what about bathroom breaks what about radiation what about more dramatic temperature changes etc.)3. the game becomes boring after several hours of playing as the environment becomes predictable the base building is limited to a small number of pre designed structures etc.)4. enemies would expand the game considerably (e.g. giant worms in tunnels which appear and move rapidly powerful storms which can damage/destroy structures meteorite strikes which form powerful aftershocks and deposits thick layers of sediment over your base tectonic movements which can modify the terrain considerably forming huge ridges mountains or canyons poisonous gas vents which can become active aliens etc.)
title: ASTRONEER

review: A beautiful and calm game that makes you want to explore. Very simple/logic to the point that possibly my grandmother could play it which is a plus. It's not yet released officially as far as Im aware of and if there is anything they need to do is it first of all the colossal lag you get at a certain point after creating a lot of things and especially on the planet "Exotic" which brings my i7+1070+16gb to 20 30 fps. Also a very big part of the game or that should be is the rover you can get but that drives no matter what it needs more traction. They also need to add more things to make I think it would fit perfectly if they added houses/villages that could essentially be build and a lot of the game is based around having enough/fast power so there are little to no down time depending on sun and wind. Im glad that I bought the game I usually refund everything I buy in the survival category but this one was cool. But the price 159 nok was in my opinion a bit pricy for an "alpha" game. You can play with up to 3 friends I believe and about 5 saved games that can be deleted and continued on as you wish. Also the game needs more settings both in gameplay and in video.

review: The reasons I recommend this game This game is literally one of the most interesting and most fun games I have played in a long time. I m so excited about this game and where it can go in the future. I will probably even buy it for Xbox One just to be able to play it on both platforms. I think this is one of my favorite games of all time. If you get lost you can use the Astroneer wiki or YouTube to find out more info and what to do. You can do everything you could want in space exploration. You can harvest research build create explore and even blast into space to go to different places on your planet or even to another planet. This game is well worth the price and well worth your time. Once you figure out what to do and how things work you will get hooked on this space exploration. If surviving and exploring on your one isn t enough there is even multiplayer! You can work with up to 3 other friends to survive in this amazing universe. The state of the game As with any early access games there will be bugs. I realize there are ALWAYS people reviewing early access games and complaining about the bugs. I know there have been some games that were so bad they are essentially unplayable. I get being mad about that. If you expect NO bugs don t get an early access game. There are bugs but nothing unforgivable. I have found that sometimes exiting the game and coming back can fix the bug or issue. When you exit the game to the menu or desktop you save the game. So if you re in the middle of a planet and you lose your goodies don t exit! Go to your desktop or ctrl+alt+delet and close the program externally. You will start the game at the last save that way. If you do loose it all don t worry because you can get it all again in this expansive game. Bottom line If you want an amazing game with incredibly fun elements and mechanics and aren t afraid of some normal early access bugs buy it today! If you re looking for a finished game with no bugs that is also amazing buy it on full release. If you buy it now or later you will love this game. I would recommend not waiting since it s the kind of game you want to play as soon as possible. The devs are great and are working to update the game regularly. I don t see this becoming an abandoned Steam game like so many others. I also see this game becoming better and most likely adding content and stuff to do over time. Not a bad investment for my money personally. If you re still unsure watch some YouTube let s plays and get a feel for the game. Thanks for reading and bye!
title: ASTRONEER

review: Fun game can't wait for more content to be released!Some people say it's buggy and glitchy personally I haven't experienced too much of that. The "Arid" planet sometimes go ape and divides itself into 4 slices of pizzaplanet. But as soon as you get on it it shapes up again.To be honest you kinda need a sense of wonder if you are going to enjoy this game.I've spent 17 hours now and Im pretty much done with all the content. I can keep exploring if I want but there is no need for it really.If you are bored as hell like me and looking for a good solid 20 hours entertainment then this is the game.And since more content are probably going to be released in the near future I can highly recommend it. There are materials in the game that have no current use at this moment. But I love the crafting system and the art style so yeah thumbs up.

review: System Era is a very small team that has put together a beautiful and refreshing early access game which I think has great potential.On March 27th 2017 one of their artists suddenly passed away. Needless to say it was a time of reflection for them but are now steadfast on rolling out updates. You can see the game's development roadmap on their website which is nice.I'll bet anyone with Astroneer was happy with the $20 they spent but are being a bit too critical about the content rollout right now.I was honestly surprised at how polished the stylized artwork looks and how intuitive the UI feels already the main reasons I'm endorsing this $20 game as opposed to saying "wait".If you do buy this game treat it as an investment. Playing it is loads of fun (alone or with friends) but watching this concept grow are being a part of the game's development is more valuable to me. We need to (now more than ever) ramp up interest and education in space exploration for the next generation and I think Astroneer can play a small part in fostering that culture.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Even in the game's current state it is worth the fun by all means. But let me firstly get out of the way yes the singleplayer is fun and the co op is even better but be prepared for fairly high data usage at the current time for multiplayer. Secondly the thing about active Early Access game development is that we shouldnt always look at the relationship between the games completion to the amount of fun it can bring. With every update and new implemented content in the course of the development brings a sense of satifaction and well ... more fun coz its always fun to get a stream of new toys over a period of time than it is to get it all at once. Yes we all want it now but hey look at the bigger picture you have fun over a longer period of time.

review: Listen I've never taken the time to review a game on here in my life. But let me tell you this game is incredible. For a game that's only in a very early access alpha stage it has so much potential. I played for only a few hours with a buddy of mine and this game is truly amazing. From the base building to finding resources to researching for new materials and build I don't have a single complaint. The controls are a bit wonky sometimes and when you slide down a semi steep hill/mountain you sometimes won't stop sliding even when you reach flat ground but those are the only bugs I've encountered thus far. 10/10 co op is incredible the gameplay is great the graphics are beautiful and too easy to run on any rig you play on. What No Mans Sky should have been.

review: Astroneer is already a great deal of fun. It's one of those games that makes you go "...OOOOHHHH I get it!" when you crest the learning curve. I also appreciate the nod to actual orbital mechanics when flying (though it's understandably simplified). This game made me rethink my position on procedural voxel based crafting games (I was very tired of them). I'm excited to see how it develops.
title: ASTRONEER

review: When I impulsively decided on buying this game I wasn't even aware it was in Alpha stage. Not that I bothered because it was the sheerly amazing artstyle and mechanics I fell for. I didn't quite anticipate the fact that there were multiple planets to explore in one save until i had played this gem for about 4 hours. The concept of this game is fantastic. It beard that solid low poly artstyle combined with a sandbox style world. Unfortunately though since it's in early alpha it's not even close to being complete. I estimate myself somewhere at 1/3 of what the game has to offer. There are naturally many things I haven't figured out yet but the majority of mechanics and buildings I've learned about rather quickly. I predict the game will hit a great audiance once it's finished. For the future I hope to see more buildings and mechanics. Perhaps animals new base foundations and add ons and other vehicles and vehicle addons and my personal most wanted a purpose for those old broken spaceships lying around randomly. Also some containers to store large objects in would be nice.Overall the game is fantastic. With more development it will make a great one. For now I'll just wait for the next patch.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I love the game. I find it fun but like all games it has drawbacks. The first is that like many EA games there are a few bugs. The biggest that i have happens when I enter or exit a vehicle mainly the truck. The car LITERALLY flips out thiis bug is funny for the first few times but then annoying especially when it gets stuck in a cave and you nearly die trying to save it. That bug has almost ruined the game for me. The only reason it hasn't is because of the true gameplay (this is looking past the EA bugs). It is fun and relaxing and I have spent much of my time exploring the HUGE landscape of the planets. The research is tedious so I would make it A) More controllable. Rather than having luck choose what new invention you get you should get a skill tree which you choose what you want. B) make the research resources more available and abundant. That is all I have to say about this game. For now i give it a solid 8/10

review: You need this game. I bought four of these games so my brother and his 2 kids and I can get into a game and have serious fun. We explore and dig and build and race rovers and refine and mine and trade and space travel and dig holes under each other and bury stuffs and explore and in the end you trade the carbon for 4 compounds..... we all know that compound makes tethers and the whole world revolves around tethers.... You can spend hours making art work out of tethers and 6 year olds luv those tethers. The game is in ALPHA and has a few bugs but I have played alot of finished games that run worst than this game. Even the bugs in this game are an adventure you overload the truck and 2 trailers with heavy loot and bam truck falls through the map and me and the kids spend the next few hours digging and exploring caves. What comes to mind when you say DYN O MITE !!!! ( not j j walker from good times ) thats right you can find dynomite on fallen explorers. Theres nothing better than saying hey kids better check the tires on the rover before we take off ( while parents are standing waaaay far off in the distance ) I have over 90 hours on this game and I still play it after work with the kids. We are looking forward to growing with the game and the new adventures that await us.

review: Don't let the "PRE ALPHA" description scare you off. This is solid and deep and extremely well done. It's ready to purchase now.As a software developer let me just say that this game in it's current "pre alpha" form is more solid and complete than most final releases. It's really well made and although I wish the terrain colors were different once you get used to it it's really quite something. It's deep but not overly complex although initially frustrating as the one thing the alpha is missing is some guidance on methods. It has one "cheat sheet" help screen which covers a lot and it's quite simple once you get it but there's a small frustrating learning curve for the first 30 60 minutes while you figure out what a tutorial would probably show you in the final release. So just a bit of alpha/beta pain that can be overcome. Same for the terrain editing but once you get used to it it's better than most and very solid in terms of reliability. Overall this is already one of my favorite exploration / survival / space / engineering / building / resource gathering games actually probably my fave. And officially it's "pre alpha". Not one crash. Not one problem. Not one weird bug. Amazing.So if you THINK you might like this or you're wasting time with inferior things like Minecraft grab a copy of this. It will only get better and better has incredible potential and is already very wonderful. Well done guys. Finish it off and ship it and it will be a classic.
title: ASTRONEER

review: After just over 2 hours playing i can easily say the game is good but not fully there yet. In my opinion what puts this way ahead of No Man's Sky is the multiplayer and the interface that being said Multiplayer is extremely glitchy not even just a little Me and a couple friends have encountered our vehicles teleporting to the sky glitching under the map and dying numerous times and a lot of rubberbanding no matter who hosted the server. I personally can't see anyone fully enjoying the game without friends (just like minecraft) so with the money that is being flooded from early access purchases I do expect fixes to these bugs as well as allowing more people to join in one server. As for the quests and different interactions to continue playing more features should be added down the line but it shouldn't be a direct priority. A HUGE NOTE Terrain building and removing sucks even with ctrl which is meant to smoothen it out it is a huge fail. Overall the game may have not had the best initial execution but when compared to No Man's Sky it is the best option and all of my issues can be addressed through updates Astroneer is still a huge thumbs up in my book.

review: TL DR Devs are very active w/ the community and are asking us for some feedback like ideas or any bugs we come across. There is lots to do for the first 45 hours then you gotta think outside the box. Ex. Race to setting up every crafting station with a friend making art with the deformer conquer every square meter of the solar system and/or rover races. This game is do able alone but all the more fun with up to 4 friends. ...But everytime you say Astroneer the game gets better. This is the worst game ever never touching it aga.... This has to be the funnest space crafting game I've played thus far and heres why. Pro's and other nice things The menus and GUI and very clean Your thrown right into the game with easy to learn controls You get to choose 4 adorable Astronuts D There is much to do much to see and all the time in the world Con's None(It's early access so yes your going to fall through the world in a super fun way and get shot up into the next planet over yes the game will crash and yes the multiplayer is a pain in the a** 1 out of 15 times but this isn't forever and it't not game breaking to the point where you can't play.)b Opinion /b It popped up in my recommended games and I just yolo'd my way to the buy screen and it was the right move.This is a great way to pass a few hours with some friends as it Currently supports 4 player co op.This is very early access so keep an open mind. The dev's are very active with the community so far and thats great. They have a planned road map (not very detail because they are just working on bugs atm for all platforms and are working on getting feedback from us such as bugs or ideas and thats amazing!) MY ONLY GRIPE is that you can't change the size of the deformer tool. Having an option to make or carve smaller or larger pathways/creations would be awesome! Do yourself a favor and JUST DO IT!

review: Early access. Sometimes you win (Prison Architect Factorio) sometimes you lose (Godus and many many others). Thankfully this conforms to the former a solid Alpha release that is an intuitive albeit rather casual third person exploration/base building game.Exploration is a key focus in the procedurally generated environment. Rewards of rare minerals and research development are granted to those brave enough to venture away from the safety of your base. I am not qualified to comment on multiplayer I have only been playing single player. Spoilers Below.PROS For me it is a calming experience watching the planetoid rotate in concert with other planets and stars. Minimalistic art direction. Not everyone's cup of tea but I appreciate the aesthetic. Music is soothing. Backpack mechanic upgrades will sacrifice precious inventory space. Choose wisely. Animations are good intentionally ragdoll the Astroneer with a debris storm. Oddly satisfying. Vehicles are limited but varied each with their own unique attributes and handling characteristics. Kid friendly. Casual game style no gore limb amputations or unpleasantness. No shooting aliens. However you do disrupt the lifecycle of various flora based life forms. Accessible and intuitive. No HUD. Think Dead Space. Spelunking is rewarding. Terrain manipulation is fun. Procedural world generation appears to be balanced quite well. Obvious pro active Developer support so far so good! Well communicated actively engaging the community Early Access done right.CONS (Early Access not representative of final product) Frame rate issues. After playing for awhile the game gets quite choppy. Terrain flora pop ins. Camera issues (rare) Bugs (Clipping physics also rare) Needs more content. Late game needs some kind of reward system/motivator.As it stands I am giving this a 75 out of 100 I could realistically see this being bumped to low 90's once the bugs are ironed out more content added and everything is optimised. Very promising.

review: I loved this game played it alot thoroughly enjoyed exploring the planet and building fancy structures that help me drive through caves easily and fast. Once my beautiful structures were made to get down to a great central place in the cave I get the brilliant idea to run tethers from my home base to the cave so I'd literally have infinite power for all the mining my little heart could desire. It was a little bit a journey but in no seems was it a length that should cause any kind of issues with how the game runs. As soon as the lost line was connected frame rates drops to a level that was unplayable. I disconect one of the tethers runs perfectly fine connect it back runs like hot garbage. Not a deal breaker i just disconnected it and went back to mining whatever I wanted to. After a while I had grown tired of my home planet due to the lack of rare resources. So I build a great ship that can voyage the galaxy as well as carry plenty of supplies that I would need in costructing a base on a new planet. Worst decision of my astroneer life. The new planet was full of riches and beautiful colors. The weather system on this little piece of hell is the same of Jupiter. Huge storms ever 5 10 minutes that completely hault any kind of work being doing or navigations that are being traveled. Not only that one of the boneheaded developers thought it would be an amazing idea to add plants the size of tuleps these stupid little plants the size of about 3 inches completely stops any vehicle you are trying to drive. These plants are what kill this game. So not only do I have to try to drive around on a planet full of nothing but craters around every corner these stupid little plants that serve absolutely no purpose but to annoy you and make you spend time trying to drive through a forest like patch of tuleps that are better served as spike strips. Then there are the endless amounts of boulders that serve no purpose but to get in your way and slow you down. Maybe if they could be broken down into smaller rocks or serve some kind of material purpose then it would be understandable. But to have over half the items on the game to have no use other than to get in your way is more than a head scratcher. The lack of any kind of compass map or any other device that would be able to help you navigate where you are going to/from. The game is still in early access so that could be the blame for the frame rates but makes no sense that a few tethers would cripple this game. My PC is able to run any game that I've got on ultra so that is no the issue. The game is actually pretty decent other than a few issues that could be easily fixed. Freedom of taking a blank canvas and building huge structures that help you maneuver throughout the world is something that I was really drawn towards. About half of my gametime was probly spent on building things like this. However the past 2 3 hours of game time have simply been me trying to find my way back to my base. Hours of driving through canyons just to get stuck on a stupid little plant. An indistructable plant that is not used for anything and has no purpose. There's also times where you will be digging and BOOM all of a sudden you fall through the ground. While this has screwed me over a few times most of the time you can figure it out to come back out where you fell through but this is quite a hinderance.The basics of the game are great haven't came accross many bugs other than falling through the floor. But at times this bug will either get you killed or drops you to a lower level in a cave which lets you run around then eventually die of lack of oxygen because it is impossible to find your way back to your vehicle. Until they make some changes and add some type of navigation I wouldn't really recommend this game. You will get to a point where there's nothing to do but to drive around a mine but you will come accross these stupid little plants that make mining an impossible task.

review: As of December 23rd the game has made leaps of improvement. The game is now playable in both singleplayer and multiplayer but it still has FPS issues and various annoying bugs. The FPS very quickly reaches unplayable levels if you venture too far into one direction even on very high end hardware. The framerate will continue to chug until you start new on a new planet. In multiplayer if you collect more resources from a vein than you can store in your backpack the extra resource will drop on the ground and you will not be able to pick it up. There are many other small annoying bugs that make the game less enjoyable but Astroneer is definitely at least playable in its current state.If you can look past the buggy state of the game Astroneer provides a very compelling experience with plenty of potential for improvement. There's several different types of biomes with different terrain features and aesthetics. It seems like every cave you enter is unique and they seem to go on forever. The terraforming tool is very intuitive allowing you to raise lower and smooth the terrain any way you please. You can even build a skybridge to space or tunnel right through a planet to the other end. If you start to get bored of your surrounding you can build a spaceship and fly to a different part of the planet or go even further and explore new celetial bodies. There's six different types of planets in the game and they all have unique environmental hazards and resource distributions. You can colonize all six planets in one savegame and travel between them easily. Currently there's about eight hours of content avaliable in the game. That's a fairly small amount for a sandbox type game and I hope to see the game expanded in the following years. The game has more content than most games fresh out of early access and it just went on sale ( in early access) a couple days ago. The devs have fixed the biggest issues with the game in record pace and they're already working on new features to add to the game surpassing my expectation of slow moving development. The game was unplayable in multiplayer on launch day and now it seems to be mostly stable despite framerate issues. 18 Dec Previous Review The game is nearly unplayable in multiplayer with crashes and framerate drops that gradually get worse as you progress. If you crash your character simply disappears and your items are left behind floating in thin air. This is especially frusturating when you're deep in a cave and there's no way to tell where you died. Tethers in the game can detatch from each other seemingly randomly and this can leave you without oxygen deep in a cave system causing you to lose all your items. Sometimes a party member will crash while joining the game leaving behind a ghost capsule that persists through reloads. After this the game will crash if you try to join a friend through the steam interface without them inviting you.Luckily most of the game's shortcomings persist to the fact that crashing is persistant in multiplayer and less frequently in singleplayer. If you're looking for a good singleplayer experience and you have a mid range computer with a good CPU you can play singleplayer to an extent. Make sure to save frequently as crashes are still plentiful at an average of every 45 minutes or so but this is much better than 15 minutes for multiplayer. If you can look past the crashing Astroneer provides a very compelling experience with plenty of potential for improvement. There's several different types of biomes with different terrain features and aesthetics. It seems like every cave you enter is unique and they seem to go on forever. If you start to get bored of your surrounding you can build a spaceship and fly to a different part of the planet or go even further and explore new celetial bodies. Currently there's about eight hours of content avaliable in the game. That's a fairly small amount for a sandbox type game and I hope to see the game expanded in the following years. I can't recommend the game in its current state. The game is completely littered with bugs framerate drops and crashes. However Astroneer has a lot of potential but keep in mind that you're buying the game as is. Updates are not guarenteed as with any early access / crowdfunded product. Be prepared to part with your money if the developer decides to abandon the project. There are no consumer protections when it comes to buying this game (nor any early access title not trying to single out the developer) and you can't get a refund if you've played more than 2 hours or owned the game for two weeks. Don't buy this game unless you're willing to accept the chance that the game may never be fully fixed.

review: Astroneer is a very great game. I reccomend it to everyone. It's very fun and addicting and just... cool. Here are some pros and cons PROS Addicting Fun to play The concept of the game is creative and really cool. If you've seen Markiplier's lets play of it he says "OMG this is soooo cool" too many times and you will most likely have a similar reaction. If you used to like Minecraft and got bored of it or quit becuase the community just sucks now you'll probably like this game. It's "crafting" is a lot more hands on and i'll say it again more cool. CONS If your computer isn't to great the game lags. It's not horrible so dont worry unless your computer is really bad. The game is in it's pre alpha so there's only 9 12 hours of play time before you have everything and there really isn't much to do. Of course you can start a new world but I'm hoping that much much more will be added in the future. Moving around and some other things are kinda wierd in general even though it could just just be my lag because my computer sucks. Sometimes the camera angles are weird like you'll walk into a structure and it'll show a close up of the wall of it rather than showing your actual character. I wish you could switch into 1st person.

review: Absolutely loving it so far. I was a bit hesitant to buy based on the reviews/comments regarding framerate/crashing issues. I watched a couple of guys stream on youtube and none of them seemed to have this issue so I gave it a shot. I have played for around 2 hours without any issue whatsoever regarding either framerates or crashes. The game runs butter smooth for me well above 60 fps and ive had no crashes. Not even as much as a stutter. Im running a 1060 with an i5 6600K. Based on a couple comments it seems that one of the issues had to do with the tethering system. I tested this out (through regular gameplay need them to breath) and they havnt seemed to affect my performance (ive built 100+ by this point). Obviously there is an issue for some but I have yet to see any sort of problems with perfomance. The only bug I have come across was when I built a module while standing in its path. I kinda got stuck inside it and my character starting panicking it was quite funny really. After some squirming I was able to escape deaths grasp. Other than that flawless gameplay so far. The graphics are beautiful. May not be for everyone but man I think it looks amazing. My first experience with a storm was great! The animations for the main character are done really well and are quite charming im really digging the entire design direction of this game. I am really liking the music as well very relaxing. *Edit* The music is fantastic plain and simple.* Ive found two caves so far one of which has a hole that goes deep deep down. I see some rrealllly cool looking stuff down there but I Havnt gone down yet because im not sure how to do it without dying from the fall xD. Ive spent the majority of my play time exploring one of these caves which is MASSIVE and building a few various modules on my base. Just built my first vehicle now im ready for the real adventures! On that note the vehicle controls are a bit loose. But i mean....ive never driven in an environment with different gravity so this may be an intentional aspect and I dont really fault the game for it either way. I am really looking forward to seeing what the devs are able to do with this game and I'm glad that I made the jump into its early access. Happy exploring everyone!

review: My name is Laika and I'm an Astronaut in real life and I would like to confirm that everything in this game is 100% accurate to reality on other planets. If you're thinking of buying this game consider a few things first Who should buy this game If you're preparing to leave Earth at some point and live on another planet this game is for you. If you want to know how to attach a research module to your space pod (you need 3 Resin btw) this game is for you. If you're a hobbiest into the following things Building sh*t researching sh*t terraforming sh*t or doing sh*tty things of the like this game is for you. If you like mincraft then f**k off. This isn't minecraft...Who shouldn't buy this game If you liked No Man's Sky. You're lying to yourself and you'll probably give this game a bad review cause you're an idiot. If you're a billionaire... Why are you reading this if you're a billionaire? If you're dead. Cuase that would be weird.TL DR Buy this game unless you liked No Man's Lie.PS Here's my wiki page in case you have no idea who Laika is. Educate yourself. I'm important. review: Wow currently my favourite game. The introduction says it is in Alpha even pre Alpha but they are doing beta testing. I think it is further along than many beta games I have played. Many people say it is similar to minecraft I don't play minecraft so I wouldn't know. What I do know is that I quite often find myself playing till 2 3 am in the morning losing track of time and playing for 8 hours. While it is in alpha/beta there are few bugs left and reporting them gets them fixed.In reviewing this I decided to describe the game so you get a gist of what it is like.So basically you start with a landing capsule on a planet and build your base up. At first you have to stay in range of your base because you need oxygen and energy the latter is not essential. You need compounds (which you mine or trade for) to build tether lines which link you to the base and provide constant oxygen and energy the latter provided you have built energy collectors. You can upgrade your character so you can carry more oxygen and more energy. Energy is produced in 3 ways you can mine it you can regenerate it with your suit by building mini solar collectors or a little wind turbine or even carry a little generator around with you in your backpack or you can build vehicles and mount solar collectors on them. Your suit stores oxygen but you cannot produce it in there. Vehicles have constant oxygen in them it seems but without energy in them they won't run ) they can be used to weather out storms.So basically you mine explore build in this game mining is simplistic as you find the item called compound mine it until you have enough to make one stack and then depending on the number of stacks you need of a particular mineral you can build firstly the extension to your base (with resin) then build the work top for example smelter to melt minerals raw copper into stacks of copper etc. trade centre vehicle station research etc.Uou power these buildings by building additional power generator/collectors in your base these are different from your suit but suit versions can be used in your base initially. It takes energy to mine and you can basicallty dig minerals out and dig further under ground into whole cave structures with minerals and find hidden items research items crashes space ships with techniology you can then research.There is a multiplayer option I have not really encountered anyone.You can build vehicles link them together so you have more space to carry things build upgradews cranes winches build additional storage power etc.So you build the main base then you find the research for say rover truck shuttle spaceships p Yes you can use a shuttle to land elsewhere start a second base or you can find the research for a spaceship and build on a new planet.So far things that have killed me storms throwing rocks at me poison underground and falling off a cliff into an area underground.No monsters thankfully I hope they don't add any Ossiris New Dawn is a similar game thopugh more realistic graphics it has monsters. this game uses anime style graphics beautiful tundras vibrant colours etc.Pros Explore mine research build craft grow more advanced tech use vehicles build shuttles and ultimately a sapce ship vibrant colours beautiful landscapes very impressed price seems really low I think once this game is finished price could double.Cons Ok so it is in Alpha/Beta atm and there are some bugs and they fixing them as well as adding new content so my main gripes atm are to do with pregame bugs they will fix. If you build too many vehicles it slows your game down if you build too many tether lines same thing (though they have fixed that now former is still a problem) you cannot presently unbuild something so if you build too many vehicles and it slows game down then you prolly need to go back to an older save. There is less control over saves I think it would be nice instead of just saving when you get in a vehicle or on a spaceship/base to be able to save with descriptive saves so it is then possible to over save your good game with a laggy game.Awesome Game though playing this while waiting for Mass Effect 4 dig the whole exploration theme build craft etc. )

review: Despite the game being in pre alpha state I can say confidently that the developers have something special here. The art style gameplay and foundation are all here. All that lacks is polish and more content for this game to erase NO MAN'S SKY from our memory. My quick thoughts below.Pros Simple but intuitive gameplay Fantastic art style...reminds me of cel shaded graphics from Wind Waker back on Gamecube Fun discovering blueprints/research materials keeps you wanting to explore Captures the sense of discovery and loneliness on a deserted planet Very fun with a friend/multiplayer Can get hooked for hours Cons Pre Alpha stage so lacks polish Some framerate dips despite well exceeding recommended requirements Needs more content (nitpicky as the game is still pre Alpha) No NPCs or enemies Get this game early if you want to support the devs. There is potential here!

review: I've been burned by Early Access titles many times so I was nervous about a game that looked so promising right out of the gate. Now that I've played for a little while my worries are gone. Astroneer is a ton of fun with a unique mechanic that makes shaping the world and gathering resources fun again. While it may be a bit light on content at the moment Astroneer has enough to keep players engaged. I can't wait to see what this game shapes into. As long as the developers keep the quality level as high as the initial release this game has a bright future.

review: A simple but elegent UI. Expansive exploration and survival. Myriad of options for discovery and death. I'm seriouly liking this pre alpha even with the issues most of which are minor (except maybe for the horrendous FPS due to sound defects at certain times). So much going for it and I'm still finding new and wonderful things that I have no clue as to how they work within the game world (glowing black &amp white striped marble I'm talking to you). For the price point this is at you'll get more hours of fun than a number of AAA games that are over in a day. Just read the discussions on Steam and decide whether you can accept the short comings and glitches. I'm on to my 3rd play through and still enjoying it.

review: This is a really Special Game. It is a fun new take of the Open World Builder Genre and I have to admit it is a take that surprised me with how well it works. Exploring the world finding caves and canyons digging up strange plants and hostile envrioment is quite challenging as you always have to look on your Oxygen and Energy. The World building tool is well implemented as it is vital for shaping the landscape for your Base.I fell in love with this game and showed it to my 3 Mates which immediatly bought it as well and joined me.The Multiplayer has a few flaws but works WAY better than on any Alpha Game I played so far. It runs smoothly with a few lag spikes here and there the only real issue I encountered was that when visiting someones elses Game on a different Planet I could not see any buildings.Designing Building and Traveling with the vehicles is can be improved but works fine so far.I have to say I am really looking forward to the next updates and patches. This game is a great promise to what is yet to come and I have high hopes for it.

title: ASTRONEER

review: So far this game is very very early in developement so there isn't too much to review. But what's already there to review is good indeed! The graphics are charming the sounds fit the visual design very well while still sounding realistic the gameplay if simple is still plenty of fun and there's still so much yet to see added by the developers. The only three downsides to the game right now is one that there isn't enough to keep players busy for an extended period of time and as it is right now this is the sort of thing I could see myself sitting down to play an hour or two a day in between working on other things and playing other games.As for number two it's simple. The game isn't optimized. It lags far more than even my heavily modded Skyrim client. But for what it's worth those issues are being cut down on piece by piece with each and every update and I'm excited to see where this game goes. As for the third this is just a personal complaint but some updates seem to re generate the map leading to weird holes in the world that you can fall through. To TL DR what I just said here.Pros Beautiful graphics always fun to look at.Good sound effects fits the graphics yet still sounds realistic.Simple yet fun game mechanics. Oxygen power and resources easy to manage once you get used to it.Casual gameplay easier to get into than more challenging competitors such as Space Engineers and From the Depths (which I am guilty of playing so I should know.)Good background music. It is simple and subtle yet benefits the alien and wondrous atmosphere quite well.Cons Not optimized yet (lots of FPS lag.)Some bugs present such as occasional crashes to desktop though the game's apparent autosaving behind the scenes can help make that a bit less painful.Not enough content yet (for my tastes at least ) this problem will be fixed over time as the developers add more to the game.Overall would I recommend this game? Definitely. For twenty dollars? If you can afford it then yes it's worth the money already and should become even more so as time goes on and more updates get issued.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Astroneer is a great game *or will be*. I have yet to play a mear 6 ish hours so dont take my word as the one of god but. Having played a fair amount of games *especially ones in pre alpha &amp beta* I can already say that this is a game I will be playing for a while.Pros 1. Beautiful Game period what can I say just have a look at some of the screenshots people have taken.2. Creatve in where it is somewhere of a successful re imagination of Mincraft with landscape modifications and crafting but different. Not at all a copy but rather improved and changed to fit the astetics and playstyle of this game *very nice*.3. Open having played a fair amount of alpha and beta games this is easely the one that is the most open. Even before buying the game I joined the Discord server and the steam community getting some quick thoughts on what are some of the games pros and cons also being able to suggest improvements directly and together with other players seeing them being put into the game a couple hours later so something I have not seen in a while.4. Its already so good! And there is such a large journey ahead! Strap in and join the fun already!But wait there must be some cons right?Yes.1. It is realitvely empty yes there theoretically an endless amount of things you can do you find yourself doing many things over and over again and not just like the grind game it is but rather cause there is nothing else no missions no "larger" idea behind it *yet*. 2. Its glitchy laggy and does a little what it wants There are a fair amount of glitches crashes and other things you run into! But we can assume it gets better and better as we play along.3. Basics the thing I found most annoying was not having the basic settings one is used to where I should be able to have some sort of graphics settings saved games cant be deleted and other things that one assumes cant be so hard to add. Overall Astroneer is a cool game it looks amazing and plays okay. I would recommend it to any one who will give a game a couple hours someone who can enjoy chatting with other gamers of the stupid glitch that killed them both a couple of minutes ago. I would not recommend it to a jump in and play gamer this is not such a game. This is a long term investment where you give in to glitches lag and other sometimes frustrating things to be a part of it to enable yourself to come a level depper into the creation of the game. *this review may be up for edit every 6 or so playhours*
title: ASTRONEER

review: I was chosen to explore the planet we were orbiting so I launched off from the station within the small pod that I hoped would not become my grave any time soon. But it nearly did as it plummeted downwards and ended up landing inside a canyon that proved to be an entrance to a vast network of tunnels below the surface of the planet. I started to carefully examine my surroundings and soon noticed that to my luck there was a natural ramp upwards to the surface of the planet as well as one leading deeper into the canyon and the tunnels. I had little idea what I was supposed to do next as I had slept throughout most of the classes back the the Astronaut academy. I figured out from the simple user's manual the buttons to my equipment after some.. considerable time. After learning how to do some simple landscaping I started my quest for materials for some heavy duty base building. This planet would soon yield me its bounty! Little did I know that the underground caverns were filled with hostile lifeforms and they surrounded me in every direction... I realized that I'd have to science the %&amp # out of this in order to survive. So like in that movie where Matt Damon becomes a potato on Mars* I began to build my Empire. I would soon rule the land with an iron fist! *I did not actually watch that movie... yet. This game is absolutely fantastic by the way.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Review date December 19 2016It's rough. It is a pre alpha. There are bugs there are hilarious physics blow outs specially with the truck . Frame rate drops will happen in most systems. Multiplayer is broken and at this moment I'd only consider that aspect of the game a demo. That being said this game is absolutely worth it. Devs are diligently working on it it is a labor of love and it shows. There is lots to do lots to explore lots to build and lots to speculate about as the game is clearly not finished. It is what it is a pre alpha early access game. A really really REALLY good and fun pre alpha early access game. 16 hours in and the worst thing I experienced was the buggy co op which was about an hour of that game time . I will update this review as the game continues to develop.

review: Looking forward to seeing the crafting/recipe finding being expanded. Ive enjoyed three different playthroughs currently working on establishing complete bases on each planet. Whats it like playing? Id say a simple minecraft in space with easier mining and no creapers. I like the gravity difference on each planet.. well the moon especially. Fun doing stunts and flips over craters!I havent looked at the forums but I am interested in the story behind the game. With all the crashed pods and other space debris on each planet. What disaster happened? Will we find data recorders that provide pieces of this puzzle in future patches? The crashed pods are rather large for such small cargo they contain or at least with whats found in them.Id like to be able to patch into some of the large damaged solar panels that still power up as do the cashed pods. Its a short game to play before you have exhausted base building. Then the other planets are barren/tundra/exotic/radiated. Each has an different variations of the basic resources. There are questionable items though. Like why all the cave lifeforms are on each planet or underground. I really liked the yellow bones below ground. Made me wonder if one was alive somewhere.....Great game for all ages. I will be looking forward to its development.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I think this game has a lot of potential however it has a long way to go. To start off with the progression is way to fast. I played for 2 and a half hours and i had already made a rocket ship. In order to give the game a lasting playtime it needs to be slowed. This could be achieved by Increasing backpack space and increasing the amount of materials for recipes. Also when i tried playing with a friend it was so buggy almost to the point of being unplayable. Sometimes we would die for no reason. And when respawning we would get stuck in the ground and die more from suffocation. Losing all of your items and potentially your rover/truck is a real pain in the However i loved this game in the short time i played it alone. It was aww inspiring and fun. I would recommend it if you had the extra cash but waiting for now might be the right move.

review: Beautiful game! You can easily get lost in the music and scenery. It does a great job in teaching you how the world works without actually telling you. review: So far I've loved this game. It's still early release so the bugs and stuff I've been running into such as game crashing with 4 players or game crashing with the tethering of rovers I've been able to look past. This game benefits a lot from having multiple players however having 2 3 more people causes a lot more bugs to rear their ugly heads. Which is a shame because this game is amazing with multiple people. It's okay when playing single player but the game gets monotonous without small bits of emergent gameplay.Either way would reccomend.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This game is for sure still in Early Acess form. It's a lot of fun overall but it crashed twice on me so far. First time it slowed my entire system to a crawl and all my OBS settings went with it (streamers beware) and second time I just called it quits.I am going to follow and support this game but the numerous issues from frame drops glitches in and out of the world and optimization all need to be addressed in the long run. If you are not a fan of testing games just wait till full build. Otherwise this game is well worth it.
title: ASTRONEER

review: The thing about Astroneer is it doesnt feel like a game. It has a lot of ways to go to keep the momentum it has now but i belive that it will be able to keep it up. the game needs more survival aspects and 100% needs more aspects of pve and combat cause as it stands right now all u need is compound and u can surivive for aslong as u want death doesnt really matter so really it will get boring at one point new planets is a great idea to keep the game new and fresh but as of right now the only thing that changes is some times gravity and the color of the planet. id love to see this game grow considering its already a well worth purchase but it needs a lot more content to keep us all playing. my main point is to add more survival apect maybe hunger thirst? this could allow a lot of content to be added just off those ideas. building needs a huge upgrade u need to make me want to stay at my planet as the game is now u can build a full size base in about 20 min if u rush we need a actual building system foundations walls windows doors all that. and finally combat/pve the game litteraly has no difficulty other than the gas and u can just take a few steps back and wait for it to go away and continue with what you were doing. add mobs add alliens add weapons combat even with other players if they enable it? this can create so many things to keep us playing. This whole thing probably doesnt sound too convinving but i promise u even as it stands right now its well worth 20$ but to keep us hooked itll need a lil work. but its a great game even greater with friends. Its a nice breathe of fresh air seeing such a simple concept taken so well and i cant wait to see this game grow!

review: This game has a very unique concept and it very fun when played with multiple people. Personally I liked the concept and how simple and almost animated/ toyish the game feels. To some this might be a let down but to me it gave the game an upbeat and lively mood. However on the other hand i disliked how hard the game is to run and how small the inventory spaces are. As for the performance issues this could just come with time since the game is in pre alpha. The same goes for the inventory issues which is just an issue I had. Overall it is a very fun game and is a really good idea but do to my average computer and possibly the pre alpha issues i cannot play it. But if you have an above average computer and a group of friends to play with this is a must buy!

title: ASTRONEER

review: I know I only have 3 and a half hours on this game at the time of writing but I have to be honest here... this game is absolutely amazing! It's not trying to be something it's not it's not showing off content that you can't find in the game and it's not trying to be anything more than what has been shown or released so far.You're on a planet with some sort of machine that can harvest and terraform the planet as you see fit. You use the resources you find to initially build your settlement then you start using those buildings to branch out and find other resources and explore more of the planet whether it's underneath or on solid ground. But it does it in a way that's fun and enjoyable and exploration is gradual you can't explore freely immediately due to your limited amount of oxygen so you have to build and you have to progress slowly in a natural feeling way. At the end of the day I can say this game is amazing! And half the price of No Man's Sky I think I know what I'd rather play.

review: 5/10 for solo playI would like to rate it higher the reason I don't isbecause it is prone to isssues which I hope can be resolved soon you get stuck (either in vehicles or falling through the floor) glitching vehicles that bounce around everywhere when you try interacting with them frame rate issues and the game crashes around sandstorms in my experience 4/10 for multi player since you have no way to keep your space pack contents if you leave then re enter or reload the game it counts as you dying the same issues as solo and the fact only the host sees whatever gets researched.overall 9/20 but it is early access so there is still a few bugs there to work out if they fixed the sandstorm crashes and getting stuck issues I would easily give it 15/20 and each mode would jump up by 3 rating. review: I recommend it with the assumption that you understand you are supporting a game in progress. Astroneer is a third person exploration game with building elements survival elements (oxygen health and power) vehicles and modular "snapping". There are no goals at the moment but progression comes in the form of crafting and research by gathering materials.As of the end of December 2016 there is very little actual content and exploration seems limited to caves with a single dangerous element. The price is near exorbitant for what there is however it is currently in alpha and the ground principles of the game seem solid especially the UI and item/terrain manipulation is stellar.Do not expect more than a few hours of gameplay at the moment which will mostly be rooted in dragging items around and manipulating terrain.

review: This is the best game of 2017 thus far and probably 2016. It is the space crafter that delievers fun. All the others try to do way too much while this game is really minecraft like simplicity with a much better theme and losing the voxels. The feel of this game is very zen. It generates a peaceful solitude that is almost medative. The game is honeslty what I would call near perfect. If there were any things that I would like to see improve it would be the ability to create flat planes somehow. I think that when you are mining or trying to clear room for rovers it gets frustrating that you are unable to make a smooth flat plane. This would also be useful in creating bridges. I feel this is something that will need to be visited as this game grows and cooperatively people want to develop large perhaps even server side based coop games where great works are the goal. But for now that certainly does not spoil anything. I will say this I am biased a little as Jacob Leichty (Sorry if I spelt that wrong) came to my house and played with my little brother at times. But I really don't think that has impacted my opinion much. I would live this game regardless.

review: (Version 0.2.117.0 at time of writing)Wow. This game has immense potential and such an amazing sense of atmosphere and immersion. I was scared to venture far out of my initial starting area out of the fear for what could be out there. While I love the idea of the whole inventory and machine interaction system as it doesn't break immersion like a UI(user interface) would it needs a little refinement. The researching and adventuring mechanics are very captivating even at its limited pre alpha state. With further update and additions to the game it can easily be a 10/10 for its respective gameplay.So in its current state this game is a 7.5/10 if it would be released right now. I recommend you pick it up and watch the updates role in.

review: What I like about this game The colour scheme is as vivid and beautiful as anything I have encountered in the last twenty years The soundtrack is soothing and at times quite enchanting fast becoming as memorable as such greats as Civ 2 and TW Rome The interface works well wonderfully well in places. Especially the sound and animation linked to the management and movement of inventory items. This is as good as it gets. The simple and pleasing design of items resources and machinery and associated sounds increases the sense of worth attached to objects in the game. The game is quickly accessible although it needs further levels of complexity after the first 5 10 hours of gameplay The tethering system. It lends gravity to the art of survival especially in the early stages of the game. The weather especially the storms which are reminiscent of The Martian. Things that I would like to see in the game's future development Fewer storms with some small degree of damage to infrastructure requiring maintenance or the research and installation of protection. Perhaps some researchable weather forecasting system which would allow for the deployment of protective measures. The researchable ability to create flat surfaces for more advanced base building. This might be in the form of a dozer blade or roadlaying machinery. It seems strange that we have the ability to raise and lower terrain but not form a permanent flat surface. Perhaps it is possible to build prefabricated interlocking base sections which would allow structures and storage to be placed in a much more organised manner later on. The current system works very well in the early stages but later on the ability to create coherent bases on a larger scale is all but impossible. The researchable ability to build roads. Again this would be an advanced research item and come with suitable reource costs. Inspection and exploration drones that would allow some limited aerial reconnaissance require retrieval and repair if caught in a storm. Conclusion /h Brilliant game. Immensely playable and engaging for an EA offering with huge development potential. The devs are building a game of exceptional quality with enormous possibilites. Tremendous value for money. This game has been a soothing balm to the devasting wounds left by No Man's (Pie in the) Sky! 0)

(MP was just launched and im sure will have its own set of bug fixes). Not a ton to do at end game and no real "enemies" or aliens/creatures. Just some dangerous plant life.Those are my main issues with the game as it currently stands. Which Im sure the devs will address given time. If you NEED to have a perfect bug free game wait for a later build. However as is I consider it playable and very enjoyable.

review: I just bought this game last night Dec. 26th in pre Alpha V 0.2. and started playing it more today Dec. 27th. I have only played it in single player and have clocked in almost 4 hrs. worth of game play.So far the survival and exploration elements work well together. With only having to worry about oxygen and power to live is super helpful in being able to do what you want most. Being able to wonder aimlessly and discover wreckages find resources or materials is already a fun time. In addition to keeping and eye on thoes two meters there seems to be a slight weather element. On the planet I spawned on there was a wind component which varies from a slight breeze to an intense dust storm that rolls by. Never knowing when the next storm comes and what the storm may bring in helps add additional boost of adredaline and tension in hoping none of your equipment or yourself blow away. There is already a bunch of machinery you can craft and resources to collect so this game has lots of content for you to enjoy. Among the machines there seems to be a shuttle you can build to explore the other planets that orbit yours in the sky. Although I have not yet gotten there it seems to be available. Also I have built a little rover which is fun to drive around and is super easy to maneuver.As far as criticisms go the game isn't optimized yet. So my decent laptop has a low frame rate. And occasionally there would be a resource in the planet's ground that there would be a portion you can not pick up. Not sure if it is picked up and the game is having a glitch or that part is just never collected. Also while driving around the way you steer is where you look. So trying to take in the scenery around you becomes a little more trickey without stopping the car. Lastly with the driving the vehicle seems to slide around a lot when I'm trying to stop but there is also a possibility that it's just my planet.BUT since this game is in the EARLY pre alpha stages thoes kinds of things were expected and I'm sure will be fixed by the time the game fully launches. My final thoughts is that none of the game's early problems effect it on a large scale. The resources are plentiful the art is beautiful and is loads of fun!
title: ASTRONEER

review: All in all a very excellent pre alpha. There are of course minor glitches and even a couple of major issues but as previously stated they are there because this is a PRE alpha and haven't been ironed out yet. Currently I'm in what can be considered the late game of the current version (0.2.111.0). I have unlocked all of the research that is currently available and visited all five of the available planets including setting up bases on three of them. I can't express my joy in words of visiting an Arid planet for the first time and finding about it's peculiar hazards. If you've visited one you know exactly what I mean and if not seriously take a stop over on one sometime it's a thing of beauty. Each of the planets has a unique feel to it from the Terran planet's earth like enviroment to the exotic planet's strange over domes. Even the barren planet/moon is wonderful with it's massive craters. Unfortunately there just isn't enough research to last more than a few hours if you are collecting research nodes on a semi regular basis. After you research all of them the research nodes just begin handing out resources with the occasional bug(?) of giving an unknown research. Again this will more than likely be fixed later as they add more to the game. My hope is that they allow you eventually unlock a larger space ship to travel to even more interesting planets.This is a game to watch and in my honest opinion well worth the money even in it's current state.

review: While still in Alpha the concept and a lot of game is there. Yes you can research and acquire everything relativley quickly (6 10 hours) the fun is the exploration aspect. You start out on a Terran planet. Basic materials are on the surface which is relativley flat and hostile free. Go into caves for more advanced resource and native research items. There are some hostile plants in caves that can kill you but that is about it. The terran planet is fun and the base building while very basic is fun. The magic came in when I went to another planet. I realized that going to another planet doesnt mean leaving your home planet behind. In fact its the opposite. You go to other planets and farm more resources. For example Arid planets have copper and aluminum on their surface unlike Terran which are in caves. Build a mining base and bring some of that sweet ore or refined metal back to your home planet. The game is loads of fun even better with friends. So excited to see what the devs do with this game. Already it has soooooo much promise. If you like Minecraft or wished No Man's Sky was what it actually advertized itself as get this game you will not be disappointed. 10/10 would get killed by random tumble weeds or super storms again.
title: ASTRONEER

review: First things first this game is very good despite it being in early access. Most of the bugs I've encountered had to do with multiplayer and that's sort of expected so I can excuse that. However most of those problems were solved simply by starting a new world with friends seperate from my singleplayer one (so they turned out to be no big deal anyway).The first ten minutes of the game you're thrown in to a world that somewhat resembles Earth (not really but it does the most out of any of the planets). The first thing you're gonna want to do is get some compound to make some tethers so you can explore more of the planet rather than being constrained to the area nearest your habitat. After that the choice is yours and there are many choices you can make ranging from finding resources to scan to collect things like blueprints (unlocks for crafting) to creating vehicles that can take you to other worlds. The other worlds are nothing like the home planet one being arid and dry another being snowwy and icy one being exotic with odd plants and such you get the point there's a lot to explore and a lot to do in this game. Definitely recommended.
