review: When you look at other games in it's genre Astroneer struggles to deliver enough content for it's $20 price tag. There are a handful of $20 early access survival games out there that offer far more content Rust for instance. That being said the game is pretty fun when playing with other people. We were able to get about 14 hours of gameplay in a co op session knowing nothing about the games mechanics. However it's pretty easy to figure everything out. Base building is quite simplistic and requires very few resources to build. Finding the resources is where it might take a while depending on your location. There's really nothing you need to worry about in a survival sense either except for oxygen. Oxygen does not deplete as long as you are tehterd to a oxygen line. These lines can be made easily which basically negates this factor in your survival. On a whole Astroneer isn't much of a survival game. You don't need to find food you don't need to build a shelter and theres maybe 1 2 hostile plant things that will injure you if you get close. Falling off from cliffs also will injure you. When you talk survival you're thinking I need to manage food water find shelter sustainment fend off predators well theres no food no water no shelter unless you make yourself one for asthetic purposes and no predatory creatures that will hunt you. The fun right now in the game comes from the exploration and for maybe 1 2 hours the researching mechanics. Researching artifacts is how you are able to build space ships and rovers etc. There aren't many things to research right now so this facet of the game quickly becomes obsolete. Exploring the randomly generated worlds is pretty cool though. I just wish there was more to the game. The good thing is it looks promising it's early access so theres more to come. The gameplay is smooth and has appealing visuals. The art style is neat too. I'll still recommend this game if you have the $20 to blow on 14 15 hrs.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Great game.Very addicting at the start but starts to get slower 6 hours later.This game goes from fast to not to fast but i recommend this game and it is way worth 20 dollars hope the game grows more and i have one problem with this game and it is that my first/best world doesnt work anymore when i try to login the game crashes and tells me to report bug and stuff so i hope that gets fixs so great game
title: ASTRONEER

review: I descend through the clouds of this strange new world that my astronaut has discovered. We touch down gently and I step out of my pod and take a look around. There s many strange looking plants scattered around and some crystals protruding from the ground. I start walking around unsure what my purpose is and where I should be going. A wind storm hits and I m dead. I respawn and begin my journey into the unknown again. My oxygen runs low and I die. Survival then is one of the aims in Astroneer because there are many ways in which this game will try to kill you.Astroneer is a space exploration/survival sandbox adventure game which is being developed by System Era Softworks based in Seattle Washington. There is no story line and instead the player must mine resources in order to expand his/her colony by creating structures with the mined resources. The team working on Astroneers come from a background which involves work on games like Halo Assassin s Creed Team Fortress the Sims amongst many others so they know what they are doing something that becomes plain to see when you look at your watch 5 minutes after starting the game and realise an hour has passed.So you start out by selecting your Astronaut who then detaches their pod from the orbiting station type structure. You head down into the atmosphere of the nearby planet admiring the beautiful looking clouds as you descend. You touch down and examine your immediate surroundings. You have nothing but your trusty suit and a mining tool that can deform the very ground you walk on and mine resources.As you venture further out you ll soon discover what resources are used for and how you can take advantage of their applications. You can extend your pod to include all sorts of useful applications from Printers to vehicle bays and machines that will research strange things you have discovered. I had no idea what I was doing to start with but I started to figure things out and I loved how things naturally start to make sense. Once you figure one piece of the puzzle the other pieces start to drop into place it s a very satisfying experience and leaves you wanting more and more.The control schemes are simple yet effective and do pretty much all you could want them to. it s the polygon game world though that impresses. It s simple yet looks gorgeous and all you want to do is explore. You can sculpt the world around you and even deform the ground right down to the planets core.So what features do you get in this early access version of Astroneer? Well the developers have a hand list on their website so lets take a look.Explore multitudes of procedural worlds.Shape completely malleable terrain. Dig to the centre of the earth or forge mountains.Craft vehicles and discover resources to reach ever further in the galaxy.Survive in ever more harsh and rewarding environments.Play with friends in online or local multiplayer.Astroneer is expected to be in early access for a year or two but it s certainly something that you should be keeping tabs on because this game has all the hall marks of a classic in the making. I can t wait to see what the developers have in store for the games future. So far they have done an astounding job this is how early access games should be and what space exploration done right looks like. This game is satisfying and beautiful to play.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Fun game I have only played for a short amount of time but can see great potential in it. Far more potential than that of other Early Access games of which I have played.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Hey! It's a working no nonsense no hand holding cute ish procedurally generated universe space simulator game .. thing.Like No Man's .. yeah. THAT game. Unlike THAT game this is a) Fun.b) Actually delivering what they promisedc) Still very early access and still cool!d) Co op!I am so very very afraid of playing this too much and getting bored before more stuff is added.Devs seem friendly down to earth and quite rare in this business not overly keen on overhyping their game.Buy now or buy later. Just buy this if you want to explore planets.Cons Limited replayability right now unless you're REALLY casual and likes digging for stuff to build your (rather simple) bases and do this repeatedly. A rudimentary assortment of materials and (inventable) gizmos are there but it's still a bit short on things to do for more than say 5 6 hours. All planets though different cosmetically are basically the same at this time of the development. I do have faith in the devs to actually deliver more interresting and fun things in the future. Pros Everything. It's according to the devs a "pre alpha" and still hours and hours more fun gameplay than That Other Game even thojugh they sort of promise the same gameplay and stuff. This is the best kind of Early Access and the best kind of devs.

review: I personally enjoy this game. Even for an early access game it is fantastic. At first I was confused. How do I play? What is this? What is that? Don't die Ouch that really hurt!!!! But as I went on I learned and adapted. I find the scenery is beautiful on the surface of every planet and all throughout each cave system. There is hours of fun but with any game it has its limitations so you can only build up to a certain research point. Fairly new game still has lots of potential. I plan on playing the crap out it! Co op anyone? lol
title: ASTRONEER

review: This is a great game so far and I only just started my three problems are after a bit the game becomes repetative because your just flying to planets which is fun for me and isn't a big problem to me but may be to lots of people also a load shrieking noise happens everytime I finnish gaining oxygen and it is so loud it says ringing in my ear for about 3 seconds after the horrible noise is gone. My final and biggest issue is the lag for my computer lag is something that happens only on really intense games so for this game to lag is suprising. Part of the reason I got this game was for the non harsh sort of Polygonal graphics and I know it's early access so I can't wait for future updates that will fix all of these problems!

review: With the state this game is in now it is by far the best space exploration game out there. Yes Man's Sky or Astroneer has a very good sense of progression that has you think about where to go or what you need and the learning that leaps you to know what is what feels great. It could be best described as minecraft in space but with better UI and things to do. Whether I have encountered a bug or not has not really destroyed my experience and I yet to find new things and this is REALLY good for its state of bugs in pre alpha. I will follow this game until it is not worked on anymore and really excited for new stuff!

review: I have enjoyed this game very much in the hour that I have played. I feel that there is potental for a lot of content in the future and the development team seems very dedicated to the game. Despite my positive response I do not recommend this game to players that want a perfectly working game when they buy one. The game currently for me is almost unplayable bacause of massive lag spikes frequent freezes that force me to hard stop through task manager and general low performance thst seems to get worse regardless of what graphics settings I choose (I have experimented with all of them.) I am going to stick with the game because i have hope it it but in its current state it is just about unplayable.***Update Since the patches that have been implemented in the week following the release of this Early Access game Astroneer has not crashed on me at all. There are still somewhat frequent lag spikes but that can be remidied by setting my view distance to its minimum which only effects the foliage rendering into my game. This game has brougnt me only joy since the patches and I highly reccomend it.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This is a legitimately good game. Sure there are bugs sure there are glitches and sure you'll unintentionally get into often hilarious situations but play this with a friend or even alone and you'll be amazed at the surprising amount of depth that's already present. On top of an amazing soundtrack and visuals to match System Era seems to be on top of the updates game themselves (thus far since the game's early access release they've released an update every other day fixing tons of bugs) so rest assured you're buying and supporting an actively developed game. This is what No Man's Sky should have been.

review: This is an amazing game! Very addicting for the stage that it's in. Obviously it will need changes it's in Pre Alpha so don't be harsh. At this point of the game it would probably take 4 hours to explore the full extent of a planet. This is a blast with friends I love the non isolation. If I was a dev my ideas would be to 1.Add a health bar2.Add some creatures on one planet3.Add more planets4.Possibly make galaxies that need more advanced spaceships to get to5.Add more craftable gadgets for the suit (i.g. Jetpack)6.Put more resources on other planets besides the home planet7.Add voice chats8.Possibly adding NPCs that can sell you thingsAnd that's all for my suggestions. This game is the better version of No Man's Sky that doesnt require high RAM. If any devs see this the please take some of my suggestions into mind. If you're considering buying this game and you're reading this Buy this game now!!!!! Chubbs The Astronaut
title: ASTRONEER

review: I've had a lot of fun playing this game. It isn't too difficult to get what you want but requires you to go on an adventure. Lots of interesting twists and turns. One time I was trying to get Malachite in a deep mine when a plant suddenly stabbed me in the back. I must have died 3 times to that one plant trying to get my stuff back again. It was an unexpected suprise but goes to show you that this game isnt all calm crafting and building. It can put you into tricky situations and make you revise your strategy. If you ever got stuck in a storm far away from home you will know this. This game has a lot of good parts but also some bad parts. I think you should be able to scrap items. I have at least 8 generators just laying around ever since I switched to solar and I could really use the compound. Maybe add a furnace or trash compactor. Also you should be able to delete certain parts of your base. Overall this game is very fun to play. If you like adventure space and industrialization I would definitely recommend it to you.Edit I think that a helpful addition to the game would be a sort of weed killer. Maybe a mod on the terrain shaper that kills plants like the spikers acid pots exploders etc. This could be useful for mining and would allow you to get rid of plants without making the path more difficult to travel. Also maybe an unstuck button.

review: I absolutly adore this game.I'm a space junkie and an exploration fanatic.I've enjoyed quite a few hours of fun in Astroneer not without a few crashes unfortunatly but that's on me for trying to run it on a potato based laptop that's below the spec minimum.Whooops.I'll take that hit.But that hasn't driven me away from this game. I can't wait to see the end product and even more importantly playing it.From what I've done so far It feels like I own all of this space and am free to core a planet if I feel like it. Or built a thousand bases. Or drive my rover into the sunset. Then forget to attach a power source that can persist through the night and end up stranded.I admit I've barely touched the surface (or caves) of the first planet alone but it's left me with a lot better feeling than most exploration type dealios.The colors are absolutly phenominal.The weird gas spewing plants are hilarious.This whole thing is a definite favorite and I'm hooked.Now if only I could force all my friends to play with me.

review: My husband found this game first. He said he wants to play this game with me and I said let's wait because I learned my lesson from NMS. I didn't want to purchase an early access game. It looked really good from the trailers but that's the exact same thing that happened to me with NMS I got tempted to buy NMS because of their stupidly beautiful trailer. But yeah things just happened you know. Somehow my husband couldn't contain his desire for the game and he bought it for both of us. We started playing at around 11pm and well what do you know? It's now 630am. Where the frick did the time go? It's just THAT awesome. I have to say this game is the perfect game for adventurous couples who do not want to leave the comfort of their home.The graphics are beautiful vivid colors awesome lighting. The gameplay is nice very easy to understand. I love how there's not much UI to deal with. I understand that the game is still in its early stages but I hope that someday the devs add living creatures in the planets as well. This game gave me good feelings. I highly recommend this especially to people who just lost a multiplayer game session with some toxic folk.

review: Pre Alpha at time of writing.I love this game and am very excited for it's potential. The pre alpha is a phenomenal display of colors and creativity.For reference I imagine this game as a bit of a mashup between Minecraft and No Man's Sky but with a unique flair of its own. Armed with a backpack that can be upgraded to hold more oxygen or draw power from the sun you go about setting off on your own adventure. At the moment it feels very sandbox and open with not much of a linear storyline. However this only leads to the excitement of finding a crashed satellite researching mysterious objects and seeking shelter from lethal storms as you build a base of operations and eventually go explore the moon you've seen in the horizon.All in all at it's pre alpha stage I love it. Sure I fall through the ground every now and then when I get a bit overzealous with crafting my own mountains or digging massive caverns but I happily take it with all the good that comes from the game.Good buy good fun.
title: ASTRONEER

title: ASTRONEER

review: Bought this game and played for about 2 hours non stop and was having a blast exploring and trying things out. Building a base then gathering resources to build vehicles including a "shuttle"(looks like the moon lander) was a lot of fun. I could see how for some the game could get boring kinda fast but I don't mind sandbox games. One touch that I enjoy is that there is no HUD everything is represented on your character. There is a blue tank on top of your backpack that is your oxygen and yellow pips running up the center of the pack represent your energy. People will compare this to No Man's Sky but I think it is more of a "Minecraft in Space" since there is a lot of focus on building(albeit you can't build a house of your design you control the layout of your base).Overall I do recommend this game as it is one of the smoothest best looking games with Early Access. Runs very smooth on my PC.Specs GTX 680(latest stable drivers)i7 3.1 GHz16 GB RAM1920x1080 with vsync enabledWindows 10 Pro

review: A lot of fun. Exploration survival a mostly non violent game. I'm amazed it plays as well as it does for being pre alpha. If you want enemies to shoot at or shoot at you this is not your game. The three biggest problems are the windstorms dangerous plants and running out of resources (like oxygen or rocket fuel) you then have to run around and hunt for. It's going to be fun to see what the developers add to this game.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I originally reviewed this game on the launch weekend of this game. Since then there's been signficant improvement. Crashes have become rare and the bugs have less severe consequences than before. Additional content is slowly coming in as well.It's stiill in Early Access and there's more work to be done but I've put over 100 hours in this game already. It's just a nice and peaceful environment to play in (when you aren't running out of oxygen or in the middle of a sandstorm).It's been about 6 months since Early Access launched and I continue to be optimistic about where this is going.Original Review It's an Early Access Game and it has bugs crashes and could use some more content.Despite all of that that I still managed to put in about 18 hours in first 2 days! It's an enjoyable experience and has so much potential to become even better.

review: Astroneer is a great game and has a lot more potential to it. The game slaps you in the face with no tutorial and a habitat in which you quickly expand and admire the creative implementation of a hands on UI. The game is beautiful and gives some good challenges. The game has many pros but with little cons especially for early access.Pros Beautiful enviromentAmazing art styleCreative UI and HUDInteresting gameplayCons Frames are pretty bad even with high end specsNo graphic customizationSmall bugs with textures and teleporting itemsAnd some game concepts that don't make senseTips for the developersExploring caves on some planets is a pain in the rear with constant pink spikey and toxic plants. The only way to stop them from killing you is to unroot them after that its a giant entity sitting on the floor decreasing your frames and then I have to dig I giant hole to bury it. Same problem with items suit upgrades and buildings once you obtain them your only solution is to leave them lying around decreasing performance. There is also a lack of items to research after an hour and a half of gameplay everything was researched and the next thing was to explore the rest of the planets and colonize mass expansion but this issue is very minor because it is early access. Developers I would like to see you add more content as you do fixing bugs it's a mistake many make yes it is hard but it will pay off. It would also be great if in graphics options you added an ability to detail the way you want the sky to look like the amount of stars and detail of the planets because I feel like this causes a lot of frame drop. Every time I look at the sky frames drop from 35 to around 20.Hope this review is seen by many including the developersSincerely XxXFiTzxXx

review: Astroneer is a fun easy to pick up and play space explorer/builder. Base building is smooth and very streamlined vehicle useage is generally pretty solid there are a few hiccups here and there but it's usually when I'm trying to do something stupid in a cave. However to some extent it's strength in gameplay is also it's limitation in content. There's no real way to build anything "different" all buildings are a module system held together with powerlines. Vehicles are similar in this fashion since the whole build aspect is module based. This isn't a complaint per se just point of fact about the gameplay. Reccomend.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Alright folks. If you are looking for a great space exploration game then look no further. This game is everything "No Mans Sky" should have been. For one this games art style alone is just incredible. Another thing I absolutely love is how you can really do anything you want in game. There are a few bugs here and there . Such as if you put tethers way too far from your base your frame rate will drop through the floor (I think the game tries to process everything that you have built items in at once)... But being that this game is in early access I would imagine that is subject to change in a future update. Another bug is you can push yourself though the world if you want (or even sometimes unintentionally) which can be useful if you get stuck but you usually accelerate through the unprocessed ground and die (can't retrive items) but again that is subject to change. A big positive I have for this game is that it's physics are phenomenal in all respects. Eg. During a windstorm if you build a wall in front or around you the windstorm no longer has an effect on you. It's the same story with shadows and solar panels. If a panel is in the shade it does not produce energy. (Sucks but at least realistic) one thing I might add to the game however is a box to choose a world seed at launch (from space) because occasionally you will end up in a world that does not have a certain element that you enjoy playing with. All in all a fantastic game!
title: ASTRONEER

review: Great game when it comes to gameplay. The content is amazing graphics are beautiful and its just overall a fun experiance. With that said the performance of the game is sad it works fine for a while but when you get a big base and stuff is going the performance shoots downhill quick. I had a base not even that large not everything was down and the game shot to 20fps when my rig can easily run this game. I know its pre alpha and thats why I upboated it it is an amazing game just needs better optimization.
title: ASTRONEER

review: HOLY THIS GAME IS AMAZING.I have been following this game for a while and instanly bought it when I had the chance. I have been playing the game for a couple of hours now and I have been enjoying the game from the second I started it.Once you open the game you are greeted with a beautiful loading screen with all the planets orbiting the sun. After the loading is done you can select your character and you're instantly 'launched' to your first planet.When you get out of the pod it's the best feeling in the game. you can walk around in this vast world full off colours and vegetation. There are mountains raveins caves and lots more.After you progressed a bit and have some basic machines running you can look into all the diffrent modules. You have options like a solarpanel or a wind turbine for power generation but there are also things like storage racks and batterypacks. You can snap these modules everywhere don't like them there? move them somewhere else.But the best thing in this game the vehicles. Trucks rovers landers. They are compatible with all the modules and you can even daisy chain them. You can jump to other planets and start bases there the posibilities are endless.Sure there are some performance issues especially when your base is getting bigger and bigger but that's to be expected with a pre alpha game like this.Really like where this is going looking forward to the updates! Biggs

review: This game is everything you need for amazing voxel building exploration and looking beautiful all in one with no HUD to boot.I was scouring the surface with my truck and it's trailer for compound. I happened to get a little lost. Now these planets are not small. It would take quite a bit of wandering to see the marker for my base and I can barely keep my truck running smoothly as it is without running out of power. Naturally I will need to navigate using some landmarks. I remember something I did at one point. I was returning to my base when I saw a crashed ship on the very top of the tallest mountain I'd ever seen. I naturally thought "I need to knock that off." I rode down the mountain in a chair inside of it. I was fine. I saw the mountain. I made my way around it. I got back home. Then my spaceship I was building fell though the ground.OVERALL 12/10. Very fun. The infinite power panel may or may not exist. I am neither confiming nor denying.

review: a little under 15hrs and ASTRONEER is a charming experience. The exagerated stylization of objects and terrain makes for a simple &amp intuitive UI for players. You can dive and and start base building almost immediately with very little need for context. There are bugs and glitches but none have ruined my experience. The inventory system and crafting system still needs work. During my playthroughs late game the base is messy with no tools or commands to move or remove objects. (as of the time of this review)Overall 7/10 great music fun environment playful design easy to jump into and start exploring.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This is a very fun game! Even after playing about 35 hours I still feel like I'm discovering new things and I always find something fun to do. I definetely reccomend playing with a friend or two though the multiplayer is not fully optimized. I haven't had any optimization issues but I understand that that could happen. I feel that people will find the most enjoyment out of this game if they have the openmindedness and creativity to find new places to explore and things to do. The possibilities are (nearly) endless when it comes to building structures roads bridges and massive bases. There are a few glitches that are often hilarious like dying twice (and sometimes even useful) but don't come by that often. I even have a truck orbiting the base planet on one of my worlds! While most of the glitches I've found hasn't harmed the gameplay too bad every once in a while you glitch through the ground and fall to your death or the truck your riding in gets launched into infinity and beyond. (which was kinda hilarious) This game is pretty forgiving though as you respawn with your shoulder attachments augmentations and whatever your holding with your mouse. In addition almost every resource is pretty easy to retrive once you've gotten to it once with the exception of Astronium which was useless to my dismay after mining down nearly to the center of the planet. Overall Astroneer is a very fun exploration and building game and with enough creativity you could play for hours upon hours.

title: ASTRONEER

review: First and foremost this is an alpha. There will be bugs. The game is incomplete. Understand this before writing a review.All that said this game is great! I've never aspired to do anything more than collecting space dirt with an oversized suped up vaccuum cleaner then 3d printing stuff with that dirt. Astroneer teases you with tiny bits of visible resources at the surface of the planet leading you down a rabbit hole of needing to find out just how much is actually there. Once you've finished with that patch there's another one within eyeshot of the first. You want to go mine that one too but you've got to go back to base to refill on air and power. If only there was a way to carry more air or power so you could go out longer. Your first mission... You now have the means to stay out longer and you've cleaned out yet another pit of goodies and there's still more to find but your backpack is full... If only there was a way to carry more. Your second mission... This is what Astroneer is. It is the progression based space exploration and industry that drives everything that is fantastic about this game. It takes the resource gathering and machine building of Minecraft to make your job easier and pairs it with simplistic construction while still having a deep enough progression system that requires you to keep making trips out to build that next module.Playing this game even in its incomplete state has shown me what this game can be. With their suggested "automation" update and the dynamic ability to build sprawling planetary bases in whichever configuration desired is a recipe for hours of enjoyment in building the most efficient resource gathering pipelines anyone can think of. Couple this with interplanetary travel and you have the makings for Spore's resource trading on a smaller more intimate scale. And the best part is you will be the one who creates it all.This is probably one of the best "make your own fun" games I have played in a long time. There's not a lot here since it's an alpha but it's the potential that has me excited. It's what the developers have said they want to create that has me captivated. It's their communication and devotion to the project that has me in love with this game. I can't wait to see what it becomes...TLDR Buy this. Support the small team creating a game for gamers not the publishers. Be open minded and imaginative about what this game can and will become and you will have a fantastic time.

review: I bought Astroneer a long time ago. I think it could have been a year since I purchased the game or longer but I'm just estimating. The game was good in many ways it had solid cute graphics and interesting space exploration gameplay as well as a sort of 'space movie colonization' feel but once you had finished up building everything for your station the game got boring for me. I set it aside for a while. A long while. But one day I was scanning my steam page and I was like 'Hey this game was a little bit fun when I got it and it's had a lot of updates since I last played so I'll give it another shot'. Astroneer could not have changed more from when I first played it. The graphics haven't changed much no but that really wasn't where the game was lacking before. The basic concept of the game hasn't changed much either. However so much of the core mechanics of the game have changed and have continued to change and are continuing to change. Let's unpack what this game is. It is a base building space survival game with beautiful textureless graphics. If you want a story then you're out of luck but if you prefer more opened ended choice based gameplay then this is a game you should look into.Now let's see what's awesome about it. It takes place in space With numerous updates all of the bases you build become more functional and more complex It lets you feel the thrill of space exploration as you blast of to amultitude of precedurally generated (I'm sure) planets in your solar system. Access youur machinary through interactive 3D pop up panels that simulate operating controls Use a construction/deconstruction tool to mine resources and mould the world around you. Want to do something with all that dirt? You can using (I think) the mineral extractor and special cannisters. Power your base through a variety of components like solar panels and generators. Kit out your backpack for adventure with the correct atatchments and materials mounted upon it via the interactive 3D backpack menu. Build up your base by buying blueprints with bytes obtained while researching strange alien anomalies. Combine everything you love about base building RTS with everything you love about interstellar survival. And so so so so soooo much more.At this stage in the games developement I cannot say much in the way of things Astroneer does wrong especially since thegame is in earl access and any problems are liable to get fixed.By and large Astroneer is going to be worth your time. I have never been more gratified to have purchased a game pre release except maybe for PUBG and since I have logged roughly 140 hours of PUBG that comes as a complement. Thus I recommend this game to virtually everyone who is interested in its genre mechanics or anyone who is simply looking into it. Astroneer is a good game and it keeps getting better and better.

review: I've had my eye on Astroneer for some time now and I finally took the plunge this weekend... Totally worth it.The gameplay is similar to Minecraft so comparisons to it are warranted however the immersion level of Astroneer is in my opinion far greater. One moment you're traipsing across a verdant field of some random planet and the next you're running for your life to find oxygen or shelter from a massive wind storm.Originally I was drawn in by the minimalistic graphical art style which I love and I was kept engaged by the gameplay. As more features are added to the game I can see that I'm going to be sinking a LOT of hours into Astroneer. When I have more available funds I intend to purchase a copy for my son as well so that we can play together.As long as these developers don't go all 'Paradox games' on their customers and instead add lots of free features and content the upside for this game will be enormous. For Astroneer the future is bright indeed.

review: This game.. Oh my god I love it. I love the choice of vector graphics art style.First of all this game is better than it seems in the videos. I was "iffy" on the game until I actually got into it.One thing to mention however is that the game doesn't have much longevity unless you like starting a new game over or you really enjoy the exploration aspect.I find this game great because it uses a very interesting concept that games like star citizen and elite dangerous achieve. However the difference obviously between the three is art style/gameplay. I think both are very well executed for these reasons 1. The art style is simple (Vector like mentioned before)and not very resource intensive. While its simple its also very beautiful. The worlds are very intereresting and vary alot.2. The gameplay is simplistic as well but in a good way. It's basically collect resources and build a colony. With the stage I am at in the game I dont know if you can visit other planets like the moons of your starter world but I think with there being a shuttle in the game you probably can. While as of now there isnt a ton to research it is enough to keep you occupied. At the time of me writing this the research system was completely reworked and they will likely be adding more items as they go on.It is important to note however that this game is in alpha and has a long way to go. I look forward to its development and growth and hope to see this game thrive.

review: Even for an Alpha this game is very enjoyable and interesting to play and even more interesting if like me you weren't told how to do anything beforehand (figuring things out feels like an aspect of the game itself). I love the sound cues (for research oxygen and sandstorms for example) the different dangers and ways to deal with them and how you get your research currency. I also love how you can slide down hills like you're using a snowboard though at one point that nearly killed me hehe. Sandstorms though dangerous and annoying are an interesting and nice detail which to me makes the game the tiniest bit more special.The only thing that has annoyed me so far is how tricky it is with making slopes like to go to a lower part of a cave or from the banks of a river to the bed.Seeing as I've played 2 and a half hours so far and have barely moved from the area around my pod I think I'm going to play this game for a while.

review: This is an early access game which means I would urge you not to buy it till it is complete. Currently it is far from completion. I only bought it early because I see merit in the game as it is. Astroneer is a casual base building game that allows you to explore randomly generated planets. It is in no way challenging or punishing death merely means losing items in your backpack. The game actually offers very little in its current state you merely explore research and build. This is worrying considering the game is early access open world and has crafting. We've seen a huge influx of these kind of games gaining far too much attention and revenue for the garbage they are. A prime example of this is No Man's Sky.However Astroneer is not in any form a NMS copy. NMS tried to create something expansive and unimaginably huge and beatiful to explore with minimum player direction. Astroneer can be seen as the polar opposite. Planets are much smaller but visually pleasing. Crafting and base building are simple but again pleasing. Instead of trying to create something expansive Astroneer is a much smaller package with a lot more polish on it.
title: ASTRONEER

If low perfomance has been scaring you away from buying the game I highly suggest buying it now! D
title: ASTRONEER

review: As of 2/18/17 this game is in pre alpha state so keep that in mind. I've currently played about 6.5 hours &amp have been a fan of crafting/survival game for a while with both minecraft &amp 7 days to die being high on my list.A few warnings 1) don't knock down trees2) don't put modules where you don't want them.3) don't make too many items via the backpack use the printer.You can't delete anything at this point in time and having a tree flop around your home base is terrible. Or having 20 tiny solar arrays when you discover the normal size (more efficient) printed version means a lot of wasted resources.The Review Astroneers environment/artistry &amp play style is great. The backpack inventory is a bit clunky but after a while you get used to it. Moving items from connector to connector is quick &amp easy and occurs outside any sort of "crafting menu" which is a nice change of pace. Labels might be useful or an in game wiki to help identify which slot is which. But trial &amp error works too.The ability to manipulate the land on a whim is pretty awesome build bridges fall to your doom or build up into the sky. There IS a way to make completely flat land too just takes a bit of effort but then you'll have flat land forever. I highly recommend having a flat base area for sanity sake. But besides functionality you can't really "build" anything the game is more about exploring &amp discovery then building it seems.Vehicles are hilarious to drive. At this point there's no damage &amp you can end of creating quite some epic wrecks! Your character will fall out so make sure you at least land on something solid.All in all I only have space travel to do try yet. I've otherwise discovered all in game content. Yet still the games impressive weather nice graphics easy crafting &amp random generated world. Excited to see what the next update brings!

review: I am hesitant to give a thembs up to this at the moment but I'm going to do it anyway on the simple basis of it is still quite a ways away from finished as of writing this. Personally I very much enjoyed my experience slowly building my base up and exploring the world. The atmosphere presents itslelf in a way that encourages mello and laid back playing as you explore a desolate uninhabited planet. The purpose as of this build is to find things to research and gather the materials needed to build your base. That's where the problems start. Once you research the tradeing post and fuel compressor you don't really need to explore anymore. You can trade 8 fuel for the rarest materials in the game and the fuel compressor takes nothing but energy to run. It changes from base building and exploration to useless trading. Until they fix it or give me a reason to go back to exploring the world (which I'm sure they will as they appear to be quite engaged with the community) then you might want to hold off on the purchase. Personally I still think that it's worth the buy for its mello vibe.Pros Very relaxed playing. A great game when you don't want to play something serious. Minerals are actually quite difficult to find out in the world and even then require certain research to obtain. Use of tethers stagger your exploration ability which makes reaching new places seem like an accomplishment. Terrain modifier makes any landscape interestingCons Fuel compressor gives limitless fuel for nothing. This allows for infinite trade platform exploiting. Can find most materials in &gt 10 hrs Lacking content as of current patchI'll try to update as more patches go live.Edit 8/9/17 A few patches have gone live and since then I have noticed significant changes in the game. Pros Developers still update regularly. I see a lot complaining about a lack of major changes but if they read any of the updates the developers have a list of priorities and making sure the kinks are worked out is important before adding new content on top of broken old. Hydrazine trading post exploit fixed making exploration more of a necesity. Can no longer just use the fuel condensor to trade hydrazine for whatever you would likeNeutrals(?) if you are starting from a new save since the patches to the game the updates to the research tree stretch out the pacing a bit. More products to find means less chance to find the one you need right away. You might get a spaceship with no source of hydrazine for miles. While I enjoy the stretch in gameplay I can see how this would be an annoyance to others.As it stands right now I still give it a tentative recommendation. The designers make no claims of having a finished product and game design takes time. I knew it would be a while before the game is complete. Now if they released it without some sweeping changes that would be a different story.

review: Let me start by stating the obvious this game is NOT finished. With that out of the way I gotta say holy is it a good game. I know there's been a lot of reviews of people saying they have a lot of framerate issues or bugs but as to be expected from a small developer in a pre alpha game. Those things aside this game is marvelous. I love the unique style of it very simple but deep in a very similar way that Minecraft is. The sound design is very fitting for the atmospher too. It manages to feel very much like Minecraft without feeling like a complete rip off breathing new life into this create in a sandbox environment and survive genre of games. The building/crafting is smart and lends itself to the space theme of the game very well. With further polish and features enemies buildable items etc etc. this game will keep players engaged and having fun for a time quiet a bit of time. SUMMARYGraphics 8/10 (Mostly for unique style game has a lot of pop in/framerate issues very common in early releases)Sound 8/10 (Effective background music and audio ques)Gameplay 9/10 (Simple fun very easy to pick up and play for 5 min sessions or for much longer) Overall 8.5 (Minecraft meets Space Engineers in a very subtly simple awesome game)

review: This is a very fun game. They have smoothed out some bugs over the past week that make it better and the devs seem to be working and adding pretty frequently. There isn't a lot to do in the game though. I still recommend it for the price. The graphics are great the music is good but if you are on an AMD processor you will hit a bug where the audio causes the game to chug really slow. Turning off all sound makes the game run buttery smooth. I say there isn't much to do because there isn't. The whole point of the game from a gameplay perspective is to build up a base to make it easier to survive the planet you are on. You collect resources to build more and more things and soon have a large base to the point where there is no more reason to build or collect resources. There are no weapons or fuana/mobs. It's pretty much an exploring game. The only surviving aspect is from the elements. Making sure you have plenty of oxygen and power is really all there is to the game. They have a lot planned for the game that will add greatly but it is alpha so there is a lot to be expected before final release. Their path to release and the things they want to add look like it will add greatly to the game and make it more fun. For the price right now it is totally worth it.

review: ASTRONEER is an incredible game. Seriously impressed with how addicting this game is. I'v had it for maybe 4 days and i'v logged over 30 hrs and counting. After playing the first little bit i understood how everything worked right away i love the simplicity and diversity that the game has. I spent quite a few hours just trying out different base configurations and designing different vehicles to suit my area/needs. I love how you can explore litterally everything on the planet and shape anything you want really. There are some expected bugs and glitches as it is early access and still in development but i cant wait for more updates and to see where this game goes. I love how everything is modular and snaps into place would love to see more items/research and vehicles but i'm sure we'll get there in the next updates to come. Definately worth 20$ would recomend to anyone who enjoys open world exploration and base design games.

review: I played Astroneer for a very short time as you can probably see. I've been following this game since the beginning and have had high hopes for it and still do. The only problem with it at the moment at least that I ran into was stability. But it IS in alpha. So this is understandable. My computer is perfectly adaquate to run the game properly however I experience frame drops and stutters constantly. Did not matter if visuals were set to high or low or anything in between. You may download the game and not have any issue with that and thats great play on! It's a great game! I recommend this game because I KNOW it has enormous potential and the devs are being very active putting out updates. Plus if not for the constant frame issues I'd be playing it like crazy right now. It's that good. So if there are devs reading this please look into a fix for framerate issues. ) A google search will reveal I was not the only one dealing with this. I'm taking a step back from this game for a while but I WILL be coming back. I'll be watching this game's progress very closely.

review: From the little i have played of this game i have loved it. The content itself is somewhat lacking but seeing as how its a prerelease game im really digging it thus far. My biggest issue is performance related. I love exploring in games like this but i have found in my quest to travel around the world that its kind of impossible. Once i get five or so minutes by rover away from the landing site the game seems kind of broken. Mountains look like a bad acid trip caves wind around the surface of the planet much like minecraft after the ravine update and my framerate drops to single digits. With 16gb of ram an 8350 and an rx470 i would expect better framerate from a machine that can handle most games on ultra without a skip. I would highly recommend the game for 20 dollars but one must keep in mind that its in prerelease. I look forward to watching the game grow and branch out as the developers collaborate with players and continually improve upon their product.

review: Well I dont like writing reviews but I thought I would write one.Before reading below I will say they are a couple spoilers. (No choice if I want to give pro's and con's.)Pro's Great graphics and really smooth running.Sound is good (not music sound) and seems to match the type and style of game.Music I don't know as i never have music in any game.Controls on keyboard are ok and easy to understand and use.Content is good but at my stage in playing I miss some things I was expecting. Such as the ability to build a habitat that looks like a house or dome. (They may be in game but I don't know.)The in game weather is ok but need more types.Con's I have a few cons but not to many.So the game needs an ability to flip vehicles upright again. It takes long time to try to dig down and flip a vehicle in a hole.Next issue is the vehicle based drilling needs better control and the ability to move slowly while digging so you don't always have to jump in and out of seats.Also the drill should grab more materials at once when drilling it grabs so little (Or it does seem so to me.)And a big issue for me is the game needs a map that points out locations of bases on a planet. (I know there are beacons but they are little help unless you want to use 100's at a time. As you can not see them from a far)The dig tool needs a bit better tweeking. When you press ctrl to level land it should have a pinpoint section so you choose area level you want to make. Right now I get slopped hills up and down and rarely get a flat surface. Its even worse when you build bases bigger at different times.Thats it for my pro's and con's its not all but some.The cons look like lots of bad but they are not they are only what I think would make the game better.The game is fantastic and one of the best openworld games i have played and I have many.I know it is early access but it is really a great game at this stage and worth the cost even if not on sale.All in all I give this game at this point a big thumbs up and would buy it without a doubt or hesitation.So guys and or gals take a chance and buy the game.Thanks to the Devs for making this game and all the hard work.
title: ASTRONEER

review: An extreamly enticing game to fill the void of space exploration that no mans sky could not fill. This game is nothing short of incredible the engine how it plays the graphics are all brilliant and I love the art style of it. its very easy to get the hang of it without any tutorial or guide (there is a guide but I never used it as there was no mention of one) but exploring is very pleasent on the surface. Nothing will harm you other then falling into a ditch. or sliding down a mountain face. But underground the plant life have there own mind sets! Now I know this game is alpha and it's totally worth buying just to see how it'll grow playing the patches testing etc. but this game has so much potential to build something incredible and something no mans sky couldn't even dream of. I really hope more resources are added to the game too like compounds or chemicals. but honestly just thinking about what might be introduced to the game makes me feel giddy and this game has filled a whole no other game has in a long long time. Thank you!!!!

review: What a fantastic early access game! There's about 4 6 hours of content here at the moment. Probably another 10 hours if you hop to the other planets you will be doing the same thing on each one but the climates offer an an oportunity to set up your bases differently. However really your imagination with the terraforming tool is where the real fun happens do you carve out the world build a ramp to space build towers dig to the core expand your base into the caves.The art style is cute and functional be it the polygons or the player structures it defintely has appeal and matches perfectly together. Performance is fine although control of the vehicles needs a little work. For me this is the surprise title of the year coming in at the 11th hour.There is so much potential here Subnautica esque.Buy it you wont regret it.

review: AboutYou start off on a planet you know nothing about It's a random planet and when you land on it you must try your best to gather it's materials resources and other precious things in game your base is an oxygen receiver once you come in contact you get oxygen and you can continue your journey. If you decide to leave your base to gather materials you might run out of oxygen and pass out once you pass out you lose all valuable resources you collected. But once everything is nice and settled your goal is to make it to outerspace and explore more planets by exploring planets you can set other civilizations and make something called a b solution which is pretty much a massive civilization where everything is put into one and you're the ruler of every planet you touched base on. GameplayThe mechanics and gameplay are gorgeous and well put together there is no lack luster in the timeline of this game it seems extremely well put and it all adds up in the end there is no missing spots.The creativity of the game also is beautifully fit the simple ways of gathering resources and losing oxygen on this blank world you know nothing about but all of a sudden you think of it as home as you slowly grind away in the objectives in the game.Something else that is extremely fun is that you have the freedom to search the whole planet and eventually get an oxygen receiving mobile junkie so you don't have to grind oxygen everytime you're farming resources. Graphics I can say one thing the graphics may be cartooney but this is one of the most beautifully crafted graphically state game i've played that involves cartooney graphics it's just really great and everything is a beautiful site and I just keep saying to myself "thats a beautiful site" because it just really is. ConsThe replayability is terrible in this game because if you already migrate on your home world you can easily do the same thing on another planet and pretty much make the same EXACT home base every time so you don't have creativity when playing.Another con about this game is the lack of content the content in the game is extremely minimal and eventually when the full release comes around there will be more but at the time of writing this review the content is minimal and it effects the gameplay as you need different items in the game to expand your civilization on your homeworld without these items it feels like once you're done with your civilization you can't use a different method by using other tools to create a civilization. OverallThis game is great I haven't played it much due to the fact that in 2.9 hours I made my whole civilization and I don't need to put the time to make another one.If you like space games this is for you just keep in mind that it's boring after your civilization is made but if you throw your friends in you'll have a more of a fun time.So I'll give it a 7/10.

review: This is a fun lighthearted game. I am not a big FPS fan as I used to do it in real life. I find such games have a place I find them to be a good stress ball but when played often they have the reverse effect. This game is about mining exploring and building. I love the atmosphere of the game as the stars moons or other planets cross the sky and you can fly to them. The mining is much more as the ground reacts in a fluid clay like motion not big square blocks. I would love to see more building brought into the game. I actually was attracted to this game after playing Terra Tech for like 2 days straight. Astroneer has more modular building aspect to it. You build a platform that has slots where equipment plugs into such as seats or power sources that are crafted at a machine or smaller components straight from your backpack. Equipment can also be salvaged as you explore planets. I wish it would introduce a building aspect somewhat like Terra Tech so you could get more creative in your mining and space endevours. I give it a 3.7 out of 5 in its current state. Fun game with great potential.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Product received for free. Got this as a Birthday gift from a friend.1st 2 3 hrs Started to play around getting the feel of the game. Died 7 times (5 to suffocation) got lost underground far away (suffocated) then managed to make 2 research stations and a few things here and there.2hrs later made a small rover explored away from the base got caught in the storm while driving so i got out to use my rover as cover. Got hit and died as soon as i got out.20 mins later Managed to make my Large rover set out to retrieve equipment from small. 20 more mins later fell into a cave dug myself out and got out with rover.1 hour later I think im lost...UPDATE 1 2 hrs later managed to finally find my base.Flew to different planet's jumped into the man eating hole in radiated attempted to blow it up for science.14 hr since i first played found out how to use the "Flatten function" of the tool. Finally there arent holes around my base where i mined for soil XD&gt

review: Alpha game is alpha there is a severe lack of content and polish. However the core game is very solid the mechanics intuitive and the best approach to an inventory system I've seen in a survival/sandbox game. I recommend buying in but unless you are ready for a long wait (Think Space Engineers or Subnautic) hold off. update After a year in EA not much has really changed in the game. Overall the research and base updates seem to have slowed the game down rather than make the experience more interesting/challening. Rather than adventuring for a specific kind of item to research to unlock something you throw the item on a scanner and wait an hour to accumulate enough points to unlock the item. As of now its really not clear what the "game" is.I bought into the EA with the pitch of exploration and complex industry. So far neither of these items have been significantly addressed or is it clear how they will be implemented. I think I'll have to double down on my origional thought of holding off as I'm not sure what this game will turn out to be at this point.

review: Product received for free. Saw this game and was like "That looks cool."Onto the wishlist it went.As far as I can tell I've been given some kind of preveiw of the game.So here's my thoughts on it. Yeah Man I like this game.It's got that old school minecraft feel to it ya know?Let me list some of the features and you tell me if they sound any different.&gt Solo Player&gt Survival&gt Random World&gt Exploration&gt Mining&gt Building&gt ores&gt Processing Tools (Smelter/Crafter/etc.)No difference eh?Wrong.This game gives far more of a feeling of isolation.Kinda my cup a tea yeah.What i can tell you is that the other day i was playing this(It was the first time cracking it open)And im going down into this cave right?Errie Right?But ya know this game's pretty chill.Heart rate's about 30 bpm.So im wandering round' down there.See this green snot looking thing. I mine it. It pops!Not only was I startled My entire person had been removed from the chair. almost had a heart attack. 10/10.Loving it so far.Needs a map.Go lost...lost my base...Ironically enough i was goingout in my car to collect mroe resources to craft another car.Now i'll lose both the car tand the materials for the next car if i die. dammit.overall keep your eye on it good stuff. 6/10 (as of the Alpha version of the game.)

review: Product received for free. This game is recommended if you like just exploring and building a base in space but no intense combat. For me it seemed to start out a bit slow until I unlocked the space rover. Then it started to feel more fun. I personally would like for there to be more of a combat aspect to it but if you would rather it not have any combat this might be a good game for you. It mostly relies on exploring to find resources and then using them to build your base. Building is a simple concept and is easy to learn. Also you won t find yourself having to grind as much us some other games.However I have encountered some bugs with the multiplayer aspect of the game which is to be expected with early access games. Basically after playing for about an hour I couldn t move any objects in the game until I restarted it. And then I found out that when you leave a multiplayer game you die. Which is no big deal because you just have to run back to your corpse to re loot your items. That annoyed me but this hardly put a damper on the core gameplay. And by the way this game feels best when played with someone.Also any computer that isn t too old should be able to run this game.Over all though very fun gameplay nice feeling graphics and large exploration make this a recommendation.8/10
title: ASTRONEER

review: I love how early the game stage is in and how well it is in yet there are some bugs that usually end out as a 10 minute laughing session.Astroneer is a low poly sandbox survival game where you are in a different solar system (what in the actual fook are you there for?) and pretty much making a life there you can explore caves shipiwrecks and even fly to different planets and even solar systems!There is also a multiplayer feature in the game but it is only really meant for friends there isn't in game chat but assuming you're friends you can use steam chat or discord to talk. Multiplayer is also a little bit unbalanced in a way that the server host cannot kick nor invite friends it is up to the friend to join the game via steam chat. I don't quite like this feature because if you have lots of friends and one happens to be a troll well you're boned.But before you buy this game make sure your system can handle it even though the min. specs were quite low I found myself running through a few lagspikes during the game playing on my laptop while traveling.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This is one of those few games on EA that you absolutely know is going to be giant hit at launch. It's quirky it's fun it has a wonderful atmosphere and the graphics are absolutely gorgeous.Obviously the game is in EA so there are bugs and the tutorial is broken but with these thing in the past I can see only one brilliant game for your library.It's a good price and the developers seem to be very nice. I have not tried MP yet so I can't comment on that but I do find the SP very absorbing and charming. Try it I bet you don't refund. )It has to be a thumbs up for me.

title: ASTRONEER

review: If you like things short sweet and to the point scroll down to the bottom After 103 hours of gameplay I can tell you that this game is a little buggy and lacks content after a certain point. BUT I will stand by this game for as long as it takes because it has A LOT of potential. And while this game seems like it was released "too early " I think it was for a good reason. The second you start the game it shows you a message from the devs saying that they want to build a game together with the community and I can really respect that. It's important for developers to keep in touch with their players as it only helps them progress towards a greater product.While there doesn't seem like there isn't much to do in the game right now I would say to give this game a go support the team with your purchase and maybe even post in the System Era forums! It's only going to help them.Thank you for your time )*UPDATE*This game is going to get a major update by the end of 2018 that the devs announced during E3. I feel as though now is a better time than ever to start getting into Astroneer if you're interested. Simplified Review I recommend buying this game even if you have the slightest interest in it because Graphics are beautiful Gameplay is solid Your feedback helps the devs make a better game The bugs can be hilarious
title: ASTRONEER

review: I've had a chance to play around with Astroneerand find it rather compelling.I like it . . . a bit too much actually. 9.9 Sleep used to be such a LOVELY thing.I doubt the stuff exists anymore. )Having played Minecraft Space Engineers Avorian and Starmade I find many similarities Sans blocks.What I also find is a VERY nice visual astethic.The graphics are pleasant as a picture in a children's book About space.Although most of my time has consisted of tooling around on my starter planet rather than building a ship to check out any of the other planets . . . yet.And it has been an enjoyable trip.There's a definite sense of "What's that over there?" .Astroneers gives you lot's of toys to play with randomized planets to explore each with their own biome passive aggressive plant life no obvious options for PVP NO fantasy magic and a sound track that lulls you into a false sense of security whilst the Dust Storm stalks about like some menacing great volumetric creature.A note about blocky base building There ARE NO blocks like you would use in other blocky building games.You sculpt the terrain. There ARE tools to help make your work more polished. You'll need to unlock them via gameplay.That's just with making structure shaped sculptures.The actual working equipment of the base you build is a bit modularand all snaps together like a model kit with working bits.The tutorial was fine.I personally DID resort to searching online for more info.Someone is running an Astroneer wiki and there are plenty of Youtube videos to sort through although not many of them are completely straightforward to the point.The game itself is basic with some depth.Once you get up and running it will be mostly second nature to play the thing.Ultimately I get the impression that Astroneers is a great big scavenger hunt.Searching for all the goodies is a great deal of fun.If you can control how much time you spend on this game it should be fine.Otherwise You may end up discovering that you've lost 2 days on this thingwithout the foggiest idea as to where they went.Maybe you'll find them in one of the cave systems or over the next hill . . . )

review: GameplayGameplay is very simple and easy to understand. You go out dig for ores/minerals and create a bigger habitat. I believe you can go into space though I haven't yet I have been waiting on a buddy to go further into the game. Why play this? If you enjoy any form of space game and you enjoy playing with RCT esque terrain editing this game is extremely fun. I do wish we had more control over the terrain editing. As I would like to build a dirt garage for my truck but I'm sure that will come with time. Surviving? Make tethers with compounds and make other habitats around mining areas. and KEEP AWAY FROM THE GREEN GAS!!!!! It does follow you and it does kill you!!!!.

review: GameplayThis is a really solid interesting and fun game. Firstly when I bought this game I was really overall thinking that I will just get bored on the first or second hour of playing this game but I was greatly wrong. There is just so much fun stuff to do finding caves mining resources finding blueprints building habitats. And the best thing is that this is just the early alpha meaning that in the future this game will 100% have much much more stuff and things to do. At the moment I am at the point where I have found all the blueprints as there arent that many but still a good amount tough. But I still haven't explored all the planets I haven't even gotten into exploring my own starting planet as much as I would like to. BugsDuring my gameplay I have found some bugs but not to an extent where I am really annoyed or mad. I have heard that for some people their saves have corrupted etc. But for me I haven't really run into big problems. Just the minor issues like getting out of a spaceship makes you stuck on an extension which you have to jump out of or being able to land your spaceship on top of an another one.Should you buy this gameIf you like exploring scavenging building space and stuff. Then it's a big fat YES. Keep in mind that this is the early alpha so this game isn't even close to being finished which might set some people off but I dunno at this point in my opinion it is really enjoyable and I think this might become a really awesome game in the future.

review: My original review was very positive because Astroneer seemed to "come out of the gate" with a great start. For 8 months now there has been nothing new with the content. Some bug fixes here some tweaks there. It's unclear what this dev team is actually doing with their time. I don't need new content every week or even every month. But this is WAAAAAAAAY too long of a wait without seeing more content and without seeing what vision the devs have for the game.I am starting to strongly suspect they are intentionally teasing with no intention of any more real development. Prove me wrong and give us content.

review: Travel far enough away my friend and you'll find something truly amazing yourself. AnonymousI would revise this quote to include "Travel too far into a cave and you'll fall into another cave that contains another cave. Then spend the next 20 minutes getting your stuff back off your corpse!" +)Amazing how much detail there is in the environments lighting shadows and style. They are so clever in their "less is more" approach to design and put the right amount of detail in the things that you build compared with the landscape. This game is highly addictive and it is funny how much I actually die in this game compared to others. You get used to having a plan for how you want to build your base gather resources and progress. Then you fall off a mountain or into a cave are too far away from your oxygen supply and die. Then you spend the next 20 minutes getting your stuff back (which I call the walk of shame) due to your tiny stupid mistake. So much for your original plan but you learn a lot from your mistakes in the wild. I've lost track of how many times I've gone out the range of my beacons thinking to myself "I know where the hell I'm going who needs beacons!?!"... only to then find a research ball and then look up and not have a clue where you are! Then spend the next hour and a half traveling over half the planet desparately hoping to stumble onto one of your beacons. So fun! For an Alpha I've already had more fun than some games that have already been released fully with tons of DLCs.In summary this game is perfect for the price (I got mine for $15 during a sale) they are constantly developing it they have a roadmap vlogs trailers and a wiki page that really helps new players learn what there is to build and what does what. Buy this game get lost in it and find your way back. You might just learn something about yourself along the way! Zombie

review: Holy cow. My younger brothers got this game and recommended I should buy it too. They were not wrong. It may still be in its Alpha phase but it has quite a bit of content and very few bugs. There is a tutorial but it's not as clear as it could be but it was good enough and figuring out how everything works is part of the fun anyways. The format of the game is adventure mining and building.You are an astronaut on some planet and you gather resources to build up your base. You have a mining tool that absorbs the ground and to get resources they need to be uncovered from the ground. Once one clump of resource is uncovered it gets compiled into the mining tool and once enough of one resource is collected it is automatically put onto your backpack. You use the resources to create platforms and modules that enable more and better different machinary that can build tools that can assist in resource gathering. Capsules can be built to gather the ground that is cleared to get resources which can then be used to mold the terrain removing with the mining tool and adding with the stored ground.There is multiplayer though it seems to be between friends as one can invite another friend to a game or join a game that a friend is in. There are no public servers to my knowledge.I cannot wait to see what more will be added to the game more resources machines some form of a storyline discovering histories of past civilizations.Even if the game got abandoned right now there is enough content and running bug free enough that it still would be worth the money and time to those who have or will purchase it.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Astroneer...Astroneer is a space surviving game. It has sandstorms and caves and anything else you can imagine from a strange planet.I recomend this game from 10 to 26 years of age. It doesn't have a story and that is good to me.I dont recomend this game to a person that wants some story to the game.After all this is a really good game. The new updates are good.I recomend this game.

review: Feels like this game is getting worse.....peformance has gotten better but its not really fun anymore.Needs a creative mode to bring back some fun and freedom and experimenting its just dull now.Controls also feels more and more like the are made for a controller and its rather annoying.Feel a bit sad since i really used to enjoy this game but now basic stuff just seems to be trivial....like you used to be able to terraform as you pleased. So you could build all kinds of crazy stuff......now you have to collect the dirt This might seems as a nice Idea but really takes away 50% of the fun there was in the game. The other 50% are exploration and it dosent really seem to have gotten much new i noticed.......Albeit im now so bored by the game im not really getting past the start anymore....theres no surprice in what you are getting from research anymore....since i can look tru it all in a menu and thats very bad for actual exploration......I dont really have a reason to ever leave the hole i start out by digging...its will likely provide all the resources ill ever need.can build stuff like drills for cars.....But theres nothing worth drilling since you will likely have enough resources to build everything in less than an hour......So you just need to damn resarch nodes..that dont matter much anymore since they all do the same.....and not really hard to find.

review: Rating % Get it on sale!Impression Astroneer has a lot of potential but it's still early enough in its development that it yet remains to be seen if it will be a great game. The devs seem dedicated and appear to listen so that's always a plus. All that aside the concept is enjoyable colonize planets! gain tech! repeat! It's worth picking up on sale if you're interested or if you're very much into games like this at normal price point. That said it might also be worth your time to shop around a bit or simply watch this one until the development hits a point that sells you.Highlights Colonizing planets researching tech from strange alien organisms and dealing with interesting new dangers and mysteries.Fun art style!Responsive and dedicated development teamLowlights Does not play well on low end machines. Games like Boundless or Subnautica are still quite playable at lower quality settings on a basic 2 year old laptop but Astroneer chugs pretty hard even while doing something like adjusting the camera angle.There's not a lot distinguishing it from some of the other games available in this genre aside from the setting.

review: Since I've recently dipped my toe in the survival genre and I had my socks blown off by Unknown World's Subnautica I figured I'd check this little one out.In short up front great idea great work so far still a ways to go. Definitely worth a try if you have a spare $20 lying around (and I mean DISPOSABLE income) BUT I only got a few hours out of it before a bug (what I consider to be game breaking) made me put it down for the time being.The visual style and animations are fun and the interface is O K. I've seen/heard a lot of complaints about the camera/control system but I only had a real problem with it when driving the rover (I never got to the shuttle before the game broke on me). Lots of stuff to explore collect unlock and build but it would seem once one progresses to making travel between planets possible then it will get a bit repetitive. Again I got less than 10 hours out of my experience so maybe I'm missing something.As for the bug at some point after I got my rover ready to go the game stopped responding to the normal left click select function and a reload didn't fix it. I could unscrew it when at home base by unplugging the rover (or any other connected platform i.e. altering the local environment) but once out in the general environment I had no way to clear the bug. Without the ability to pick anything up you're pretty much hosed. Personally I'm not interested in putting 5 6 hours into a save game to have it break on me I just don't have that kind of spare time.So in the end I'll still recommend Astroneers because it is only in Alpha and I want to believe that it is still on a good path and the devs will give it the care and feeding it needs to turn into awesomeness. But seriously only drop the cash if you have extra to burn $20 is a bit steep for less than 10 hours worth of consistent gameplay (IMO).
title: ASTRONEER
