review: In general this game is simply amazing and gorgeous. Even though is still in early access it feels like almost a complete game the developers are constantly working on it and it's pretty amazing what nine people can do. The game has insane amounts of potential and for me right now this is the best game I've ever played about Exploration/Survival. In depth analysis ahead Gameplay The gameplay goes to the fundamentals of survivals you explore and mine resourses so that you can advance and upgrade your equipment and base/s. With simple controls I believe Astroneer brought an innovative way of mining resourses the Deform tool. Your basic tool throught the game that you'll always have. I found very clever the ways in which you can use the tool not just for mining but also creating new paths like bridges tunnels etc. Simple gameplay but very well made and kinda addictive. Graphics In terms of graphics Astroneer didn't went for a reaslistic aproach instead it went for a cartoony/low poly art style which is insanely gorgeous! The lighting effects are really well made and the low poly art looks really crisp and clean doesn't even feel low poly. The appeal for me is the simpleness of the graphics but the way which the devs made a very appeling and beautiful low poly art style is oustanding. Mechanics and Exploration In Astroneer the exploration is Open World which means there are no loading screens which is awsome. There's a limited amount of planets which you can explore but I believe this is for the better because then the game feels like it has a purpose explore all the planets rather than having an enourmous universe you'll never get to explore fully. Even though the World is limited there is a lot to discover just in the first planet that is smply outstanding. The vehicles for exploration are really versatile just with the Rover and Truck you can do a lot of different combinations of vehicles even combining between them. The same case with the Shuttle and Spaceship you can't combine them both but you can do several amounts of combinatins for each of them do you want a shuttle for exploration with just seats for your friends or do you want to do a shuttle with a storage for resourses? Both are posible and even more types of combinations. There could be more vehicles in the future that can bring a lot of diversity but right now even though that it is limited to four it doesn't feel like little. In terms of space traveling your are rigged to go on type of railroad with just the control of point and click for where you want to go but I believe this is for the best because the appeal of the game is planet exploration not space exploration still just watching the shuttle/spaceship move around the planets and landing is awsome. Potential and Final Thoughts This game has just insane potential the fact that this is still a pre alpha that is really well made is incredible. I have for 17 hours worth off gameplay and I think I haven't even explore 5% off this amazing world I know much people don't like to but early access games because it is a risk but for me this risk was really worthwhile. Finally this game will keep growing and becoming one of the best Exploration games of all time.

review: Ok I see alot of people giving this game a thumbs down and I can't agree. Strictly because it is in PRE Alpha and they even said so in the game decription so I'm not sure what people are complaining about. Now about my personal opinion it's great. It's amazingly beautiful and fun to play. Now after spending some hours you find yourself at a wall or doing the same thing over and over but that's only because that's what they're testing. I find myself coming back and spending a few days starting over and rebuilding a base over and over because I just enjoy the look and feel of the game. The little guys waving and noises they make are perfect. The inventory and crafting system is unique and actually really enjoyable to use. If you're looking for what NMS should've and could've been this game could be it when it's finished. I've seen some Dev streams and they're doing their best to make a great game and if that takes time then so be it. I'd rather have an amazing game like ASTRONEER in a few years rather than a steaming NMS pile of crap. To people thinking about buying it to play with friends but hesitant about spending the money and having it go to waste nothaving things to do you can do 1 of 2 things. Get it and enjoy the stuff in the game currently or toss it on your wishlist and keep an eye on it because I feel confident enough to say this game is going to be damn near perfect when it is finished.

review: This game well and truly has the potential to become something great. As it stands right now not so much.I played Minecraft while it was still f2p and in Alpha. To some degree Astroneer feels the same to me now as Minecraft did then. It was unpolished multiplayer was a mess and there were some simple memory drops (performance issues) but look where we got from it.Astroneer is definitely worth a shot if you're into the whole research base building exploring the universe kind of thing although as it stands right now you'll be amazed for about 10 hours untill you realize there is nothing more to explore.I truly hope the developers are looking into what they can do to make this game better and have some sort of vision. Although as it stands right now simply the base aspect of exploring space in the way that Astroneer enables you to that is amazing.I really hope they don't get too caught up in building bases on the ground if it were up to me I would definitely set my eyes to the skies and embrace the stars because that is where Astroneer should be headed. One thing I was hoping to find in my first playthrough was to make a base in space shoot a satellite into orbit which I could definitely see happening considering how the space travelling currently works. (As a side note this was actually an idea I got from seeing a crashed solar panel on the ground it was insanely huge and definitely part of something bigger and considering I was able to hook up my rover in order to charge up power for my next move I think it is definitely something the developers are looking into.)It seems at the moment the developers are a bit caught up in hiring more people and setting up shop in their new office so hopefully they'll get back on track and start releasing more content on a regular basis.TL DR Buy it Enjoy it Wait for future content.

review: This game is fun. Hear me out The game is fun and magical for the first 3 hour binge session. After that you realize that the game is mailny about farming for resources so you can keep going around the area unless you build a vehicle. (They have infinite Oxygen gen) But if you use your compound to build modules of your base you can run out of compound to keep making tethers and expanding the world. This is an issue the resources are non renewable. If you get this game be considerate of this. The game also has no goal it you never end up going to another planet or anything of the sort. This alone would improve the game 10 fold. This game has a lot of potential 100%. Maybe with better graphics and more straightforward goals it could justify the price. Still reccomend to buy if you're looking for a game that you start playing at 10 am then look up and find out it's 6 pm. If you're looking for a game to play casually 100% pick up this game.

review: It has some issues but it's alpha so what can you expect. I haven't encountered any game breaking bugs and I really enjoy the gameplay. It's a drop in play a little drop out kind of game at least it can be if you don't have much time at hand to play it. It lacks more content to extend it's playability and is focused mainly at exploration but that's done quite impressively. The only thing that botters me is vehicle handling it's attrocious you can't drive forward or back and turn like in other games it's like driving a howercraft and pressing the directions relatively to your view but with wheels on the howercraft which interfere with terrain obviously. Well on the other hand I see why they made driving like this. The terrain is realy bumpy and your vehicles would get stuck on it. But I realy hope they change this in the future. I do recommend it though you can get past driving and it's a really good game behind it.Edit The vehicle handling was changed (repaired) now it's fun and controllable. Can't find anything to complain about I love the direction the game is going!

I'll grant you that.But understand this this isn't a game you grind. You don't spend hours on it.This is a game you play with your cup of coffee in the morning before going to work. review: Astroneer is alright prolly 6/10? Music is good game play is entertaining. I've uninstalled it after the latest patch probably never play it again. They changed the simple click to activate machinery menus to Hold either Q or E if you click wrong you risk popping the box off the platform which tosses anything it's hold off into the general vicinity. Also digging in caves is noisy as hell now. It's loud and it echos. Turned all the volumes to 0 saved and still hear nothing but that sound. It's an alright game and I have very little issue with getting away from the simple click to activate machinery but jesus christ... The sound while digging in a cave is obnoxious.I'm sure that will get fixed I recommend the game it's just very short on content at the moment.

review: Bought this game and already love it.You can build mountains or sculpt the ones you find. Dig into the center of the planets you are on or build into the sky.A lot of things to explore and build great relaxing music as well as game play.... starting out anyway.There are so many things that will keep your attention and keep you going for more!Bought this game as a time waster and I can already see it is going to be a huge success! D Pffttt... and everyone says new space games are a waste of time. Different take on space exploration and a great way to get your space exploration building and mining fix!Overview You start out being blasted onto a planet with nothing more than a tool that helps you excavate and recreate. You have to find resources and craft things to aid you in your exploration of not just the planet you are on but many many many others.Graphics Amazing especially for a voxel world.Game play Only 1.6 hours into it but so far I'd give it a 2 thumbs up.Music RelaxingStory There isn't one yetIf you love to build random things or just like to explore stunning worlds then you will have fun in this game. I bought it on Humble Bundle and it was well worth it for the $14 I spent on it.EDIT 4 hours game playCaves are full of surprises... from wonder to danger. There is a lot to find and a lot to explore. Dig deeper and deeper the more you find the more you want to dig down more.EDIT 27 Hours of Game play 3 new saves and 1 multiplayer game with a friend... I am blown away by how awesome this game is. I am sure it will bring many more hours of play time and fun!!!hands down one of the best games I have ever played and that is saying something since I have over 600 of them on steam alone.

review: If you like playing sandbox survival games this game is FOR YOU. Although currently it's still in its Alpha phase this game is amazing. And by amazing I mean completely STELLAR (haha see what I did there? Stellar? Space? Haha). The game is extremely cool there are so many features that are so complex yet so easy to use. You can design everything to your taste and do what you want to do. But since it's still in its Alpha stage there are a few graphics and lag problems. Aside from that the gameplay is just fantastic. Everything about it can be explored more and more. All the cool little details are there and I can see more and more popping up in the full release. If there is this much awesomeness in the Alpha version I see so much more (and I mean A LOT MORE) potention in this game in its full version. My recommendation? BUY THIS GAME.

review: It's a cute early access space exploration game with some survival aspects already including power and oxygen. You need to collect materials to craft tools to help you survive longer such as an oxygen tank or tethers which extend your starting habitat's internal power/oxygen supply. You find medium/large objects in the world that you can research to obtain 'bytes' which are used to unlock upgraded tools and buildings.Overall the concept is fun especially being able to drop in and out of friends games as you wish. While there are a fair amount of bugs it's still in early alpha stages so I expect lots of improvements in the future. I would recommend picking up on sale if you liked the idea of No Man's Sky Star Citizen etc. but wanna just have some casual fun.

review: Amazingly addicting beautiful simple visuals! The sound track and ambient random sounds make for great atmosphere. Well designed fun system no HUD. Just you the planet and whatever you put in between. Terraforming base building cave diving mountain climbing planet hopping mobile base creation. The main objective for now is building a base on each planet and exploring like crazy. It's early access so I don't get why people are complaining about not having enough to do. They don't read the news updates for an unfinished game but they have an opinion just silly please ignore them. There is a lot more coming check out the E3 release and trello roadmap for more info but remember that teasers aren't far from spoilers. Many updates are set to drop between now and the 1.0 release and future content after the release is going to be free according to the Devs. Sometimes the updates kill your saves and yes the game is still a little glitchy sometimes.I think $20 is more than a fair price even If you do get bored after 10 or 20 hours. Part of the fun for now is creating your own challenges and objectives like making beacon rings around your planets tunneling to the planets core etc. and fine tuning your skills for the big 1.0 release thats being kept secret. My motto is There's always something else to do waiting for one thing means time to do something else. Build a monster base be an astronaut or a gypsy! Don't wait around for guns and stuff to kill the Devs already said it's not that kind of game. Eating drinking and sleeping also aren't going to be part of the game according to Devs.Big landscapes mountain ranges crazy caves and giant caverns to explore. I spend a lot of time fine tuning base building trying out different ways of exploring. There is a lot to research and build and more to come! I can't wait for character customization!
title: ASTRONEER

review: English version Really love this game more fun when you co op. There is one more thing i don't like about this game Multiplayer (Online co op) is very bad and when you are host you may get dropped fps (others will encounter some bugs). Vietnamese Tôi rất thích game này đồ họa khá ổn lối chơi hay rất vui nếu chơi cùng nhiều người (tối đa 4 1 người host). Nếu sửa được những lỗi này thì game thực sự hoàn hảo. Dù sao với mình nó vẫn rất đáng mua.

review: TL DR This is a very fun game with a lot of potential just needs a little more content and polishing.Played this game with one other person and had a lot of fun although in its current state only has about 10 15 hours of content if you do everything there is to do. There were some bugs that were apparently introduced into the game last patch such as only the host player being able to do certain things (manageable just slightly annoying) and the joined player in a game not seeing backpack crafting recipes. Having multiple planets to visit kept the game fresh a little longer but for the most part you didn't really NEED to ever visit a planet other than the starting one (with the starting planet resources you can build everything you need in the game). There was a little variance in hostile enemies on different planets but for the most part you never needed to wory about them.Suggestions 1.)need more uses for titanium and more things to build in general (i'm sure this is in the works)2.)unique resources for each planet with important uses making traveling/setting up bases there important3.)adding to the last one maybe an unmanned shuttle to send materials back to the main base4.)easier way to bring research and salvage back to the base was thinking maybe some sort of rover wagon that attaches to the player and can be dagged around and holds 2 4 research or salvages pieces (maybe different tiers of wagons) and slows the player down just like if you carried one research/salvage maybe make it so carrying a single one doesn't slow you down5.)special unique areas with special loot for example one filled with the ceiling grabbers and a ceiling too high to just break them so you'd have to dodge the tentacles

review: TLDR Good game expect bugs and glitches but an overall experience that is calming and relaxing that I keep coming back to due to the active devs. If its on sale its a must buy.If you like to watch a video version of this video you can find it here.OverviewAstroneer is a $20 game which fortunately a friend bought me. The price of this game is not justified compared to other games you can play for $20 in terms of receiving a polished product. That being said I would look at this game not as a ready to play product but rather an experience. As of this review I have logged in close to 14 hours but I don't plan on adding to that number anytime soon. The developers tend to prefer small changes as opposed to larger patches. Returning to this game to find many changes made is refreshing which is why I tend to return to this game periodically to note all the developments made. I was hesitant to review this game because of its unfinished state but I really wanted to explain how this game is different from others in the early access program and why it is worth at least a look into.OK THIS GAME IS PRETTY WONKY. Do not expect everything to work 100% of the time. Astroneer has this certain charm. The anger you feel for this game could be directed at a small puppy or an angry ex. At times when it messes up you can't help but laugh and start over but at times after you've put in all this effort into mining and gathering materials only to fall into a pit and die. GameplayWhen the gameplay does work its is really a unique experience the building/excavator tool in this game provides a whole new depth to the world as you aren't forced to react to events statically you can build a shelter or dig a whole. You mold the world into your needs which adds a dimension of satisfaction. Can't reach a mineral because it's across a trench? Build a bridge across. Gathering materials is this risky adventure. It seems mundae but in this game it becomes a risk vs reward situation. Should you go grab that extra copper you see or turn back now with all materials you have collected? The only major problem with the game is the end game there is none. Once you have amassed enough materials you are free to take your spaceship to another planet only to start the process all over again. I would like to see this concept expanded upon What if the planets you visit next belong to another player who has made their planet open to exploration? What if there was enough players on a planet that resources become extremely valuable and tradable. I know these are concepts that are really out there especially for an indie dev company but it would be really amazing to see this game progress that far. It will also be interesting to see how they keep the game simple and still attempt to keep the players attention.FeaturesThere is a really cool oxygen and energy system that forces players to get creative. Your space ship can have tethers attached to it which provide a line of oxygen to the player. The more tethers you chain together the further you can explore while still having an oxygen supply. Power is also derived from your spaceship which can be produced by generators solar panels and windmills. Power is supplied so long as you are hooked onto a tether. What this means is your rate of exploration is severely limited by how creatively you use your resources. It sort of works in a loop the more you explore the better gear you can make which leads to more and faster exploration. Atmosphere and PacingThe pace of this game is very relaxing. Currently there are no mobs in the game and the only things that have killed me so far have been sandstorms toxic gases pitfalls and major bugs. And usually major bugs lead to pitfalls so I guess there's not too many options there. Astroneer provides this relaxing gameplay but still manages an initially addicting sense of progression. This game is fun to play with friends or by yourself it is not really dependent on external factors for entertainment like some many other games are. However you will eventually find the pace of the game to become boring and strungout. The tasks you complete are extremely repetitive and while there is the aforementioned resource management it's not complicated and comparatively lands below games like Minecraft or Terraria. Anyone looking for a similar experience to those games will be sorely disappointed. Astroneer is a game designed to be a non competitive experience. A pure game which is why there are no mobs in the world. While it would make the game more interesting mobs within the game would just create panic. And I get the sense that System Era aren t really going for that vibe.GraphicsSo it goes without saying a game doesn t need realistic graphics to be beautiful and Astroneer does a great job of portraying this. Many indie developers are in a budget constraint for assets and it really provides them with an opportunity to be creative and make do with what they have. This game consistently looks pretty. Whether it be tunneling deep down in a cave or running tethers across a bare plain this game has got me in awe. The color choice in this game is really amazing and vibrant at times and dull and melancholic during others. The vibrant tones can clash hard with the somber musical melodies that are accomied in the game. While such a sharp contrast would not suit most situations in Astroneer it adds this mysterious almost eerie feeling. In a huge world it makes the player feel... small.Should you buy this game?Astroneer is a game that needs polish. However its core mechanics and design are very attractive so attractive that I believe that it suits the $20 price tag. While there isn t much depth to the game story wise there is a certain atmosphere that this game builds that I really don t find in other games. It treats itself so casually but once the player starts to explore the word and becomes immersed you start to realize just how lonely it is especially you are playing the single player. Maybe that's the point of the game maybe that's the only goal of the game. To make you realize that no matter how much you do there is still more to discover. That is till you reach the end game. Would I purchase Astroneer if I was you? Yes but maybe wait till there is sale.Pros+ Active Devs+ Simple Yet Beautiful Graphics+ Complimenting Soundtrack+ Initially Addicting Gameplay+ Fun with friends or Solo+ Much to Explore (But can feel hollow at times)+ Moldable Environment+ Lot of mechanics available for the player to explore+ Casual and Relaxing gameCons Lacking a good End Game Can become grindy past the mid game Can feel slow paced compared to other games Bugs and Glitches are apparent Little variety in Environmental Hazards

title: ASTRONEER

review: Alright Astroneer... The Game To Put It Plain Is As Good As I Feel An Early Access Game Can Really Get. Looking Through The Negitive Reveiws I See Theres A Ton Of Complaint With The Controlling Of The Rovers And Some Promblems With The Interaction Buttons Which Really I Don't Mind The Problem... I'm Used To These Kinda Buggy Controls By Now I Know To Look For The Text Promt To Know What I'm Doing... I Know To Hold The Interaction Key... Ect Though I Can't Really Say It's Bad Controls It's Just "Differnt" It Seems Wrong That People Gave This Game A Poor Reveiw Due To The Controls They Can't Get Used To But. I Don't Know Might Just Be Me.NOW! The Bugs! The Wonderful Early Access Bugs! Now Personally I Still Don't Like The Bugs That Do Apper Which Are Hardly EVER But To List The Few I Have Seen In My Time Playing The Rover Launching Into The Sky (0.6.5 Seems To Have Fixed Such Bug Terrain/Collesion ) Normal Wind Speeds Blowwing Standing Materials ( I.E Copper Aluminum Titanuium Ect. ) And Lastly The Crazy Flying Habitiat Bug ( Also As Of 0.6.5 Is Gone ). These Bugs I've Found Are Not "GAME ENDDING PROBLEMS FIX YOUR DEVS" Nor Are They A Pain It's Early Access I'm Alright With Such Problems As Long As The Devs Care ( Which They Do ) To Fix The Problems When They Can But More Importently To Keep This Game Growwing...Now The Big Talk Of A "Story" To Astoneer Thats Not Somthing This Game Needs. I Mean If You Want Story Try "Subnautica" (#SPON) Or Somthing ( I Won't Go Into Detail This Is For Astroneer ) But This Game I Feel Is Wonderful With Or Without A Story Line ( But Incase Thats Not Enough For You Check One Of The Other 1 000s Of Suggestions/Reveiws To See Their POV On A Story ) If The Devs Wanna Make A Game Thats Been About Making A Base On All The Planets Zoomin' Around Orbits And Crusing Terrain In A Rover Then Hey. I Say They Go For It But It's Just Not Nessasary For This Sandbox/Exploration Game... Annnd Thats About All I Have To Say Really The Game Is Progressing Things Are Getting More Optimized Updates Thing Bring New Things To The Table While We Wait For Game Stablility... All That Good Stuff So... I'm Quite Happy With The Game Bugs Or Not. For More Insight Look No Further The The Games Store Page For More Details On Recommended Set Ups And The Games Intro Froms The Devs.Thank You Everyone For Your Time. ( Update 0.6.5 )

review: No refunds required here. Best Pre Alpha EverThis is what all Early Access games should be like. A joy to play and test. I'm not going to sit here and say it's perfect of course it's not the driving physics and control method leave much to be desired. But what the hell? You're on an uninhabited planet in a vast uncompromising (except for when it compromises.... usually with compond) universe. So the physics are going to be funky.I didn't hate No Man's Sky... at all. I just got bored of it. But this is not that game... nor is it "Minecraft in Space". This is a world unto itself that continues to engage me after almost constant play for 2 days and too many hilarious and infuriating deaths to count (suffocates 1 step from tether line.... falls to death while tunnelling through a mountain.... gets killed by a flying research item 3 steps from shelter during a dust storm)11/10 Would go in search of "Compound" again

I have personally not come across any bugs or performance issues so far but I feel that the game is easy to master and hard to forget. You can't expect that you will be shoving as much time and effort into this game as you would an MMORPG but you can expect to want to launch it randomly throughout your life whenever you see the title or logo. As odd as it may sound it's worth buying even if you only play for a few days or hours.

review: Great game! There are lots of things to do once you get the hang on how it works. This is by the way the major problem why there are many negative reviews. Most people do not figure out how it works. So indeed my first 15 minutes were literally helplessness since I did not know what I was meant to do. Then I realized that F1 not only shows you "the newest features" but basically tells you how to play. Maybe some sort of tutorial would be great or at least some pinpointer with text telling you like "get some cargo" "unpack this sh*t" "check out what it can build" "place this sh*t" "plug this sh*t into the base" etc. Or getting some notification that tell you why things happen like "Oh your base has a power problem. You should somehow get more power." Give the player some hits what he is actually searching for. This would definitely short cut the part where most players are just to bored to explore everything. I only found out about the terrain flattener by scanning the keyboard shortcuts and I had problems finding the things I can get with my bytes. I think the game has super great potential if just the player gets to know better what tools actually are at hand.

review: Update Devs made personal contact which is more then enough to restore my confidence in this early access product.Update 2 (month later) Still no patch notes and a lot of non communication game is sadly untestible this way which is the actual point of early access and especially for an experimental branch. For now I've changed to DON'T BUY at this moment again because it's simply unclear if devs are actually fixing anything and the current state of the game needs good updates before being worth it again.Update 3 Sadly bug reports get closed by mods yes bug reports in an early access game. I can't really give a positive comment anymore. Done with astroneer sadly...Asking for patch notes for the experimental branch is called "noise" and is locked so you can't even reply.Well then I choose to make noise again and reply by writing a negative review as customer support is as important as the product itself.Pro's " Game is actually good. (will never deny that unless it's actually getting bad).Cons Ignoring paying customers. Early Access product that doesn't want to get tested.

review: I honestly came into this game with low expectations. I saw the E3 demo and thought it looked ok but didn't think mutch of it. Fast foward a couple of months and me and my friend decide to both buy this at the same time. And holy it blew us away how the game was played and looked. It destroyed both his and my expectations and left us in awe of how much fun it was. Now imagine if No Man's Sky was good. That's this game an amazing expierience from when we started to when we eneded. The only complaints that we had during our game was the lack of a tutorial. We of course don't want to spoonfed the content with directions on how to do everything (that would be boring!) just a bit more directions other than basic controls. For example the game never tells you that the ending hubs can't be added on to. We didn't know that and it ended our first base. Other than that and minor performace issues They could release this game right now and I would be happy.Edit Now that i have played a bit more of the game I have to say that I think that they release the pre alpha just a BIT to early. By the time they release a majority of the hype around this game will be gone.

review: Astroneer is a really fun game especially when you play with other people. The game is simple relaxing and peaceful with active developers who consistently add new content. The game design and gameplay is simple yet it doesn't get boring with all of the stuff you can do. I get satisfied just exploring the planet I'm on and there's so much more to do. You can create portable bases on top of rovers attach thrusters and making a speedy mobile and even create awesome bases with a huge amount of customizability. When I first bought the game I wished it was slightly cheaper as $20 is normally the threshold for casual gamers when buying games so the $25 mark was slightly over budget but after a couple months I finally got it and with all of the new content added since I bought it I would say that the money was definietely worth it.

review: I got ASTRONEER a little over a year ago and I can say without a doubt that it's one of my favorite games ever. The gameplay is fun and with continuous updates you can count on new things being added. There isn't exactly a way to beat the game however the feeling of finally getting your first vehicle or going to another planet is awesome. You do have to keep in mind the game is in an alpha stage so there WILL be bugs and glitches all games have them. With the constant updates the bugs are fixed almost as soon as they come out. My personal favorite thing about the game is the multiplayer function by pressing Shift + Tab you can open a menu and invite friends into your world and play together. Overall there are few down sides however with the ever expanding community and new things being added all the time this game is one of the best.

review: This game is amazing. It looks good runs decently although don't expect 60fps on high is you don't have a decent gpu. The gameplay is amazing. I can spend hours on end in this game. The big updates have somewhat slowed down you get a big update once every 1 2 months but they are always full of content and bug fixes. Conclusion this game is definitely worth the money and is constantly evolving so you won't get easily bored.Old review If somebody tells you this game is buggy you can trust them HOWEVER first its an indie game second its still in PRE alpha. Its not even an official game yet. Its an amazing game with a very good concept. The community is as alive as ever and ive not seen a week pass without an update. On my setup (hd 6570 2gb from sapphire and a fx 8350 a 4ghz 8 core) it runs at 20 fps but feels very smooth. Also perfomance has gone up a lot the past updates. Older reviews may say it runs very poorly but if they are older then a month the performance has probably gone way up in the meantime. All and all if you have the money or you are looking for a game you can spend hours on end on go for it. You wont regret it.

title: ASTRONEER

review: Astroneer plays really well but doesn't entirely deliver. With the platform patch promised for today (but still not dropped) I'm hoping to see the playtime extended with some new content.The graphics are awesome and the controls are really smooth as well. I play on a PC not console IMO this game would be hell on console but that's just me (die hard PC gamer I'm afraid). They do get clunky jumping in &amp out of rovers (which saves the game).Where it fails are in places that I have to keep reminding myself that this is an alpha game The rovers come with a learning curve (tip when wanting to drive them make sure your view is directly BEHIND. If you're backing up make sure your view is from the FRONT) and takes some getting used to. They still drive like a drunk albatross but considering how difficult they were before they've been vastly improved and it shows.Your carefully collected resources have a bad habit of floating off in to space (as do rovers but they're retrievable with a sky bridge) or worse falling through the planet to who knows where. It's a really bad glitch and is serious enough that it has made me have to delete and start over.I've been playing since the game came out (maybe a few weeks after) and my first huge disappointment with it is content. Once I figured the game out (there were some world deletions there especially as I had a habit of stranding myself on planets) from start to finish it only took me several hours to get a base built on every planet. I kinda like a game with an end (unless it's an MMO which this is not) and there is no end here. I just kinda went 'Hunh. Soooo... now what?' And quit playing for a few months until something new pops up.Then the patch came out and they gutted how resources work. HIGHLY love this update as I'm not in early pre rover stage and getting something useless. Now I can choose.But I feel like this new research is a bit of a cop out. They've extended play time by making research take for freaking ever depending on how much power you have going through your base and even then it only goes so fast. They didn't extend the content just stretched it out for eons. Luckily you can throw research in leave the game running and go find something else to do for 30 minutes like laundry.I'm greatly looking forward to the base update (today or so we're promised... still waiting!) to see what the devo gods have spewed forth upon us mere mortals. Would I recommend this game? At the price it's at now yes. Highly. I'm really looking forward to seeing where this game goes in the future and really hope they extend the game play both on &amp off planet.If it stays as it is now (just colonizing planets?) it's blech.

review: ASTRONEER is a genuinely fun yet also relaxing game. I've spent hours building bases slowly crawling along the map marking points of interest farming materials and just exploring a simple yet very pretty world.This being said this game is not perfect. As expected with early access games there are many irritating bugs and issues. I've had vehicles fly randomly into the air and become unusable too many tethers have caused my game to freeze or crash and spending hours building giant walls around my base proved useless to prevent wind. But still I do love this game and recommend it completely.

review: Firstly image mindcraft. now add no man sky and the un pixelated version of mindcraft and booom you have astoneer! lol.. its a farming game with plenty potential and loads of fun in 2 ways. so that is why I am going to break this down in 2 reviews First one being. The multiplay. anyone at any one time can join your game.So the game goes alot faster and gets fun faster when you get through the basics of establishing your base. when you land on the planet hunting for the upgrades becomes alot easier with a friend and in doing so makes the game go better in the short term. trust me you want to jump in and out of planets and start new ones when you can and if you made mistakes with your digging etc.. its cool though each new start gives you a different planet colouring and style and layout. the tunnels underneath vary between each new game you make too so once you find the perfect tunneling near your habitat (home/rocket) dont play around with it too much. just build yourself to get ready for making an underground network once you have unlocked the habitat upgrade from the shells.once you get yourself a habitat and a decent tunnel network underground the potential of farming is unlimited!! and becomes more fun and faster to gather resources.the 2nd part of my review is. Playing by yourself.well unlike playing with a mate. the game goes alot slower and can potentially become boring fast if you dont have a good strategy. so i suggest you turn on your music and play it as if you are guna play for 5 hours or so. because its a grind. but becomes fun once you have sorted out your oxygen and power supply. On top of all this . the game is a typical grinding game which means all your doing is gathering resources to expand your base networks and also gives you the chance to unlock a rocketship to travel to a different part of the planet which you can start a new game within your own game... very handy when you want to start fresh but still keep your old network at your original base.fun game for people with an open mind. not a game you want to play when emotional or not happy.. definately a chill out game and mellow gameplay.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I can honestly say ASTRONEER is a great game and that I highly recommend it. BUT...That said it there is not much content but what there is core gameplay with smooth controls and few (if any) glitches. The developers are also active and releases new content steadily but this is also here where the catch is. They rarely release new content as in new object and tools . But instead they realises updates that are stable reliable and improve upon the core gameplayunlike most other developers in this age of cash grabbing pre releases.And if you really want to follow the progress the even post regular blogs/videos about the progress in the studio/office on YouTube System EraSo to sum it up Core gameplay not really any content.Edit I have just played it again after almost a year a lot has changed but not much new to find. Still it's a great game were you find yourself spending 12 hours straight playing only to ignore it for a year again. Great fun when it feels new not so much once you have tried it all.

review: I love base building games where I dont have to focus on combat constantly. I've played many different games solo and with friends and while many are great there are only 2 that keep me coming back for more and that is Astroneer and The Forest. To me they are different sides of the same coin and both are defintly worth the play. I played this for a few hours when I first got it but it was extremely choppy and laggy and had bad framerate all because of my laptop I have to play on. However they have had a few updates since I last really played and I tested it out again to find everything has been polished alot more and runs much smoother! I can finally sit down and really get into this game now and to me that alone is worth my time. This is probably going to become one of my biggest titles I'll play between classes on campus since its so relaxed calm and goes at whatever pace I wish. Highly Recommended!Please keep up the good work with this title. I really want to see where you take it!

review: Lots of people say that this has no replay value that it becomes boring after 20 30 hours or so (even if you only play it for 20 hours thats $1 an hour a hell of a price) and what they say has some validity to it. However as you can see I have 140 hours in this game as of writing this review. The developers have so much passion for this game they love the community and they keep releasing great updates. They are all unbelievably skilled and they have crafted not only the most well made game I have ever seen/played but also the most gorgeous. Of course there are bugs and some slightly broken gameplay loops but for god's sake it's called early access for a reason. If I had the funds I would easily buy this game for every single person that I know who I haven't already convinced to get it. If you like beautiful incredibly fun games that are still evolving and that the community has a huge voice in the development of get this one.

review: I went into this with "meh" expectations. The first 15 30 minutes are kind of slow as you start to learn more about the game I almost quit because I didn't understand some of the terrain altering controls and the items required to do so. Once I figured that out I was good to go.After playing almost 6 straight hours with some friends I can say that this game is immensely fun for something thats only in Alpha. I've seen "fully" released games with less content and triple the price.Speaking of it being in Alpha there are definetly bugs but I haven't encountered anything game breaking yet. The one bug I commonly encounter is when entering your homebase sometimes I get stuck but after reentering and exiting a few times it corrects itself.My biggest complaint so far is the vehicle controls(using KB+M). Whenever you're driving the controls change directions as you rotate the camera which is horrid. I didn't see an option to disable this in the settings but I could have overlooked it.Overall I enjoy this game especially with my friends. I highly recommend it and can't wait to see what else they add to it as it goes to beta and eventually full release(lol).
title: ASTRONEER

review: This game is awesome.... Until you acquire the game breaking bug that causes you to not be able to interact with the world. I was able to verify that this issue has been reported since AT LEAST mid 2017. I found a dead astroneer pulled up his backpack grabbed an object off it then my backpack and his sort of flashed and i could no longer place the object on any socket in the game. Cant get in my vehicle that is like 200 meters under the surface cant repower the organic generators with all the organic i came supplied with Cant even place a newly gathered power brick on the vehicle to charge it. It should be noted that should you aquire this bug IT WILL PERSIST BETWEEN SAVING AND RELOADING.... Please fix this bug... im done with this game til then.Edit I am now changing my review to a Positive Recommendation. As of Hotfix 0.6.7 (which strangely is not mentioned on the store page i had to pull up their patch note history online) My issue is fixed and my game save is now usable!!! Thank you for fixing this issue you have won my loyalty.

review: This is a good game there are loads of bugs but it early access so that is fine. For how much this game costs its worth it because it gives you a lot of stuff you can do. I would say it does get repeatitive because going to new worlds is basically starting from scratch a little bit. Although getting to a new planet is kind of cool though new biomes and explorations more research etc. Pros Very addicting at first Rather large worlds Easy to get the hang of Contols are good a little annoying here and there (I saw some improvements from updates) Little to no monsters so a rather peaceful game Pretty grindy getting enough recources to build etc Visuals are pleasing colorful and cartoonish Multiplayer is fun buggy here and there and lags when your in multiple worldsCons Not good for replayability its basically the same thing over again from the first play through Not long game you will start to get less intreseted when your done with the first planet your on (Most likely will be made bigger and more things to do but for now it small) Starts to get real laggy when you have a lot of building pads and vehicles i would recommend one or two vehichles per planet it starts getting laggy noticably when you have more stuff. (will probably get fixed) needs to have a building pad made specifically for storage and a lot of it because i ran out of space fast i had the storage units but it wasn't enough

review: For an Early Access Game it is well done and is operating well.It is worth the price currently and if they add to the game as the have laid out it will be well worth it and maybe even a price increase for a few bucks more. As of now it is perfect.A bit demanding on some video cards because of the world having so much content. So be sure to update all drivers when installing. Also it would not hurt to use that Christmas excuse for a better card right about now. It will run but when you get your base big enough it will slow you down.So what can you do... well here is our first hour in playing Vaccum our home planet like a boss(with your TURBO 10000 sucker thingy)Research after building some cool thingamabob's Vaccum some more(enough to make your mother proud)Run out of Oxygen(damn)Respawn and get caught in a Sandstorm(Damn Damn) Respawn again go to retrieve your loot get spit on by a plant(Son of a B**)Respawn Sandstorm block to the face(Mother F*)Try to go deeper into the planet fall to my death while placing a tether(Face Palm)Respawn sit in my ship because its safer there and dream of what could have been...8/10 Would sit and call it success again!September 4th 2018 UPDATE!AFTER A LONG YEAR BREAK... we decided to visit games of promise and well ASTRONEER certainly has delivered from a year ago!WOW the changes in all directions graphically gui execution ect... are fantastic. I have to learn how to play the who game again... which is exciting. Some old things now deeper within the three of actions... but still there... but there is SO much more to do now... and it really challenging from what it was. BRAVO! THESE GUYS AND GALS HAVE EARNED REP OVER AND OVER!KEEP IT UP!
title: ASTRONEER

review: I'm about 30 hours in so far with about 10 games restarted for various reasons. Very few glitches for an Alpha game at least that I have experienced to this point. I like the keyboard interface over the gamepad (wireless xbox controller) that may change with the next update.Even with no tutorials plotlines or goals prepared for you this game is really smooth playing and fun. You have to go to the forums and FAQs and sift through a lot of outdated stuff to learn how to do things in the game. Once you have some of it down learn to build/print different items to expand your base and NOT die from running out of oxygen or getting hit in the head by a big friggin rock blown by a storm... Its like opening a box to find a few hundred even cooler boxes nested within.You pick what you want to do and when lots of room to explore caves exotic landscapes random dangers Huge learning curve but really interesting gameplay. I haven't tried to do multi yet still trying to finger the SP game all out. Unlimited lives so if you die another pod comes down and you go search for your previous spaceperson's carcass and raid the backpack so you can continue what you were working on.Waiting for an update but really playable challenging and a great time sucker (that's good). Very well done.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I come back to review this game with its nearing 1.0 release and all I can say is this game has come a long way.When I first played this game back in March 21 2017 it found it to be a fun and peacful game. While there were a couple of game breaking bugs (Like rovers flying in the air not being able to pick up things crafting errors things like that.) as there are in early access games it was still fun. There was a time though when there was a bug so bad that I eventually had to take a break from the game. (The bug was were you would go through the ground and then die somewhere in a cave far below the surface. This happened constantly and was very annoying.)Then there was a period of time from what I can say was the the golden age of Astroneer. I came back after a while to see that they had updated some of the mechanics and also had fixed many bugs. Things like the reasearch update changed the mechanics of it from giving you an instant and random item to make to it now being a system that works where research is being slowly converted into bytes which from there you choose what to obtain. Then came the base building update and the rover update. For me this was a very big change in the mechanics of the game. It allowed to to reoriante your whole base in new ways that made things a lot easier. (Before you would extend your base out and it would be permanent.) It also added new features to putting things in boxes before you would unpack them making it easier to start a new base by loading a truck (or large rover now which makes more sense) with a bunch of boxes to drive over somewhere and unpack it all into a new base. It also updated how power is used and new fuctional Going into the rover update they really imroved the rover mechanics fixed lots of old bugs with them and gave them new features and a visual update. In fact a lot of the new updates include lots of visual updates. Ores really had a major update to visuals and in the newest crafting update all kinds of new items and other items already in the game got another visual update. In between this they fixed the trading platform which had bugs that would cause it to not come back new visual update that looks cool as well of a new way in trading scrap made from the new shredder to get ores from metals easier. But going into the latest update which was all about crafting I really got excited because this added a whole new point to going top other planets which a lot of people complained about in the past about there being no real point to go somewhere else. It added many new methods and levels to the crafting system and right now I'm getting a grasp to it and from what I can tell it made a sort of upgrade path. What I mean by this is that to ghet a large rover or a large shuttle you have to make thiings from the chemistry lab. To make that you need ores from another planet. Thus you have low tier stuff to use until you explore new worlds to upgrade to better things making it easier to progress and set up bases.Honestly I had a lot of fun with this game. I hope you can too.
title: ASTRONEER

review: After Playing Astroneer for a soild 35h i feel its saft to do a review so here it is(damm that sounds cringy)Pros fun solo and 4 player coopez to run on old pcs (about 3 2 years old ish)desently cheapconstant (big and small) updates (about one or two bigens amonth)bugs get De_Storyed quicklysimple grap.Cons alot more fun with friends (with out friends to play with i can find my self getting off after 10 20 min)needs ways to find new people to play with eg seversSuggestions 1. Add an option to make your game public so randos can join and add text chat with a filter like RainbowSix's one3. Add and indepth guide on how to use items such as the sheader4. Add a place on the main menu where people and give suggestions

review: Excellent Early Access game for exploration and crafting in chill and beautiful environments. The System Era team is wonderful and has made great progress. I can't wait for the 1.0 launch in February (fingers crossed for no delays)! The only real complaint I have is that the UI is fairly unintuitive at the very start. Once you are used to it though it's not a problem at all. There's just a lot to do and a lot of information that would be helpful from the beginning. I'm not sure how to best convey all that info the brand new players apart from guiding them to the Wiki (which I do recommend but watch out for spoilers). Don't let this discourage you though it's a fun challenge learning to find and use the control panels.Multiplayer is a little buggy for the non hosting player(s) especially as you explore more planets and build multiple bases. But I still highly recommend playing with a buddy or two. It really speeds up with all the resource gathering and researching.It's also been incredibly helpful for my anxiety. Life has been crazy lately but sitting down for a couple hours of Astoneer solo or with my friends is a wonderful way to give my mind a break from the real world. Pretty much zero stress in this game (apart from occasionally getting lost).

review: This game is amazing. I learned to play it just after they added the research (version 0.5.0). It is a multiplayer and single player game that dumps you on a planet and you can dig tunnels and holes looking for materials to build with and research items to earn bytes which allows you to unlock platforms storage machines vehicles and shuttles. You can explore above and under ground and also travel in space between several planets. Soon they will be adding objectives and/or goals. Game is due to release 1.0 February 6 2019 (for $29.99). If you buy now (and you should definitely) you get the full release for free (you don't have to buy it again). I've bought this game for Steam and Windows 10. Cool thing is I can also play the Windows 10 on my Xbox One and cross platform allows multiplayer between Windows 10 and Xbox. Eventually Steam Windows 10 and Xbox will all be able to play together. Very active and informative community (including devs from SES) on Discord server. I nominated both System ERA (devs) and this game for a Steam award. Biggest difficulty was there was more than one category that this game fits into. I could only choose one. I picked (Labor of Love). I highly recommend you buy this game!

review: Basically it's Minecraft in space. It's similar principles to many resource gathering games establish a base mine for resources watch out for perils etc. The problem is its incredibly addictive and relaxing. There's no real pressure (apart from running out of oxygen) and you get to wander and explore fascinating planets. As it's still very early access please take the following points with that in mind There isn't enough notable differences between the planets so exploring tends to get slightly monotonous after a while (but still thoroughly stress free). A little more diversity would certain aid in exploring.So far there's only a few modules to research and work with I'm pretty sure this will improve over time and at the moment it's fun and functional. The bugs I've come across are minor and relatively pain free its so far never been game breaking. Astroneer is such great potential and I have no regrets about recommending that people buy it play it and enjoy it. It's a game made with a lot of heart. Thoroughly enjoyable.

review: (UPDATED REVIEW AT THE BUTTOM)This is my review about Astroneer. Please repsect my review thanks.Well were should i start this game is about survival and exploration in space. What it contains (Look down below and it WILL contain SPOILERS!!!)The game comes with Open world with mineable terrain ore's broken space ships and lots of plants and flowers. I comes also with industry to make vehicles smelt ore upgradeable gear to your Astronaut or vehicle and solar panels or windturbines. It also has sandstorms. When a sandstorm arrive it will push any phycis object and thats not the last of it. It can also kill you if you dont seek cover or somewhat. Colored caves and mountains are also included. Theres also something called research object that be used to create new gear and other things. Overall it has good grahics and beautiful landscape that is random generated. Also you can travel in space to other planets for other materials.For my this is one of the best Early acces games that i have ever played. It's not beta or aphla. I's ing Pre aphla and in my own inpinion this is amazezing to a bug free game(have not seen any bugs yet). But it also include online co op to explore and survive in Astroneer. But NOTE its pre aphla and im sure there will be more content in the feature.11/10Update The game is on the path of growing up (coming out of early access). I had many adventures with one of my closest friends and damn this game dosent end here for me with this exploration in the game. Looking really foward to the next update of the game this is a must have to have before launch!.Thank you for reading my review. Cheers

review: I purchased Astroneer just after the Research update in December of 2017. Ever since I've followed the game's patches almost religiously each one inspiring another 10+ hour playthrough. The main thing about Astroneer is how easily one gets lost. Both literally and figuratively one gets lost in this game. Beacons help literally but its hard to pull oneself out of the simple neon world System Era has made. I've lost countless hours countless times with this game the simple gameplay loop and easy going difficulty curve makes it easy to just "space" out and relax while playing.Multiplayer connectivity blows but its still fun.The soundtrack is fun but I forget it exists sometimes.This is what No Man's Sky wishes it could be.
title: ASTRONEER

review: This is the most chilled out survival sandbox you could ask for. The design of everything is very laid back abstract pastel worlds and plants even the soundtrack is chilled out. Only resource you have to worry about is oxygen which you get free when near any of your structures or vehicles. There's a bunch of tools and structures to unlock and use to further your exploration. Favorite pastime so far is hitching rovers together and slapping a crane with a drill and some storage on then gradually tearing down a mountain. Developers have been continually ironing out bugs and reworking systems since the game hit early access. (Writing this Nov. 2018 game hits 1.0 Feb. 2019.) Overall as of now the game runs smoothly and is almost bug free. Only downside is it cooks my old GTX680... a non issue on current hardware.

review: I don't say much about good places. Others have comments. I'll talk about it here.(Without special annotations most of the problems occur in online mode and I'm not sure if the single mode is the same.)1. game cartonI configure gtx1080 i5 8600k 16g not to say a high end machine but full effect play some large multiplayer online games is no pressure in this game 2 people online 40 FPS3 people online 25 FPS4 people online 20 FPSSandstorm weather 10 15 FPSAuto save 1 FPS (usually 3 seconds or so).2. game BUGOften can not take things can only push back. Occasionally the game wears a model perspective. When a person touches a car sometimes the car will go to heaven and the 4 engine characteristic of illusory? Minerals sometimes float in the sky and they can't be dug. It's very uncomfortable. A has been testing for two years.3. magic settingMy 6 tank car will be moved by several grass and several small stone cards.What is the use of sandstorms besides wasting time and letting me drop frames? For a wind power generation players can't hide anything for a few minutes?Hundreds of tons of tank cars will be blown away by the wind and people will be fine on the ground.4. game modeWhen you first enter the game you will feel that the game is really fun and there will always be something new to discover. Later it was discovered that the game had only one purpose mining. You don't live in your home. Studying things is just to build things for mining. It feels very NB to go to other planets but in the end you can only dig. It feels fresh to find ruins at first but it's customary to look at them once or twice. The more boring and boring the game mode is the more I don't know what the overnight wealth refers to in the introduction.Several suggestions1. game trouble is changed to drag bar one point is really slow. You can't ask all players to change to config.2. Create some constructable elements so that players can build their own houses garages and other things even a simple wall can make the game more playable.3. sandstorms can be changed for several days only once but very destructive. Players can learn ahead of time and make a lot of preparations to prevent losses and come up with rare materials that can only be collected with special devices in sandstorms.4. More accessories can be added to the car such as brakes headlights bulldozers off road tires nitrogen accelerators.5. If there will be biological systems in the future different civilizations can be set up on different planets and different civilizations have different facilities. After learning the structure of their facilities they can be used at the base. If I want to shoot a gun I suggest that a laser gun be used instead of something that can destroy the terrain.The 6. bomb can be larger than the explosion range now or it can fry large ruins into metal fragments. I didn't even unlock the bomb because the bomb was useless.7. set the angle for the ctrl+ right button so that the OCD player can make a flat plane.In the later version if I make some useful changes I will praise it.

review: This will be a positive review since the game is in its alpha stages so I am just reflecting on that part for now.The game will be very great as time progresses as I enjoy it's core concepts such as its UI art style and gameplay as a whole. This does not mean it's perfect again I stress that I know it's in alpha and this is just feedback so far.To dive into the negative aspects as of now the game is lacking content wise (YES I KNOW OF COURSE THEY WILL ADD MORE I AM JUST SAYING YOU CAN'T PLAY IT INDEFINITELY) but that really isn't my concern the only negative part about that is waiting since it will happen eventually. My main concerns as of now are the "behind the scenes" issues. To start I almost always play this game with a friend and this has its problems. These problems include connectivity issues (which for the most part have been fixed) crashing at times when extensive travel is done (players on 2 different celestial bodies) and worst of all the servers (AND YES I KNOW THIS WILL BE FIXED TOO). I feel bad for my friend when we play becuase he can't drive anything around without the game throwing him into the ground (losing all that he has and the vehicle).So over all this game WILL get better and I know it's early access just warning about what to expect. Though for now the main parts i've expressed are that content will come but it will take time. Ive done almost all there is in under 20 hours (though you can still play more depends on yourself). The other thing is coop is very buggy as of now and there a more bugs in general. (AND I KNOW ALL THIS WILL GET FIXED THESE DEVS ARE GREAT) This is just my experience with the game at this stage in time and that's why this review is positive.Update they've improved so much and continue to show growth. Worth it still!
title: ASTRONEER

review: As of now I can't really recommend the game at this price yet unless you REALLY love everything astronaut/space themed like me. But as it is still an early access game I hope the dev team would listen to the players and add more content because I really like the simple cartooney astronaut/space theme and having played it for a while it does have potential.+ Pretty colourful graphics+ Relaxing soundtrack+ Astronaut/space theme+ Finding resources to start it all off is easy No other threats besides lack of oxygen makes it seem less survival. A few types of hostile aliens would make it more interesting. tutorial seemed a tad unclear Lack of content makes it boring after a while Far too few things to craft The landscape and scenery is pretty but what you see there on that planet when you first landed there is basically what it will be everywhere else on that same planet as well. Or at least it seemed like that to me that I was trapped in the same environment no matter how far I traveled.Get this when Full price On sale x On an even saler sale (like 60% or something...) x Someone else gets it for you No... Just. No.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I enjoy this game with gusto. At least the beginning few hours. Having a friend with you for four hours of just ing around and exploring is absolutely great paired with unique graphics and enjoyable mechanics. Granted I did say the first few hours. This game lacks all replayability. There is no pve pvp or any interaction in the game. After you've gotten a rover maybe explored a planet or five what's next? What's the main goal? After the charming introduction it's unfortunate to have to say there's really no substance. I would still recomend this game but play it with some friends. It's worth the price but it lacks in the aspect of replayability.
title: ASTRONEER

review: As an early Alpha it's absolutely amazing so far I've seen. It weilds great potential to become one of the best space games on the market on full product release (depending what will become of this game in the future).If they manage to put in a fun questing system or anything else that makes it's self a target/goal for the player then this game is set. I can't stress enough how much they need to put work into keeping the player occupied with more and more and more goals to reach. This way "The new experience" doesn't need to run out and so this game does not need to fall into the same endless loop trap that most modern open world games fall into.Other than all of that. Buy it if you can't wait to try it on early alpha. Though the price tag is a tidy bit high to get your money on the product when it's not complete so you make the choice.
title: ASTRONEER

review: My only complaint for the game is that it doesnt seem to have any true graphics settings. The render distance for terrain objects like rocks and plants is incredibly short... Running a system that has a 2070 means thast I am 110% not using its full potential.But in regards to everything else this game feels (to me) like it is the achiever of want No Man's Sky couldnt achieve A multi player multi planet exploration game. The game stays true to its 'lego esque' piece by piece style even in its crafting system. Over all I would say this game goes right next to the games Terraria and Minecraft as it is a sandbox game that is not repetitive and its VERY active update schedule helps prove that. I have had a lot of fun playing this game. so much so that I bought it again on the windows store to play with my Xbox friends. I totally recommend this game to anyone who even remotely enjoys open world exploration games.
title: ASTRONEER

review: so yeah. great game we got here lads. specialy when your friends join in and you end up retriving the truck you just made from the atmosphere cuz for some reason when they drive in your world. lets just say some intresting "phenomoneons" tend to happen. moving on it is in all a great game to be in EA. could use a few tweaks here and there. looking forward to seeing a full game D10/10 would retive trucks from space again.Back again after 2 years of devolopment i can say i enjoy the huge increase in stuff they added and bugs they fixed. The game looks the same but it is also just to vastly different from when i started playing Dec 2016. 2019 just began and i can say i am looking forward to the full relase with my friends. Now i have praised the game i will admit the game kinda dies after like 20h in a world. The goal of discovering more stuff and trying to get even more effective dies. there is no ending however this games does deliver the nice take away from everything else i play. The game is so cute and innocent the only violence is you massmurdering plants to get further down your cave. It is a nice game mostly every bug i encountered with orbit launched rovers have been resolved and hence i can now say it is (to mostly 90%) a certain degree a stable mulitplayer experience!

review: *Updated from last year*So I've been following this game for a while and I've learned two things... The devs are chill and open with the community. In a sea of early access titles being half this is a lighthouse of hope. The game is good and people should play it.I started playing this game when it first popped up on steam and it was this weird little game with a ton of bugs some weird art and incredibly peaceful music. The entire atmosphere was ... "newness" and I frequently came back to the game just to escape some stressful points in my life. The more I came back the more I started to see a finished game come into focus and now with the announcement of 1.0 coming out... I'm just so happy about this game growing up.If you like space aesthetics sandbox games semi survival games and the ability to be very creative with terrain/world manipulation I would highly recommend this game. Like a solid 8/10.(Although warning to those who can't find a 'grove' and who may get bored easily this game is probably not for you. You kind of have to let the monotonous aspects be part of the fun.)

review: Product received for free. I enjoyed this game so much I had so much fun playing with my brother and friends. Though throughout the entire journey we struggled with such things like 1. Lag of DOOM Tends to happen occasionally or when the planet cant load properly. It also happens a lot when youre not near the host.2. The Cracks of Void in the Planet There would be these spots in caves where you can see through the map and when entering you gravitate up to the surface but if you fly too high you'll die when you land.3. Monsters/Ores that tend to Respawn after being Dugged up There would be ores that are mined such as Malachite or Lithium but when we re enter the game the ores and hostile plants would respawn which if you dig the ore again you basically get nothing.4. The Magical Non interactive Moments Whenever you do something like spam the ping there's a 50/50 chance you would not be able to grab anything/pick something up.5. The World that Broke in Four Whenever i fly to the Moon(Barren) the Earth(Terran) would be split into 4 pieces flying through the Moon which jumpscared me a lot of times cause of the scary BG sound that plays and a huge green wall that just flies through the caves quickly at my face.6. The Shuttle that just stays in one spot Once you craft a shuttle it's stuck there unless you fly it and landing somewhere else which leads to fuel waste flying it to another planet build another one etc. Basically if you left a shuttle in a planet and fly another shuttle to that spot they just phase through each other.7. Loading In Issues There would be some issues where it says it couldnt connect to the host or the loading just completely crashes.8. Entering the Game There would also be issues where you dug a spot some objects such as a rock or plant would respawn there resulting in you having to remove it again.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Astroneer is a very interesting game. It's a really neat fun and very enjoyable. The only problem I've had with it is that it begins to feel repetitive and can start to get boring after 6 hours. I've began around four characters and it only takes a couple hours to get a ship and go to other worlds. If you put some time into the game and learn what needs to be done and how to do it you'll enjoy the game more than you would by just looking around and trying to figure things out as you go. Go watch some YouTube videos on the game they help a lot. I recommend anyone reading this to get the game but take their time with the game and enjoy it. It's a really fun experience that many will love! 7/10

review: I have around 130 hours in Astroneer from the time writing this and can easily say that it is one of the best games I have ever played. The developers are dedicated and update the game regularly adding bug fixes and exciting new content. The world generation is perfect with little to no bugs and the game has different yet beautiful graphics. After a few hours of gameplay you will know how to play fairly well. Even with all the time I have I still experience new things regularly such as a new thing to research or occasionally even a new mechanic I never knew about. It is worth every penny and I wouldn't blame System Era for charging more for such a great game. The only thing I could possibly say they could improve on is adding more content for late game. Perhaps a story or maybe even NPCs? Recommended to all those who like relaxed gameplay still with some challenge to it.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Great game while its still in early access and the main goal atm is exploration/building everything in the game the devs are comitted to improving it and have a great roadmap. Can't wait to see what else they will add to the game in the future (especailly the story).
title: ASTRONEER

review: I must say Astroneer is an awsome game! There is just a kind of aura to it that draws casual players like me to spend countless hours building up bases farming for bytes and creating new resources! The Exploration is Fantastic and I hope this game grows from an indie into a full blown Game witha full release! There are of course things to improve like how the game is very low poly but it still takes up alot of your cpu usage and sucks the living life out of my medium sized laptop. Though I'm really excited for the new 1.0 update thats coming out! It could add a plot to your adventures and just seams like a massive update. I hope that the devs fix the bugs and improve this game since it is early alpha after all all in all this game is in its development stages but it has big plans for the future!
title: ASTRONEER

review: Yes I may only have an hour or two on this game as of the time I write this review but I can tell this game is incredible so early on. For those of you that like Terraria Starbound or other games like that ASTRONEER is sort of similar. There is grinding and underground exploring but what I love about this game is the space themed gameplay. If you don't bring tethers with you you will die of oxygen loss. You need to make a rocket ship to explore other planets to get more resources. I have played with a friend who has been playing this game for years and I suggest you do the same because this game can be confusing. All in all though this game is a fantastic creation I wish I bought sooner since I love Terraria but a 3d experience in space with stunning graphics and music is infinitly better. My only problem is the slight complexity but don't let that stop you!TL DR Beautiful slightly complex game similar to Terraria and Starbound with it's own unique twist.

review: Very excited for the Feb release this game !#$ing rocks. The only thing that could make this game better is just let them do more of what they're doing. I want more of whatever they come up with. For those wanting to know about why you should purchase this game... sandbox style open world survival not a lot of interaction with npc's however complete freedom to explore mine and craft a procedural solar system. Very addictive. Gameplay feels meditative and relaxing. You barely feel the grind which propels you to further tech levels for your ever growing domain in this survial exploration sandbox. The graphics look amazing and the conceptual design will make you question everything by it's modular approach to exploration. You will answer mysteries of the ancients as you embark into a fresh solar system with modern tech. Why did they build pyramids? It's all right here! Sure they've got room for improvement but that doesn't mean the early access should you give you delay in purchasing. People who won't like this game??? I suppose sportball heros and 1st person kill streak oriented folks will balk. Take care!

review: Astroneer is an amazing game though I only recently bought it I have played it for extensive periods of time on friends devices. The game had a pretty good start back a few years ago (bugs aside) and had a moderately sized following. I have noticed that the game has evolved in just the right way to where it is the perfect balance of exporation crafting and somewhat of a tech tree. The game isn't that difficult or easy putting right right in the perfect blend of difficulty where it won't be too easy for hardcore gamers and won't be to hard for people who are just starting to play video games. The game's performance is outstanding and runs like a warm knife through butter on my disgustingly underpowered laptop so performance isn't anything to worry about. Overall I'd have to give Astroneer a 9.5/10 it is an amazing game and because it runs so well with such a small file size pretty much anyone can pick it up. Which you absolutely should.P.s. I it's also one of the veeeeeeeeeeeeery few games on steam to make it out of early access.

review: There's definitely a lot of fun to be had with Astroneer but there's still a lot of room for improvement. The game has a nice progression curve and is overall extremely polished and delightful to play with friends. However this game desperately needs some sort of enemy or lingering threat that will spice up the gameplay signficantly. The only things that you can currently die to (as I am aware) are lack of oxygen fall damage a random poison plant and debris flying at you from the occasional dune storm. My only other real complaint (so far) is that the game relies heavily on symbolism and visual information for a lot of things (such as power oxygen levels) since it avoids using a standard HUD layout. It also utilizes extremely convoluted interfaces for crafting and inventory management. This is something that I am not sure if I like or dislike because on the one hand it feels very unique and interesting but on the other hand it feels really counter intuitive in a lot of cases. A lot of time spent on your first playthrough will be you just figuring out what anything even means.However I would still recommend it just because it's definitely a fun experience (especially with friends) and it's really well made in almost every aspect. Hopefully we get some future updates to flesh out this game into a fuller experience.
