review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!!!Not until the LAZY developers FIX the following things!I hear you ask "Why you call them lazy?" Because THEY ARE! I sent them countless emails about improvements bug fixes general fixes ideas etc and I didn't get a SIMPLE answer from them!It's a really nice and relaxing game BUT there are a looooooooot of staff that need to be added/fixed so we can keep playing calm.1. (FIXED) FIX this thing when driving the buggy/rover! I use the arrows instead of WASD and I can't steer my vehicle! I NEED the mouse to look around the vehicle not steering with mouse! Also! Up arrow means forward relative to the vehicle not relative to the camera! I have my mouse viewing the right side of the vehicle and when I press the vehicle goes RIGHT! What kind of mechanic is this? I haven't seen this before since THE FIRST HALO! (FIXED)2. Larger backpack capacity. Seriously! I have TWO hands and I can carry more things than this guy in the game! The following backpack attachments solar panel light oxygen tank and wind generator should take no space3. I want to change the terrain modules by pressing 1 2 3 etc. Not by opening the backpack &gt selecting the terrain tool &gt and adding/removing the modules. Also there's no need for the modules to occupy space. Do it like an "update/upgrade" on terrain tool. Also WHY THESE MODULES DRAIN POWER!?4. Here's the big deal. I built a smelting furnace on the one side of my base on the other side there's a vehicle bay. So if I want to build a vehicle I MUST carry the items with me! Insted of that since all the buildings are connected together the items would transfer among powerlines like a conveyor system.5. Make a cargo container.6. Also crafting items should be stacking like they are in Space Engineers Minecraft etc. I mean yes to build a buggy you only need 4 items (seat included) but that means half of the medium storage module. For example make a stack of maximun 9 of every item (9 resins 9 glass 9 scraps etc.) 7. A GPS system would be very very helpful.8. Enable us to build something to move in the air like a hover or a little plane (not nessesarily with aerodynamics physics) so we can roam around the planet. I know that launcing at the atmosphere and landing again is something new and convenient too so keep both.9. (FIXED) We NEED to dissasemble the modules from the platforms ex the "Research Chamber" from the "medium platform A". (FIXED)10. We need to deconstuct the buildings and return the half of the resources.EDIT 26 12 2018 (FIXED)11.(FIXED) FIX this thing with the key bindings! Every time I play the game I MUST change the keys to play. WASD is NOT convenient for me I prefer to play with the arrows! (FIXED)EDIT 27 12 201812. I went to Radiated planet and every 10 steps I had to struggle with INVISIBLE walls blocking my way! Also I couldn't build with my terrain tool every 10 steps too!EDIT 28 12 2018 (FIXED)13. (FIXED) FIX this thing with the planets! Everytime I go to space ALL the panets are "deconstructed (FIXED)14. (FIXED)Came back to Terran planet from Radiated planet (Radiatied is a very windy planet) When I landed on Terran plants went crazy and the Astroneer was walking like there was a massive storm and protected his head head with his arms. THERE WAS NO WIND AT THIS MOMENT! I spent about TWO hours on Terran and the INVISIBLE STROM was there ALL THE TIME!(FIXED)EDIT 29 12 201815. I made a rover train of 4 rovers and ONLY the first rover has power to move the other rovers. review: I recommend this game to anyone looking for a great and original game however i'm very disappointed (personally) with the look and aesthetic of the full release of the game. In my opinion the flora has gotten a very Earth like appearance contrary to the alpha look and the main menu has change for the worse it is hard to pick a skin as you are only given the name and they have become quite unappealing and the overall look of the game changed almost completely leaving little of what it originally was. I'm not saying its bad not by a long shot. For the 60 hours i've played I appreciated the extra terrestrial look of the planets not barren not overly decorated with flora but still alien. Overall the looks of the game make it feel like you're returning to Earth many years later and life has just evolved. Take the trees for example they barred leaves unlike any you'ed see on Earth but now they just feel like adapted pine trees. Gameplay is great its just the aesthetic of the game and the menu that has changed for the worse.
title: ASTRONEER

review: You're gonna look at this game and think oh another survival sandbox game to add to the pile of games that I'm not interested in.I'm here to tell you that you're wrong. I'm here to tell you that this game is full of ideas that are well fleshed out and blend well into a lovely experience. Even if it may not seem to have a goal there are structures and planets waiting for you to find and explore them things to unlock and a gigantic tech tree that will have you digging deeper into the planet or going to other worlds entirely just to find the materials that you need for that next piece of the puzzle.This game is lovely to play to relax on your own or a blast to play with friends and work towards those otherworldly alien orbs in the sky the stars far beyond or even just mess around! Using plenty of clever design decisions and choices your inventory is limited without weighing you down the terrain is freely deformable but easy to manipulate (think rollercoaster tycoon brushes) and while there are no hunger or thirst systems there are just enough hardcore elements to punish you. Astroneer succeeds where Space Engineers Starforge and many others have failed.Even the graphics and terrain generation while appearing simplistic in nature are leagues above MANY other games on the market. It sticks to a simplistic clear and attractive style and does not stray away from it for even a moment yet continues to amaze me with its beauty.TL DR if you have even a slight interest in this game if your dreams are to explore the great unknown or if you've ever wished Minecraft wasn't as blocky buy it and give it a go. It will not disappoint.P.S. The problem of the game being unoptimized is subjective. While many say they can't run it with their chunky 10 series GTX cards I myself have a 1050 Ti and an i5 6600k and can run all settings at High pretty well. Just understand going in that it may hit you the same way it has others.

Overall it is incredibly aesthetically pleasing and also is somewhat the ultimate relaxation game. The soundtrack mixed with the graphics creates a calm environment to enjoy either alone or with friends. Although I praise the creativity and look the one downside is that there are many optimization issues that result in major lag spikes (goes from 50fps down to about 10fps then back within 5 8 seconds). System Era is currently working on fixes for this but for now beware the lag. Other than this Astroneer is definitely one of my more favorite games in my library and I would highly recommend it to everyone.

title: ASTRONEER

review: I bought this game years ago in early access and wow has it come a long way. It's a sandbox explorer where you get an entire solar system to play around in with unique and charming planets to explore. There's no combat but there are plenty of ways to die if you aren't careful storms surprise holes in the ground dangerous plants running out of oxygen getting stranded on dangerous planets taking the rover too far and running out of power then oxygen etc. Your base is your hub for a while until you learn how to make spaceships and fuel then the real adventure starts. The terrain tool is still awesome you can make giant sculptures or ramps and see them from space. Situations to avoid Running out of fuel on an irradiated planet without any base structures or resources with you then having to build a small makeshift base and finding the materials to make fuel while dodging massive radiation storms that sweep across the planet.Mining the underside of a cliff while standing at the top to discover that you were on a boulder that is now falling.Sprinting without looking and falling down a giant hole that looks like it goes to the core. Exploring too far from your deployable oxygen lines and then getting distracted by a weird tree. Being outside during a severe storm and getting whacked in the head by debris.Taking a rover convoy far from your base and then accidentally scrapping the only solar panel/power source. Walking next to suspicious looking plants. There's a reason they look suspicious.Building a ramp high into space and then falling through the planet in a rover. Allowing your friends to build a giant that can be seen from across the solar system.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Low FPS Issue needs re optimization and the Draw distance needs to come back for lower end PCs and Better optimization for Hosts when playing with Friends.Other than that the new content is amazing and alot of fun and a Awesome game just needs more optimization
title: ASTRONEER

review: EDIT THIS REVIEW WAS FOR THE EARLY ACCESS. MY FULL RELEASE REVIEW WILL BE AT THE BOTTOM.This game has incredible potential and the company that is working on it System Era is putting a lot of time and love into the game. This is their first game and with everything they have done so far it shows how much passion they have for it. I am extremely excited to see what they do in the future. Hopefully more things to craft like different space suits that have a variety of benefits. The game is still in Early Access so expect a few minor bugs but nothing severly game breaking that I have found so far. The soundtrack is amazing. The crafting system just got a massive update and makes things more complicated which is actually enjoyable because it forces players to explore different planets more and collect more resources. Astroneer makes you want to explore. It prods at my curiosity and always lands me in sticky situations but it's always fun getting myself out of them. And when a game rewards you for exploring while also make the exploring fun and enjoyable then you know you have yourself an amazing game. I've made everything you can in this game up to this point. And within the day of me making this review I'll be making a ramp to space and launching myself in a rover. I haven't even touched 3 planets yet so the exploring is certainly not over yet. I absolutely love this game and anyone who enjoys resource based adventure/exploring games such as Rust ARK Minecraft Subnautica etc. Beyond that you have the option to play with friends which is why I would put this game above Subnautia. Hoping into a server with friends and chatting over discord or in person have been some of the best hours I've had playing video games. Exploring planets in buggys cave diving rescueing people off planets recovering someone's dead body launching into space together in different rovers and the list goes on. Everytime this game gets a new update I make a new world and spend way too much time playing it all to the end again. It's a game where you make the end goal. You don't have to do anything specific you can sit on the main planet and collect bytes forever if that's all you want to do. You can spend a whole day getting high and collecting debris from wrecks (that's from experience). Updates are few and far between but when they come out they are often big updates that add a lot to the game. This can be good and bad if you don't want to wait for a long time between updates. The developers are involved in the game so I doubt they will stop updating it which is good because if they don't then the game will have little to no replayability value. Things that I think should be added AchievementsEnd Game ItemsDifferent Suits (Low Gravity Jump higher and take less fall damage More Oxygen Harded resistance to physical damage like spikers storm blocks etc Gas Suit immune to both gas mushrooms Light Weight Run Faster etc...Emote Selection (Each model have their own emote set)More Variety in Enemies but Less Abundance (I hate trying to go into a cave and being walled off by 30 spiker mushrooms. That's 20 too many. Lower the amount I run into these enemies) I remember watching an update video about plants that can push the player around or plants that erupt in a volcanic way. That's a yes from me.Let me connect more than 4 large rovers together please. I want to make a rover train. * Give Marbles and Astronium a purpose. Give Diamond and Nanocarbon Alloy a purpose (new items and I think there can be so many craftable things with them).Another Planet (Just one for now) Bugs that need to be fixed If you try and craft another object while the chemistry lab is running you can break the lab and make items get stuck in it so it becomes unusable.Somtimes Tundra appears to be cut in 4 quarters while on other planets or in space (while on and orbitting Tundra it looks fine).Sometimes I'm able to see through the map. The ground kinda opens up.If you build a cave into a mountain and a storm goes by the game can't detect that it's underground so blocks will still spawn in the cave if it's big enough(in a natural cave the block don't spawn).If you plant a spiker seed on the unbreakable ground at your main base it's impossible to remove it with a basic tool. I think that maybe you can remove it with a drill since the drill head break unbreakable ground for ore patches but I'm not sure if it'll work on the base ground or if there is a difference between base ground and titanium/lithium ground.See you out there Astroneers.FULL RELEASE REVIEW I played about 145 hours of this game before the full release came out and as I boot up the freshly updated Astroneer I am awestruck at the amazing improvements graphically and gameplay wise. Just from my first few hours I can tell that I'm going to be putting in a lot more than just 145 hours into this game. They got almost everything right. I have little complaints so far as I am still only on the first planet when I'm writing this review but this game hits an emotional chord with me that I just felt it necessary to write about it now. Things they got right When I stated in my early access review about how they should add certain things and how updates were few but generally large they didn't step out of line with the full release. Coming with the new release are achievements which I previously stated the game needed. This is a HUGE perk for me as I am a completionist and will play this game to the core (pun intended). My goal is to get all the achievements but I will not stop playing when I have them all. With the full release I was able to start my experience off right and have crew of 3 buddies and myself in a world together. Without a doubt this is how the game is meant to be played. Surrounded by friends and just messing around having a good ol' time. This game is amazing when played with friends but don't take that as it's bad when played alone. If you're someone who enjoyed Subnautica or maybe singleplayer Minecraft then this game is right up your alley. It's all about the adventure and the journey to endgame but not endgame itself. They took some of my advice and added more endgame items more variety to plants/enemies and reduced their spawn so it's not a living hell to explore caves. You have an emote selection list along with customizable suits. This makes just sitting at base with your friends and dancing a highlight in it of itself. Laughing as you all do the MC Hammer dance on top of your base. These are the things that make Astroneer special to me. Certain items that didn't have a use in early access now have purpose and an abundance of new items and crafting methods has breathed fresh air into the game. There's not much else for me to say. This has to be one of my favorite games in existence for it's sheer level of childlike wonder it gives me every time I start it up. Get this game. Trust me.
title: ASTRONEER

review: I have played Astroneer on and off since it was first available but decided to wait until release to review it. I've been impressed by the teams dedication to improvement through early access and eagerly awaited the finished product dropping this February and I've not been disappointed. The game has a pretty unique feel and style which I enjoy and the attention to detail has kept me coming back to explore each update.The game itself is incredibly open yes there are tried and true methods of starting out and progression alike but sandbox flair of "play your own way" is ever present you're not driven down a particular path or forced to complete tasks in a certain order (outside of having the gather specific resources for crafting purposes). The game gently nudges you into exploration and experimentation the balance of risk and reward is easy going and your ultimate goal is left pretty much only limited by your imagination (or free time I guess!). Want to dominate the galaxy with your elite mining and scrapping empire ? Go for it. Want to build recreations of the great pyramids on every planet ? Go ahead! Just want to build treacherous go cart tracks around your base and challenge your friends to beat your personal best ? Do it !! TL DR If you're looking for a fairly casual approach to space exploration sandbox survival this could be the game for you. With its bright quirky visual style laid back yet still immersive gameplay and surprisingly in depth crafting system you can spend countless hours planning and designing exploring and surviving or simply pushing unsuspecting friends into the nearest crater for funzies. Have fun out there!

review: After playing the game for about an hour I feel it is my duty to explain to you exactly why you should purchase this game. First of all in the new release a ton of bugs were cleared. In the four or so hours I have on my new account the only bug I experienced was a glitch in the UI menu which was quickly solved by saving going back to the main menu and logging back in. This seemed to be a big problem in the early days of this game so I'm glad they have this resolved.Another thing I want to point out This is not an rpg or an intense survival game! For those of you who like rust or dayz turn away. For those who like to explore build and have fun with friends in a more peaceful setting this game is for you. Despite the simple polygon graphics I fell in love after just a few minutes of playing. Plus it wont take a huge toll on your computer. A lot of people were upset about there not being a ton of new stuff in the update but I think in the future we can expect many more things to build create and do as the developers keep working on it. One thing people pointed out was that there wasn't much to do as it mostly followed the same pattern. Again now that the first official release is here the developers don't need to spend as much time bug hunting and spend more time adding new content. A big aspect of game play is building bases and crafting components so if you were into the sort of tekkit minecraft scene you'll probably love this as well. All in all 9/10. Great work guys!

review: Would I recommend Astroneer the simple answer is yes it is a great little game.I was wondering last night when I was playing it and thinking of writing a review why I would and the simple answer is it reminds me of being a kid and the sense of wonder I used to get from them. Astroneer reminds me of a time when I played games and it wasnt all laid out on a plate for you you needed to go look for things make mistakes go the wrong way and then when you finally made it work you got a sense of reward. Does the game has its flaws yeah totally but it is a week into v 1.0 from a small studio so any issues are totally understandable and certainly dont impact on the game in a way that makes me want to stop.Finally and this is the best thing I can say about the game is the desire just to keep playing it for a couple more minutes just to do one more thing (it normally becomes 3 or 4 but you know what I mean). If you grew up playing Civilization and hours of extra playing that came from you saying "just one more turn" you will get alot of enjoy from Astroneer.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Space exploration with friends. What can beat that? But really tho'. The game is stunning graphics are amazing music is subtle yet still has an impact on you. Just when you think you have done everything you can on the planet you find out that there is a massive structure that you can power up to give you god knows what unlimited poweer! I love the game. I do. The devs did a great job with it and I hope most of the games would be able to captivate my attention so quickly )Yet there is a major issue. This is probably the most bugged a** game I have ever played. Buggies tractors ... pretty much everything falls thru the floor every now and then people getting launched in space without reason (when entering a vehicle). Fps is abysmal. 1080 with a i5 6600k Oc to 4.5k "cannot handle" consistent 60fps not to say that the more you play the game (discover more and have more items out) the worse it gets. Lowering/Upping the Graphic settings has 0 effect on the performance. If you check their forums you will see that every day the frustration builds up. I have no idea how a game could be "released" on such game breaking bugs...Enough rant from my side. If you wish to have a really good experience with a minecraft esk space game and see all the progress go down the drain when you get bugged and either die or get saved in space (in where you cannot have another backup save...) feel free to buy the game. Otherwise I really recommend passing it for a while until it is at least playable to the normal " a minute without bugs" gameplay. And no way is the "full game release" worth 20+$ ... not while it is being debugged by a chimpanzee without hands.Devs please. I really plead you. I know you have to make money and stick to the Alpha test business strat. Don't release the game just because you think it's ok. Fix it first. Make it perform better than you want it too. hell have it in test mode for a year more but don't do what astroneer did and have the 1.0 game out with too many bugs to play the game. Thanks.

review: Haven't reviewed this game since December 2016. Whilst a lot has changed it's mostly been quality of life improvements and refinements.The release build currently isn't all too stable. Towards the end of the beta the game seemed to be running fine but with release FPS stutters even on lowest graphical settings and crashes are abound making the game stressful and not worth playing since progress is quite slow nothing's worse then delving deep into a cave and having the game crash because you can't save unless you quit or go back to your base on the surface.Stability adjustments need to be priority as well as glitches involving deformation of rock. Rock tends to warp and cause holes in the geometry of the landscape allowing you to look through the planet. It's weird. Not to mention cave systems are a lot more obtuse now the one's that I've entered are shallow and require precarious mining downwards which just creates awkward work flow and disrupts the far superior surface to cave formations from alpha and beta.Currently wait for the game to become more stable. It's not a bad game but not investing time into when it effectively deletes progress.
title: ASTRONEER

review: UPDATE This game hit 1.0 now. It is amazingly good and as of this writing I've been playing it daily since release in 4+ hour sessions coop with a friend. Caverns are incredible looking now with extreme variety both as you get deeper and between planets and the breadcrumb trail of the game's untold story is fascinating and had me freaking out the first time I saw That Thing. Wonderful game and my original review's wishes for a breadcrumb trail of a story line to follow panned out beautifully.Original early access review below As someone who can't stand pretty much every open world crafting game this is really something special. Gorgeous environments concrete goals to build toward oxygen is your only mandatory survival resource and is free and infinite at home base and the satisfaction of an expanding base and the ever growing reach of your influence do a lot for my enjoyment of this game where no other open world does.I just can't build for building's sake you know? I gotta have a goal to build toward and basically no other open world game I've played allows me to do that.This game's come a long way too first build released was completely intolerable to me but with the latest version I've put in at least 4 playthroughs to the point of setting up a permenent base on another planet which is where the current version's goals kinda dry up.But the developer's roadmap include plans for an optional breadcrumb trail of goals for you to build toward and something of a story which I am greatly looking forward to. Here's hoping!

review: Really neat game! The "1.0" release added a lot of new content but unfortunately that also ended up meaning lots of new bugs. cStill fun but don't expect a smooth experience. I've been having sound cut out map syncing issues that create holes that let you fall through the world then jet straight up to fall to your death and various small glitches. I've been able to play around the bugs for the most part just feels like they came out of Beta/Early Access too early. If you don't mind some bugs it's worth a play. review: Astroneer....Is it worth a buy?After a long time in development the game is finnaly release from early acces.....Ok so i have owned this game for over a year and im more than happy with the end product of this game....This is a masterpiece of a game....The graphics are low poly but they are so well done.The game is a bit grindy at some points but its aswell really well balanced it gives a sence of progresion since you need to go to other planets to get a specific resourceBut what i think shines best on this game is exploration....Really the first play experience its exellent.The caves of the planets are perfectly done...specially the # #4(Data corrupted)## # 9.5/10Exellent game the only isiue is that its a bit laggy
title: ASTRONEER

review: The game is really fun very nice to look at and real easy on the ears.It's so sad that it's full of bugs. It randomly crashes between 10 minutes to an hour of play. The controls cannot be mapped to basic keys like TAB. No dedicated servers. Missing lots of "planned features". Basically a rushed release.I was really hoping to play this game in a complete state but that seems really difficult right now. I realize now that I bought a dream this developers can't accomplish.I respect their work but this release sadly tells me that they don't respect my time. Would refund if possible but I already played a lot in early access which was more stable and playable than it is now. It doesn't seem that it'll get any better than this. A real shame.Don't buy if you expect a playable game. Not now at least this is still early access.
title: ASTRONEER

review: Product received for free. Now that this game is finally out of early access it is worth posting a review!My first experiences with it were quite nice of course I started with multiplayer.Everything was fine for the first day or so but today 2/8/2019 everything has....Gone to I had joined my friend and I was about to head back out into space for materials in the large shuttle but the game had...Crashed while in space. Then every other time while trying to join my friend I would be stuck in the spawning area for a minute or two then be forced into the menu to click join game as soon as I would enter the planet my game every time would crash trying to load everything. This did not used to be a problem. I don't know what's happened but it's annoying and I can't play with my friend because of it....And we've lost a large shuttle. Aside from that the game is amazing. I hope to see fixes in the sooner future.

review: Edited Review Ver 1.0I had a review from the game was in alpha and it always was a fun experience. Not officially launched version 1.0 comes with a lot of improvements. Astroneer its a survival game there are others like it but this have an very unique flavor goofy charismatic visual with simple animations cute plant design beautiful atmospheric enviroment shaders lots of items materials and several planets all procedurally generated.This is not a FPS RPG RTS or even a common survival. You can beat it in a couple of hours but the game thrives in its purpose to keep you bussy exploring new places expanding your base and travelling through harsh and beautiful landscapes.

review: Unlike many other people I've experienced very few issues with the game. It runs smoothly never dropping below 60 frames no screen tearing without vsync all while maintaining beautiful graphics. I've come across almost no bugs whatsoever and the ones I have seen are fixed upon a simple exit and restart.So what about the gameplay? There's not much to say about it other than it's an absolute blast. Very relaxing but interesting not so complicated that I don't understand the mechanics but not simple enough that it's boring. After the fiasco that was No Man's Sky this really is a breath of fresh air.Albeit at the time of writing I haven't put that much time into the game (a little over two hours) but so far I'm loving it. If it weren't for exams I'd be playing this nonstop.So far the game is wonderful in its execution and I'm eager to see where it goes in the future. I've heard many complain about lack of content which is an issue I would agree. But in its current iteration I believe this game is absolutely worth your time and money especially if it's on sale.Overall 9/10. I love it.

review: My first impression and review was a not recommend due to the options menu not being fully functional (could not change resolution). With the full release of the game I deleted my review because the options work and thus my review was no longer relevant. Unfortunately I just died do to a glitch that launched me through a planet from underground. I was not worried because I figured I could use console commands to get the stuff I lost back. Nope not going to happen as there are no console commands which is not good enough. Subnautica had similar quirks but I could fall back on the console commands to redeem the situation so all was forgiven. Not here I now have to go through the trouble of harvesting and recreating everything I lost on my character while walking on eggshells hoping it does not happen again no thank you.I suggest everyone read the EULA for this game. Someone else mentioned it in his or her review so I decided to read it myself to see if you truly are giving the publisher/developer permission to data mine. THIRD PARTY SOFTWARE. This Software may contain third party software that requires notices and/or additional terms and conditions (including without limitation analytics software and ad serving technologies as discussed below). Such required third party software notices and/or additional terms and conditions are located on System Era website at www.systemera.net and such terms are made a part of and incorporated by reference into this Agreement.This paragraph and everything that follows it made me take moment to contemplate what that paragraph is actually stating. Then I realized I don t have to I can go to the web address listed. I combed through everything I could click on and found nothing regarding third party software. I did read their privacy policy which only made me feel more uneasy. At the end of the privacy policy there is contact information if someone has any questions so I submitted my questions. Basically asking what third party software is the EULA referring to and how I may find out if it is included or not. That was three days ago with no response.

review: Patch 1.04 ReviewAs of this update I am no longer recommending the game until game breaking bugs are addressed. Until that time I suggest that it sits on your wishlist.There are two obvious bugs that are GAME BREAKING. Not just random either but consistent and heavily reported bugs. 1.) Players being randomly EJECTED upwards regardless of height. Surface Cave or Core of the planet it happens too often. This usually kills the player as well.2.) Vehicles getting stuck for no reason. My Large Rover Train that is only 3 rovers long will get frozen in place after exiting then re entering just about every time. Considering how often you will do this you can imagine how a 5 minute trip suddenly turns into 20 minutes of frustration where you just go back to your base and do something else. Oh and hope #1 doesn't happen or you'll have to find your rover again while hoping you don't die to #1 on the way assuming you can even get there.Simply put these 2 bugs are completely game breaking. The number of times I've died inside my base from bug #1 is absurd. The best part? It rarely happens on the starting planet so you are easily 2 hours into the game by the time you discover how often this happens when you get to the other planets (Calidor was by far one of the worst Novus wasn't far behind.)Yes this is single player still we haven't even touched multiplayer.Add in the poor multiplayer experience with missing terrain lag spikes when entering/exiting vehicles disappearing objects and other such nonsense that you'd expect to have been fixed before release. Oh and some of these bugs were not even present BEFORE the game came out.Finish it off with broken achievements and you'll find not a polished gem at release but a buggy mess (which some people reporting using the buggy just crashes the game entirely) that was not ready to be a Steam Feature. Simply put I wouldn't (even if I could) ask for a refund but to be fair the game when it works is a stellar game. There have been plenty of great moments in the game. Unfortunately these bugs dim any light because it has been a nightmare to play.Original ReviewI was quite excited to play Astroneer when it came out. My buddy and I started playing co op right from the start and we were not disappointed. If you are into having some co op exploration mining building etc then I recommended this title.The game is not without flaws but for the state the game is in it is pretty good. The planet is pretty large and I haven't even checked to see if I could goto another one yet albeit I have gotten into orbit to look around.I'll clean up this review once I have more time in and update it as the game progresses. If you were hyped about this game you will not be left disappointed.System Specs CPU Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 4790K Processor 4.40GHz CPU Cooler Corsair H100i GPU GeForce GTX 970 G1 Gaming Memory Corsair Vengeance 32GB OS Windows 10 Pro

review: I've followed Astroneer for a while sort of checking in/out.It's a fantastic niche game. Exploration lite in the sense of it's not hard and yes it's grindy but it's very relaxing. I love that it doesn't hold your hand too much. A super game for 10 minutes of jumping in for "one more mining run" or for hours of exploring and checking out that "next mountain over the horizon."Worth the cost? I don't know. I think so but it's easy to see criticism of it It feels like it is a little light on content. But at the same time I really want to plow ahead research out everything build everything set up easy travel between all the planets find all the structures on each planet etc. So it does drive you to keep moving forward even though truly there's no real end goal.Some QoL bugs that are super irritating (currently the tractor bug where you occasionally have to hop in/out several times to get it to move) but unlike many developers I'm confident SES will fix it (and likely soon based on past performance).

review: I've been playing since wayyy before all these big updates and let me just say that this game has grown a great amount since the last time I looked at it. I thought I'd give a review while the sale is going on to get people to purchase it because these developers are awesome. This game was released a long while back and it's STILL getting big updates. Although it's been in early access for as long as I can remember it doesn't matter. The devs don't know when to quit its truly awesome. If only more triple A companies would learn by these guys' example.1.0 UPDATE REVIEW Holy damn it's finally out of 1.0 and I've already put several hours into the game to see what I've been missing out on and so far everything has changed for the better good. The annoying storm that came around every so often is gone which is great (although I'd like to see it on other planets to show uniqueness of each planet) and they completely changed how some things work like research (now you get currency from researching which is then used to unlock new buildings instead of just getting the building straight from simply researching one thing). Vehicles are still as a fun as ever and everything feels a lot more balanced and fleshed out from the last time I played. Also I get a cool retro outfit so there's that. Get it while it's 20% off!

review: Look I have gotten a lot of enjoyment out of this game. I picked it up in early early access and have always found something fun with it. I even recommend it to anyone who likes these types of games. BUT it is not bug free This is how a bug has ruined my enjoyment. TLDR Vehicles get stuck in objects because of a bug no consistent fix. Ruins late game IMO. If this doesnt bother you great it bugs me to no end.This is a complaint coming from a long time fan they need to fix the vehicle mechanics. Right now if you get towards the end game you can make a vehicle called a truck and check them together. You will also most likely encounter a bug where your trucks get stuck ALL THE TIME. I dont mean stuck on objects though that happens i mean literally stuck in the ground.. This bug has been around for years I've lost vehicles through the ground into the sky and now just the pure annoyance of not being able to go out and collect you know a major mechanic of the game because of a game jarring bug is too much. I was very excited about this game going 1.0. I put in 20 hours that week which for me is a lot as a parent. But this bug has made me turn it off. Do i recommend this game sure the devs have put out a love letter to the genre its a lot of fun if you are into this genre but this bug is driving me away.

review: Edit Wow. The communications guy himself Joe Tirado(I assume judging by the jt) informed me that SystemEra changed the EULA within a day and posted what happened. It was their first EULA and they wanted it to encompass ALL current/future games made by SystemEra(I can understand that). This MIGHT include phone games developed by them that need more invasive permissions or ads for example(not their words mine). They quickly realized the mistake and fixed it for Astroneer. All Astroneer collects is anonymous user crash data when a crash happens. I LOVE this game again! Thank you all at SystemEra for listening to the players and staying on top of things. The only question now is "do the rovers still get caught on every frigging rock!?" lol. I'll know when I get home and reinstall XDBelow is my old review and is now completely obsolete LOVED this game since Alpha then it released on Feb 6 to full game and I HAD to uninstall it due to invasion of privacy EULA being shoved down our throats. DO NOT BUY until this is changed!
title: ASTRONEER

review: Pros Beautiful game great color and design.Interesting base building.Interesting research mechanics.Lots of room to explore.Lots of depths to uncover.Multiplayer!Cons There's no real threat at any point. The few environmental hazards are easily overcome.The exploration tends to be simply for the sake of exploration with a fairly uninteresting slog up the tech tree.Storage is a complete nightmare. You can't even build a storage container that holds more than your *backpack* until decently far into the game. Overall I find Astroneer to be a pleasant first experience. Great animations color palette and world generation makes one constantly pause in admiration. The base building system is well fleshed out and clever. The research system while a bit opaque with no tooltips is interesting and keeps you exploring.Where the game falls short for me personally is that with no real *threat* or hardship to overcome no real danger the game is really only interesting for a while. There's nothing to draw one back for another playthrough nothing to add that spike of excitement.I'd say the sale price is a good time to get what to me is a wonderful first experience with nearly zero replay value.
title: ASTRONEER

title: ASTRONEER

review: Due to the fact that the devs have quickly responded to people's concerns and have addressed the EULA debacle I am changing my review.I am not a fan of survival/crafting games in general but Astroneer has won me over. No pun intended but it's so atmospheric. I have not tried the multiplayer but the single player experience gives the lonely feeling of being stranded on a planet far from home with only your wits and a dwindling supply of oxygen.It's a relaxing exploration experience yet there are moments of drama such as getting lost in a cave as I took one too many side passages looking for that hard to find material desperately searching for the exit as the seconds ticked down. The vibe is kind of like the film The Martian where your adversaries are not sci fi monsters but the occasional storm and the tyranny of a limited air supply.And I loved the satisfaction of finding wreckage making a new device and finally building a ship that could get me off the planet. Astroneer is probably not a game for everyone but I really enjoy its chill vibe.
title: ASTRONEER
