title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I was pretty disheartened to hear that Take Two have shut down the OpenIV modding platform for the singleplayer.Sadly I never got the chance to mess around with this amazing program but I was affected none the less.I was really excited to the tune of the hype around GTA V being released on PC back in 2015 and bought it when it first came out with intentions of modding although I never got around to it I've always modded previous games like GTA SA and GTA IV because who wouldn't want to squash people in a Ferrari F50?From the early days of Half Life when Sven Co op Day of Defeat and Counter Strike first took the spotlight I've always added in custom models sound packs texture packs etc.I was quite taken with the multiplayer at first because it's like "oh cool you can now play GTA online with a whole bunch of random strangers and squash people together!" but after a while the hackers start spawning random objects in the game and you get teleported somewhere with the rest of the players on the server only to be blown up a hundred times over and get laughed at by a 10 year old down the microphone. Next thing I heard about Take Two they had banned another mod called 'FiveM' which supposedly allows multiplayer with illegal copies of GTA V. This wasn't true though as it asked for a legitimate CD key to be able to play it. I gave it a shot before it got completely shut down which I managed to get around ten minutes of gameplay out of but it was still very underdeveloped and never had the chance to bloom. It could have been the next big thing with possible full conversion mods and the ability to play them online.Instead of going after the hackers they've come after the more legitimate side of the table the modders. I don't know why. It's not going to make them more money.I'm 27 years old now and I'm fed up of having to play with immature little heads spawning indestructible tanks and spawn the out of people.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is quite probably the most polished game ever made. Boasting an obscenely detailed map with some of the best looking scenery I've ever seen this game pushed the envelope in 2013 for sandbox gameplay. Five years later following a high resolution PC release it still dominates the multiplayer charts thanks to its extremely varied gameplay and massive amount of addictive activities.The online part of GTA V is not without its issues particularly in the form of a particularly toxic element in its playerbase something the developer Rockstar is either unwilling or unable to address. However the gameplay itself is incredibly immersive and entertaining providing you find the right kind of people to experience it with.As a complete package Grand Theft Auto V is easily my most favourite game. I have recommended it to friends and we've had some fantastic experiences as a result.

review: https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openivI'm going to be honest here the game is fantastic and so is multiplayer. In saying that I'm leaving this review negative until Take Two gets their heads out of their behinds. If and when that happens (highly unlikely) I'll change it to a positive review. I believe even though the game is good a negative review is warranted due to horrible developpers who can't make good decisions. I'm sure all of you know the situation where Take Two took down Open IV so I won't go into detail about that but I'll go into detail about why it was a stupid move. The online modders already know the Open IV code this isn't going to stop them. I believe so many people will be off by this that the online hacking community will just grow. The hackers found a way around OpenIV's MANY attempts to stop their users from going online and will continue to create more. The OpenIV team was clearly against their players modding online. Why did Take Two instead of taking the lazy and damaging route not just simply work with and communicate with the OpenIV team? I won't blame Rockstar yet since they're just a subsidiary company and we don't know their role in this other than that they're obviously going to defend their parent company but Take Two that move was honestly stupid. I and many others had passion in modding the game it kept me playing GTA. I had many fond memories of messing around in singleplayer and that was the only thing that made me come back to GTA and sometimes try out online again. The online community is toxic and as I'm sure everyone is aware there's plenty of cheaters. If you really cared about that why not just impletement a system where you report a hacker and you get a reward of in game currency if the case turns out to be real? And then you can work with the OpenIV team to tell them that you aren't ok with certain features and you'd like to see _____ be implemented? This was an "in the moment" irrational decision and while that's normal seeing as we're all humans here you decide to double down on your stupid move and try to back it up. This shows that it was done out of corporate greed and other motivations. Maybe you didn't want to shut down singleplayer modding but you sure as hell didn't think this was going to help combat cheaters. I booted up online and I saw modders in every single lobby I went to yesterday this hasn't crippled the hacking community only made it stronger. People will release workarounds and be hailed as heroes and profit off of your mistakes. OpenIV cared about GTA and wished for it to remain a grounds for creativity and passion that people put into their mods. Clearly they cared more about the users than Take Two or Rockstar. Summary This will do nothing to the hackers (infact I personnally believe this will only make hacking more popular) This only hurts people who care about your game and don't hack They could have worked with the OpenIV team They could have pushed a system of reporting a hacker with proof reward for person/people reporting them Instead of fixing this clear mistake they double down on it showing that they truly don't care about real fans creativity or passion and just want more money This shows a clear disconnect from the GTA community and the creators This shows that the creators truly are incompetent and balancing public/corporate interests I loved this game but I won't be purchasing anything from either Take Two or Rockstar until you deal with this crap properly and I suggest anyone reading this do the same https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openiv Sign this petition. They can easily ignore reviews but they cant ignore thousands upon thousands of angry costumers threatening to stop purchasing their products.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This review applies to online mostly as I haven't played much of the story. The game is lots of fun when it works but there's too many issues for me to recommend as "good". The experience inevitably gets frustrating after not very much play.Pros+Free DLC with lots of content+Some extremely fun and unique game modes.+Something for everyone. There's a million different ways to play.+Tons of vehicles. Collecting personalizing and driving around cars is how I have the most fun+Benny's cars have a ton of personalization options. (I wish every car had that level of customization)Cons You can't get a world record on any race all the times are hacked to a few seconds. Long loading times. Wouldn't be such a big deal on its own but generally annoying. You can't try out different color combinations on vehicles before paying. If you try one color combo switch to see another and switch back you'll end paying three times for each color change. This applies to all vehicle upgrades (spoilers performance upgrades etc) This bothers me because the MKII weapons added in the Gunrunning update have upgrades and color options as well but once you buy a paint scheme or a scope you own it forever. You can switch between any purchased upgrades for free. Cars should work this way as well. Just makes me feel like the game is nickel and diming me. Any time the game fails to join session it boots you right into singleplayer automatically. It wastes my time because I'm typically not in the mood to play singleplayer if I'm online. Give me the option to retry joining online instead of forcing me to load singleplayer than join multiplayer again. This makes zero sense from a user experience perspective. Also it usually fails to join session because I alt tab to do something else because the wait times are so long. The game doesnt like losing focus even in Borderless windowed mode. In some competetive game modes (gta races deathmatches) where you can use your owned weapons instead of a predetermined set there is a 'Buy all ammo' button which is supposed to fill all your owned weapons. It always takes my money but rarely actually fills all my ammo. Also most of the time when I buy ammo for MKII weapons it disappears from my inventory next time I log in. I've filed support tickets for both of these issues but the outsourced support department just runs me through a script of basic troubleshooting items (verifying game cache etc) before just offering to compensate me for the lost money without addressing the root of the problem. Daily objectives would be a great way to make money but many are nearly impossible to complete without friends. There's just so many gamemodes and half of them have no one playing. I appreciate that we have a lot to do but oversaturation has divided the playerbase. For example 'Complete a Capture Contend'. Barely anyone plays Captures and the fact that they've divided into 4 types doesn't help. A lot of useful game functions like replacing a destroyed vehicle going off the radar summoning a vehicle from your garage are handled through the in game phone. The problem is that half the time the phone rings a few time and doesnt pick up (the menu acts like a simulated phone conversation). The whole phone thing is for immersion I guess but I will never understand why I cant just access these options on the first try. Also there's a second in game menu (interaction menu) that also has similar features but works differently. The two need to be merged. You also can't climb or shoot while using the phone which is frustrating

review: After trying to force players to buy ingame currency by releasing more and more powerful items for astronomical high prices (worth 700h of grinding OR 500 US $ of ingame currency for the content of ONE SINGLE DLC) the developer and its publisher Take Two Interactive decided that this wasn't enough. Here is a quote from the CEO of Take Two Interactive "We are convinced that we are probably from an industry view UNDERMONETIZING on a per user basis. There is wood to chop because I think we can do more ... "Following this statement they shut down the most popular tool for creating singleplayer mods. One might suspect they are doing this to force players into multiplayer (and ultimately buying ingame currency). The company's stance is already clear when watching their neglect of singleplayer content and pretty much exclusive focus on the more lucrative multiplayer part. For the reasons mentioned above I can not recommend this game.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is THE ing around simulator of 2013. There's a lot of ing around simulators set in sandboxes but there's none quite with the same hallowed recognition and flair that Grand Theft Auto possesses. It's unevenly designed (see the ing UI re it being garbage beyond figuring out waypoints) padded as to fill out a 40 hour game time (that's only if you do the main missions and little else in between) and the game itself feels well detailed and alive and somehow at the same time feeling like computer people existing in a computer environment. Now that it's 2015 it's finally out on the PC and it has new content for its multiplayer platform! Unfortunately for Rockstar I don't give a about Grand Theft Auto's multiplayer mode. If I wanted to play a multiplayer Grand Theft Auto I'd just buy a box of surplus grenades from my local Neo Nazi and huck them at passing cars during rush hour.Despite the tongue lashing I gave the game I like Grand Theft Auto 5. I like it a of a lot more than I liked Grand Theft Auto 4 which managed to tap me out through a combination of awful writing ancillary t and not being able to shoot Roman in the face when he begs me to take him bowling. Oh don't worry there is so much ing around you can do here from golf to taxi driving to underwater deep sea diving to fighting with other s on the Steam Discussion forums on whether Claude Speed is still canon in GTA or not. But if you want to just dig deep into the miserable lives of three s looking for scratch so you can get into all the awesome multi stage heists to pull off for sweet dollars and sweeter gamer cred you can do that too and ignore everything else.Now that I've validated your opinion on this video game I am going to say mean things about the writing. If you don't care about the writing of Grand Theft Auto please do not reveal the spoiler tag. Pretend I'm talking about cheeseburgers or something.I think the writing of GTA 5 is highly uneven. Sure Rockstar are taking bold leaps forward by having three main characters with wildly different lifestyles and circles of friends and that is something to applaud. I want to see Rockstar do some Wire type with many main characters but they have to overcome their hurdles first.I think largely I was tired of GTA 5's satirization because I know what they're getting at I just don't find it funny anymore and it think it has more to do with 'haha lol political satire rofl topical humor s and rofl' than it has to do with the lack of attempt of actual satirization. The game is kind of really misogynist and I don't know whether that's an intentional choice or whether it escaped the glaucoma ridden panopticon of SATIRE that the writers tried to create. (I'm betting on the latter). The torture mission sucked and I told the game to go itself when it was over. The main characters are fun and occasionally have actual human emotional moments but their characters kind of fall apart towards the middle part of the game and are driven by the overwritten 80's action movie plot that you can either wrap up neatly or not. It's all shoddy writing masked by excellent world detail and voice acting performances and I hope Rockstar ups their writing game for the next time around.Anyway Bacon Cheddar Burgers are delicious you should go buy one!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: ONLINE REVIEW 3/10SINGEPLAYER REVIEW 8/10Do not under any circumstances buy this game. I am one of the few people that isn't banned and isn't venting in steam reviews.I haven't been banned. I don't use any mods/hacks. This game used to be the hub for all my friends. Great game hours and hours of play on the ps3 and then another 161 clocked in less than two weeks after I bought it. So why the not recommended? Listed from least bad to most bad 4. P2P networking Watch your data usage during play online. The upload speed is phenomemal and as such I cannot play with my friends as my character will update it's position on their screen once every 10 60 seconds. I don't have an amazing upload speed in fact its pretty poor. But why would that cause a game to be unplayable online? I'm an avid gamer online and this $75 game I can't play online with my landline connection. So I have to use my mobile hotspot to play it. How sad is that? This game will eat like 1 GB per hour of play. Oh and if your networks misses to many you'll just be kicked back to singleplayer and enjoy "loading simulator" trying to get back into the lobby with your friends.3. The grind for money Money works more like EXP than the leveling system does. Even when the game works you have most things locked because you're to low level then you need to have enough money to get everything. Granted you gain levels quickly early of course. Now money is how the entire online thing works and it is supposed to and it's done quite well. You are always trying to get more money even if you already have to much. The problem is when everything costs so much you have no freedom in Grand Theft Auto. It will take 100's of hours to get yourself into a position where you can just "do whatever you want" in online lobby's and that is when it is the most fun and THAT is how R* is making so much money off the sharkcards. I won't spend more time explaining it but I'll just say it'll take like 10 hours to save enough to buy a 2 000 000 dollar car and then you still have to get all the things that go on the car.2. Sharkcards One of the last points I made in the last paragraph leads onto this Pay to Have Fun. The sharkcards aren't "needed" to play but if you have a full time job a family and other things to look after you are never going to get a plane/helicopter/boat worth having. DO NOT buy the sharkcards. They are work 40% what they are asking for them as you're basically paying more money on top of an already overpriced game (How the is this game not $60 on steam yet?) so that you can skip play time and get to the part where you can get the things you want.1. Hacking/Modders and the banning You knew this would come up. Even if you spend $1 000 getting a tonne of sharkcards and you getting literally everything in the game others have suggested you can get banend for no reason. I have not seen a case of a false postive personally but I'm sure there heaps I mean every person that it happens to is going to be loud about it. HOWEVER one of my friends decided he dgaf about GTA O anymore and set up some modding software for online. Took about 5 minutes for him to get banned for a month. So it does work... That being said it to easy to do it. They are literally in EVERY SECOND LOBBY if not more often. So even if you spend $500 or 500 hours getting everything you want your lobbies are plagued with modders. Not like one dude cheating 100's of millions. That would be fine. Nah you have buses flying around faster than jets with 14 people in them and the bus is invincible. That kind of cheating. This is what drove me away from this game.TL DR If you want the singleplayer experience go pirate it. R* does not deserve any more money for this game. Do not buy it. Don't even buy it when it's on sale. The bar has been set very low for red dead redemption 2.

review: For single player I can say the game is good enough. Tbh I actually wanted GTA V to be released on PC since It was released on 2013 (on console).The game offers more vehicle customizations 3 protagonists Heists where you can earn lot of money in SP doing stocks get 5 stars and wasted.The game gave me very good first impressions.In the Online world however...Well I liked GTAO mainly because I can "permanently" own a Car/Motorcycle where you can reaquire your vehicle so I dont need to worry about losing my favourite vehicle (back then when I was playing previous GTA games I drove my favourite car CAREFULLY so it won't crash flipped or sink into the river).My good impressions however got ruined after several hours of playing this game.Lots of grinding overpriced vehicles and tryhards that causes cancer in the lobby. Public sessions with 20+ amount of players is usually a complete warzone.Had to be in empty public one's to get my CEO MC Bunker Business to run well for me.So about the Doomsday Heists I thought this update going to great.But sadly no...Some of the heist missions are ridiculously difficult infinity enemy spawns in the same area enemies that have "superior" aim and irritating glitches.The thing that made me dissapointed is the oRbiTaL Cannon. FFS why ppl would spend a 900k + 500 750k just to TROLL players with this thing.I reccomend this because of the Single Player.If you prefer Online.Go get yourself some friends to tag along or if you were alone play in empty public session.If you play with randoms expect them to kill you without reasons.

review: Ok so this review was initially about Take Two taking down OpenIV awhile back but now it's about the game not being fun anymore. I remember in 2013 on the Xbox 360 when the game was just regular cars some fast some slow and Helicopters and Planes. But now its Jetpacks ing flying deloreans advanced tanks that shoot lasers. I want the original game back not this Year 2746 game. And if you're a new player it's even worse you'll be spawn killed by Tryhards and other players because you're a low level. The DLC is free BUT the cars are EXTREMELY overpriced they're forcing you to buy shark cards or unless you want to spend hours of grinding to buy ONE CAR. review: This is a marvelous game. You marvel at its scale you marvel at its possibilities. This is a terrible game. The more you look at it the more you think about it and the more you compare it it is a downgrade within the franchise and a shallow expirience. Singleplayer This suffers due to three things in my mind. 1 a development focus on money making multiplayer which leaves the singleplayer seeming old in concept. 2 multiple protagonists fail to be good individual characters. yes they may work together well as character types but within the storyline there are extreme inconsistencies and a total lack of Franklins reason to exist as a playable character except for the San Andreas callback. 3 the singleplayer is stuck between being a Ubisoft game and being a story driven title. GTA 3 and its branching titles were all very much sandbox games with a distictly separate story mission set. GTA was all narrative driven and reasoned for within the character and world. GTA tries to be both these things and just comes off confused and not confident. Online Where to begin. This has an incredibly toxic community. This has a series of added content that simply makes griefing more accessible harder to counter and encouraged in some scenarios. I understand the idea R* was going for with this and it interested me at first but the more I played it the more I understood that they were creating a milk machine of investment. The more you play the more you compete. In order to compete you need to get the good gear. To get the good gear you need to research it. To research its means you need money and a business. To get a business you need money. To get money you need to do missions. To do missions you need to invest your time. How does one invest their time? Play. Its a money microtransaction scheme of rage at this point with stupid omissions and a failure to keep prices reasonable. I will give it that they throw in some excellent lines of dialogue and the voice acting is superb despite the flaws in the writing. Also the graphics are an improvement over 4 and are still goodby modern standards short a few bad texture here and there. Also it has the best shooting system of the franchise. Its not the best third person cover available shooter but its still decent.If you like sinking time in to an ever rage inducing and increasingly worthless example of the phrase "Familiarity breeds contempt" then you may like this game. Otherwise its not worth picking up these days.

review: Product received for free. I recieved a copy of GTA 5 for my birthday last year. When I first recieved it I had alot of fun playing through the Story mode for the first time. Micheal Trevor and Franklin are all very unique and interesting characters each one fitting a type of player. Micheal being for those who enjoy story Franklin for those who enjoy progression and Trevor for those who enjoy Gameplay and Carnage. The Campaign is surprisingly long with a large amount of heists tied into the storyline plenty of collectibles and side missions for after the storyline. I've even reset my storyline progress a few times the story is just that fun to play. So whats with the Negative review you ask? GTA Online.The Online scene had been rampant with hackers for the longest time. Players who would use menus to generally mess around with other people in their online experience Such as littering the map with UFOs or Spawn in an invincible Rhino Tank and blow up everything and anyone in sight. Or teleport everyone out to the ocean and instantly kill them.Some of these modders would try to be nice to other players and give them large sums of in game money. Let them be able to buy the better things the game has to offer. Rockstar was loosing the opportunity to sell shark cards their form of currency boosts. They began to crack down on these modders. For the longest time they were loosing. And all the while they continued to pump out content that slowly grew more and more expensive.Rockstar had started some shady business practices as well. With certain things like CEO Bikers and Lowriders they will often hide paywalls behind paywalls. For example the Bikers Update added illegal business such as Weed Coke and Meth. To get into the Biker content you'll first have to buy a Clubhouse. The cheapest is 200K so its not a big deal. From there you'll have to shell out even more of your cash to purchase a property of your choice. Once you pick and buy the shady business that you want you'll have to upgrade it even more to get more efficeny out of it. you can restock you business with long and repetitive restocking missions that don't give any cash and a small amount of RP or just pay money to restock the business. You have to pay money to pay more money to only then begin to make money.Then came the Gunrunning Update. The Pay to Win Update I could rename it.You're given the chance to buy a Bunker and sell firearms throughout Los Santos getting some weapon upgrades of your own and some really cool vehichles along the way. Sounds great and fun on Paper but its completely tarnished by Rockstars greed. Paywalls on Paywalls once again except these are a minimum of 1 Million each this time. First you'll have to buy the bunker to get access to the Gunrunning aspects of this update which is really just a really expensive Biker business. After that you can either make firearms to sell or develop more advanced weaponry and munitions. some of these being very powerfull modifications that can dramatically shift the balance of a fight.There is also a Mobile Operations Center that you can purchase from Warstock acting as well a Mobile base of Operations. Problem is you can't buy one unless you own a Bunker. So theres at elast 1.1 million out of your pocket there. The Truck itself is 1.2 Million but unless you add nearly another million to the price tag to add the ACTUAL MOBILE OPERATIONS to the Mobile Operations Center its really just an oversized overpriced trailer. Its a minimum of 4 5 Million to access just the basics of the update let alone upgrading the business firearms vehichles and purchasing all the really overpowered veichles of the update (That Surprising nobody require even more money to upgrade after buying them. "Guns Sold Seperately" in a sence.)Now here's the crowning moment of this Microtransaction hell The Cease and Desist of OpenIV effectively making modding of GTA illegal. The number one way to mod the Singleplayer experience of GTA 5 now can revoke your $60 purchase. You see Rockstar on purposely makes most of their content locked to GTA Online so they can force microtransactions on everyone who plays their game. With the end of OpenIV and mods for singleplayer anyone who just wanted to try the content of Rockstars game have to play the Chaotic Online multiplayer or pay money to use their content and now that theres no modders able to drop money for other players Rockstar can charge whatever they want for in game content.If you don't own this game good. Don't buy it. Don't get sucked into the Microtransaction filled 30 player PvP cluster that is GTA Online that I've wasted 500+ hours of my life in. If you do own this game get out of Online now. Either stick with the well made Story or just stop playing it completely find a better game one that wont make you pay money to just be able to pay for more money.You ed up hard Rockstar. Stop milking your games success and start making it fun again.EDIT Alright I need to make some changes to what I've said. Rockstar isn't the culprit with this latest attack on Modding and GTA Online microtransaction hell this was Take Two Interactive. Rockstar not only encouraged mods they had also made blogs about some of the best mods they had seen for their games. OpenIV was very careful with its modding making sure it didn't encroach on the Online scene but yet Take Two have shut it down because they saw singleplayer mods as "a Breach of Security."What they really meant was that it was a way for players to have more fun from their game or simply use their overpriced content for free in the Singleplayer story mode without having to pay money to basically unlock extra content. Take Two interactive believes that they "undermonetize" their players and that they should be making more from each individual user so they're now trying to shut down any form of fun that doesn't require shoveling massive amounts of money into their Online Cluster Grindfest. You're not a player to them you're just another souce of money that they'll try their damndest to suck dry.Oh and hackers are still in the game. They shut down singleplayer modding with the C&amp D on OpenIV third party mod menus and hacks are still abundant. You shot what kept your nearly 5 year old game relevant in the head and ignored the second biggest issue your game has beside your corporate greed.Maybe just maybe you wouldn't have a modder or hacker in every lobby of your Online how if you didn't make getting the fun stuff locked behind multiple expensive Paywalls and nearly mandatory Microtransactions.

review: I pulled my original review giving it a B a while back as well as my revised review giving it a solid D and I think it's about time I revised it a second time. The Good Attention to detail. Trees shake with the wind rain forms puddles. Snow on the ground affects traction. Temperature gauges inside vehicles start on the lower end of the dial and slowly rise as the engine warms up post start. There's wildlife in singleplayer too. Large map almost TOO large. If you get tired of the urban jungle take a ride up the 1. Soon the grassy but otherwise barren mountainside will give way to swamps lush mountains hilly countryside beautiful rivers small farming towns and a desert. It's even more diverse than San Andreas and San Andreas was already pretty diverse. Weapons You can hold more than just one weapon of each type. In earlier GTA titles if you picked up a Desert Eagle you would not be able to also carry a standard handgun. In GTA 5 you can carry both plus the rest of the handguns. Same for all weaponry types handgun MG assault rifle sniper rifle melee shotguns heavy weapons and thrown weapons can all carry different weapons in the same slot. (Access them by holding the weapon wheel key and using the scroll wheel or triggers to choose.) This comes with the caveat that you cannot drop them in single player so if you buy six different handguns you'll have to scroll through them to get to the one you want. This is a double edged sword in Online however if you purchase a weapon you cannot permanently remove it.The BadThis is what I felt was disappointing enough to complain about at least. Keyboard flight controls are rubbish. By default W and S are throttle not pitch. My suggestion rebind them to Saints' Row controls (WASD for movement with throttle on Shift and Ctrl) You cannot change the 3 main player characters' personal vehicles. Don't like Michael's Tailgater? Sorry you're outta luck. Physics and combat engines feel like they've had a downgrade in realism from GTA4. Driving physics feel less realistic and more arcade like compared to GTA4 pedestrians don't really react to being shot/run over/hit from GTA4 your character doesn't react as well to the environment as in GTA4 and specific example hovering a heli low over water doesn't cause the water to get a dip in it anymore it just kicks up what could barely be called mist. The combat system also got a downgrade where you can't shoot guns out of someone's hand like you could in GTA4. If you want more examples here https //www.youtube.com/watch?v GWVtZJo HqIThe UglyHere's what I felt needed a total re work. I'll divide it into two subsections THE UGLY DEVELOPER PRACTICES The game is centred around Online. There are no DLC which specifically targets singleplayer. Also recent DLC patches haven't even MADE it to singleplayer AND if you somehow manage to get a vehicle from said recent patches in a singleplayer garage it'll despawn as soon as you attempt to drive it out. Online is centred around microtransactions. First things first the cost of DLC items and vehicles is insanely high. Example A flashlight A FLASHLIGHT was in the 4 digit cost range in game. In order to get something that isn't the lowest end thing available you need to grind and grind and grind and grind... or buy some virtual dosh with real dosh. You can argue pedantics with me all you like but the truth is this At a perfect 25% split without any bonuses PacStan pays out 312 500 maximum. That can be repeated by the host every 48 minutes or so. Not assuming setup time or anything else just assuming that every 48 minutes you get GTA$312 500 in order to buy a 10 car garage you would need to do that once. In order to buy say a Zentorno (formerly one of the go to supercars) you would need to grind the mission thrice assuming you had no cash on hand at the start and that's just to purchase not upgrade. Now say you want to purchase a yacht in GTA Online with no cash on hand. The cheapest yacht costs $6M so you would have to grind it TWENTY times just to be able to afford that. Developers are strongly against modding. Let's be honest you probably are looking at buying this to mod the hell out of it. Good luck. TakeTwo Interactive the publisher of GTA 5 literally sent private investigators to modders' homes with cease and desist letters after the modders announced they were working on an alternative multiplayer project. Not only that they literally just declared modding Grand Theft Auto 5 to be illegal and in doing so they shut down the main tool for modifying ingame assets such as cars gtaforums.com (which is why this review was pulled this appended and the review reposted). THE UGLY EVERYTHING ELSE Keybind conflicts. As in the keyboard and controller directly conflict with each other for some silly reason. Unlike in GTA4 where you could say accelerate with the triggers and shoot with the right mouse button (how you'd do that I have no idea) here if you're using the keyboard at all the controller behaves oddly. For example if you use a push to talk key in Online while running or jumping using the controller you'll activate the recording functions. If you're backing up a car with controller and just ever so slightly nudge the mouse your character will aim their weapon where the camera's pointed usually shattering the window in the process. It's a rather difficult thing to explain you'd have to experience it yourself to know what I mean. Does not affect those using keyboard only. Unmodified first person FOV is so narrow it's disorienting. Even with the slider set to maximum it's still hilariously low by today's standards. I don't have a source to go along with this but the max end of the slider in the menus is around 60 degrees horizontal (referred to hereafter as H) which can cause motion sickness if you are used to a much higher value. Going past 60 H requires external modifications. (For comparison Team Fortress 2 a first person shooter which was released for PC and consoles at the same time has its default set to 75 H which is still low by today's standards.) (Online only) Simeon ing Yetarian. The guy that wants every car off the street. Want to get somewhere fast? Accidentally jack a car off the street he wants? Boom two wanted stars. Kill the owner and jack the car five miles from the nearest person? LSPD instantly knows. Simeon can honestly go to hell and I'm glad that in a SP strangers and freaks mission you have the option to kill him.The verdictEven if I have spent a lot of time in the game it's still a rather disappointing change from GTA4. Yeah it's more optimised yeah it's a new story but that and what's up there in the "good" really is all it has going for it. I've gotta mark this down from a D to a straight up F given the crap developer's practices. Review for game version 1.0.678.1 typed 2016 03 23 23 58 0500 updated 2017 06 15 18 08 0500 to address the OpenIV cease and desist notification.

review: TakeTwo's and Rockstars game approach "Why should the players have fun when we can get money AND put in as little effort as possible?"Generally speaking gameplay wise the game is definitely good. But other than that it's just... no.Let's start with the singleplayer component of the game. You're through the story in perhaps a few hours if you do all the side missions and collectibles it's perhaps 20 hours at best and after that there's literally nothing left to do except doing it all over again. There has not been a single update concerned with the singleplayer since it's release in 2013. No singleplayer DLC no smaller updates nothing that concerns itself with singleplayer. Worst of all is that you can't even test out the new things that get released for online in singleplayer because why should you? It'd just make TakeTwo lose money because you can just get all the cool stuff in singleplayer and not buy shark cards to get it.Now online. The community is toxic the support is t and hackers are literally everywhere and neither Rockstar nor TakeTwo give enough of a to fix anything about it they just let it happen banning the people that get hacked rather than the hackers and just pushing out completely overpriced DLCs while nerfing the missions into total uselessness to force people into buying their Shark Cards so they can get even more money from this game.And now they even tried taking away singleplayer modding. The only thing that made this game actually fun. The game was in a downward spiral ever since it got released but this was a new low. And to have the audacity and try to choke down the news that they have put a C&amp D onto OpenIV by doing it simultaneously to releasing their Gunrunning DLC is just the worst I have seen so far even Ubisoft and EA can do better than that. I'm just gonna say shame on TakeTwo for ruining such a game and shame on Rockstar for letting such people ruin their game. Don't buy the game don't buy Shark Cards don't give those people more money than they already have. That's all I have to say to this peace.

review: This review only addresses the GTA V Online mode.Please improve the server system meaning improve loading times (I wrote this review while loading a session.....) make it easier to join specific games (full server almost epmty server join by ping/latency) make it easier to switch between servers (I was put in the same game I just left many times)Improve the economy system make earning money easier/faster (especially for new players) &gt or reduce overall prices make earning money less of a grind and more fun &gt because every fun thing you can buy (e.g. good cars weapons vehicles ...) is too expensive the only reason I play the game as a new player is to earn money as fast as possible which is not fun at all &amp not easy either.Improve the car tuning only the good/expensive cars can be strongly changed in appearance while the cheap cars you can snatch from the streets often can't be changed at all generally add more appearance modifications to every car not only the cheap as i mentioned but even the expensive ones can't be changed enough in my opinionImprove the experience for new players please. Yes I am a new player. Most people I met got their money from early days when many cheaters were present and invested it imediately and even they told me the economy is and they have no way of earning sufficient funds in the future...Please fix that Rockstar the game has so much potential but not if you just update it for your own good (e.g. cash card dlcs etc.). I want to see some more good updates in the future please &lt 3Edit (03/10/18) after having uninstalled since 20/01/18 for same reasons just installed it again to give it another try.BIG MISTAKE you ing greedy devs and fix this economy system.I am still trying to grind for like the storage halls for car deliveries and while trying to deliver the 20 000th delivery (BORING!) someone started following me (LIKE ALWAYS) with his ing OP flying motorcylce with auto aiming rockets (wtf even is this did you come up with that idea when you were high?). I can't even afford to defend myself if I want to save up for more important investments!And guess what no one has ever grinded for any in your stupid game because it is impossible. Because I enjoy the stuff that isn't grinding or p2w.

review: Really enjoyed this game when it first came out but it seems like Rockstar and Take2 are doing all they can to kill it and suck the playerbase dry of their money.The singleplayer is fantastic and it may be worth 60 bucks to you. The multiplayer on the other hand is a crap filled grind fest to do literally anything fun. That is unless you buy shark cards. The game is basically no fun if you don't have millions of dollars to blow and it's basically impossible to grind that money naturally.Not to mention the recent thing with Take2 sending cease and desist letters to prominent modders and such which is the lifeblood of the GTA community and has been since the franchise began. It's sad to see.Don't buy this game for the multiplayer and I really wouldn't recommend you buy it at all.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is a masterpiece. One of the best games ever made developed written and published. However being a masterpiece does not excuse a product by any means to target and discriminate against your audience. Three times you charged for this game on last gen consoles next gen consoles and finally on PC. Three times we bought it. We gave you our money willingly 3 times. Your recent attack on the modding community of your PC port is unacceptable. Many people would not have bought this game if not for the fantastic modding community provided by the OpenIV team. The single player world you crafted was only enhanced by these mods never took away from. Yet you continue to prioritize your multiplayer which by the way is really really bad. I have never seen something that took so much grinding. It's so impossible to progress quickly in it it is actually more economical to go out and get a job irl and pay for in game money with real world money through the Shark Cards. Yet you deliberately attack the single player and make it less fun by destroying the mod community in order to bring more people over to multiplayer so more people will spend money on your scummy microtransactions. To Take Two Interactive and Rockstar studios I am really sorry that you have *only* the fourth best selling game of all time behind Tetris Minecraft and Wii Sports. I'm sorry you feel the need to punish your loyal fanbase for your greed but enough is enough. I will not have it and your community won't have it. Maybe this one review won't do anything maybe all these negative reviews won't do anything but when the gaming press sees those review scores dropping they'll take it into their own hands. Maybe you should rethink your recent actions and actually reward your playerbase rather than punish it. There's a rumor going around that you actually scrapped plans for single player DLC in order to spend time on your abysmal multiplayer. After yesterday and today I believe it full heartedly. Get your act together you *were* one of the most respected publishers and developers in the world you *were* many people's favorite company and Grand Theft Auto 5 *was* one of the best games of all time. This game is a master piece and I am truly sorry that I have to turn my back on it. Sincerely A very dissapointed customer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is full of superfluous t hostile user interface toxic userbase offensive design choices and it's downright baffling that this is somehow supposed to be a multi million dollar franchise as much as it's an overpriced litterbox filled with and dead fetuses for the eager "consumers" to fling at eachother in a noisy poisonous mess. Which is all fun and games until a kid gets strangles with an umbellical cord and cacks their pants all over the other children turning to a hodgepodge of necrophagia and . All these things have come to be the rule and not the exception for Rockstar and no less their dominatrix Take Two Interactive and yet they sweep pop culture with every release I reckon people love a bit of poo play now and then but it becomes offputting to say the least when people come flocking around it like carrion.And yet is as evident from the amount of time I have spent on this game it's something to sink a heap of time into even if it feels like empty busywork that you autonomously "engage" in. I say engage in the same way that you "engage" in having a stroke.Despite all this I wouldn't have recommended against the product and I mean product before very recently in an event where Take Two Interactive filed cease and desist against a mod that a massive proportion of all mods available for the game heavily relied upon.It's time to stop playing a capricious idiot god Take Two or you might as well Take Two cyanide pills up your and a capscasin pill down your cockhole and die convulsing frothing and all over your consumerbase.

review: The game itself great sure. (At least in single player)However I could never recommend than anybody gave Rockstar or TakeTwo money they are some of the greediest seemingly self obsessed developers/publishers in the entire video game space. They have repeatedly decreased cash rewards in GTA online for everything and inflated the prices too meaning that it ends up costing 100K to refill your ammo which is the equivalent to a heist mission and that is if you can get in a lobby without somebody leaving in the first 12 seconds.Micro transactions are full stop. Nevertheless Rockstar comes along and still manages to beat all of the competition except maybe EA in how they make them. The most expensive shark card costs NZ$125 for 8 million in game dollars this might seem like a lot but once you get in game you realise it really is not. Having to spend more money on top of the NZ$99 that I spent on the game in order to afford cars or whatnot (since you cannot steal them) is simply a cash grab and it makes me wonder why anybody feeds this with their wallets.In short do not buy this game please. As much as I hate to encourage piracy if you must play the single player then pirate it but please do not feed Rockstar and TakeTwo any more or things will never improve.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is pretty fun and the port is well done but it's a 4 year old game with heavy microtransactions being sold at full price. 3 singleplayer expansions were cancelled in order to focus on the lucrative multiplayer where new more expansive items are always being added. If you want to obtain money in game you can work like hell to grind missions over and over for as many hours as you can stand and hope the cars and ammo you lose are more than the money you are getting. Or you can hand them a lot of real money and start actually getting the new modes missions weapons cars and cosmetics. This game is meant to entice whales and constantly annoy everyone else with what they can't have.The publisher also just crushed the modding community devoted to mods that literally only function in the singleplayer mode because they felt the mods compete with the multiplayer mode. If you have everything you want in singleplayer you wont want to give them all your money to get it in multiplayer. I can't stand by this.

review: R* fcked this game over with their greedy bs practices and it's just not worth it if you're a new player and want to jump into online. Buy the game if you're interested in the story it was alright but don't buy the game for online. Paywalls timewalls grinding AGL's all the things i thought i would never ever see in a R* game but here they are to ruin and slow down your fun. There is no feeling of rewarding progression in the game like when online first came out when prices weren't so blown out of proportion. You end up playing the same boring missions all the time to afford the cool stuff but it feels like you never get anywhere. You can't even enjoy the new heist missions after seeing what the new vehicles cost and how little you get after the missions and you can't enjoy the heist story because you only really care how much money it will get you. Online was amazing when it first came out and you might wanna buy the game because it looks cool or because you've heard great things but it is very very different now. They even created a starter pack for online that costs more than the original game that gives you money and properties to give you a headstart because they now that online is fcked and that players would lose interest immediately if they bought the standard game and had to grind from the very start. 135 euro bundles and 90 euro bundles are you serious R*!? It does not cost that much much to make a dlc what the actual fock. That's things EA would do and you have now stooped down to their level. This just goes to show that at the end they are all just companies trying to squeeze every last bit of money out of you. When hackers feel like angels sent from heaven then you now the game is fcked. review: (A NOTE This review would have told you to buy it if I had written in two weeks ago)This game frankly on it's own is amazing. The story is over the top but the characters are relatable. The world is very much alive in it's own strange and quirky way.And I won't be playing it anymore. At least not for the forseeable future.The recent move by Take Two with the C&amp D against the creators of OpenIV a tool that for the past ten years allowed some AMAZING things to be done with their games (See ICEnhancer for GTAIV and GTAVREDUX) has given me pause with this game.With TT claiming that OpenIV allowed online cheating (it didn't as it disabled online play when you installed a mod with it) it was apparent that they simply don't want the players on PC to be able to enjoy the game they bought the way that they want to. This is ridiculous and anti consumer. Please if you do not own this game do not buy it on PC. If you buy it for console make sure you buy it used. Don't give Take Two and R* any more money if they are going to pull these kinds of moves.

review: Game is good and well made. But I cannot honestly give this game a good review due to the company. Rockstar has banned most PC players and reset their accounts for no reason at all while modders and hackers roam the public rooms unafraid of any bans. I have seen users with ridiculously high RP levels such as 4000 5000 and up to 9000 grieving other players in the public room. I know of people who used hacked accounts that have billions of dollars and Rockstar rewards them giving them kickbacks. But to the clean player who bought regularly Shark Cards an "I appreciate your support" comes in the form of a one month ban. Twitter support is nonexistent and any ticket with the word "ban" is automatically closed and there are no replies whatsoever. Unfortunately this is a good and entertaining game but the company behind it is simply disastrous. They will take your money and in appreciation will ban you resetting your character and stealing GTA money from your account. Any hope of Rockstar fixing this is very very slim.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A Masterpiece thats worth the waitIn a world filled with money grabbing devs useless DLCs and notorious but popular locked contents that were supposed to be part of the game was stripped away and made into season passes. These practices angered a lot of avid gamers such as myself and needless to say it is revolting to see that games are being treated untruthful to the genre's original roots.2015 has not been a great year for games with promising titles such as Evolve Dying Light and for the ps4 Order 1866 failing to deliver leading to disappointments for many. Doubts started to creep in and some suspect that even the best upcoming titles such as MGS PP and even Witcher 3 might suck.Amidst the chaos one star shines above all its gleaming bright and pure radiance covered the sky full of light hope and dreams. This star is known as Rockstar.GTA V was originally released as a console exclusive and has received praise across the board with 10/10 ratings. I did not buy into the hype as I had little memory of playing GTA IV 5 6 years ago and so I hesitated and waited.Suddenly Rockstar decided to port it over to the PC and when I say 'Port' I didn't mean Crapcom's lazy port with missing features and bad optimizations. I mean a whole new experience build from the ground up adding exclusive features implementing bug free experience detailed PC settings that are both well optimized and greatly refined. The PC version is hands down the superior and most definitive way to play GTA V.The StoryThe story revolves around 3 characters allowing you to switch freely in between. The characters introduced are Franklin Michael and Trevor. Each individual has an interesting back story and personality with Franklin growing up in the rough Compton like neighbourhood but is fed up with all the gangbanging and killing and instead wants to turn and make honest or perhaps fast dollars.Leading him into the shady world of doing vehicle repossessions and eventually meet Michael who is an ex bank robber now retired living off of the money from his final heist. Wanting a peaceful life seems to be too much to ask for and as trouble always come looking for him. With family on the line Michael is now back in the game.Trevor on the other hand is Michael's brother in crime and from many years of doing 'Professional business' the two formed unshakable bonds. In everyday life Trevor is one violent who runs 'Trevor Enterprise' a meth cooking laboratory. Nobody wants to mess with this psycho maniac as he will do anything to keep his business running smooth.The worldThe state of Lost Santos is a recreation of modern day Los Angeles and it is amazingly detailed graphically beautiful and vibrant. Popular landmarks were represented accurately and are a wonder to look at. The world and its people live and breath the same air as you do and will react to everything that has happened locally or globally which is reflected in news and radio channels. The size of the world is also incredibly huge containing varies geographical locations such as downtown area desert countryside narrow mountain roads and luxurious Beverly hills. Talking about radio channels there are hundreds of tracks available and I rarely hear repeated songs. The tracks were well selected with West Coast classics being my favorite channel constantly play tunes from rap icons from Tupac N.W.A to Snoop Dogg and many others instantly recognizable.Music genres have rich varieties and there is something for everyone. In addition you can import your own soundtracks into the built in radio to create the self radio and it can be shared and heard by friends on the passenger seats.Voice Acting/AnimationThe voice acting were spot on the moment you hear Franklin talking with Lamar each character feels realistic and packed with emotions that can be related to. Even the pedestrians will often talk to their loved ones or friends on the phone.The animation and facial expression were on par with LA noir creating the perfect balance between gameplay and storytelling.GTA V excels at the fact that it doesn't take itself too serious showing constant humor racial slurs and stereotypical aspects of different cultures and races. It is well executed in GTA V as it makes the player feel integral to the community whether you are rich or poor or the areas you live in.VehiclesGTA V offers a huge selection of vehicles with really well designed handling and overall great driving mechanics.Cars were also smartly placed with richer areas containing more high end sports and luxury cars and other areas containing more standard commuting cars and trucks on the countryside.By simply driving around you will instantly recognize Audi R8 Bugatti Veyron Porsche GT Lamborghinis and Ferraris.The intricacies of the mechanics expand deeper when reaching out into the air as aircraft has totally different controls with some degree of learning curve and practices getting used to.MultiplayerGTA V is not complete without its popular online multiplayer. With Rockstar well prepared launch every single thing were fully functional since day one and I have not crashed once in my 50 or so hours of gameplay.Character creation has you choose the heritage and inheritance based on your parents to give a general outlook and an accurate template of the character. Which can then be customized further to become a unique representation of your online avatar. But choose wisely as other characters do not share levels stats and money stored in the bank.As you level up and progress the character stats you will encounter countless of activities all over the map whether you are into shootout robbery or racing there's something for everyone.There are also plenty of competitive multiplayer modes to choose from standard team death match to car death match it has literally too many features and modes for me to list all here and you definitely need to play everything for yourself.Finally online mode introduces heist once you reach level 12. If you think Payday has great heist you might need to think again because GTA V's heist is definitely on another level. Heist has you assemble your own team and carefully selecting who's job is what and how it will be executed is the key to success.Each heist contains many smaller missions and these missions serve as preparation jobs. Once all the preparation jobs are completed you will unlock the finale of the heist. A longer intense action packed and adrenaline rushing action set pieces perfectly created by Rockstar. It really goes to show the high production value because it is mind blowing fun. After 10 failures and 1 success it makes me think I deserve that huge paycheck.For hardcore players and the perfectionist heists can be replayed to allow perfect plan execution for the mastermind. Completing extra challenges will reward you handsomely.With 80% of my play time sucked in multiplayer I have only just scratched the surface. There are still tons of content I have yet to experience and tons of missions I have not played. For the asking price of 39.99 it is absolutely a must buy as online alone will contain hundreds if not thousands of hours of gameplay and in the future more may be added.If you ask me "Should I buy GTA V" I say "Hell ing yeah"The only aspect of the game I didn't like is the long loading time when transitioning from online to story mode and between screens when selecting missions but then again it is understandable considering the size of the game.Rockstar pays attention to details in a sandbox game with unparalleled gameplay and extremely rich content packed with a fully realized world to experience in first person mode. GTA V sets the standard for what an AAA game should be and likewise Rockstar sets the standard to how an AAA developer should make a game.10/10

review: Одиночная игра и в частности сюжетная линия прекрасны спору нет.Но пока GTA Online не станет чем то более глубоким и продуманным чем деревянные PvP пострелушки никому не нужные противоборства и огромный выбор дорогущих не окупаемых ничем кроме дебильных карт "Акула" транспортных средств этот режим не будет стоить ни часа потраченного в него времени. Совет тем кто покупает игру ради режима GTA Online в принципе я не отрицаю что вам оно может понравиться (особенно если вы поклонник серии) но это в любом случае не стоит того._____________________________________________The single player and especially the story line are amazing no doubt.On the other hand GTA Online is nothing more deep and exciting but dull PvP pointless races and huge choice of over expensive and uncompensateble vehicles. Until it's changed Online isn't worth a single hour expended in it. I give an advice to people who want to buy the game just for Online mode I don't deny that you might like it (especially if you are a fun of GTA) but it is not worth your time and money anyway.

review: This is the first I ever seen a company go full retard into modding with out looking up the facts. OpenIV was just a viewer and yet you could NOT play GTA V Online after using OpenIV to change stuff. If I want to Play a CRAPPY game I could of just shelled out tons of dollars Electronic Arts for one crappy game. Monetizing is ok. But Take Two has took it to a new level of making it so you HAVE to pay or "hack" for it. GTA V Online was a let down from the start when it started on the Xbox360 and Playstation3. Yes GTA V Online needs to be protected from harmful players but players that are not being harmful are being harmed not by the harmful players but from how the money system works in GTA V Online. I never had high hopes for GTA V Online and now the player community is more heart broken as ever. The only reason I build a gaming computer was to play GTA V... now I want all the money I spent back. Great going Take Two you earn the lowest of the low reward your grave has been set.

review: Rockstar did a great job I wouldn't even call this a "port" from consoles. Just an entirely new version of the game. I am able to run it with a 3770k + GTX780 at 4k and get 50 60FPS maxed out I enabled SLI for my second GTX 780 and I am running at over 100FPS (90 144) with both cards. The first person mode + drunk is amazing when driving because you actually get the holy I'm about to up moment. But overall I have only crashed one time due to driver issues but so far so good. R* is one of the few game developers who still actually give a crap about PC and the optimization in this game running at 4K is amazing. All other game developers should feel shamed.

review: This one is a far departure from the prior GTA games.Single player is alright while the online multiplayer (clearly the core component of the game considering the attention Rockstar spends on it) is a lengthy grind fest to acquire almost purely aesthetic content. While the attention to graphical detail is great the gameplay is shallow and repetitive.For the longest time in this game's development I had hoped and was very excited for it to be somewhat of a remastered GTA San Andreas. Boy was I wrong. The more I play and try to give it a chance the more I'm disappointed.It's very clear that their passion for making money has overshadowed their prior passion for making outstanding games. It really does pain me to say this as I've been a big fan of most all of Rockstar's prior games but my faith in them is absolutely null and void at this point in time.RIP Rockstar Games
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Now before you jump on me for not recommending this game I just wanna say that I do not recommend buying this game AT THE MOMENT. The things that makes Gta 5 one of the best games in the universe. Gta 5 is a flawless sandbox game where you can go around and do almost whatever you like in an enormous map. It's like they put you in another life where you can do whatever you like without being punished for it. You can just run down the street and punch someone in the face steal someone's car steal a chopper steal a jet go on a npc killing spree. There's almost no limit of what you can do.The online mode is what makes this game so extremely good (in my opinion). Just think of it doing this stuff i mentioned before but with friends! When you're playing gta online you get to create your own character and when you've done that you'll just have to clear the tutorial and after that you're free to join a server and do whatever you like! You can contact your friends and start a job to earn money and xp. If you got 4 friends one of them or you can start a little more difficult but well payed job called heists. The more you level up on gta the more jobs heists vehicles and weapons you unlock. Some annoying things in Gta but doesn't affect the game alot I know that this isn't something that can be helped but the loading in gta can be a real b!tch and the online might not be so fun without friends. The cloud servers are right now a little weird because they're sometimes preventing you or others from joining online. THE REASON WHY I DON'T RECOMMEND BUYING IT RIGHT NOW Rockstar had a problem where people who installed mods into gta got permanently banned even if they used the mods offline. In the latest patch rockstar tried to fix this issue (possibly) but the patch only made it worse.It's not why you couldn't install any mods in gta why I don't recommend this game now it's because of cheaters.There are ALOT of cheaters that have overflowed the gta online servers. These cheaters are ruining the gta online economy by spawning tons of money to other players on the server and they are also ruining the fun for alot of players by constantly killing them even if they're in passive mode (passive mode is a mode where you can't be killed by players) or not. It's almost impossible to report them aswell because they can hide themselves or their name and they can use other players name.Becuase of the cheaters all of the good things I meantioned above about jobs heists and fun gets thrown out the window because why would you wanna play a heist or a job now when you have a funk ton of money? You can buy every vehicle in the game when you're at a low level. You'll feel that you won't gain anything from doing heists and jobs because you already have everything you've wished for the jobs and heists will be completely pointless. Sure it may feel good at first but that happiness will not last long you'll get bored of the game almost right after you bought it. And that's why I don't recommend buying this game right now. Until rockstar has fixed this issue then I highly recommend this game!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player is GREAT multiplayer is also extremely fun but has a few issues. You'll find that most negative reviews are due to players experiencing hackers in the online game. This is what lead to the developers taking aggressive banning action and some players were falsely banned (even though they were not allegedly cheating).Despite these mistakes the devs are clearly making an active effort to improve the game state. However for multiplayer to work effectively there are many client side actions which are performed which makes cheating incredibly hard to spot with an automated system (hopefully not impossbile though). Despite what some say most online sessions you will join at least in EU will not contain a blatant hacker. This is not to say that hackers are a particularly rare occurence but it's not hard to quickly join a new session.The main reason I am writing this review is because of how positively astounded I was by the new FREE DLC. I first saw it advertised in the cinema and just couldn't believe it was available free. The new heists are challenging yet rewarding and the new vehicles are great fun. I highly encoruage you to grab a few mates and play through all three new heists together it's a great laugh.Overall then this game is a steal for the current sale price and I have no doubts that the developers will continue to support the game for free until a newer GTA comes out.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Product received for free. Best game for action and adventure
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer campaign is great and has a lot of content. Trevor is the best character ever he makes the story interesting and unpredictable and he has several comedic moments. I feel like Franklin lacked a bit of personality. He seems too calm and doesn't have that many moments of note spoilers until the end of the game /spoilers . Michael's temper drives the story forward and his relationship with his family is intriguing. The heists are fun and the game having multiple protagonists makes it feel like as if all of the responsibility isn't being shifted onto one character for heists setups and other missions.Online is good however it is a bit of a grind early on. I recommend you do Heists with a group of friends early on as it is very fun and gives you some good money. Once you develop a good way of making money freemode becomes fun as long as you don't get harassed much. The main problems I have with Online are just related to the grinding early in the game the hackers that you may encounter every so often (if you're in a full game you probably will have at least one however whether they use their hacks to annoy you or not depends) and the amount of trolls who just want to see you suffer and you need to use exploits to create a solo lobby so that you can enjoy freemode and make your money.I've noticed that a of of reviews ignore the singleplayer which is like the core of the game even if it isn't getting major updates anymore. Singleplayer totally makes up for the price if you have a bad Online experience.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Though I highly enjoyed it the Multiplayer is entirely too lackluster for me to enjoy anymore. I was going to see about modding single player to enjoy some of the more out there mods buuuuuuuut seeing as Take Two decided mods are bad I went ahead and uninstalled this dumpster fire.Edit Right so I figure I'd do a proper edit from my own experiences with this game.Pros GTA5 Single Player is a pretty great experience. It can be a bit jarring being switched between characters sometimes but overall the story is pretty solid. Though I vastly prefer GTA4's storyline and characters 5 does a nice job of a HEAT esque bank robbery story.Pretty stellar graphics and animations physics etc.Cons Pretty much everything about Online. All items are stupidly overpriced from your lowest jeans to the most expensive vehicles and buildings. It's like Rockstar is forcing you to buy their stupid shark cards so you don't have to suffer the grind and the grind is real.I don't know when GTA Online turned into Grand Saints Theft Row Auto 5 or whatever but a lot of the vehicles and "events" in the online portion of the game are hot garbage not to mention stupidly overpowered against people who don't have tens of millions of dollars or the time to grind out these absurd vehicles. Leave out all the flying DeLoreans and flying motorbikes and all of the rail guns etc and you'd have a solid Online experience if you don't mind grinding half your life away to make money to buy things.I personally find Free Roam vastly superior to any of the separate lobbies you need to be forced in to play missions i.e. Heists etc. Sure the nuance of "specific mission sets" is lost in Free Roam but when I spent most of my time playing GTA 4 you created your own fun and that was well the most fun I've had in an online GTA experience.To close I still don't recommend this game based upon the sheer amount of grinding time you need to dedicate toward making money along with the ridiculous and plain stupid vehicles you are able to purchase and the events you can partake in. If I wanted to play Saints Row I'd reinstall 3 and 4 and go nuts. GTA Online isn't the place for all of this stupidity. The Single Player is a good experience and I'd highly recommend checking it out but I'd avoid the Online unless you're a masochist and just enjoy the stupidity in which case this game is exactly for you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Actually you probably have more chance to get banned by running a third party program like Discord on overlay than any modder in this game.On top of that you CANNOT appeal your ban if that ever happens to you since Rockstar's customer services is worse than an Indian scamming anti virus software services.Luckilly I haven't gotten banned (yet) but I wouldn't even be surprised if my character ends up disappearing for no reason and wasting the ridiculous amount of time I spent on this trash.Update Now hackers can ERASE ALL YOUR MONEY without you knowing who did it and as usual Rockstar's support is so bad they won't give all the money you've grinded back. So there's literally no point in playing if all the time you spent grinding is just wasted by some random that you don't even know.Update 2 Not only did they took down a SINGLE PLAYER modding tool for absolutly no reason but they also suspended my account for a whole month because go figure. Well actually thank you very much for that now I'm free from this crap and I can finally spend my time on better games.Update 3 They actually lifted my ban probably because of a few kids who mass reported me because I said something snarky about them in chat or something. review: Game is fun and the story mode is incredible and well worth the money but this multiplayer is a disaster. Any modifications to the game result in a ban. I'm not entirely up to date on penalty but your first strike used to be a week. At this point it might be a character reset. By modifications I mean things such as FOV sliders or custom UIs that add a bit of flavor to the game. Hackers can give you money but if you are caught recieving the money (even if they force it onto you) you are at risk of ban. Rockstar has no appeal system so if you are wrongly banned it is over for you. One thing the multiplayer does correct is have no DLC that is necessary. Only money packs. Everything you see you can get easily by leveling up. An issue with this is balance though. All DLC weapons (which are free again) do not have a level requirement meaning level 1 players can have lock on rocket launchers and other explosives or assault rifles. In some situations the DLC stuff is better than actual weapons meaning level 1 players are only at the disadvantage of inexperience. Balance in vehicles is poor too and a huge issue. Destroying another players car means you have to pay their insurance which is sometimes very expensive. A large portion of players you encounter will fight you FROM their car. This puts you at risk of destroying the car and having to pay a large sum of money for destroying the car and it could also put you in the bad behavior pool of players or risk you losing your good sport money bonus. Another issue is how fragile heists are. They require a lot of setup and are actually very fun but it is too hard to be able to rely on randoms or even friends. Usually you get one life so one teammate can die but if you play on hard if a single teammate dies the heist mission is over. Also random disconnects from the very poor servers can end a heist and send you back to square one on your mission. Heists are though once you get past the mechanics. Servers are terrible too. Randomly when playing it will say every player has disconnected or something alone those lines. You will then have to find a new server or try to find remember someones name to rejoin the same session. Playing with friends is very hard as servers are usually "full" (even though they are usually 8 or so under the limit) because people loading in that take awhile take up a slot and will usually end up not even getting into the game! Buy Grand Theft Auto V if you are looking for a great story game but if you want a free roam multiplayer experience this game is not designed well enough to function and not have you pulling your hair out.

review: To make things clear I like gta V. Hell I nearly have 2000 hours on it making my total playtime over 2 and 1/2 months. My "beef" is the multiplayer and the practices of the company who made it. Online mode started out fine it added content with DLC that was managable. Anyone could get the things in it. Then the first time they said "F**k you!" to the fans. That was when they added the gold helicoptor for 5000000 and the gold plane for 10000000. Nobody could get that unless they hacked or paid for ingame money which is the reason they do this. For the last year and more all DLCs did was add some clothes for regular people then things that costs so much money that it's nearly impossible to get it without hacking or buying ingame money.Now with singleplayer I play singleplayer almost exclusively now due to the reasons listed above and it gets more and more obvious that Rockstar doesn't care about singleplayer. At first when DLCs came a lot of the content was added to singleplayer as well that would be the vehicles the guns and some more. For over a year now they have not added anything to singleplayer.And the lies Rockstar said before the game came out on any platform that their would be singleplayer expansions. They said it after it was released as well and they said it again after that and they keep saying it. They said that it would already be out far before now. But nothing. No singleplayer DLC because Rockstar thinks it can milk more money out of little kids stealing daddys credit card to buy ingame money then to actualy bring an expansion that the fans would pay for to play new missions of GTA V's amazing singleplayer.TLDR Unless you only want it for singleplayer or are a hacker who knows how you wont get banned or are extremely rich and you are willing to sink a f**kton of money into anything then DON'T BUY THIS GAME.If they add a good singleplayer DLC or addon then I will happily change my review.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Removing mods was a mistake. Take Two ed up big time and the overwhelmingly negative on the recent reviews is proof that they messed up. The singleplayer mode when the campaign is over (and sometimes even while the campaign is in progress) is pointless and gets boring really fast. I wasn't a big fan on online mode since I saw it as nothing but a pointless grind sure the heist update was fun but that was probably one of the best updates for online if not the best update for online. And that was over 2 years ago. There was no reason to remove mods Take Two. I'm ashamed the way that Take Two limits users people just want to have fun with mods I would understand banning mods on online mode there is no doubt about that. But singleplayer? Really? Why? Thanks for freeing my hard drive of 70 gigs I needed it )
