Let's break it down Pros The game mechanics and physics are improved with each iteration of GTA They've created a whole bunch of neat add ons tons of weapons to choose fromCons Heists are fun but you can never finish them because one person always quits before you're done Community is toxic Modders violate your game experience You are often not paired with people who speak your own language (Not conducive to completing missions) You can get blocked from playing altogether by moddersEdit They've added all new gameplay all of which is ruined by modders who destroy you with the most minor of teenage rage plus your co op experience is now ruined by both Russian and Chinese gamers who probably didn't even pay for the game you busted your balls for. You need to grind for dosh like it's your job plus the drive from most of the base locations is longer than my daily commute TO MY ACTUAL ING JOB.Final note from Rockstar you fans! We're going to ruin Red Dead Redemption 2!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Two years of waiting since the console release GTA V has arrived on PC and it is spectacular. I wasn't sure what to expect when I hopped onto this game since I haven't touch anything from the series since San Andreas but I have no qualms about the direction the game has taken. The story is amazing three different dudes with a singular interconnected storyline that involves the three of them together as well as smaller subplots to each character. Each character follows a story that involves some major character development along the way. The writing in the characters are solid too each has their unique origins opinions everything! Supporting characters to side quests (labelled as Strangers and Freaks in game) are pretty nicely done too ranging from the bumbling papparazzi photographer Beverly to Cletus the roadkill obsessed redneck to the toking libertarian Barry most have rather unusual requests but entertaining. The addition of random events occuring in the game helps spice up the mood a little you can intercept a robbery help as the escape driver to one escort party goers home etc.Heists are the big game in this title the three main characters storylines usually converge on large scale heists (stealing a nuke from a private military group for one) that involve pre planning and setup missions with both loud or quiet options and additional crew members that affect how the heist goes. Both quiet or loud options have different approaches and crew members required both are quite eventful in terms of action pretty much none of the missions in the last few games can top the kind of action and writing put into these. Each heist pays out a rather large sum of money which can be spent upon completion of the heists this is by far the best way to earn money in the game. Music in the game is fantastic they have a rock and pop channel that just literally gives me the greatest nostalgic feelings the more modern channels also have excellent electronic music rap and a channel for classic rap too!! There's also a channel for country music... if you're into that sort of thing. The graphics on this game are simply amazing the way the characters and objects move the physics of moving vehicles textures on objects not to mention the optimization is pretty well tuned. As of writing this review I'm using an Nvidia GTS 450 and the game runs medium graphics at a decent FPS rate of 50 and it doesn't look terrible. The return to and remodelling of Los Santos was one of the things I liked the most about this game you see a lot of features around the place that remind you of GTA SA and I think that's great. You can also trip out on peyote and become a cat that's neat.Customization for guns and cars are pretty much the same from last time though save for the addition of camos for guns and few miscellaneous options for cars maybe a little better but not a radical change from the last game I played. Clothing customizations are pretty neat too each character has access to the common clothes that all three of them can wear and other clothing items that are unique to them. Hairstyles and beards are a little lacking each character has about &lt 5 to pick from at each barber unlike the vast variety of options applicable to CJ ala San Andreas. Earning money is a little scarce outside of heists most missions don't even award you with anything beyond storyline progression (a measly reward occassionally) and opening up other side quests. Options to earn money from activities outside the story are few and far in between and don't dish out a whole lot. GTA Online's integration into the game was a big thing everyone looked forward to. The introduction is pretty cool you begin customizing your character in a lockup get released from prison and fly into Los Santos meet "YUH BOY L D" get thrown into a sedan class race and at the conclusion of the race you are allowed to keep whatever car you ended the race in however there are probably other better options available to steal to make your own. You may also purchase high end cars and other expensive cars through the phone's online browser too and there are a wide variety to pick from. The heists in GTA Online require more complicated setups but the finales are more run and guns than the heists in the story something I find a bit disappointing also they all end up loud so the stealth feature/skill is pretty much useless. The payouts for the heists are rather substantial (items in Online are double the price they are in the story however) and unlock a variety of items to use in free roam and other missions. However all this aside unless you are performing activities or heists with friends there isn't much else to do in Online's free roam besides waging war on random players the police or robbing convenience stores. Heists also have little to no other checkpoints beyond a checkpoint right outside the objective location which you will spawn at when you fail and restart. Heists will also fail immediately if a player disconnects/dies at any point of a heist leading to the cancellation of the heist altogether. One of the most frustrating features while on a heist is the fact that teammates can hurt and kill each other leaving griefing a very real option. I think the kicker for this all is that half the time you spend on GTA Online will be staring at a loading screen.TL DRGTA V has an amazing story features music and graphics.You can get high and turn into random animals.Side quests are pretty interesting and unique.GTA Online gets old after a while maybe really quick.Not much else interesting to do on GTA Online besides heists races and some PVP activities.Integration of Rockstar Social Club isn't as annoying as I last remember.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So after playing the video game (of which i picked up on the steam summer sale but I digress) I have to say in my honest objectionally fact opinion that I don't see the appeal and I'm positive that everyone will agree that I am not in the minority. After extensive research and constant playthroughs I have gathered evidence of why this is a lackluster video game and not the game of which the legacy speaks for itself allegedly. I have conducted numerous points to maintain a simplified review.Story Lacks the ability to maintain a coherent plot. Characters lack any passion and also one of which is of the african american descent. Dialogue is appalling. Most of the missions are filler. Most of the missions aren't fun and not to mention that they have nothing to do with the story. The story is a mess and mostly uses pop culture references to justify rockstars lack of storytelling. Mass fanbase praises the game to cover up the fact that it is in all honesty a Mediocre video game. Rockstar uses the online feature as damage control.Online A buggy and glitchy mess. Unnecessary loading screens. Terrible server security. Mass amounts of hackers with no repercussions. Boring if you're alone. Awful character creation system. A lot of filler. Horrible community. Heists are pointless. Microtransactions which basically makes earning money (from illegal or legal activities) obsolete. Missions/Jobs are even more pointless than story mode. Just an appalling experience overall even with friends. Most of the time playing is wasted and doesn't impact you in any way. (compared to a game with a compelling story) Would not recommend.As for pros go I honestly couldn't put any together in my unbiased research. Lets face the facts and agree to a degree that this is a mediocre video game and that is just putting it modestly.0/10 would not recommend. (from a video game enthusiast)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've owned this game for a long time. About a month ago (Jan 2017) I picked the game up again. I loved the Online play and the game in general. Periodically you have to leave online lobbies because of modders teleporting you and just abusing you in general.I find out (feb 2017) ive been wiped and my character removed. 400+ hours of work and 150 levels who knows how much oney all gone. From what I've read theres no recourse to appeal since mid 2016. My ticket was closed instantly with a generic response.Lost my most expensive/fun game due to an algorithm. Super frustrating.Buy for the story if you want but not for the online.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The only reason you should consider buying this should be for the single player experience but even then 60 bucks is asking too much. You are probably better off just watching a playthrough of it on youtube.If you are buying it for the multiplayer experience you are probably going to be severely disappointed.The concept of multiplayer is that you grind as much money as you can by doing jobs PvP races or just by messing around. Unfortunately these tasks do not award a lot of money. You are going to have to rely on a friend to carry you through some of the activities in the game otherwise you will never reach a point where you can stand on your own within a sane amount of time. Unless of course you buy a Shark Card. Shark Cards are basically "boosters" that give you a bit of in game cash. They are pretty expensive but you don't *need* them to progress in the game but unfortunately Rockstar uses every excuse to force the Shark Card business model into the game and down your throat. The cash you get from jobs heists activities races and free roam just isn't enough for a new player to get started. You're going to need things like Facilities Motorcycle Clubs or Warehouses to make any real money in the game and unfortunately the game is set up in a way that if you start these CEO activities other players can join in and try to steal it from you and you can easily lose half a million dollars and you can't do these activities unless you are in a PUBLIC lobby (but you can do it if you're alone in one).Speaking of lobbies it's nearly impossible to find a session without tryhard cuᥒts. And if it's not the tryhards thats ruining it it's the modders who will get you banned for playing the game legitimately by forcing you to pick up trillions of dollars and other things.Speaking of bans Rockstar falsely banned literally thousands on march 23th including me and someone I played with because of a flaw in their anti cheat. As of march 31th they have made no statements no apologies and no attempts at rectifying their mistakes. Some people were unbanned but many of them were then later re banned and still are. They give you NO option to appeal your bans all bans are permanent and final even if you are innocent and Rockstar can get away with this because everyone agreed to their EULA that states that they can "suspend anyone for any reason or for no reason at all" if they so choose.tl dr Singleplayer is ok Shark Cards are being shoved down your throat you can't be safe in public games because of hackers the community is full of tryhard ғucks who fly around in their jets and kill everyone they see the grind is unbearable without friends and you'll get banned for no reason with no chance to appeal because lmao bans are final. Ғuck Rockstar and ғuck everyone thinks this mess is acceptable.

review: This game is overhyped. The single player is alright but the multiplayer is just one big mess. Every decision that Rockstar makes about multiplayer is predicated on trying to get you to buy Shark Cards. Shark Cards give you in game money in return for real world cash. It is very VERY difficult to make much money in the game without throwing real world money at the game. And to top it all off if you DO put in the work to make the money Rockstar will sometimes simply suspend your account and reset your character for no good reason denying you any recourse. "All bans are final and cannot be appealed".

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game...I've played it a ton and I've had fun I've met nice people as well.This would be an absolute favorite if only it wasn't for the community. It seems like every session has those pesky hackers/modders or whatever and nearly everyone in freeroam is just hostile for no apparent reason. I'm fine with fights in the game as long as it's for a valid reason but I just can't understand people who shoot everything they see.Getting money in online is a problem as well it's just grindy. You know unless some modder decides to drop everyone money which has a chance to ban people anyway. About the bans as well I haven't experienced it myself but I've heard that a lot of people are getting banned for no reason at all and Rockstar won't even give them a reason for it. Their support won't even help with removing a ban because their system is just great and never makes mistakes and whatnot. Yeah right.Then what's actually good about the game. Well for starters the graphics are amazing and the storyline is quite enjoyable. The game also has a wide selection of vehicles including a ton of cars and customization for them helicopters boats planes and some military vehicles like tanks and jet fighters which we'll probably be getting more of in an upcoming DLC (the DLC itself is free to download). You can also buy a yacht in online for the low low price of 6 million dollars and up but it can't be controlled other than paying to move it to a preset location.Overall I like the game. I've played it for hundreds of hours which should prove that I've enjoyed playing it. The only real flaw is yet again the community. I just can't bring myself to give the game a positive rating with the modder situation there are so many of them and they'll never completely disappear but at the moment the situation is very bad. I'll probably keep playing though so don't be too surprised if you see that I've played it lately.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Deliveryman simulator
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Having played on Xbox 360 and now on PC I enjoy the game especially the singleplayer story. Modding the singleplayer can make it even better. But in order to continue selling their Shark Cards they focus on Online and don't release DLC or other content for their great singleplayer which a lot of us would love.The multiplayer is fun if you have a few friends to play with all the time but if you have to play with randoms I wouldn't bother the public sessions are filled with cheaters that they can't seem to put in protections to prevent without tons of DRM stuff that also hurts and slows down legitimate players. And while I'm talking about online the price of buying almost anything is insane you earn next to nothing for missions and have to grind for hours to legitimately buy most interesting things I understand they want to sell their "micro" transaction Shark cards but it's quite ridiculous considering even the highest one will only buy you 2 or 3 of the most recent things for it's insane price. If they were to add an option to host a personal/private or LAN server where we could enable mods and enjoy the game with friends it would be much better even with the insane economy because again we could mod it to reasonable levels.And now let's come back around to the modding recently Take Two shutdown OpenIV a popular editor and manager for GTA mods. Sending the developers a Cease and Desist letter stating that OpenIV "allow third parties to defeat security features of its software and modify that software in violation Take Two's rights". Ignoring the fact that mods are typically made for singleplayer and serve almost no purpose online trainers should be their issue if anything not our singleplayer mods. And they should be able to patch their game to prevent some of the very easy to do hacks.While I may play with friends still occasionally and may finally complete the story again I will not be buying anymore Rockstar or Take Two games for the forseeable future.So long and thanks for all the long hours of grinding in order to get the fish Take Two and Rockstar.

review: Product received for free. EDIT It's truly depressing to see how far Rockstar and Take Two have fallen. The business practices used in recent years culminating in the alienation of the modding community are simply despicable. Until both companies get back in touch with their fan base I will no longer be supporting them.Did you want a game with a story as great as the story of Grand Theft Auto IV?Did you want an open world as fun as the world of all previous Grand Theft Auto games?Did you expect Rockstar to release a game that blew everyone away with the quality it displayed?Well don't look here. While not a bad game by any means Grand Theft Auto V falls short of my expectations. As someone who grew up with San Andreas and IV I hoped for a game that I could sink thousands of hours into like I did with the mentioned titles. Unfortunately this was not the game that I wanted.The story while creative with three different protagonists fell short for me. While previous games had upwards of 90 missions in them V only has 69. This would be fine if they were all of a higher quality however to me they are not. For a story based on heists of various kinds there are only a handful of them. One of these heists boasts a staggering payout of $0. Yes $0. Maybe my playthroughs were bugged but I didn't get paid at all for the majority of the missions.Overall the gameplay feels like a downgrade. While I like the highly improved driving the gunplay feels terrible compared to games like Grand Theft Auto IV and Max Payne 3. The ragdolls also seem worse than the aforementioned titles. I seem to be a minority with this opinion so your mileage may vary.Grand Theft Auto V isn't so much the focus of Rockstar Games so much as Grand Theft Auto Online is. If you like spending all of your free time for weeks to buy one car then this is the game for you. This is assuming that you don't quit before the loading screen decides to end. Where does the developer ruin it here you ask? Well once you get into the game you had better pray to whatever deity you do or don't believe in because one of two things is about to happen. If you're lucky you will run into a friendly hacker who just does his own thing or a hacker who just likes killing you sometimes in surprisingly creative ways. If fortune hates you you will run into a hacker who wants to give you money. This is bad. If you pick it up you can probably expect to be banned. Yes you not the hacker. Why? Who knows.Openly state you're a hacker with your 1337 Hacker crew name logo and members? Cool.Pick up a hacked $5? Banned.In conclusion a game with a great open world great graphics and a great premise is brought down by some strange decisions. Exercise caution both with your gameplay and your wallet.6/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The story mode is great and highly recommended. You can checkout a professional review from IGN if you wanna know how it is. The graphics are solid and the mechanics are realistic. If you're buying for the story mode then go ahead and buy this game.The online is really horrible and downright disgusting.1) R* doesn't have its own servers. So one person effectively becomes a server which is not ideal. The loading times are too damn long. Be prepared to spend 5 7 minutes/hour watching the game load which is too long. If not for reddit I wouldn't have ever played online.2) This is the main point of GTA Online's review. The objective is not to have fun among the community. There are tons of fun game modes which are incredible to play but nobody plays them. The community is busy "Grinding" away hours doing mundane tasks to earn money to buy stuff like flying cars and tanks which they won't have the time to use because they will be grinding for the next thing. R* is encouraging this by introducing the Shark Card system where people can pay to avoid grinding to get their fancy stuff. This has also created a huge market for modders who hack the system to make millions in game making the game really unfair to the honest. Why should we pay money for a pay to win game ? What's the point of a pay to win game ? What's the point of playing video games if you are not having fun ?GTA Online is not fun and not worth playing. It's nice to have those insane cars but at the end of the day it didn't make me happy and have quit playing it. I just started some other interesting games and i'm happy.

review: The game itself is pretty fun but they've recently destroyed the modding community for both online and offline play. The new content they add is only accessible online which wouldn't be the worst thing ever but it is locked behind insane prices that would require hours of tedious grinding if you wanted to gather up enough funds. ...or you know you can buy Sharkcards and get a fraction of the content that they put out. For $100 you would get 8 million in game currency which won't even get you very far. You might be able to get a few of the vehicles or the special facilities that they seem to keep locking content behind. To put things into perspective 8 million in game currency isn't even enough to buy the most expensive yacht in the game and the yachts don't really even do that much for you. So Rockstar seems to think that their virtual yacht (you can't even drive it) is worth over 100 dollars.

I tried to contact the support their support is even worse when I realised I was arguing with bots trying to explain them that I never cheated or did anything to violate their terms.I absolutely do not recommend this or any of their product because of their terrible support and feedback to their customers paid 60 euros for a ban I never deserved while the servers are crawling with hackers or expoiters not to mention psn servers....Although the game itself is pretty damn good with free dlcs and updates in online great story in single player and lots of stuff to do online. Forgot to mention that you have to spend a lot of time looking at the loading screen while playing GTA online.I would rate this 9/10 but getting me a perma ban without actually doing anything and their feedback are bots that respond with the same answer everytime I will rate this 1/10 due to their support. review: Single player is a solid 4 out of 5 and if the game is actually on sale (unlike the current Summer shadiness) it's worth it for that if you're a fan of the series.Online is actually getting worse over time. Adding free DLC is nice but not fixing the base issues with the game has resulted in an awful experience. Huge loading times tons of lag memory leaks unstable GPU performance every race having global records set by hackers and now it's all but impossible to find a public lobby without hackers in it. Especially infuriating is that every 3rd mission online for me fails to reconnect afterwards leading to a long exit load then a single player load then online load again taking several minutes just in loading screens.Given how these problems persist and in some cases are actually getting worse I'm doubtful R* is even going to bother fixing them and instead focus on their next title. For a game that's done a billion dollars in sales that's pretty disappointing.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 3rd/1st person game with huge open sandbox world where you drive shoot and cause havoc among other things.To start it off I will say that this time around map size has increased by A LOT compared to previous games. Game world feels more alive (at least in Story mode) with pedestrians people in traffic airplanes helicopters etc. going through their daily routes and assigned tasks. Every location you visit is populated by set number of active NPC's that talk to each other interact with environment or even with you when you pass them by. Be it simple sidewalk with random pedestrians lifeguard station near the beach or sawmill by the forest far away from the city. Basically game has everything from it's predecessors and much more added on top. Like always there are many different kind of ground water and air vehicles in the game that you can either steal or buy from "internet" in game. Clothing stores where you can buy outfits for your characters either in Story or Online. Same goes for barber that can change your hairstyle and some face features.Story follows three main characters who will interact with one another more as game goes on with their own set of problems their own unique personalities background and skills. You can freely switch between them play through their specific story or side missions take part in activities change their clothing visit barber browse in game "internet" and more. Each of them have their own safe house vehicle amount of money number of friends and/or enemies one even has a dog who likes to leave big piles of dung everywhere.In GTA5 you are back in Los Santos an "island" if you will. But this time around you have more than a city to play in. Game has different regions you can visit from busy city streets and suburbs airport ship port army base to desert country land with farms mountain areas with forests lakes rivers and much more. You can also explore the underwater around the island and lakes in submarine or "on foot" meet some hikers while on bike ride in mountains walk down the beach and take a ride on a jetski or take awkward yoga classes with your wife watch movie in theatre play tennis darts or golf game etc. Those are only few of the things you can do in game.Once in a while you will stumble on events like person being mugged for money someone stealing a vehicle police chasing some criminals couple drunk guys needing a lift crashed car on the freeway with people in need of help etc. And you can choose to help them drive past or watch to see what will happen. Small things like that really bring life to the game.Environments are filled with a lot of interactable objects miscellaneous props and going through a back alley in a car chased by police feels mighty satisfying when you go through pile of trash cans fences and such. World is filled not only with people but also some variety of wildlife and domestic animals be it simple dogs cats or rats on the street to deer's mountain lions birds cows chickens pigs whales dolphins sharks etc. You can even hunt wildlife and get paid for it. Sadly animals are somewhat limited to Story mode and not that easy to come by in Online.Game looks good up close with good texture quality and rich environment detail. But lacks detail past few dozen meters objects look blurred distant detail is very poor even on highest settings. Character model quality is good only on main story characters and isn't that good on random pedestrians and 2nd grade characters. Facial animation is strong in cut scenes and somewhat weak outside of them. Detail on vehicles and vehicle damage is great though sometimes you wonder how it can still drive after you "shaved the train" couple dozen times and you barely can tell what car looked like brand new.Apart from Story mode you can play Online mode in either private / friend or public lobby. You start off by creating your character join crew do missions versus PVP games races in land air or water vehicles activities like darts golf tennis and much more similar to Story mode but hand crafted for Online and up to 30 people. Everything you do will grant you experience cash and increase your skills depending on what you do. Higher your level the more stuff you unlock the more jobs and missions become available to you. You earn money you buy and modify cars you purchase living quarters or garage when you get bored from driving you can buy airplanes or choppers to rain havoc from air or simply take a break from madness on the ground high above the skies but remember you're never safe from a guided missile even if it's from a friend. Main attraction in Online mode is Heists where you do series of setup jobs in 4 player team that leads to a finale mission that will reward everyone with decent amount of cash. Currently there are five available Heists with each following different kind of crime with different set of characters and increasing amount of paycheck.Personally I had a lot of fun in Online mode some enjoyable moments in Story mode and around 200 hours of playtime so far. And I'm still not completely done with it though I'm struggling because you will get bored eventually. Apart from some personal issues with how game looks in distance and other minor complaints this game is very well optimized runs great on PC with recommended system requirements looks good and is fun to play. Enjoy.

review: I'm not covering the story mode in this review because majority of us bought this for the online anyway.PC version itself runs smooth I can get a solid 60FPS for the most part and the occasional drop to 40 50FPS. I have only had three issues with it so far which is the random crashes the game randomly alt+tabbing to the desktop and the game randomly going into windowed mode.The community in this game is a joke its full of mic spamming children telling us about there minecraft tutorials Hackers that spawn in all sort of vehicles into different game modes and griefers who come in and ruin heists or leave in the middle of one. Speaking of heists if you up once that's it... call it gg because either someone is going to leave or the rest of crew won't take you seriously the host will try to give you like 10% cut of the final heist cut which is pretty cancer.The hacking situation is pretty bad at the moment the only way I can explain it is this... DayZ Mod the very first few months before the introduction of private hives a hacker on every server. Barely anything is being done about them either which is pretty weird of Rockstar because in Max Payne 3 Multiplayer you didn't get banned you got paired up with other cheaters. Why can't this system be put in place here as well but instead its a slap in the wrist and only a temp ban of a few weeks. Its quite funny &amp sad to see people announcing how badass they are because they can spawn all this in or my personal favorite is when they "Take over Los Santos customs."One other thing that ticks me off is these money cards nonsense I mean why pay that amount of money for a game and say "nah you no wat m8 fu*k it my buying loads of in game money" get a grip of yourself'sNice try Rockstar with the summer sale scandal keep that sh!t up and you will end up with an EA reputationOverall I feel like I'm forcing my way to play this just so i can get my moneys worth I do enjoy the heists when you have a good crew and survival/races is enjoyable to but theirs more than enough room for improvement.

She got unbanned recently and WHILE creating her new online character she got Permanently banned... how's that for fair?EDIT Still banned..
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A great game we like to hateI really enjoy playing GTA V I have been playing it since 2013 on my Xbox 360 and have more than 1000 hours on the PC version alone. Back in 2013 GTA V did nothing wrong it was the perfect game. But since then many people began to see its flaws and eventually the downfall of GTA Online.Story ModeThe story mode in GTA V is quite enjoyable I liked the 3 characters but I know many others didn't. Being able to switch between characters is a cool idea and in this case well executed. It added a lot of depth and made the world seem more alive than ever. While driving all sorts of different cars you would see airplanes flying citizens walking around and talking to each other random events triggering and a lot more.But it's not all good and fun almost all of the story missions are heavily scripted making it much less enjoyable on your second playthrough but also eliminating frustrating moments like that damned train in GTA San Andreas Exchange from GTA III or the final mission of GTA Vice City. All these scripted moments look incredibly cool but once you notice they are all scripted and realize that Rockstar is holding your hand through the entire game it will become boring and stale really fast.The story is kind of all over the place and full with lucky coincidences and it doesn't have the rags to riches feel. The main characters are all well done in my opinion as always is the voice acting is done well. The map is not as big as in GTA San Andreas but it is more detailed and filled.OnlineGTA Online was and still kind of is a great addition. It makes it possible to play GTA V with up to 32 players. Unlike GTA IV there is a money system. Almost everything costs money I thought it was a great idea. Keep people playing for more cars planes houses etc but since 2015 the prices began to rise.Everything became expensive to make people buy microtransactions to buy money with money (Shark Cards). People started grinding heists to earn as much money as possible. Hackers started invading online lobbies making it hard to find friendly people. If you were AFK for 10 minutes or something a hacker would come by and give you loads of money and the next day you would get banned for getting too much money in a certain amount of time...Now we're at a point where the most expensive car is almost 3 million GTA$ and yachts that can cost 10 million GTA$ (More than 80 euro's in Shark Cards). People flying with bikes and cars randomly killing players. An orbital cannon that can instakill someone if you're willing to pay a hefty price.Rockstar still adds random vehicles new game modes and clothing items to the game. It's still a lot of fun to mess around in GTA Online but try to stay out of public lobbies.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR Take Two their CEO Strauss Zelnick and his "undermonetization". their profits and them for ing with the modding community. Note not the hacking community which they've done nothing to the modding community.I've paid for this game twice over having bought it for the original 360 release and then again when it came to PC preordering the PC version in fact. I adore this game's singleplayer and had hours upon hours of fun in the multiplayer.And then Online started to go down the . As of the last Online update Rockstar (and Take Two who are the real culprits here pushing for more profits the is actively ing over legitimate players and claiming to be helping them. You recieved modded money because a hacker came in your lobby? Well there goes all of your money. Wanna grind out the painfully boring CEO and bikie missions so you can buy the new bunkers? Lol we just gave every griefer and hacker the ability to buy a SEMIAUTO RAILGUN. Oh I'll just use solo sess NO YOU WON'T YOU HAVE TO DO THIS IS PUBLIC LOBBIES BUY OUR SHARK CARDS INSTEAD.I WANT to enjoy Online but there's no point anymore. All the new content is expensive and just pushing Shark Card purchases griefers have more ways to you up than ever let alone hackers and some of the new content is just ing stupid and doesn't fit in a GTA game! Looking at you jetbike.And then after ALL OF THIS Rockstar/Take2 have the ing GALL to take away the last bastion of fun. Modding.Modding is one of the cornerstones of PC gaming and allows a dedicated passionate community to keep a game going long after it's no longer supported as well as well mod! And it's not just PC gamers now with recent Bethesda games console players are starting to like the idea as well.Of course... that would draw people away from the Online. It would hurt Take2's profits. So they've given OpenIV the tool that is the backbone of Singleplayer modding a Cease and Desist. Note this does NOTHING to affect hackers they don't use OpenIV they have other methods. The devs know this.I hardly have to say anything else the ing disgusting nature of this new development speaks for itself.

review: Introduction I have been a fan of this game since the day it launched on 17 Sep. 2013! More than 2 years ago. got the midnight release of the game on the PS3 and when i launched it for the first time seeing the amazing epilouge i thought NOTHING could possibly outclass this game many games were released after non lived up to this game and gaming for me turned into gta. either i am playing gta v or not gaming at all. Year after Came the Release of then next gen came.. that trailer and adding first person view! rockstar is outclassing themselves because apparently no one can so i got it on the PS4 and now was certain that gta v REMASTERED won't be outclassed.and funny enough about 6 months later! the PC version came out. ( i got it in the last sale to be fair) but with the MODS and the 60 FPS and the beautiful Editor.. i think now NOTHING can outclass gtav. (prove me wrong please rockstar) The Pro You have not one not two BUT three main characters each with his own unique personality family and basically LIFE.everchanging world with extreme depth to it from wildrness to urban to the desert life to the ClassyCity. you can do literally anything in this city! wanna get all the cops on you while an epic shootout with your BFF driving your car and other friend with an plane covering you all? or you just want to drive a tank? break in into the most secured place in history of gta. alone with IRL friends or ingame buddies. you are in for a treator you wanna do some Deathmatches or try your new purchased Car in some illegel street racingahhh it's midnight and you need to rest. go into your own house mansion apartment and chill with either a friend a dog or preferably a stripper...i mean a lady friend.and there is MODS. basically..if you can think it it's there. Cons On all 3 versions of the game. ROCKSTAR SERVERS. just..UGH.specifically on the PC version the always online Kinda DRM is killing me alive. please rockstar from a really really loyal fan do something about this. tho their support on forums or emails are amazing.rating GtaV 10. it has it's own class like i said
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Buy this game if youLike Crime Spending hundreds of hours of your life grinding for enough cash to purchase cars which you think look remotely cool (because the prices are inflated as and the only other way is to shell out another $100 for Shark Cards) only for you to realize that they don't really mean anything and are only a little bit faster than other cars. Getting banned right after you acquire that spanking new car for no apparent reason. Getting stonewalled by Rockstar's support system which stinks more than a pile of created by 600 cows with hemorrhoids. Every ticket is replied to by a bot with the same copy and paste answer. The answer doesn't tell you why you get banned but it does list every single reason why you COULD get banned. Calling customer support who are very friendly and helpful until you tell them that you got banned for no reason to which they instantly start reading the same copy and paste message which they must have memorized.Honestly I enjoyed the game while I could play. Even the grinding was enjoyable (if you do vehicle warehouse) but all of that gets on by Rockstar's crappy policies. As you can see with all the other negative reviews Rockstar's flagging system is and false positives are very possible if not common. This wouldn't be that big of a problem if they didn't insist that all these bans cannot be repealed and erase your character data at the end of the ban AND if they had a competant customer support system that actually took the time to check if their bans were legitimate.Edit Bought a $7 key off of some dude on Ebay do that instead of giving Rockstar anymore money.

review: This game would very easily be in the positives on steam if the issues it had weren't so glaring modders are quite rampant with a 50/50 chance of getting atleast one in each session. Many of these modders are quite obvious leaving you to wonder how they haven't been banned for example you will often run into people over level 500 which might be plausible if you've played since day one on console but frequently you will see levels surely not reached in a legitamate manner. Meanwhile if you are banned at all Rockstar rather than properly fixing the damage will completely reset your character while this may be apt for malicious modders considering they can get innocent people banned it's quite bad. In addition to that rockstar also refuses to dispute any bans and will instantly close support tickets with copy paste replies(which is pretty much most of their support).Lack of dedicated servers also allows for most of the mayhem commited by modders and even some bad actors being able to grab your IP(if they're the host) and either attempt to scare or DDoS you.Once you get past all of this including maybe the tryhard who will shoot himself before he lets you kill him or the oppressor repeatedly throwing missiles in your direction unless you have friends to play with you experience is much more difficult. Certain aspects force having other people such as selling stock from a buissness(if you want the most cash) or completing any heist.There is genuinely good content released in the updates but more and more it feels superficial to extend playtimes or purchase currency with extremely expensive operations or vehicles being sold with added modifications that can easily rack up millions of dollars extra.Compared to the first updates things have definitely risen greatly in price and time investment.The in game advertisement is also extremely annoying adding to the feeling above you will have characters calling you or messaging you regularly telling to invest in the latest update's additions with little option to disable it other to turn your ringer on silent but still have the phone GUI pop up on your screen.The only other thing I can think of is the world feels quite dull after a while its grand and very detailed but there's a lack of actual interaction. Every NPC you see almost always has the same reaction of fear disdain and eventually running away. Almost none of the buildings you see are enterable other than things like gun convenience and clothing stores. Rockstar has the interiors for some buildings that can be seen in the story and cutscenes but has never actually sewn them into online.The game is still enjoyable singleplayer is definitely worth it especially when the game sales to 15$ the game is always an excellent piece of social commentary and the work put into it can't simply be denied it just certainly feels like the direction is changed especially with RDR2 online looking to be a very cash focused outlet I would expect this to be the last good Rockstar online experience.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA five is an excellent game not the best but still rather good.The story is engaging and lasts for quite some time.However that isnt why this is a negative review it is a negative review because of the god awful multiplayer.Sure it is great fun to just muck about with your mates for a few hours but if you want to do anything that you see in the trailers (The DeLorean Import Export cars ect.) you'll need money thats expected but with the introcuction of "Shark Cards" a few months if not a year or two back everything is alot more expensive so unless you are willing to grind for hours on end (I've personally done nearly 40 hours of grinding) the only option is to buy ingame money with real money this is something normally seen in free to play mobile games where it is understandable because the game was free.This is a full price game that is almost 5 years old ill say that again. This game was released in 2013 and still costs $60.(This is the second time ive bought the game it bought it on the 360 when it came out but my xbox acc broke so no multiplayer)This brings me neatly onto the state of GTA Online servers you cannot connect to the online 3/4 of the time for example today I tried for 2 hours to connect to GTA online all to no avail it takes 6 minutes when it does work and when it doesn't with no retry connection option at the end.The DRM (Social Club) is AIDS you have to sign in twice (once when you start the game and again when you are loading the game. This is why Piracy is still a thing not for the cost but to avoid the often broken DRM. Sure its illegal but the odds of you getting caught are far outweighed by the convenience of not having the stupid broken as all hell DRM.If you want to play a multiplayer GTA game try GTASAMP its a mod for the best GTA game that adds in multiplayer that is free to play with more than one server and hundreds of different gamemodes. Most importantly it is fairly priced as in the cost of things matches income unlike GTA Online.I rest my case.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you're getting this game just for the singleplayer great go for it it's a lot of fun. Just make sure you get it on sale. There's no way a game released in 2013 should cost you $60.Multiplayer however is a mixed bag with the biggest issue being matchmaking. There is no server list or a proper menu from which you select immidiatelly what you want to play. Instead you have to start the game wait for it to load the city to put you in a random lobby and only then from your in game phone you can browse for games (which is a cumbersome proccess of its own).Now just hope that the lobby you joined isn't empty doesn't have players who aren't trying to kill you or hackers who can get your account falsely banned because you were both in the same session.As for the actual multiplayer gameplay I'll start off by saying that if you don't have a buddy (or three) to play with you won't have a good time. Most co op missions require a minimum of 4 players and by the time you finally find 3 random people to play a mission with and one of them leaves that's it the mission fails. That's one of the most flawed game mechanics I have ever seen sometimes it's just a momentarliy bad connection and not the player's fault. Combine that with atrocious loading times (up to 2 minutes per loading screen and there's a lot of them) and you got yourself a disaster not a fun co op experience.Surprisingly the PvP game modes are where most of the fun is at but honestly when the game is 10% fun 40% loading screens and 50% frustration I don't see why even bother.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I both love this game and hate it beyond recognition.Things good about this game Single player is MASSIVE the game has hundreds of hours of content to explore collect and participate with an impressive story. The world is massive with a giant city and wilderness to explore. Graphics are pretty darn good For a game thats 2.5 years old the graphics aren't that bad. Rain makes everything look wet wind blows trash around and the lighting is pretty spot on. Vehicle customization is ADDICTING The customizable vehicles is mindblowing you can change almost anything from the rims to the blower (big chrome thing on hood that sucks in air). Weapon customization is pretty cool You can add attachments to your weapons to improve them over time or add new paint jobs to better suits your style. NPCs act and behive fairly well... most of the time Pedestrian behavior is awesome as all NPCs act differently some will run from danger some will fight back and some will do something unpredictable (like get in their car and run you over....). The mission editor is really good 3D editors are extremely useful over 2D editors as your able to edit and visualize how your game / mission looks and turns out. You can create a variety of missions from racing challanges to team death matches. I made a race track that had muscle cars race down the highway all around los santos with some oncoming traffic and cops. WHY I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS GAME! THE MULTYPLAYER The multiplayer is absolutly horrible! Imagine the way you play GTA now clone yourself 50 times and put all of them in the same GTA online map..... yup it's exactly how you think it'll turn out. Red players (players who kill and go psycho a lot) hunt and kill everyone else who are trying to do other things. The only way to combat this is to turn on "Passive Mode" which make you invulnerable to player attacks which also means you can't attack as well this means you can't participate in gang hideouts vip target missions armored van missions with your weapons (unless you turn off passive mode). HACKERS!!!! GTA online is plagued with hackers (if you thought CS GO was bad ooooh by you ain't seen the full power of the dark side.) most large population servers have hackers on them either breaking the economy by spawning money or ruining everyones' day by killing everyone every 30 seconds. The only way to combat hackers is to host private servers (if you have friends...) use passive mode and reporting (and pray to our dread god Nyarlathotep that Rockstar actually gets around to banning these guys.). SOME CONTENT IS LOCKED!!! The exclusive content promised to gives players special vehicles new missions and new weapons. the problem it's only available to those who played the game on the xbox 360 or ps3 FIRST. I tried using the content unlocker mod but Rockstar patched that (seriously rockstar unlock the content!!). The only way to get the content is to get a 360 or PS3 and play the game on that for 5 minutes. There's not enough content to keep you in multiplayer As of the time stamp of this review The only content in multiplayer worth playing are the heists and the Lamar Lowrider Missions (LLM). Everyting else in the game is used as a grinding mechanic to make ingame cash once you finish the heists and LLMs missions you'll regrind them just to make some more ingame cash to buy more stuff. You will eventually use Shark Cash Cards (micro transactions) inorder to buy that house / car / weapon / outfit / etc. Random server drops From my experience with multiplayer you will experience a lot of connection issues where you'll be dropped from a server for no reason. Just keep calm and reconnect. The game is still 60 dollars after 2.5 years the game is still 60 dollars. I don't remember the last time this game was on sale but even if it were 50% off it would've been over priced. I would recommend getting this game when it's no less than 60% off. Like CS GO the community is completely toxic It doesn't matter if it's on Rockstar forums or ingame the community is toxic so toxic it became radioactive decay and causes cancer. CONCLUSION Wait for the game to get marked down 60% Wait for more content for the multiplayer (or stick to just single player.) If your playing multiplayer expect hackers red players and lack of content.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Take2's attitude towards modders and the modding communinity gives me no choice but to give Grand Theft Auto V a negative review. In no way am I saying that it is overall a bad game it's one of my favourites but i can't recommend Grand Theft Auto V if you are looking into modding your game modding being a useful and different way to play your game that you likely paid full price for. Furthermore Take2's reasoning behind the mod ban frustrates me they say that it is to protect players who are playing GTA Online yet the OpenIV mod only effects Story Mode the mode that I and many others primarily play. It's as if Take2 assume that everyone is only playing the online mode. In many ways i cannot stand GTA Online it is riddled with micro transactions and loadtimes and is likely the reason we do not have a Single Player expansion pack (DLC). If you are not concerned in modding your game or supporting modders then i would recommend you buy GTA V it's fantastic
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Almost 900 hours in and still going strong. Can't say enough about the game. They keep adding more free online DLC that gets better than the previous one. No shortage of stuff to do. Haven't gotten far in the story mode because I'm just enjoying the online portion too much.Bear in mind that online is still frustrating at times due to scripters so it takes a while to find a good lobby sometimes. If you have friends to play with it just makes the game even better. I've found a great community of folks to play with and it makes dealing with scripters practically non existent. It's more fun now than it ever was and the new Gunrunning DLC is quite enjoyable so far.

review: EDIT Currently it looks like the community outcry MAY have made a slight difference to the policy decision Take 2 Interactive made. It's still not completely confirmed if all the damage that has been done will be undone. We shall have to wait and see.Hopefully Rockstar Games will be able to stop Take 2 Interactive from destroying GTA V's modding community the way they have and undo at least some of the harm they've done to their image by doing so... But as it is there's no excuse for shutting down OpenIV the modding core of GTA V and even of GTA IV the way they have.Yes it's technically LEGALLY Take 2's right to send a cease and desist letter to the OpenIV team. Legally it's their property to attempt to protect from what they decide to see as harmful to their business practices. But morally and ethically? It's a thing to do for them to actively seek to prohibit the single player only mods as they have done.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player is pretty good. However the online portion of this game is so flaky that it feels very much like an alpha or beta game.Its riddled with bugs or "features" like Load times are rediculous....ludicrous even Occasionally the game doesnt load and you have to alt+f4 then escape to make it try again. kicking your copilot out of the helicopter if you start a mission while he is riding with you Group/Team/Organization chat sometimes doesn work and you'll talk to nobody for an hour before realizing it. Seriously what was the last game you played where the group chat was unreliable? Rewards for logging in during the promo period are never received There's no way to turn off the profanity filter. You can say but assbandit is censored? really? Clicking the "buy all ammo" button before a job buys all ammo except the ammo for your primary weapon... Occasionally microsoft updates prevent you from logging in.Lastly the shark cards sold here make the online game borderline pay to win.Other than these few minor annoyances the game is sometimes fun with a friend and theres no monthly fee
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Bought the game on 28/10/2016 played day and night to get cash and stuff then I get banned til 12/7/2016. Addition to that everything is reset. Wow. Just Wow. Whats up with the random ban? All i did was do jobs over and over again. You can even check. Good luck to those planning on buying the game to play online. I tried to submit an appeal since i saw an option then within 5 seconds I automatically get an email saying i violated the eula and other crap. I did nothing but do jobs and earn cash now they ban me for a month and are gonna reset my character (stats money inventory) Just wow.

review: Friend got banned withing first two hours of online play having done nothing to warrent said ban. Honestly this game should get an 7/10 for gameplay. 10/10 for story looks and sound design. but dies when it comes to support server stability pc compatibility and a rediculous psuedo pay to win model which forces players to HEAVILY grind content inorder to afford even the basic amenities of the game. Leaving you envious of the (mostly harckers/moders/scripters) who have the full and glorious yet seemingly unobtainable suite of vehicles at their disposal yet often choose to troll the whole server by blowing eveyone up or freezing everyone in place changing their model to a toilet and then blowing everyone up. Why these people dont get banned but my friend who just bought the game and never did anything was?? idk lol. The devs keep adding cars and cosmetics to the game but fail to fix crashes bugs server stability and rampant abuse by people who mod the game. Why not have open servers and closed servers? so people who like to be invulnerable and cheat can do that in their own space and let people who want to play the game with their friends who get banned for nothing and then refund the game to never buy it again because the sysatem is broken have normal servers where we can tirelessly grind out our overpriced virtual money for cool toys and houses without the fear of being banned for nothing. ill never reccomend this game to friend again. not because i dont want to play with my friends but because i wouldnt want to put another friend in the same position as the last one i got to buy the game. and that goes for anyone else who is buying this game to play online. if you want the singleplayer experience its great. dont expect any singple player updates without paid dlc though.

review: I really have enjoyed the GTA franchise and ended up purchasing more copies of GTA V than any other game I own. It's a shame it's going to go out in flames like this. R* I will not be supporting your games in the future unless this is addressed. I have tried to make online work I have tried to get around the shark cards and extreme price gouging I've even tried to look past the hackers and jerks who ruin the game. I can even look past the insane loading screens. I look past that because at least I can play single player in peace with graphical mods and trainers to truly enjoy the SANDBOX you have built. With no additional Single Player content since launch I've resorted to excellent mods that ENHANCE this experience and keep me coming back. In fact the only reason I bought the PC version was to take advantage of mods. BUT NOPE. Buying the copy 3x wasn't enough Take Two wants more from me. They want to extract MORE from me in ways that only reward the cash cows. One of the most lucrative best selling video game of ALL TIME needs help from you to keep it going. Try and square that circle.

review: First I'll start out by saying The support is terrible.I was happily playing the game until I got banned for a month likely due to another modder in the session? I'm not really sure. I was fine since I would be able to play after anyways but still irratated. I log on and all my stuff is gone I didn't know there was a new policy. Decided to play the game again since there was nothing I could do about it now.One week ago I was a happy little boy running down the street. Something pops up and since I was spamming "A" it dissapeared right away. Network error? At least that's what I thought. I get put in single player and decide to join back."You have been permanently banned"Wow! Great! I never ing did anything and I've gotten banned twice. Resulting in me getting permanently banned. Rockstar "Hey guys I have a great idea! Lets create a completely automated system that bans the people it thinks are hacking and then never appeal bans again!"I'll start by saying I never did anything wrong or hacked they just felt like they needed to ban me.So if you plan to buy this game be prepared to lose your progress and probably buy the game once a year.Oh yeah on the Rockstar support forums they allow to request a ban appeal. Then they instantly have a bot replying to you saying they don't appeal bans.I'm just thinking Rockstar is a greedy company that wants the players to buy the game again. They probably don't care if innocent players are banned or not it just gets them more money.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Soooo upset with this game right now / never even owned the game for much longer than a day or two and I got banned for a month. It feels like i got targeted by some computer software and thrown on a black list for reasons they have yet to explain not even so much as a reason to why the banned me...... yea this is a rant but as you can see i'm deeply frustrated I got friends playing this game right now and i'm just sitting here. sad day (

review: Now for this game I'm gonna put this into three parts the good and the bad of online and singleplayerThe good part about this game is that you can play it with friends and whatnot get to grind together and work together towards a common goal like buying a new car (some of them have really good modifcations) or a new airplane a new something whatever. Mission vareity is more then enough covering CEO BUNKER CAR THINGS HANGERS. Big enough map for everyone to roam in.The bad part the modders... the modders man ruin this game... they can blow you up at any time and make you catch on fire and roll around on the ground. They can even make themselfs immortal so you cannot murder them. they can kick you out of your own personal vehicle and teleport in your car for a job and they steal it and they get it... its not good.They can EVEN KICK YOU OUT OF ONLINE and put you in singleplayer which is ridiculous. But rockstar hasn't added any easy anti cheat or anything. I feel the only reason that modders roam free is so rockstar can have some pre hype for updates with the modders getting a free look at vehicles.The singleplayer is amazing in everyway tons of missions very good story telling and amazing characters. I somewhat recommend this game to anyone... just depends if your up for the huge grind for some of the stuff and if you can deal with the modders.

review: This game has a great story mode great modding community but for the love of god don't play online.Here's what you can expect in online races Hosters always leave collision ON which in this case is a bad thing since there are a metric ton of idiots who will wait and ram you on finish. Some hosters spawn first in line so they turn OFF catchup &amp slipstream then you can't get first place at all since they'll just speed off with glitches and whatnot. IT WILL DRIVE YOU INSANE!HONORABLE MENTIONS People use controllers which enables them to use aim assist. In order to have actual fun you'll have to take a time machine and travel to 2013 2014 then you can start making money and by 2018 you'll have some cash to around with.WARNING Online mode is a pay to have fun mode since you can't earn reasonable amounts of money without buying sharkcards ( i haven't bought any ). You will have to become a basement dweller that hasn't had a in 6 months and didn't sleep for a millenia constantly playing and grinding in order to earn money. You won't see your loved ones for 3 years minimum.I regret buying this game since I am able to aquire it for free just without online mode. Don't buy it rather download it from internet for free since the developers took a huge on the GTA Franchise. I played GTA III I played Vice City I played San Andreas I played GTA IV and i have some awesome memories from those games but this this is a despicable cash grab.

review: Disclaimer I never got banned in GTA online and rockstar never took money or anythng from my account the following review is NOT based in any of this situations.So Is it worth it?Well for the most part not very much. The story of this game is already well known by those who know the game. Rockstar never aded more content of any kind to it and it's nowhere near to the quality of GTA San Andeas' or even GTA IV story it doesn't tell any more than just "shoot the hell out of evrerything you can" (talking about the story itself not the game content). As for the Online feature (and probably the main reason for people to want this game) It's probably not what you think it is. First of all and currently the main problem the cheaters kids who want to break the game's fun because they are to bad to play properly the lost the sense of life or their dadys' don't love them. More often than the other issues you will find below Suddenly you will find yourself with no weapons with explosives or clones of your character raining on your head appearing in a cage on the other side of the map or with a forecast of heavy bags of money falling from the sky(ironically the least probable). This people wasted money in a game they don't want to play and are wasting other people's money because they ruin the fun for every one. And the worst part of this Rockstar (Rs) doesn't do shtt to stop them (exept maybe when they give money as it is what hurts them most but generally they also ban you for "accepting the money" that fell on your head). Then there are server issues . So if you where lucky to not find any cheaters in a session you will end up loosing the one you are in for any of theese reasons 1 "there was a problem in gta online please return to gta v" 2 fulano left mengano left sultano left pirulo left xplayerx010230 left falconlover left 124937618946 left YourFriend1 left YourOtherFriend left edgyName left and suddenly you are the only player in the session no reason given(see Rs support reference). 3 you end up ragequitting the game because you sold all the cocaine and for a "connection issue" you didn't recive a penny even though you had no issues 4 And also very typical The Clouds Simulator 2018 an endless loading screen. The third reason is the Balance mess Rs did . So first there was the Hydra a Plane with VTOL that shoots a death laser of explosions and can dodge every missile you shoot them the pain of the skies. Then they added an explosive bullet type and the problem faded a bit. However because Rs doesn't like balanced things they also aded (pay attention) A FLYING BIKE IMPOSIBLE TO HIT THAT SHOOTS ROCKETS THAT CAN TURN 360 DEGREES IN A 2 FOOT RADIUS (making them imposible to dodge) AND YOU CAN EVEN CALL IT BESIDE YOU AT ANY TIME! This is one of many like the tank which can't take more explosions than an armored car. And last but not least the Rockstar Support issue . Did you Loose al your money because an "unknown network problem"? did you loose al your bunker weapons because some cheater took your weapons and you had to fight a Valkyria helicopter with your bare hands? Did you get banned because some cheater spawned some dollars on your head?(see disclaimer). Well Don't think it's over! Because now comes the part where you get a generic bot response from Rs Support or a "sorry there is nothing we can do go 8 D O yourself" answer. And for the modic prize of 3 Shark cards wi'll make it so the wall you ar talking to is made out of bricks instead of concret so you have a pretty wall to talk to. Rockstar giver no support unless the following things 1 You have a video proof certified by a lawyer as trusted evidence. 2 it's a problem that impairs them and benefits you 3 it's a problem than can end in a legal action from the client against Rs But seriously i've seen GTA SA Multiplayer Servers with better support than GTA V.So at this point you might be asking "why did you say "for the most part not"?" Well there's not all bad things with the game. In terms of what you can do in it it feels like you can accomplish everything you can imagine within the limits of realism. Basicly if non of the listed issues exist it would be the perfect game. There's so much potential wasted by the negligence of Rs there are many options to minimize or kill the problems the game has (Battle eye a support team that actually cares etc) And if you have either A) a lot of patience against game malfunctions or B) a crew only server that ensures there are no cheaters in it. You can have a Great time with this. And probably A is the reason for me to keep playing the game hoping that one day Rs will change his attitude.I will be happy to modify this review as the game changes (if it does) and to clear any questions people may have.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The online component is just a micro transaction filled grind fest straight out of mobile gaming. The game play itself is fun but it's ruined by the ever present push towards buying in game currency and poor support ( customer service/response times refusal to respond limiting migration of characters across platforms despite it being the same Rock Star account what seems to be a complete lack of trying to stop cheaters and then you get banned for being in a lobby with cheaters or when cheaters give you money... which is even worse in games where you've dumped a ton of micro transactions into a character. The single player is the saving grace of this hot mess but don't worry they've ed that up too. No single player DLC because they'd rather use exploitative psychologically manipulative micro transaction schemes to rake in easier money. They've also killed the modding community (which the developers had embraced in the past) with legal action in the hopes that modders don't have the time and money to push back against their t (and they're right modders don't have the money to stand up to them).The publisher claims it's to fight cheaters but these single player modding tools aren't part of the cheater MO. What it probably is is that they don't want you enjoying the game in ways that don't make them more money despite the still full retail price. Instead of spending your time playing the game with mods they want to gimp the single player back to the vanilla you've completed in hopes it will push you into the online portion of the game.The game was fun but at this point it's a dumpster fire.

review: "VILLIAN MOST IN NEED OF A HUG" award definitely should go to Trevor Philips. Guy is a complete train wreck and could certainly use a hug.PROS This game could have no storyline at all and I'd still have 100+ hours into it. One of the most replayable games ever made. Great selection of weapons and vehicles. Convertible vehicles that actually have functioning soft and hard tops that go up and down. So many little "attention to detail" things like the "tinking" sound a cooling motor makes when shutting a car off etc. Vehicle customization is pretty badass. Huge open world. Switching between characters on the fly. Graphics and physics are great. Not super real like The Witcher 3 or anything but still very visually appealing. Like all GTA games of recent the ability to load a custom soundtrack and bump it while doing 100 MPH down a sidewalk. A game you can play for 10 minutes or 10 hours and accomplish something in game either way. Great way to unwind after putting up with BS all day at work... Humorous NPC conversations cutscenes and random fights because they always each other off. Gun fights between the police and random NPC criminals or even innocent NPC's that run over a cop because i pushed their car into them. Very few frustrating missions so you never really get stuck or frustrated enough to rage quit or rage uninstall. In fact I will probably not uninstall this game until GTA VI comes out should they make it. (This is why I have 5 SSD's not a fan of uninstalling favorite games...) Could make this list much longer.CONS Could use a more convenient fast travel. (Can use a taxi but for those that are impatient the 30 second wait for a taxi feels like forever.) Wish some of the killer online vehicles were available in single player. (Such as the Armored Karin Kuruma aka Armored Mitsubishi Lancer Evo) The occassional mission where you have a long drive and the passenger is whining or being extremely annoying the entire ride. Then you either drive them off a cliff and jump out or just shoot them in the face so they shut up and you have to do the mission all over again... Not too much else negative about this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer is good but the biggest part of the game is the online mode.The online mode is Absolute garbage. It's fun for a little while but soon you realize it's repetative uninspired full of cheaters and hackers (who can and most likely will get YOU banned for even being around them wether you realize or not.).The heists in multiplayer has the potential of being amazing but between the absurdly long loading times the random people you often have to join up with (unless you got 3 friends willing to wade through the that is this multiplayer) the random people who more often than not (in my experience) either just around and fails the mission or just simply leaves/afks making you restart.And of course in the vein of the how that is EA microtransactions out the wazoo. In multiplayer you WILL get annihalted on a regular basis by people who have paid to get fighter jets with lock on missiles actual tanks and armed and armored vehicles super weapons of all kinds while if you don't pay you're stuck with for well... anything really for the good 80% or so of your playtime on multiplayer as getting that amount of money without paying real money is tedious at best.If there's a heavy sale get it for singleplayer. Anything else is just not worth it certainly not the "full" price.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's worth noting before I actuall get into this that I've been playing this game for a very long time. Even before it was released on PC I played on console so I've gotten reasonably attached to it. This also might be kind of long so bare with me.SINGLEPLAYER The singleplayer experience is easily the best thing about this entire game it's a vast and very well detailed world to explor and there's a lot to do in that world. If you do plan on buying this game at this perticular point in time only do it for the singleplayer that's actually included since you won't be able to mod new stuff into it anymore thanks to the devs parent company Take two interactive.MULTIPLAYERGTA Online honestly shows a lot of potential but never really lives up to that potential. The promise of "You can play GTA V with all your friends" is technically true. (even if it is on a watered down and less detailed verson of the origianl map) But the sad truth about this that while it can be fun you have a choice to either grind for hours maybe even days just to get access to any of the fun intersting or new items cars and weapons or you can simply do what Take two wants you to do and pay them for some GTA cash. The entire multiplayer has a very free to play atmosphere which is goddamn inexcusable in a game I payed $60 for.MODDINGI could very easily put a long list here of all the mods that you can't use anymore thnaks to Take two's actioans agains Openfour and the entire modding scene for this game instead I'd simply like to leave a message to Take two directly even if it's very unlikely they'll ever see or read the one review among thousand of other.I'd simply like to say this to Take two interactive ....................../ /) .................... / ../ .................../..../ ............./ /'...'/ ........../'/.../..../......./ ........('(... ... .... /'...') ......... .................'...../ ..........''... .......... _. ............ ..............( .............. ............. ...
