title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've had this game for a while and with that I can tell you exactly how this game went (online). (Long Review. TL DR at bottom)When I got this game it was good it was fun things weren't exuberant in price you could get a good car within a day and a good place within a few more days grinding for money was a thing but you could play the game without focusing on gaining the money. CEO is kinda cool. But that's how the game for me started. I played for a while and then Motorcycle club stuff came out yet again this for me was pretty nice the abillity to gain money over time without physically spending the majority of your time getting the loot for your club to manufacture into better worthwhile stock. Allows you to mess around with your friends without penalizing you for not actively gaining money.Later on CEO got a new update Import/Export Vehicle Warehouse. You could steal vehicles and sell the vehicles for money in the way how special cargo worked. (You collect small bits and sell bulk.) Vehical Cargo was similar but you gain little stock and sell little stock. for big money. (As of currently one of the best ways of gaining money in GTA Online). With this update we saw the release of "Special Vehicles" these vehicles was fun but was the start of power creep. These were costly (The Nightrider car is $5mil.)Now Gunrunning released. Major powercreep here. Explosive Heavy Sniper Rifle makes planes pretty weak within combat. You had vehicles which you could upgrade to be more resilient to damage and protective of your fleshy body. These vehicles aren't cheap either. The upgrades were locked behind research researched can use stock you can steal to do overtime or you can fast track the research which for the first is $100k then $225k for the rest. (Fast Tracking can reduce all the research into a 3hr time period). These items can dominate a game if used by a group of competent people. Now the new update as of writing this Smuggler's Run. Oh boy what do I have to say? Except it's of subpar quallity to previous updates. Yes the previous update had problems but even that update was better. The planes aren't worth the money even when upgraded. Balance is another problem with this update the planes are fairly low damage unless you're a fan of homing missles on the planes. A Hydra is a straight upgrade to them and that already exists in the game and is considerably cheaper since you don't have to buy a hangar to store it. The hanger's money making system is the same as Special Cargo. Build up supplies by grabbing bits and sell bulk. Except unlike special cargo you can only get 1 crate of goods at a time which is worth $10k. Special Cargo is worth twice the money (If you go use the Large Special Cargo Warehouse). And you can gather up to 3 at once. Also the update is buggy but that's to be expected. The update on a whole appears to be rushed. Compared to Import/Export and Gunrunning this DLC doesn't have missions to reduce price of the vehicles that's an unlock of just doing supply runs. That is a downgrade as the missions were actually fun the supply runs not that fun in this update actually really fustrating. You shoot down the enemy and more enemies spawn constantly throughout the mission. It's tedious at best. It's also worth considering that this update's stuff at the best options costs $30 million in total. If you bought the cash cards that's 240 worth of cash cards to get this stuff... O.oIf anything I hate to say that Rockstar has made a hash of the current update. As this update is more buggy than Gunrunning was on release. The supply missions are tedious at best. On the whole this update isn't fun. GTA Online as the entire thing is a boring grind fest. You need money if you want to have fun with things like the Half Track. And I'd dare say that modders that actually drop money for others make the game a more of a balanced experience. Not everyone has the time and/or funds to unlock the expensive content. TL DR GTA Online is a grind fest to get the good things. Unbalanced and possibly contains Pay 2 Win elements.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Okay so where to begin with this game. Overall I've said i would NOT recommend it but i think its more fair to say it depends what you like to play. My recommendation is based on how me and my core friend group like to play games.So the single player i have admittedly not completed but it seems like a lot of fun like any other GTA Game except with the added bonus that the heist setups and heists in game seem to add something even though theyre basically just missions. In general i do find it a pain that i have to swap between characters to complete missions and i think thats the reason i stopped. If i don't like a player character it tends to put me off the game this happened with GTA IV and TLAD expansion i just gave up on it. Otherwise id highly recommend this as a single player game to people who like WYSIWYG games. If you like modding or cheats like i do once ive completed a game then id be guarded about buying this unless you intend to outright disregard the multiplayer or are a capable hacker as there is the possibility you may get banned.Which then neatly brings me to GTA Online and the online version of the game. So for the most part its pretty good. Grab a team of 3 friends train and do the heists and its a lot of fun. Thanks to the continuous addition of expansions you can now own a fair amount of property and a lot of cool stuff (if you can get the money in). I also feel to some extent that its a credit to rockstar that they have actually bothered to continue adding content to this game as long as they have where other developers have offered to do this and then given up after a year of limited additions. Of course this does come at a price in GTA Online. With the exception of Heists nearly everything expansion wise is disabled in anything other than public matches probably so you cant farm them with your crew without others being able to challenge you. But as someone who enjoys playing Solo or with a group of friends this is nearly damming since it only takes one hacker or griefer to ruin a server yes this is how GTA has always worked but its also why ive never wanted to get involved in that part of it. If you have no friends youre pretty much limited to the low paying jobs (20k at best) unless youre lucky enough to stick with a team throughout a whole heist that you can get along with. All the other high paying jobs are pretty much locked away in public multiplayer. Items from the latest expansions are often 5 to 20m credits (depending on whether its a new car boat or core feature of the expansion) but put this into perspective. If you are the average person you wont know how to cheat you probably wont have a huge gang of friends to play with and youre probably not going to be top of the leader boards. So if you want anything remotely quickly they expect you to buy shark cards 3.5m credits are around 30. If you want to play this casually and build up slowly or youre happy to sink money into this then id argue its a great game. Same if youre okay fighting off griefers swapping server whenever theres a hacker or otherwise generally just want to mess around with people who want to do the same to you. As for graphics i honestly would still consider them pretty awesome. When a year and a half ago i bought 2 980Ti to SLI i was amazed to see that at upper graphics you can get building reflections on the inside of your cockpit or star reflections. all things i had never seen with my 780. Now whether theyve further improved it as part of patches for the 1080 i have no idea but this at least impressed me.My concern with the latest negative reviews at the time of writing this review is while to be best of my knowledge i havnt had any money taken away from me if they ARE modifying peoples wallets based on potential hacking then while some may be saying "well dont cheat" i dont think some people consider just how hackers may decide to grief players. and if theyre offering in game money for real money then they need to be VERY careful how they apply this rule to players who have paid additional money into the multiplayer. In conclusion Detach SP from MP so that cheaters can cheat offline if they want. Mods in single player should never be a problem no matter the attitude of the developers over IP most of the developers i know now started life modding games. Stop forcing me back into public multiplayer if i drop out of a private MP match (it takes longer to load and party find for something im going to quit anyway).And if you like GTA and havnt at least tried the single player then by all means buy this game preferably on sale because it feels near criminal that the price has barely dropped since launch yet they have a perfectly good micro transactions system. And the multiplayer is worth at least taking a look at to decide whether or not its for you.

Any funds purchased via Shark Cards have been preserved and are still available on your account.The next infraction on your account will result in a permanent ban from GTA Online.GTA Online bans are triggered by a number of factors including modding in GTA Online exploiting or abusing game mechanics manipulating protected game data and code or otherwise interfering with other players gameplay experience.All GTA Online suspension and banning decisions are final and may not be appealed. review: It's a really fun game (i've only played online) but...Don't know what anticheat software is? Neither does TakeTwo/Rockstar."There are many facets of cheating in online games which make the creation of a system to stop cheating very difficult however game developers and third party software developers have created or are developing 10 11 technologies that attempt to prevent cheating. Such countermeasures are commonly used in video games with notable anti cheat software being GameGuard PunkBuster Valve Anti Cheat (specifically used on games on the Steam platform) and EasyAntiCheat. 12 Exploits of bugs are usually resolved/removed via a patch to the game however not all companies force the patches/updates on users leaving the actual resolution to individual users."They seem to take the "leaving the actual resolution to individual users." part way too literally.The only unbearable problem with the game is modders/glitchers in my opinion but nothing really gets done about it.Most games will do a small patch every few days when they've found an exploit that can be abused in order to prevent cheating but with TakeTwo/Rockstar you can expect a patch every... 4 6 months. After the patch there's usually a ban wave which will give you a splendid week of modder free playing time. The other 16 23 weeks though? lol good luck.To give an example of how bad the modding is I have played in approximately 30 sessions over the last 4 days. I left 5 of those sessions because I was content and felt it was a reasonable time to get off the game. The other 25? Well either server crash from modder trying to spawn too much money at once or the entire lobby was just blowing up repeatedly and getting teleported around and having their weapons taken away. Oh and vehicles don't save you they'll just force eject you from them. You can also be frozen so you can't move your character or modders can spawn 1000+ planes on you at once crashing your game. Switching lobbies doesn't save you because there's another malicious modder in the one you're loading into already.To reiterate it's a really fun game. One of the best I've played actually. But unless you're going to play invite only sessions or instanced missions it's not currently worth the frustration. September 6 2018 this review is still relevant.

review: Great story but boring gameplay. Pick it up for the story alone for 10 bucks when on sale.Pros The story. And flying a helicopter is so hard you could probably test for your flight papers after playing this game.Cons Console Port. Repetitive gameplay lack of engaging open world activities. Few ways to make money in storymode the game keeps you poor. Few things worth spending money on. First person mode will make you want to hurl. GTA online is set up simply to take your money.In storymode for 40 hours I roamed the world tying to find something interesting to do. The hype around this game kept telling me excitment would eventually come to me.... There are occaisonally random encounters scripted in same locations (robbers you can rob armored vehicles to rob etc) but they are rare random and the pay is small. If you are lucky enough to catch an armored vehicle you get 2000 5000 cash if you can outrun the cops. But that is literally it. Even 50% of the way through the story this was the only way to really make any money. Doing the same thing again and again. Even the heists and activities for the story do not pay out except for 2 or 3 of the big ones. At which point you are nearly done the game and bored. The 3 characters rarely are paid for anything which is incredibly frustrating (and likely a ploy to make you want to quit and play GTA online where microtransactions will give you money). Worse by the time you have enough money from following the story and to buy some businesses and do missions for them you no longer need that small amount of cash flow. Why? Because there is nothing worth spending money on. What? For example if you buy cars and upgrade them they will disappear on you and you will never see them again (not in your gararge and not in the impound where they are supposed to show up). Money wasted. There isn't even any point buying guns or ammo as the story missions give you access to new ones and all the ammo you will ever need by looting bodies. Lame. But what can you expect from a console game? On top of that the cars given to the 3 characters (that always spawn for them to use) are boring. A sedan a slow bike truck and a whale of a sports car with no handling is what you are given. Hilariously they are the only vehicles that can be counted on to spawn or not be lost. Even after being fully upgraded they are boring and slow. What the hell? Why am I so poor? Why are the activites around the world so mind numblingly boring? Why wasn't there some early side missions allowing us to jack specific vehicles and have to outrun the cops and then get paid by selling them on the black market? How does being able to run over or fight random people and shoot cops and snoozefest minigames count as an open world game? Because you aren't supposed to enjoy storymode fool you are supposed to play GTA online for anything exciting.Pick any bad open world game and it will have more to do in it than this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Let me just say first that I've never posted a review of any game as I normally don't induldge in games enough to be able to post a thourough enough review. I purchased this game originally just to get the game. Like a majority of people. Didn't care much for online as I just wanted to get the experience of playing GTA V on PC since it was a different feel and a brand new experience overall. I have not yet completed the single player campaign on PC as I went through it completely on next gen before the PC release. Have tried a time or two but repeating a campaign isn't something I find interest in on any game. With that said I did spend a lot of time exploring the open world and just doing what I wanted to do as I felt. That too becomes very old as would be expected when becoming so adjusted to an open world map. When I felt single player wasn't cutting it anymore I attempted to invest time in online. Rockstar does a tremendous job at adding content to this game with all of the game mode additions vehicle additions weapons and so on so I am not cutting them short in that respect. Put simply online also gets boring as time goes on. Heists become very frustrating if you don't have a large group of friends to play them on. Races are a cluster most of the time. Death match game modes are very fun for the first couple of times you play them but become very repetitive as time goes on. Don't even get me started on the open world aspect of online. When you do everything in GTA V it becomes very uninteresting. It is hard to bring yourself to press "Play" when you know you'll be running through the same frustrations the last time you tried. With that said there was one thing that extended my interest in GTA V. Mods. Mods kept me playing this game when I ran out of interest. Mods take up about 40% of the hrs on record that you see posted. Mods are in large part why there is any real interest in this game this late into its life. The single player campaign is fantastic. The online is.. meh. Both run out on you and mods keep a constant interest. Now that's gone and so is what interest I had left in this game. Going to help clear out some hard drive space I must say. )

review: GTA V single player is one of the most brilliant most ambitious games I have ever played. And the sad thing is it is willfully neglected in favor of its lesser GTA Online multiplayer counterpart.Microtransactions are rampant (and the only legitimate way to ever hope to keep up with all of the ludicrously expensive in game content) and practically forced down your throat if you want to stay current and complaints from the community on this have been largely ignored.Hackers run rampant and honest players realistically must fear being banned for picking up hacked cash on accident. Gameplay is tailored to favor the rich and smother the poor and while I may be guilty of buying a shark card or two the entire grind for in game currency almost legitimizes some players' modding for cash.And to top it all off Rockstar has recently 'addressed' Take Two's abhorrent attack on the modding community brushing the action off as if they held no responsibility to the matter. Shame on Rockstar for giving lip service to such a blatant attempt to force the player base to the microtransaction hell that is GTA Online.This game had the potential to be legendary and in many respects it has achieved that status. But it's clear that Rockstar and Take Two care little for the gamers the modding community and gaming's culture and values as a whole. Don't buy this game. If I could I would return it for a refund. Hell I'd give it back for free.Save yourself the heartburn because the only thing left on multiplayer is cancer and the Singleplayer is a sidenote to Rockstar's wallet. Interesting but wasted potential.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The single player for this game is the best I've seen/played in the GTA series. The multiplayer on the other hand has some real issues at the moment.GTA Online was a ton of fun at first and where I have spent most of my time playing this game. The SP was a lot of fun but the idea of having my own character and assets like garages full of pimped out customized cars pulled me in and I put in a couple hundred hours before touching the singplayer again and I only did the prologue missions before jumping head first into GTA Online.The heists are top notch and what I prefer to play but there are only 4 heists not counting the boring first heist that can only be played with 2 players. The jobs and heists are fun but after a hundred hours in GTAO you get bored with them because there isn't enough of them you start repeating the same stuff over and over again.The new content they are releasing is all the same thing re skinned. It's all about CEOs now you buy a property for 1 million or so and then you can access the new content so right off the bat you have to either buy a shark card or grind to get access to the latest updates then you will find that they are all the same thing. Be a boss get a crew and then do mission where everyone else on the map in session can intervene and mess up your plans. There are 4 or 5 modes now like this that are just slightly different but pretty much the same thing. I suppose Rockstar is content with dividing the community as long as they are getting enough shark cards bought.When this was released it was my favorite game and me and mine played weakly doing heists and jobs. Looking back the future of GTAO looked so promising it's sad to see it in the state it is currently. We vote with our wallets so if you don't like the new content please don't buy shark cards and maybe RS will realize they need to give GTAO some serious attention instead of these repeats of content being added over and over again.We need new heists which RS has stated they will not do and the promise of SP DLC has been completely glossed over due to the success of GTAO. I hope that the game losses population and RS realizes their business model isn't going to last and if GTAO is going to survive or have a profitable sequel they need to do things differently. It seems they put so much into the base game and the new content doesn't mesh well with that base.TL/DRIf you want it for SP then get it right away if you want it for GTAO (The only thing RS is actively supporting) then I would say you are going to have a lot of fun at first untill you hit that content ceiling and start having to do the same things over and over again and if the trend continues you'll be sadly dissapointed by the content updates that are all essentially the same thing.I'm not recommending this game only because I want RS to fix some serious issues with the game. 6 months after release I could not have recommended this game more but now I have a hard time recommending it with the current shortcomings of GTAO.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: plus side the Story mode Is Great there's no other way to put it. I have a big issue with GTA online though For some unknown reason I've been banned from GTA Online. I only played GTA V Online once a few months ago for a few hours done some races and roamed around. So I have like at most a few hours on Gta Online. I wanted to start playing GTA online again even watched some youtube videos on how to make money and so on. So I went to go to GTA Online and says Ive been banned for 1 month how????!!!!I've never abused or cheated on GTA online I dont even have 1 bad sport report ot whatever it is. Then I find out that I cant even appeal against this ban I've recieved. This really disappointed me so I have to not recommend because. This game Is clearly punishing players that have done nothing wrong and its very unfair.So after I wrote this post I contacted Rockstar threw there online chat. I would say it wasn't much help but its better than nothing. Also Its got to the point you properly need to record yourselfs while playing gta 5 online to prove to them you're innocent when they do there routine sweeps of cheaters and hackers. So that when they mess up and take soem of us the INNOCENTS with the bad guys we have the evidence to prove to rockstar that we're not the cheaters. Unfortunately guys the low life hackers and cheaters have created this problem for us and Its not fair at all. I copy and pasted my conversation with rockstar it's just down below. ME Hi If its possible could I be given a explanation as to why I got banned on GTA Online. I've only played GTA online once and just done a couple races like a few months back. Then 3 days ago I go to GTA Online and I'm Banned. I've never ever abused the GTA online or ever cheated and I never intend too.ROCKSTAR Hello thank you for contacting Rockstar Support my name is Rene. I understand that you are banned from playing GTA Online is this correct?ME yesME I've never used cheats on GTA OnlineME I only played online a few hours like a few months backROCKSTAR I understand your concern we will look into your account and we will get back to you after looking into it.ME Ok thank youROCKSTAR Thank you for your understanding. Is there anything else I can assist you with?ME Yes can you unban me please I've been banned for no reason.ROCKSTAR I can understand we will look into your account now and we will get back to you once we have looked into other than ban do you have any questions or concerns?ME Yeah there is One more thing. Ive been watching alot of videos of gta online. I watched a video saying dont go on gta 5 online its unsafe because of cheaters and hackers. What steps is rockstar games doing to prevent these poeple from ruining my game experience and others?ROCKSTAR I understand we are currently working to play the game fairly and remove modders and cheaters in game. To keep the game play environment as fair as possible we routinely do sweeps to separate cheaters from legitimate players. In addition to in game automated detection we also review evidence submitted by the GTA Online community.ROCKSTAR You can also report players through GTA Online if you see cheaters or modders in game. The best and most effective way to report cheaters in GTA Online is through the in game menu. When reports are sent to us via the in game tools we are able to study much more data to help identify and act on the user and the activity in question. You can visit the below article to report the players in game https //support.rockstargames.com/hc/en us/articles/200704406ME do you guys allow recorded evidence? as im thinking of recording my gta online gameplay to prove I havent done anything wrong and that this ban issue doesnt ahppen againand im guessing these routinne sweeps also sweeps up some of the innocent as well? sorry to sound bluntROCKSTAR I understand it is better to record your game play for future issues to be resolved as I have already stated we are looking into your account we will update the status after looking into it.ME so will you inform me in this chat or send me a notificationROCKSTAR You'll receive a notification once we look into your account.ME do you know how long that can atek upto?ROCKSTAR Unfortunately we do not have any time frame regarding this we notify you once this is resolved.

review: tl dr GTA Online is a gem but Rockstar decides to slather rancid on anything that shines. Only fun with friends. Im still going to buy red dead 2.This game was a favourite of mine during the early years when it came out on the 360. And after playing hundreds of missions I bought a Cheetah and a suite at the Eclipse Hotel. However Rockstar removed my ownership of both of those and left me with no car and no apartment thus slapping me in the face for playing their game.After buying GTA on PC I signed in with a new account unaware i could link my 360 account and after numerous back and forth emails with Rockstars customer support I was told I had to buy the game yet again because Social Club binds with my steam account. Ofcourse my old account was stripped of its possesions but I still worked up for a cheap apartment and a Turismo along with almost 100 in levels.When I played this on the 360 it was perfect in performance now on PC however I experience constant frame drops almost completely freezing my game and at one point requiring me to "end task" from Task Manager.Running on an i5 6500 GTX 1070 and 8GB RAM I am well over the recommended requirments. I don't know if this is just myself as my friends haven't had such a frequent issue and I can assure you my drivers are up to date. Additionaly GTA is the only game in which i experience massive frame drops (or any frame drops). Obviously running most settings on ultra high should not be a problem.The loading times in this game are unbearably long. Simply just starting up online mode takes atleast a couple minutes usually ranging at the 5 minute mark. Joining other servers take some time aswell but you usually don't have to thanks to Rockstar automatically putting you in the same server as a friend which is the only redeeming mechanic of this game.The prices in this game are insanely high for the low amount jobs pay you. Most jobs only pay a few thousands maybe just up to 15k. Although this sounds reasonable Rockstar removed the ability to replay a mission without first going back into freemode which brings up my point again about long loading times. Not being able to replay a mission severely stunts a quick income. Now I haven't done the research on this but I have noticed it while browsing car listings on IGN with IGN showing a lower price for certain cars than what is shown ingame. Rockstar has seemed to raise the prices of items and also lowered the reward money of many jobs which were once used to farm.Rockstar has shark codes which will give you money for real world purchase which is obviously what they're trying to enforce.

review: Good game company! I rarely type reviews. This one was warranted to warn others. I did not use any cheats in the online game. In fact I barely even played it. The first time I actually played online was in June. After playing I logged off. I checked my email before going to bed to see I had received a ban. I asked around and a few other gamers I know said it was possible because of a Trainer (which shuts off during online) might have set it off. OK I didn't even contest that I had read that GTA supported mods for offline. So a month later I installed a new SSD drive and thought I will give GTA another shot. Mind you this was a fresh install of Windows 7. It took 2 days to download all of my games back. A group of gamers I know wanted me to jump on. So I did I didn't even really do anything special. I stood in my apartment and watched a helo battle going on. I live in a hotspot across from Maze bank where a CEO office is. So I have to be sneaky leaving cause I always got gunned down trying to leave. So I left my apartment stood outside and watched other players battling it out. I got in my car and drove to ammunation to buy some ammo and new guns. Note I am only a Level 8. The gun owner gets spooked because there is a tank outside blowing up everything in the streets. I have to leave because the owner closed shop. I walk outside and get blasted. I laugh it off and respawn and get a car and drive off. I got into a gun battle with a guy he kills me 5 times to my 3. I was also just trying out a new gamepad I had gotten. It was late so I jumped out of the game. Next morning I see I had received another ban.This was a fresh install with no mods installed! I contacted RockStar support only to get a automated response about my ban. They didn't even bother to look at the evidence. I repeatedly sent responses and reopened the ticket to get the same BS run around. They will not even explain why I got the ban nor will they help me try to solve it so it won't happen again. I requested a refund for the game through Steam. I hope it goes through. I will never buy another RS game ever. I sold so much of my TF2 inventory to get the game. Now all I can hope is I hope for the refund. I don't have a lot of money to be wasting on games where the company doesn't give a crap about it's players.Over all I can't take anything away from the game. I love the game. I played the single player mode mostly. I didn't have any beef with the game until I had the god awful experience with their online. I really never got a chance to play the online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer I've been playing GTA V since launch back in 2013. I've play it on Xbox 360 Xbox One and now PC. It is by far one of my favorite games and one of the best games ever. It has an extremely awesome singleplayer with so much to from side missions to buying your dream setup (cars guns clothes etc) and tons more to do on top of its amazing campaign. It's extremely immersive and you will get lost in all of it's content. Singleplayer 10/10 Multiplayeer I've also been playing GTA Online since it was released and it is extremely fun and there is tons to do. All of the missions are very fun and there are endless missions to choose from. Heists are a lot of fun to play with a group of friends if you play with random players online it is risky but it is very possible to do you just have to trust in others. My problems with GTA O is it has way to many loading screens where there shouldn't be and they back you out of missions to often when you should just be taken back to lobbies for the said missions. Also in GTA O you need lots of money to have a full expierence but it is a hard task to get enough money to achieve everything you want it is very possible to get the money through missions and heists but Rockstar has made it so it can be very pay to win in terms of getting your dream set up. Though the multiplayer has some flaws you will have a blast with everything you can do. I would also recommend having friends to play with as it is a lot better to have people to play missions with. Multiplayer w/o friends 7/10 Multiplayer w/ friends 9/10

Massive multiple minute loading times even with an SSD hard drive vehicles and properties all costing insane amounts to try to make you buy the microtranscations an annoying interface that requires multiple sub menus to summon a vehicle or use an item healing items that don't replenish if you die and retry missions that take 10+ minutes and fail instantly if one of your four players leaves or dies etc.It could have been so much more than it is but what it feels like at a moment is a second job. Consider if you have three friends to play with regularly otherwise don't bother with online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Only be prepared to enjoy GTA Online if you're ready to spend hundreds of dollars on their microtransactions. Grinding is impossible since 80% of the playerbase is full of s who only play to screw up other peoples' work so don't bother with that. Even if it was possible there are about three things you could do that actually earn money each one as tedious and anti fun as the last. Ignoring that GTA Online isn't GTA anymore. It's Just Cause with worse physics worse AI worse tools and the best part is that you have to pay real money to use any of those things.The promo images are also extremely misleading. Those are exceedingly hi res compared to what the majority of players will be able to use and the textures have been scaled up. In the actual game many textures (Mostly clothing with some concrete and buildings) are compressed to and look terrible from just about any distance.Single player could be worse. Not realistic in the slightest and characters' motives make no sense but it's a decent amount of fun. Your best bet is to just stick with GTA IV.

review: So first things first If you are here to read about a full on game review then leave and look at another one. In this review I will mainly cover some things that I think should be told to the people that want to buy it in the first place.So what does it not contain? Plot Gameplay and nearly everything in the game will not be part of this review. If you are still here and interested into what I have come up with then go ahead and read.The game is a good game. It is enjoyable to watch as I do tend to watch alot of Vanoss Daithi Mini and the other guys on Youtube. Seeing how much fun they had I thought of looking into the game myself. If I wouldnt be able to play the multiplayer there was still the singleplayer right?So I went and looked at the minimum requirements knowing that my PC is far from being a beast PC. It can handle however quite a few games where others said You cant play this. I looked through the internet made a few tests and it told me everything I needed to know Your PC meets the minimum requirements. Alright then! Bought and installed!And that is where my mood went downhill.The first thing that happened was minor It started in windowed and in the lowest resolution possible. Graphics were still on default though. Turning the resolution up and putting it into fullscreen took me a while as the game kept saying You do not meet the recommended requirements. "No sherlock! I want it to be fullscreen for it to work better anyways!"After 5 minutes it finally decided to cut it and it crashed the first time. After crashing however what could be a planned restart it went fullscreen and I could play.Actually no I couldnt. I simply wanted to try out multiplayer real quick and it told me I cant. I need to play the prologue first. Ok then. Play it finish it and now go on with it. And so I went into... Nope time out on loading Player Data! But now I can... "You need a character first". Oh really? How about putting me into the creation screen before you load me into the server then? But ok. Made my character nice looking asian girl and went on with it. And boy did I have fun. If fun equals a rage session with the biggest amount of lag on the lowest possible settings.I didnt say this but before heading into the game I lowered all settings to the lowest point which is... NORMAL. Normal. ing really? Ok you might not understand this but it has all the graphical settings but only these stages Normal &gt High &gt Highest. No Lowest or Low. Alright no problem or atleast it wouldnt be if the server itself which is focused on germany which is where I am coming from wouldnt lag just as well.And so I raged out of it took a good 30 minutes to calm down from waiting for 7 hours to install and 1 hour of rage and went into the Singleplayer. I am a gamehistory guy so I keep on listening. Boom we steal cars. Ok. Interesting. But the lag hits the fan again. I tried it a few times looking at settings and all but no. It just didnt want to stop. It came to a point of the game crashing on me and I had to wait 6 minutes for the Task Manager to show up. What happened then blew my ing mind.Now for the next part you need to know the following. I am using Firefox. Sometimes Firefox gives me a ton of lag. And that is when it hits 2 million on the process. GTAV hit 1 million and gave me more PC lag than Firefox ever did in 100 sessions.Now what is the point of this review? Well. The game is good. But if you only meet the minimum requirements you cannot play this game. It doesnt matter how good you think your PC is or if they tell you that you are able to run it You cannot play it.

review: My only real issue is that Rockstar social club keeps FORCING me to restart steam in online mode and pretend I want to play their stupid multiplayer version just to double check that I actually bought the game It pretends there's a connectivity issue but the simple fact is that it shouldn't be trying to connect to Rockstar's servers at all when Steam Rockstar Social Club and the game launcher ( scOfflineOnly) are all set to offline mode. I find being lied to for the purpose of backdoor DRM objectionable (particularly when they're deliberately preventing me from using software I PAID to use whenever I want) and wish I had never paid for it. As long as Rockstar insists on crippling offline play because "muh (unused) features" I won't be buying another one of their games. Also I'm 90% confident they fake connectivity issues to force people to download updates and prevent them using older versions of the games which means they're surreptitiously communicating with software they're running in the background. I just can't support a company that uses the same reviled tactics as malware distributors.

review: I've owned this game since it's release on the PlayStation 3 and I've loved it all the way through the PlayStation 4 and the PC. Rockstar outdid themselves with the development of this game and the story was decent enough for me to complete on both consoles but became super predictable once I came around to playing it on PC. GTA Online has always been a major point in this game and it shows with all the content added through updates (thank god it's not DLC you gotta purchase).The multiplayer was pretty fun even before any big updates were released for it but as time passes people have been reporting of hackers/modders that spawn and give money to other players just to ban them and it gets even worse when it comes down to people needing to spend cash to recieve tons of in game money. Players have complained that earning money through missions heists and even the CEO missions is a very slow process. There have even been some cases where people take weeks and even months out of their time to earn enough in game cash to purchase a yacht (which falls around $8 million) just to get banned after they start up the game again.TL DR The story is good enough to try but there are a lot of problems with GTA Online and Rockstar stealing people's money with shark cards. Maybe they'll come up with something to fix it in a later update?

review: This game... WOW!Ive put 400 hundred hours onto this game on Console but when i transferred to PC i have put around 125 hours as of this review. My world changed for this game. The graphics much deeply improved with mods everywhere including enhancers and texture packs.Although RP isnt much enforced into this game i love doing it with my friends as i see it as a huge part of the game in my opininon. This is because youve got a Huge city with lots of activities and i believe that RP should be included such as having to eat or real life activities such as Fishing or playing basketball. As of this review a casino update is being speculated which i assure my self and many others are looking forward to. I hope this brings in an option allowing you to gamble and play casino games with and against friends!Recently with the New update (The executives and criminals) the features of this DLC are many things that have been daunting my mind and they are now reality. Huge fricking yachts that are just badass in every aspect and my new favourite The Organization. This allows you and your friends to be in a official team that brings a variety of perks as well as a nice even variety of missions and game modes including my favourite Yacht piracy. Heists Always struggling to find that 4th person.. Weve been there. This update was delayed time and time again until it was finally released earlier this year. It brought a HUGE variety of things to the table New guns vehicles clothing equipment and of all The heists them selves. These missions give the oppurtunity of you and your friends teaming up in a group of four and completing a series set up missions for the big finale. Despite some set ups being a pain i can assure the pay outs are very rewarding.This game was released 2 years ago and it is still very popular and well played BUT there have been periods at time where the playerbase has just died.I highly recommend this game as it has SO much to do with a brilliant story hundreds of features and an epic online mode.Sadly im going to end this review on a bad note...Unfortunately hackers and modders are ruining the Online mode of the gane which destroys the thriving players and community of this game.

review: Grand Theft Auto V ReviewTL DR multiplayer isn't very good but the singleplayer is definitely worth it. Maybe wait for a sale though because $75 USD is fairly expensive.I have played this game a lot across three seperate platforms. PS3 Xbox 360 PS4 and now PC. So up top I do not recommend you buy this game if you're just playing multiplayer. I played the multiplayer a lot on console and I can't say it's worth it. I've also read plenty of stories about Rockstar's awful Anti Cheat system that takes money from innocent players so no I don't believe you should get this game for the multiplayer.The singleplayer is a different story. Everything from the writing to gameplay is nearly perfect. The main three characters are funny psychopaths that you somehow end up liking and the gameplay between the three really does feel different. Each one has different skills different houses and different vehicles and they're all great.The story is a lot of fun and can be pretty emotional at times. Most of the famous Heists are really amazing definitely some of the best heists in video game history.I played this game with a Duelshock 4 controller but I did play about an hour with my keyboard and in my opinion the keyboard controls suck. I would recommend playing with a controller.That's all you need to know. Didn't talk about the flaws because there really aren't many of them but even though the game is amazing the price is very steep. Wait for a sale if you don't think it's worth the $75 USD.I would recommend.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The story mode is pretty enjoyable for a single time lateron replaying it its just predictable and repetitive even if some things change. But it's just little things not big things because everything just ends up to the same ending.The online mode is a nightmare you enjoy it until it gets repetitive and grindy for you. All the money you earn from jobs last only for one purchase or purchases that let you continue (that deplete your bank account so it's pretty pointless to grind jobs etc.) The online mode itself marks you as a 'free 2 play' like in Team Fortress 2 even if you bought the game (or you lucky devil received it for free) until you buy any shark card at least above 500 000 1 000 000$ and make a profit changing purchase like getting a bunker. But it still is repetitive but with higher profits that probably will get you going until you have enough. As a past modder I can confirm that modding money online actually brings you fun in online.For the clarification i did not "cage" anyone in public sessions (despite i've been victim of that once) annoyed anyone or killed people with cheats I only cheated money for my own profit and reason to play this bloody game.Why would modding bring you fun you ask.The answer is that it unlocks new possibilities for you to take part of like gunrunning airfreight and other cool things but being enforced to buy shark cards kills the fun you could have if R* wouldnt be a greedy cow despite earning lots of money from first week of original 2013 GTAV release on consoles resulting the company gain 2.1B $ within few days of release!I'd extremely recommend waiting for a GTAV sale before you buy it it's not worth buying it full price if the developers dont accept it enough. (if you're getting it for online mode of course)If you're getting GTAV for the story then buying it full price could be worth it. Story mode has a lot of mods to offer and it's way more fun than GTAO.Conclusion Fun game for first several hours then gets repetitive and makes you less likely to play it.Not worth full price.Pay2win. (most hated "feature)Edit I think rockstar made a sale to counter my review

review: Since they treat this game like two entirely separate games in one (GTA V and GTA Online) I'll review mainly the online mode seeing as it's the only thing they really care about putting time and effort into these days since it's probably easier for them to milk the microtransactions that are "Shark Cards" than release any sort of singleplayer expansion.If you play it without "buying more money" and mainly co op with friends you'll find it incredibly boring and repetitive and it'll take you forever for you to get basically anywhere since it takes around 20 so minutes to make around $20 000 and everything that's worth buying is millions upon millions of dollars.I don't play public lobbies so I can't make use of any of the CEO or biker expansions but really the "Go here blow up this vehicle pick up the box drive back" missions are a small price to forfeit for avoiding getting banned from some script kiddies messing with your account.Missions will always come down to which ones you can effeciently complete quickly and for a lot of money the heists are "okay" but getting people together for them is a pain if you don't play with strangers and they really feel like they were just slapped in so the community would stop complaining about no heists for online.Overrall just a really mediocre experience in my opinion can't recommend it.

The missions are very repetetive and boring. It's disappointing. They also banned mods in singleplayer recently so not only are they determined to avoid expanding the singleplayer experience they want to make sure no one else does it either.

review: Hey friends GTA V it's a nice game but it's not so cool like San Andreas or Vice City. For sure the graphics are stunning and this game have a better gameplay than the previous ones but it's not so addictive. I'm a "old" classic player so what I really enjoy is the offline version and not the online. So I will only comment about Story Mode because I don't have experience in the online version.So what I don't like in this game? The story behind the game is just a total disaster. Basically you can play with three different guys one young and cool and two boring middle aged criminals (i'm not young btw).The first problem is the characters are always arguing with everyone. Franklin is always arguing with his aunt and with street friend Lamar. Michael is always arguing with all his family and Trevor. And Trevor is all the time arguing with everyone specially with Michael. When you reach 50% of the game it's impossible to continue listening Trevor complaining about what Michael did 10 years ago. Always crying like a baby about the same history. It's just boring annoying and depressing.The protagonists are even all the time arguing with the supporting characters so don't expect make and lose "friends" in this story. They already hate each other. So you will make jobs (missions) to guys like Dave Steve and Devin but you will never sympathize with them. Honestly that's not very exciting... Could happen some times but not all the game. But... worst you will make dozens of missions and you will earn ZERO. Yes you read well... some guy will give you a mission and then you don't have a real reward (or you get some ridiculous reward). You will kill guys and earn zero steal cars and earn zero chase cars and earn zero kidnap people and earn zero. Why? Well the support characters will just tell you they will "pay later" have no money or some other stupid things. So you only will be rich in the last mission (the irony) what means you will not get real fun buying things and expending your money. Some missions (too much examples) are just boring like get some specific car and put it in other place so sometimes you will just drive to north and to south and it's all. Also the story mode is really short and easy so don't expect have lots of fun.Just to finish don't expect to create some street gang and make your own money in the Los Santos criminal underworld. Rockstar have other ideas to "Grand Theft Auto" like lost time playing golf tennis or watch tv (wtf?). Seriously? C'mon guys... if I want to play tennis I would buy a real tennis simulater and not GTA. In GTA I want a criminal simulator can you do that?So GTA V got the best graphics and gameplay ever but the story and missions are a big big big disappointment. If you are "greener" maybe this game looks like the best experience ever but it's not. It's sad because the map graphics and gameplay deserves better.

review: Poor Management Overshadowing an Otherwise Enjoyable GameI've not spent massive amounts of time on GTA V. I got through the story on PS4 and it was great so I got it here to play online with my friends. In this past week we've decided to come back to the game for a fun time and now one of them has been banned for no reason. To my understanding it's related to just being in the same game as anyone who has "hacked" or altered the game or whatever so now there's many players in the same boat. And what does Rockstar do about this? Nothing. Once you're banned or suspended until a certain date they won't accept tickets for these individual cases and when you try to contact the support Twitter account they advise you to send a ticket. It's a vicious cycle and poor management by the customer service side of things.Overall definitely play the single player story. It's a tonne of fun in this large sandbox world the game has. Don't touch the online part of things until these issues are sorted. Also if you've had a similar situation to this you should absolutely bring it up here or in any way that Rockstar will see it. Hopefully we can get these unnecessary bans and suspensions reverted so we can have our things back. Thanks for reading

review: BOYCOTT THIS GAME. My friend who spent several hundred dollars on this game got temporarily banned for 1 month made a support ticket to find out why he was banned and asked if he can keep his in game money that he earned from in game purchases. He was told yes today he got unbanned he played for 3 hours and next thing he knows he is banned again this time permanently. So in conclusion BOYCOTT THIS GAME. So many hours and so much money spent and it's all gone to waste.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There is alot to say about GTA Online but I'll sum it up with this It should be better. It should be much better. The GTA series has been a staple in the industry with a reputation for good design and cheap fun. That all changes now. Now I see the GTA series as a goddamn chore.The single player game is good. One of my favorites for the year it came out.The online portion is what I came back for. It's bad. It's designed poorly on purpose. The devs want to manipulate new players into spending extra money on the game to avoid the grind. The problem is all of the deeper gameplay in GTA Online is PURE GRIND. Start of the game huge grind to get your first business. Then you realize you bought the wrong business and you're actually LOSING money. Then you grind to get a better business. Then you grind once that business is up and running. Then you buy more businesses. Then you continue grinding. It never stops.Without spending money an invdividual player progresses at a snail's pace. It can be punishing at times. And you do not feel like your time is well spent. This is notwithstanding the other players who are ENCOURAGED to interrupt your progress. There are plenty of edgelords that will grief you but the game encourages regular players (who otherwise wouldn't grief) to go out of their way to ruin your fun. I have to make this more clear THIS GAME ENCOURAGES OTHER PLAYERS TO RUIN YOUR PROGRESS AND SPOIL YOUR FUN. It can be very discouraging disheartening and downright depressing at times. Revenge can be sweet but simply not sweet enough.In conclusion this game has ruined the reputation of Rockstar in my eyes. I loved their products from GTA III to The Warriors to that stupid Ping Pong game. They made great games. Now I see Red Dead 2 on the horizon and I encourage people NOT to buy it. I simply cannot trust them anymore. I feel somewhat betrayed. Rockstar has made enough money they made it clear they don't care about the gaming experience or their consumers anymore. They should stop making games. More importantly people should stop buying them.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As someone that has played GTA 5 since its released way back when Xbox 360 was still a thing (was it ever) I have been very disappointed with the new sign in system. I am one of those players that like to enjoy the game in single player fashion every now and then as a method to reminisce. Despite this I was disgusted to find that for single player I have to create an account (despite my already existing steam account). I don t have the patience or the time to go through an account recovery process especially when there is absolutely no reason to take a wonderful game that can be played as a quick action sandbox by players. The game looks like a data cash cow now without any of the real value that is expected to be added to a GTA game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V as a single player game has it's ups and downs all over the place. When it comes to the writing some bits are funny as with Rockstar tradition. The game also looks fine no matter what platform it is on. For the gameplay it is still Grand Theft Auto and not much has changed since the days of top down view but it definitely has some welcomed features such as being able to hold more than one type of pistol rifle and so on whereas from Vice City to 4 only one weapon of a certain class could be held. Other small tidbits like being able to turn on and off the lights of a car or even activating the roof of convertibles is the small touches that make the game more interesting than the rest. The map is also huge but it is also mostly pointless since only 25% of it is an actual city where the rest are just mountains country side and nothing worth driving over.Everything else is either lame missions that makes Grand Theft Auto 1 missions look good or gameplay and mechanic wise choices that make the game feel inferior to other games in the series. Notably the lack of 6 stars and even evading the cops themselves is more of a chore than it was in GTA 4 that did it much better. With the next gen version of the Director Mode allows some funny shenanigans to be put into play and even getting to play in first person if that is your thing. The iron sights could have been better but it is thankfully optional and not forced into the game.To put it best it is playable but I would not pay full price for it. However there is the online... oh boy GTA Online is the worst "casual" game in existence. It is such a grindfest since it's launch in 2013 having microtransactions to boot (even to the point where Rockstar has a overpriced starter pack) griefers that get more punishment than games with actual invasions *coughDarkSoulscough* but hackers somehow avoiding the ban hammer despite Rockstar's attempts to clean house (although websites that claim to add funds into your account STILL EXIST) and Rockstar's greed that singlehandedly killed the feeling of beating enough missions and races so you can enjoy your prized vehicle or apartment. It is overall not a fun game to play period unless you have (a) dedicated friend(s) to play with which makes leveling up and getting reputation points and cash easier than playing in a invite only session since playing in a solo lobby that you are not allowed to customize (unlike GTA 4) restricts you from doing missions that can be done by yourself.By the way the expansions that are added all for online go completely against GTA tradition (at least in the later years)... flying cars the stunt races the batmobile third rate throwbacks to other better Rockstar Games (Smuggler's Run) and the heists which is the most overhyped feature in a video game period. There are also RNG missions that can only be done in a public lobby... it's a Recipe for Disaster.Worst of all the PC version tends to crash whether you move the mouse or even fire a gun or even trying to start up the game. The PC version also requires a Social Club account just to play offline. You only need to sign in once but just to play a game with zero updates to the campaign because Rockstar wants to profit from whales and sheep of gamers who think online multiplayer is the future of gaming.Playing on console 360/PS3 or Xbox One/PS4 would be a better investment as even Take Two is against mods that don't even effect Rockstar's precious online component. I would rather buy a game that will work when I put in the disc even if I need to install it than to be online to install a game pretty it up with mods but still experience crashing because Rockstar apparently can't optimize their games for The older 3D era of GTA games that you can buy that have SecuROM DRM have better optimization than a modern AAA game. Quite sad.Scratch that buying the older GTA games on Steam albeit censored and removal of certain songs would guarantee a better experience than from a company who has made way better games with actual content instead of bloated prices that has several paywalls behind it.And finally the overuse of clickbait and dubstep on how to get easy cash and RP from the cancerous section on YouTube has also influenced my overall rating of the game. Buy it on console if you must but don't bother on PC unless you can bypass the crashing and the hackers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Now seriously what has this game become?From a somewhat realistic game it went to a pure carnage filled game with flying rocket cars and motorcycles.I remember the days when i sat infornt of my Playstation playing GTA2 and that game was better than GTA (Multiplayer) these days.Don't get me wrong the singleplayer still captures the essence that GTA used to be but in contrast to the multiplayer I have no idea what this game has become. I know and respect the way game developers have to update a game like this with new features to keep it alive but why the hell does it need a rocket powered flying motorcycle that can shoot rockets? Or a flying delorean? The game went from GTA (Grand Theft Auto) to GFA (Grand Flying Auto). This a excrement ton of vehicles having the same max speed (I get the balancing reason but cmon..) and tons of tons of hackers who drop you money and even tho you report it you will get punished by Rockstar by just ripping all your money out of your bank multiple updates after you have apperantly "cheated" by getting moneybags drop from hackers you basicly cant avoid but just not play in public lobbies. But obviously i do not only see the bad side about this game. It really is giant in option Tons of diverse vehicle sea air and land. (I really dislike the newer generation of OP flying and shooting vehicles) Incredible amount of missions. (Community and Rockstar made) Really huge map for you and your friends to enjoy some stupid times. Many businesses to run. (Tho rather repetetive) Singleplayer campaign is really good!I just wanted to leave my opinion about this game here and I really don't give a damn if anyone reads this. But if anyone actually read this congratulations and i genuinely hope i didn't bore you to death with it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Absolutely Terrible!I played GTA Online for about 500 hours and during a mission i was doing with friends i was kicked off Banned for 30 days and had my 500+ hours character deleted (with about 25 million earned on that character from Jobs and heists etc.). They emailed me sand said I was hacking cheating or otherwise broke the terms of service. I have never installed any mods cheats or hacks for GTA V ever Period. I called suppost several times and was literally hung up on over and over without anyone even listening for 1 second to anything i had to say. I read the terms and services they have it written in their policy that if you even connect to the server for GTA Online you are basically already in violation because they instantly reserve the right to ban or delete anyone if they affect anyone's online experience regardless of what the affect is or how minor it is. For instance it's fully within the policy to be able to ban a person and delete their character if they have a bad connection to the server for just a moment and cause a lag spike that affects the players on the same server. I dunno if that's what happened to me I had lag semi regularly when i played but if it was that's even more reason not to play this game. And then today i just heard they banned all mods and cheats etc even from single player so now all the Youtube Channels with the crazy mods will be done even thought i don t play this game anymore i sometimes like those videos.Take Two and Rockstar are a bunch of money grubbing s don't buy this game.

review: If you're looking for a game with one of the best campaigns since Grand Theft Auto San Andreas then this is for you. The game is simply a masterpiece which is why I recommend it. That's where my recommendation ends. If I could split my review into SP vs Online I would.I have over 440 hours in this game probably another 300 hours on the PS4 version prior to arriving to PC. Many of these hours were spent on GTA Online.Myself and three other friends would create a Crew Server and play immune to the griefers. Just free roam around and play the Rockstar created missions. We created this persona around this "Unsuspecting Van" the name of our crew. Like a crack team of idiots unprofessional to the core.All that frivolity came to a screetching halt on March 4th 2017 at about 11 45 PM PST.Nearly all of the new content since Heists has required to be done in Public lobbies. Our once safehaven of getting all of the game's content within the confines of our crew/friends only lobbies was removed. We were forced into the detritus that makes up most of GTA Online. Griefers and modders mainly. We accepted this as inevitable to make stuff like motorcycle gangs make sense and for CEO contraband thefts/deliveries to not be ridiculously easy. We even started contributing to the game in the form of Shark Cash cards. Between myself and my three friends we probably dropped over 600 US dollars in Shark Cash both for entertainment and to be able to have the infrastructure to support the new content (CEO towers motorcycle clubhouses import/export garages etc)Tonight as we all joined into lobbies to find the least populated one (and then join the friend that found said lobby) to minimize the chance of griefers and modders everything went on as usual. We began to steal CEO contraband prepping to make a delivery with only three to four other individuals in the lobby. During our third delivery something happened. Our worst nightmare so to speak and something we could never fathom.One of our friends incidentally the one who had spent the most on the game "left the server". He was hysterical in our Discord server. He had been banned. Until April 4th. That wasn't the problem the problem was that his character who he spent over 220 hours crafting and playing with had been reset and all of the property he spent hard earned money on had been removed. We have never modded we don't support modders we hate what they do to the game. We used to play in Crew only lobbies for a reason.Tonight we all collectively uninstalled Grand Theft Auto V. A title we have spent a combined total of probably over 3000 hours on and probably around 1000 US dollars across two platforms. There is no way to argue the ban. There is no way of knowing what he was banned for. The rest of us are not banned but have no interest in playing now. An automated system had determined my friend guilty of some crime and all decisions are final. In fact supporting a "ban appeal" trouble ticket at Rockstar cutely is a dead end as they literally throw it into the trash as you press submit with the message "All bans are final." Power trip much? Why does the ban appeal option even exist then?Be very wary of spending your hard earned cash in this game. I finally understand why people mod by the way. After picking up a 30 day ban and more importantly a total character reset my friend has nothing left to lose. What's stopping him from actually modding and being a head until being caught? Nothing. We won't do that though. That'd be against everything we believe in. It's too bad the ban system works like YouTube content ID. Shame on you Rockstar. PS Nice indemnity clause on your EULA Rockstar. literally protecting you from everything.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Keep in mind when I say this i was banned THREE times over FOUR different accounts and that while i only have 7.5hrs on steam its closer to about 400 500 hours overall I first bought the game for PS4 and at the time online wasn't a pay to win how and at the time i genuinely liked the game the Single Player stories were pretty cool too but lets be honest no one cares for campaigns anymore. After playing for about 2 years on the PS4 i finally made the move to swap over to PC MASTER RACE because of a new gaming rig i custom built I bought a pc copy from rockstars website loaded up got into online IMMEDIATELY met with a ban. i didn't even get to do the tutorial for the gun you start with. I tried to appeal because they have a BAN APPEAL section on their forums instant denied even though i was recording and had proof that i wasn't hacking. I said what ever and that what ever was my first mistake. after about 2 weeks i bought another copy off of loaded up again immediately banned. After about a month or two it became on sale on steam i bought it for a lower price and was able to play for about 4 hours no issues I log off and come back on the next day to play for a few hours and ban again. Rockstar refuses to understand my recordings of playing as proof of not hacking and won't claim responsibility for their how of a ban system.

review: Single Player/Story ModeA job well done on part of R* as they have been doing for many of their past GTA games up until this point. This aspect of their games has never ceased to dissappoint me. The character development was on point as well as the overall plot. This was the main reason I had invested into the game to begin with and if you're in the same boat I would recommend it (ONLY ON SALE though since this isn't exactly a new game to begin with).Online/MultiplayerI tried my best to enjoy this part of the game but R* had made it hard for me to justify any reason to really continue playing. I personally felt like this could have turned into something great for everyone but in the end hackers just ended up ruining everything. The fact that most of these hackers reign without consequence is reason enough to stay away from Online in general. However should you find yourself wanting to live the experience free of this insanity "Invite Only" or "Solo" sessions are your only other hope. And if you're lucky enough to have friends join you that could become the redeeming factor of Online I suppose. Other than that there is very little point to playing Online right now as long as hackers remain in control of the majority of servers and little is being done at least to my knowledge to stop it (reporting doesn't seem to help all that much even with proof provided S H O C K I N G). Not to mention there is the potential to get banned even if you happen to be innocent or legit as hackers can still screw you over by dumping modded money or RP (xp) on you involuntarily.Long story short (1) Avoid public lobbies if you're solo (2) you're advised to only play with friends (3) just don't play Online save yourself the trouble and frustration.One more thing everything in Online nowadays is MUCH more expensive than the last gen days (PS3 Xbox 360) to the point where it could take you weeks to months to get what you want legit. Bear that in mind.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The gameplay itself is fun you move around in various machines do insane jumps shoot all around and otherwise defy reason in a visually pleasing way. You might actually be satisfied if you only play the campaign but I actually bought it for the online part to play with friends.First thing you notice in the online mode is the loading screen and I mean you'll have at least full 5 minutes to recall the sound of cassette tape drives. You must keep your eyes on the game as there is a short countdown (at most 15 minutes) before you get kicked for idling but you will get randomly dropped from a session as well so be prepared to see the loading screen a lot. This is especially annoying if you try to do something organized with friends.The heists (gated by a reasonably short prep time if you already have 4 man team) are not really fun to slightly frustrating so you don't really do them for the little monetary rewards but as a distraction while your staff produces a bit of money. And you need a lot of money to afford anything interesting.Anyway after few hours you will nurture the masochistic tendencies to like the endless grind interleaved with colorful loading screens. Avoid it if you can.

review: Unfortunately everything people are saying about the game is true as far as the multiplayer. Here is the ***IMPORTANT* Info that you need to know***!!***The game's netcode is written... so terribly that not only can people cheat. They can see your info. Your IP address. They can even mess with your game. They can DDOS you and worse. I killed a player in the game and they told me to let them kill me or they would ( i can't remember the phrase they use) any way I said no and they screwed my game up. I don't know to what extent they can upload files to your computer. But risking having you PC hacked just to play a game isn't worth it. This is due to rockstar making too many things client side. Because they want to save money on how many servers they have to buy.*Other exploiters are just there to ruin your experience. And at this point you run into one on EVERY server you will join. If you join one and there isn't any one exploiting... don't worry give it a few minutes and one will join. They make the game unplayable they will just constantly make you explode. Ruin your vehicles you have bought... mess up missions you are playing.. etc. Some exploits follow you even onto other game sessions. *It seems like everyone EXCEPT the cheaters are the ones that get banned. People get banned for no reason ( possibly because hackers have put files on their computer) There was an exploit hackers used changing your gun skin that got players permanently banned. So just playing the game risks you losing your ability to play multiplayer ever at this point. Several times warnings have gone out on GTA news sites telling everyone not to play until a bug that gets you banned is fixed. Ridiculous..*Rockstar has the nerve to charge people for in game money when hackers just give themselves as much money as they want. DO NOT BUY THEIR SHARK CARDS!*Rockstar knew that this could happen. They had the same issue with the last GTA game. And decided to use the same style of netcode. This has everything to do with them wanting to save money.* They are so nice to continue releasing content for the game dlc you get for free! Except.. Oh wait it is usually cars that you have to buy with in game money. That takes forever to get ( they want you to buy the in game money with real money) so it basically is payed DLC unless you are a hacker.So basically this comes down to Rockstar being cheap. They didn't want to cough up the money for servers even though they made billions off of the game. If you recently bought the game get a refund if you can. For those who have the game. You can send complaints to Rockstar about their netcode. That they need to use dedicated servers. ( this is completely possible. There is a modding project that allows you to join and create dedicated servers good luck finding players though. )Do not buy this game.It sucks because the game WAS fun. And the multiplayer WOULD be awesome. If it wasn t for these issues.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Just like many others before me I have not played GTA online in half a year. I have been playing GTA online since its first release and I decided to log back in a day or two ago. Little did I know that I would be faced with a "your account has been suspended until June 25" statement along with a reset of my online account. I have tried sending a request ticket but I do not have any hope that they will help me resolve my issue let alone reply back to me and it honestly ruined the positive experience I had with GTA from now on. Do not get me wrong however. The game itself is great in my opinion. The have had very fun experiences with my friends but I do find their customer service and their approach on anti cheating really unfair as I think that those who have been playing innocently have been paying more of the price for what the hackers and modders are doing. This game has so much potential and I really hope to buy GTA 6 if it ever comes out but they really need to improve on their customer services for the sake of those like myself have been playing this game for nearly 5 years just to see their hardwork get deleted in a day. Also while I did have fun with the game and have been a fan of the franchise it has been quite unsettling to see how much of a grind culture the GTA online setting has been progressing towards but other than that and the need to tremendously improve on their customer support the game has been really fun for me while it lasted.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Fancy graphics and high framerate is all this game has to offer. However vapid story mode loss of gameplay elements which were present in GTA IV dumbed down (sorry I mean "assisted") driving mechanics and Online totally negates that. All the latest updates only have content for the multiplayer mode which is not only excluded from singleplayer without any reason but actively kept out of it. The whole game looks like it's oriented towards preschool kids who buy the ingame currency with their mothers' plastic cards. For me it feels like a massive downgrade compared to the amazing GTA IV. With a heavy heart I do not recommend this game.Now Take Two the company owning Rockstar Games has gone too far this time. They have stopped FiveM an alternative multiplayer project without Shark Cards nonsense development in the past they forced RDR V the RDR map conversion project to shut down and yesterday it became public that they threatened guys behind OpenIV into stopping developing and distributing their tool which was essential for a GTA game modding. They don't understand that the modding on PC is what made their games so popular and them so rich and famous. They don't understand that OpenIV has literally nothing to do with all those hackers and cheaters Online is full of. They need to be taught a lesson.

Not even warnings!I had been working on my profile for months and one day I logged in to find that I had been banned for 30 days and my entire account wiped without a given reason. With this I gave up. Rockstar doesn't give two worth of a crap about their player base. It used to be a lot of fun but the game is so riddled with Rockstar isms that it's not worth the money anymore. Your money is better spent in a Pay to win MMO than in this pay to win ban fest.

review: Grade Report Singleplayer AMultiplayer D Side Quests CCharacter Design (Singleplayer) A+Character Design (Multiplayer) D+Customer Service FAlright first off The single player is FANTASTIC.The story is if nothing else above passable. The balance of multiple characters in an overarching plot all of which have their own unique traits quirks and lovable sides that endear the player is amazing. It shifts the tone of the story and the world with each different character fluidly without coming to any harsh breaks.If you're looking for a good GTAV Single Player expierence PLAY THIS GAME.Now let's get to the reason why I can't reccomend this game.Rockstar got greedy.Now the multiplayer is nothing but a grind. The designers and developers are so laser focused on implementing new overly expensive cars in the game to either I don't know pretend their Forza or to give more players an execuse to pay ludicrious amounts of money to fill their garage without having to be creative.There hasn't been a SINGLE DLC to come out for single player. All of the devs' work have been put into their multiplayer side of things and it shows. The multiplayer completely lacks any tone management and you can easily tell that along the way Rockstar forgot what they wanted GTAV multiplayer to be.It's grindy annoying unfun to play and if you ever manage to find someone that'd be willing to play the fun stuff with you (The Heists) you have to wait for hours on end for the loading screens to pass by to set everything up to filter out the newbs and griefers (Whom of which go unpunished constantly) and have to spend millions of dollars just to buy the damn heist itself making the return profit a loss if the host doesn't gobble up 80% of the cut. It's pathetic.This is a prime example of what it looks like when greed overtakes creativity. Study it.
