review: Edit Rockstar got Take Two to allow mods for singleplayer again so good on them. However my negative review still stands for the online portion.However there's still an incredible amount of things that really don't appeal in this game when it comes to the online portion. Let's list off a few things...1. Grinding is extremely tedious. It's like a mini MMORPG but you can also get screwed over at any time. You have to wait till character level 20 to do any Heist and even then you have to get a good apartment/home for it so you'll need a ton of money to do it. Heists make good money but well you can only really reliably do it with friends due to random pubs mostly being extremely terrible.2. EVERY player that isn't a hacker apparently is just basically Trevor. If you even cross paths with players in this game it is highly likely that they WILL kill you and blow up your vehicle. The game is only bearable in solo or friends only sessions but...3. In order to do anything that makes money you must do it in a public session. Apart from Heists you have to do everything in a public session. CEO missions are extremely lucrative especially if you have some friends to do it with but there will be a humongous target on your back that everyone will come over to shoot. Everything in this game is designed to be one huge grind that is made worse by the game's community.4. Hackers and Modders are pretty rampant in the game. I've never actually come across hackers myself however I tended to stick with non public gaming sessions. Did you know that a hacker can get YOU banned by putting tons of money into your account? Talk about a kick in the 5. Shark Cards. Remember how I said that it's incredibly hard to make money in this game safely and reliably? Well you actually do have a way... by spending REAL money to get in game money! So yeah an extremely toxic community that would rather blow you up even in your own apartment than let you have some peace combined with the fact that CEO stuff can't be done except in public servers and you have yourself quite the business model. You WILL play the online you WILL see how infuriating it is to make any sort of money and you WILL be extremely tempted to spend real cash on in game cash to get everything. Heck there's even a radio advertisement in the game that references the shark cards. Then let's just say you buy something with that money. Surprise! Since everything is so expensive you'll likely have to put down even MORE money to get more things you want. More houses? Exotic cars? Helicopters or Jets? Yup all of that cost a pretty penny in the game.Just go live out your life and you'll be playing a far better version of GTA 5. Minus the cop chases of course I would hope.

review: Let me give you a quick lowdown of GTA and the history of GTA.GTA was released on PC fairly late I think we all know this. The online was meh but it was always meh. Free updates is okay but hey you know free is free. however there's a twist with this. Where as a big game like Battlefield 4 back in its hayday DLC wasnt free. however paying for DLC would certainly cost less than GTA's proposed updates. You pay $20 get content. Simple. GTA you need to grind. You will not advance in the game until you grind. You must grind. If you dont want to grind you have to shovel cash into Rockstars pocket. This will only get you the barebones of what you want.Even then online is a hellhole. Most of everyone said " paying for cash" (for good reason) and have gotten money from scripters who cheat in cash. And even then scripters run rampid and normally unopposed. They dont have any retribution for banning people no backlash for anything.to simply put it GTA O is a cool concept yes. But milks the fact you the person who enjoys the content of GTA O Also doesnt have the time to farm in GTA O. So you're more likely to pay or try to find a scripter who may potentially ban you instead of well. Grinding. Grinding is terrible. It's hair pulling annoyance. It's repetitive. Every issue with it is just obvious.While I do applaud the content of GTA O it simply plays you the player like a fiddle if you want to play it "Legit" If you dont? You risk getting banned. Even if you get the cash from a scripter and dont report it there's still a tiny chance of getting banned permanently from the games servers. Which they've changed their policies ridiculously.Once again GTA O is just a of cool content and terrible management. Now I will say this. I wouldnt mind paying $20 towards the game if the game gave me more money and not just a 3% of any money I need to accomplish anything. I think we all would. Even then the game is poorly optimized I'm told.Singleplayer is cool storys neat all wraps up. If you want my advice though Just play Singleplayer with mods. We fought Two Take hard to get Open IV back (which enables you to swap between normal GTA and Modded GTA to prevent getting banned in GTA O for mods) Because singleplayer with mods is more enjoyable than online. Online is impossible to enjoy anymore.Dont support Rockstars bad habbit. Dont buy shark cards. If you dont pay them money in micro transactions they'll either abandon them Or improve them.

review: This game has a major issue with GTA Online the single player is great so if you only plan to buy it for that then go for it as its worth it. The Online on the other hand is simply poor mainly because the game is infested by people who enjoy ruining the game for others obviously I am talking about hackers they're in most of the lobbies and just ruin the game for others. Rockstar has done hardly anything to stop this and as a result its just gotten worse. GTA Online is great when you find a lobby without someone hacking but nine times out of ten you will always be in a lobby with one. It's a shame because GTA Online would be so much fun if everyone just played fairly and didn't resort to cheating. Until Rockstar fixes this issue I would not recommend this game. But again if you only plan to play the single player then buy this game as that portion of the game is fantastic.

review: Gameplay Campaign 7/10Gameplay Online 6/10Graphics 8/10Matchmaking 0/10 GTA 5 have been out for console for quite a while now and yet the online systems seems really unpolished and bad for one it is impossible to search for a race with the settings you would like and when you finally find one and complete the race you will be asked between 6 random races replay or go to open world mode. and if a majority want something different than you they still throw you into that game where you need to go through a loading screen which by the way take ages. I spent the last 30 minutes trying to get into a race without being picky so the first race I get into I wait 5 minutes for the game to start and when we finally start it's just bumper cars and can barely be called a race when we are done with that people vote for open world and I have to through another long loading screen after which I load another race which has horrible settings as well IMHO after that were done 30minutes had past.TT DR 30minutes spent 10min loading screen/finding a lobby 12min waiting in lobby and 8min racing/bumping into each other.

review: In all honesty this game is not worth it's price maybe... $5 if I want to be nice.. $10. It's just.. the only things good about this game is MAYBE the interesting character customization and the single player storyline. That's it.You're very likely to get banned over nothing as the bots responsible for banning cheaters and hackers are horribly made and if you DO get banned you'll never see the light of day in this game as the company themselves will just throw your ticket in the trash and run away with your precious money that you spent on this game. And yes they'd rather lose their fans than actually own up to their mistakes and fix it.The community itself is also horrible I've never seen such an anti user friendly game until now. You could be someone who just started 2 seconds ago and already get killed by some player for no damn reason at all. Like no one gives a flying who you are and they'll let you know in a heartbeat.To be honest you're better off pirating this game than actually buying it it's not really worth your money at all. If you do want to support the people responsible for the game and not the company look them up and see if they have a patreon DO NOT support the company itself.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After playing for about a month with friends and family one of the members of our group got an automatic ban which was not warranted(we don't cheat or mod or grief). One day we were driving through town and our car hit an invisible barrier and 10 minutes later the driver of the car was booted out of the game with a ban. Autorespones explained that it was automatic with no human oversight permanent and non appealable.We all had by this time paid for the heist pack and a couple shark cards for fun stuff. Once we saw how Rockstar had handled the customer support side of this issue we all decided to stop playing the game We're in agreement as well that we won't be purchasing any future titles by Rockstar as well which ends an incredibly long string of purchases.It's a shame to be honest. We were perfectly happy playing within the game's rules while spending more money than was responsible on the online portion which their flawed and unsupervised automated chat system put an end to.TL DR buy only if you're ok with the chance of gameplay being taken away from you without legitimate reason resulting in wasting the money you've spent on it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Alright Grand Theft Auto V (Online) is a great game. But it will be just for about 300 hrs. Why you might ask? Well let me tell you First you wanna buy every single vehicle you probably know from the real world. You are playing with your friends and doing heists or races or something like that. It takes quite a while to do if you are a starter but that will be fine. In the open world you'll get "trolled" or just killed by higher level players with their expensive jets and so on. That really gets annoying and you just want to have a lobby without these kind of players in it because you can't do any of the free roam missions without getting blown up. That sucks because you just spent money and time into the game and won't be rewarded. Now you can say but that is what Rockstar wants. Yes they do. They want you to fail at making money in the way of grinding endless amounts of hours just to make you buy a shark card for real money. And they will continue to make everything more expensive so you don't even try grinding and take the easy way out buying a shark card. That is what the game has become. Micro transaction. In the end I just want to tell you that you can do so much in this game but it will get boring really quick if your friends are getting tired of this game because they want to do other stuff not just grinding. I hope I could help you!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Gta online is filled with hackers and very incompetent people.I found hackers extremly common and heists extremly hard to do not becausde they were hard but because most of the players failed the missions. I'm unsure if I should rate this game based on the multiplayer experience though as the main game is pretty spot on. The single player is as they say where it's at.To concludeOnline is quite rubbishWhy? Extremly grindy it'll feel like an mmo pretty quickly unless you wait for Rockstar to release an event that showers you with gold for no effort but that ain't fun. Hackers sadly this game seems right filled with the buggers. I'm unsure if I'm just unlucky or I'm right but I found them everywhere.+ Heist Variety I felt the heists were pretty rad. Once I got a solid team they were quite fun.Singleplayer is awesome+It has so much more content. And yes the online is filled with hundreds of hours countless players organizations and butt loads of shazzam you feel overwhelmed. But I felt the content didn't have bite to it. It felt so lacking like I ordered a BLT and all I got was damned lettuce. I mean seriously GTA Online is lettuce and lettuce is one of those things you just don't eat alone it's a garnish at best. I mean come on what sort of tail end orders a BLT with only lettuce? What sort of sadism would allow a person to walk from their house to your shop and order a BLT hold the bacon and tomato.A psychopath.In conclusion I have come to the proposal that GTA Online is lettuce and GTA 5 Single Player is a wholesome Bacon Lettuce and Tomato sandwhich.

review: WARNING DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF YOU PLAN ON PLAYING GTA ONLINE MULTIPLAYER READ BELOWI have never wrote a review before for any game however never have I felt more compelled to share my thoughts of this particular game. I'll start off by saying the singleplayer hands down is amazing the world the environment and the heists are fluid and extremely entertaining. Awesome characters from three different backgrounds and three different stories that mash into one. Definitely worth the 20 bucks I paid for the singleplayer.Now the multiplayer. The multiplayer is in one word an extreme GRIND. All the major DLC releases include 2 things a new way to make money and awesome new vehicles to purchase. The new ways to make money are through businesses and the barriers to entry are stupid expensive. The upgrades you can put on your businesses can cost to be more than the business itself. Rockstar does this to leave you with two options GRIND 100+ hours or pay actual US currency for ingame currency through shark cards. Shark cards can give you that vehicle you wanted as soon as possible without any work just 100 dollars for 8 million in game or something like that.Now modding I'm not against modding however I did not mod myself (not even the singleplayer). Modding gets you whatever whenever you want. Skip the grind skip the shark cards you can do awesome stuff modding and in my opinion it increases the longevity of the game. Rockstar has made it very clear no modding is allowed in any way shape or form. Modding can result in a temp or perm ban which is basically because they want to squeeze every dollar they can out of their player base for those shark cards. Yesterday I was in the midst of a supply run when a modder teleported the whole lobby into a bus and told us we were going on a "magic school bus trip". Just some dude having his fun with the lobby we were doing some crazy like zooming across the entire map in 4 seconds and dropping nukes like it was Nagasaki below. I thought when he hits the ground I would exit and continue my supply run and I did exactly this. This morning I was hit with a temporary ban and a full reset my next ban would be permanent. I had no mods nothing installed on my computer just discord running in the background. You can and are likely to get banned for not doing anything wrong just being present in a modded lobby (which is every other session) can get you in trouble. I read up about this in the forums and Rockstar will not appeal any bans they don't care if you were modding or not. Many people had 500+ hours in the game playing legitimate and still get banned thank god I didn't invest that much time in the multiplayer only to be wasted away. Rockstar clearly has a flaw in their system that probably won't get any attention due to the fact RDR2's release date is approaching and Rockstar could care less about about appealing unjustified bans.tl dr singleplayer gud multiplayer is ruined by Rockstars greed and ban system
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I don't know how to tell you this. This game is both fantastic as all get out and absolutely terrible at the same damn time. Moments of real tension and amazing action packed nail biting finishes ... and complete boring drudgery and "modders" (see god mode cheaters who ruin the game everyway you could possibly imagine) who will ruin any sense of monetary progression and skillful accomplishments.I say this because playing single player is only like the first 10% of this game's total experience all the other unlocks are online and online is a total show 90% either you are gaming the system to be in a online session with maybe only friends grinding missions against AI with near perfect aim getting griefed for hours on end in a public session by cheaters or just other players who have vehicles you can't possibly hope to take out without help (which you are very unlikely to get) because you had the audacity in their minds to be "a jerk" by playing the object Rockstar set out before you or experiencing the rare moment when others play fair even as they come after their opposing objective to your making pretend criminal cash and somehow you succeed or you don't and don't get mad about it this is how the game was meant to be by Rockstar because they set the mission objectives that way.I don't think I can reccomend this frustrating experience to friends despite the rare amazing moments that as time goes on seem to be less and less in this game despite more and more amazing content that doesn't seem to be designed with in mind how the game is actually played in public servers.

They make millions on their sharkcards and still they can't deal with the cheating. Over the last day the servers have been awful yet from this company that gets praise they still haven't specified what this issue is and when it will be fixed.This game is such a mess but does offer some hope for future releases. If only they can get the basics right!

My phone gets a notification of a email from rockstar saying my account has been perma banned. I double check that I removed the mods and indeed I had so then I sumbit a ticket to rockstar. They respond saying bans cant be appealed and if that is true thats just . Anyway I send another ticket. And another. And another. All saying that my account was banned and they cant do anything. review: The amount of effort that went into QA (balance bug fixes netcode server management etc) is close to nil. DC's exploits poor server connections netcode bugs that result in crashes getting stuck in black or white screens during load and having to force restart the game hackers glitch exploiters expensive weapons and vehicles that exist only to grief other players to frustrate people into buying Shark Cards terrible transaction logic (when you purchase A for your car and then purchase B you have to rebuy A to equip it and no discount/refund is given for the transactions) I can honestly go on and on and on about how poorly GTAO was designed and implemented. When the game was designed to prioritize micro transactions over everything else you will not have fun with it. I am writing this as I quit trying to play GTAO after 10+ "Program has stopped responding" crashes "Lost connection to servers kicking to GTA 5" error messages and game loading to white/black and nothing else while trying to play with my girlfriend. For the 3 or 4 hours I played I think 1 hour of that was actual game time. If I were to ignore all these issues would I recommend the game? Yes. But they happen in every single gaming session (today being especially worse) that there are absolutely no excuses for the devs.tl dr if you can deal with terrible quality for a finished product go ahead and buy it. By no means is it an unfun game just very frustrating when the devs can give less about common QA issues and would rather make "features" that promote Shark Card sales.

review: Okay my first review was pretty much satire so let's do actual serious one so people understand is this game worth it or not? Averagely yes. It's alot of fun especially with friends. But I'm talking about online not story. To be honest I haven't even touched story if we don't count obligatory prologue. But most people are here for the online anyways. So where we begin? Pros Gameplay Gameplay is straight forward. You live in city of Los Santos fictional city on West California. You are going to create your character with some random clothes and starting skills. You spawn to city without apartment car or anything. So you're vulnerable to attack unless you go to passive mode. Passive mode is status that you can't take damage but you can't hurt anyone either. You can do simple things. You can mess around in freemode go to the missions heists or host then yourself. Or just race with your friends on expensive cars like Grotti X80 Proto. Heists (sort of) I like the heists. Most part. I talk about heist finales. They're most part fun to do and you get alot money from them especially from Pacific Standard. They're innovative and realistic. Unlike Payday 2 if you screw up it's over. You have to quick restart or start all over again. If you quick restart you can't do elite challenges. This is why heists in GTA Online are more rewarding than Payday 2's even though you get less money. But there is another problem with heists that I'm going to cover later. Freemode Freemode is probably funniest part in the game. You can just mess around and do whatever you want. You can get 5 star cops and then get killed by shotgun cop from kilometre away. You can make your own company deliver illegal cargo and get killed by trolling players or just drive around on your car that you wasted 1 million dollars on. Though there aren't alot ways to grind money on freemode it's still fun sandbox to mess around. Other Modes Races are fun but they repeat themself too much. Survival is easy way to improve shooting and to waste ammo. San Andreas Flight School is good way to improve your flying and getting And other modes are decent but cash from them are so low that they're worth even trying.Okay pros are over. Let's get rooooit into the cons! Cons Heist Setups Heist setups are easy way to waste time. In Payday 2 you jump right into action because Bain (aka Payday's Lester) setups everything for you. Medic bags ammo bags keycards and spotters. What does (Creepy Uncle) Lester aka hacker that talks too much do? Absolutely f*cking nothing! You have to do everything by yourself and 3 other crew members that might disconnect anytime so you can waste time and see "Mission Failed" screen. Setups are mostly drive to some location kill some bad guys steal something from them lose cops and deliver that something you stole. Some of them are easy like every Fleeca Job's setup or that one where you have to take pictures but setups like Deliver EMP (isn't hard if your team communicates but if not you're screwed) Steal Truck from SWAT in Pacific Standard or every 5 setups in Series A just to see that heist feeled like those missions with 15k prize money are disappointing and annoying. Also why we have to hack our way in to Fleeca Bank while we could just rush through loud? Performance If someone says GTAV is optimized I could laugh my a*s off. It isn't. I don't have high end PC or anything like that in fact I run NVidia Geforce GTX 750 and Intel Core i5 4460 3.2 GHz with 8 GB RAM but I run most games really smoothly. CSGO maxed over 150fps Payday 2 with mods High 60fps Overwatch Medium High 60fps and even Battlefield 4 Medium 60fps on Siege of Shanghai. But why I keep getting frame drops on worst possible situations possible for example Pacific Standard's bike escape? First 1 2 hours I run game Medium 60fps no frame drops very smoothly with VSync on. Then frame drops came and were none stop even once crashed my game. This is very bad because it looks like I teleport on the map and for me game stutters and freezes. Making game run Direct10 and lowering NVidia Control Panels 3D Settings helped bit but I still keep getting these even without VSync on. I readed some posts online and I found out this isn't my pc fault and actually someone with GTX 970 had same problem. It should be internet either because I use 4G Internet Connection without problems. Trolls People that kill you while moving cargo and then destroy cargo are annoying. Or people that keep killing you all over again because they can. It's funny if it's friend but if not it's not funny.There are more that I would list but you already understand what I mean. Grand Theft Auto V is great game that I fun with friends qhen you play Online. There are alot stuff to do and you won't get bored soon. But if you don't have friends and aren't interested of Story Mode don't buy it. Go play Saints Row instead for story or Payday 2 for online and heists.

If you went to get the $100 shark card ($8 000 000 in game) you could purchase 6 8 supercars/aircrafts/etc. Now a days a supercar can cost damn near 6 million. No one supercar and a little bike is worth $100. I've stopped playing this game. If they updated the shark cards to where the $20 dollar version game 8 million in game and the rest adjusted accordingly I'd play again. Too many new items getting released with no way to keep up unless you make GTA5 a full time job.

review: I ve just started playing this game and I am rather impressed so far this game eats ram and I would suggest closing as much as you can before playing. The missions so far are detailed and the environment is beautiful it really everything you could want from a game that wears the label of GTA. It is the second GTA San Andreas which is a game I love and one that has inspired my interest in technology &amp computing. Rockstar did a better job with the GTA 5 pc port than GTA IV. Rockstar learned their lesson well and produced something beautiful I hope one day I can create something like GTA 5 something different but equally if not more beautiful. In summary this game is good and it would be a unlikely that rockstar would be able to push the wall any further even assuming computer power grows. Some elements could be added to the game but I feel that the choices made on the game where the right ones. I am not one to give 10 ratings but in the case of GTA 5 there are few improvements that could possibly be made to this game. 10/10

review: "Mine 'aint nothin' special but it gets the job done" TrevorWhere to begin?Let's start out with the "hype" around this game. While no game can truely live up to it all this game certainly comes close. The Single Player sorry 'Story Mode' is what you'd expect from a GTA game these days long fun and somewhat captivating. There's some silly moments in it (not quite San Andreas level but pretty close) that keeps the more boring bits interesting and some great chase scenes.While I haven't even came close to completing the game at the time of this 'review' I still feel the game was worth the 39.99 I payed.Now GTA Online Oh boy...It's hard to explain or even define but there's something about Online that makes it addictive. Much like your Skyrims you're constantly wanting to get better stuff. Be that cars boats helicopters jets weapons or clothes you're always after something new.Yes there are "lobbies" with much higher level players in there "destroying" us newer players but they're not that frequent. Even when in one you'll have some enjoyment getting your revenge (or go into "Passive Mode").While I brought the game for the 'Story Mode' I'm finding myself focusing more on the Online play.There's some issues with lobbies randomly being "emptied" (in short you are moved into your own empty lobby due to the Rockstar Servers claiming your rig or connection can't handle the current lobby) but you can still join "Jobs" with others no problem.In short I'd highly recommend this game to pretty much anyone.It's great fun has humour and is excellent value for money.

Unfortunately GTA Online is all wrapped up into the same files. Only a few weeks post release and evidence abounds of thousands of players getting banned for using the new generation of mod content for single player. People getting banned for using a simple Field of View MOD is totally uncalled for. Not supporting the honest efforts of the mod community disgusting. I really want to recommend this game but honestly it will not be fun without mod support. Stick to GTA IV if you enjoy the PC advantage of mod fun.PROS Beautiful game. Truly stunning.Highly enjoyable missions characters and story.Audio is amazing.GTAO is extremely fun even with randoms.CONS Punishes MOD community.

review: WARNING BEFORE BUYING KNOW YOU CAN USE *NO* MODS AT ALL EVER OR YOU ARE BANNED FROM THE ENTIRE ONLINE. Luckily I found THAT out before I purchased it.GOOD WAY TO BURN LEGITIMATE CUSTOMERS!THIS COMPANY SENDS GOONS TO FOLKS HOUSES THAT WRITE MODDING APPSSingle player game is the good part... it's gta if you like that sort of thing then buy it.The SP experience is rather well done and runs okay turn off V sync if you get the laggies (you'll know what I mean). It's a shame this game defaults to vsync on why I don't know. Some people may like it but it causes problems if your system isn't a 3000$ system. Use HALF or OFF for Vysnc.Multiplayer... oh where to start. Huge city with 32 ppl max... yeah ok. Coming from Just Cause 2 multiplayer mod this GTA has absolutely nothing to compare to it except AI in it.I am quite dissapointed by the cumbersome mess that is GTA Online and won't be spending a penny more on this.Thank goodness the community is making a better front end for the multiplayer it's sorely needed.OOPS ROCKSTAR SENDS GOONS AFTER YOU IF YOU MAKE MODDING TOOLS.That's the most messed up thing I've ever heard.No more rubbish from this company on my computer. Now that they've issued a take down notice to OPENIV modding application I can safely delete this waste of space from my hard drive. However if you want to hand feed the greedy devs who hate their customers having free fun with their product IN SINGLEPLAYER then fine instead of buying a house or car IN REAL LIFE WASTE MONEY ON SHARK CARDS. No use the money for another Steam game that you can mod.Besides Beamng.drive's physics are 100x better seriously this game has nothing on it other than some story (which was good) guns and random AI traffic you don't have to self program.If you just like crashing about and making a wreck of things play Beamng.drive as the physics in GTAV are laughable at best in comparison.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto VSingle Player And General OverviewI have been a GTA fan since the very beginning. Unlike most GTA "Fans" coming to GTA V my favourite game in the series was GTA IV not SA. I loved GTA IV and fully 100 percented it and probably put in nearly 300 hours on a single player game without ever modding it I loved it that much. When I first heard about GTA V I was excited to say the least. Excited but skeptical skeptical that they wouldent be able to better IV especially when I learned about the three character story and character changing. Waiting for the PC (superior) release seemed like an eternity. But when it finally came I was blown away. The game is visualy beautiful the world is more alive than the previous versions. The story and the characters were fantastic. The gunplay and first person mode is great it gives a new feeling to a game we are all familiar with. As with GTAIV I will be fully 100 percenting this game as I feel it deserves it. Their are aspects of the game that were definetley better in IV in my opionion. I feel IV &amp V are both masterpieces.Well Done Rockstar whats next?MultiplayerGTA Online COULD be one of the best multiplayer games out there could.The range of activities and the heists are fantastic. Daily challenges random pop up challenges all the diffrent events fantastic.Throw some friends into the equasion and you have even more fun on heists etc.The problem with online the crippling hideous and depressing problem with Online is the Hackers &amp The Modders.Dont get me wrong as a PC gamer we have the power to mod games but Rockstar should have a choice in servers. One for people who want to play vanilla and one for the Modders. "No Mr modder I dont want you to spawn me any vehicle or money as I like to complete a game with skill and feel achievement for what I have done"The hackers jesus christ! Casualy cruising down the road and suddenley "EXPLOSION" oh great I'm dead oh the whole server is dead and now its raining cargo planes and tanks! Oh and I'm dead again!The commuinty is odd. Its 80% bad in honesty. Hackers and modders justifying what they are doing and even legit games begging modders for money then praising the modders! Shows the calibre of gamer when they accept cheaters in a game as they can profit from it. Pathetic!I respect Rockstar as a company keeping the game up to date and giving us free DLC and Additions (I'm looking at you EA &amp Ubisoft)But cmon guys please sort out the hackers at least! Its hard to get excited about a game when you cant play online without the fear of them messing up your game. It sucks to say but I'm almost looking forward to 100 percenting my achievements so I can walk away from the frustration that is GTA Online (Freerider Dave
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Compared to its predecessor GTA IV V to me is a let down in terms of mediocre vehicle mechanics and damage modelling. The physics engine is quite bad compared to Max Payne 3 and Red Dead Redemption those which used the same RAGE engine. If GTA V is still selling up to date it is because the Online portion is constantly getting updated bringing new content and game modes keeping the community alive. The game is fun to play with friends they are the ones make it fun and enjoyable.To speak for the story I only advanced till %18 and I found each mission boring and dull. I am a big fan of Grand Theft Auto series since the 1997 GTA V to me feels very dumb fun and GTA was never meant to be that way if you take a look at the previous titles. The humor is still there but it tells an engaging story it always had for each title. That was not the case with V. I'll pass on story and carry on playing Online until Rockstar stops pushing updates which I reckon will be after the release of Red Dead Redemption 2. Looking forward to the next installment hoping that Rockstar is working on a better project. P.S Creating specific sessions (invite only friends only etc) and connecting to online is an hassle. Did I even mention hackers? Rockstar makes great games but they cannot administrate their online portion.GTA IV ile V'i kıyaslayınca hikaye bakımından yerlerde sürünüyor oyun. Nefret ettiğim araç mekaniklerini ve vasat hasar modellemelerini saymıyorum bile. Rezalet bir fizik motoru Max Payne 3 ve Red Dead Redemption'dan sonra. GTA V sırf bugün hala online özelliği sayesinde yaşayan bir oyun. Yoksa çoktan ölmüştü. Ben de aldım ve hikaye modunu %18'de bıraktım. (Trevor'ın ilk açıldığı görev Johnny'yi öldürdüğü) Bıraktıktan sonra online geçtim. Hemen her gün online oynuyorum. Hikayesi ilerlediğim yere kadar hiç mi hiç sarmadı. Görevler eğlenceli ancak boş. Bir görevi tamamladıktan sonra GTA oynadığımı hissettirmedi oyun bana. '97 tarihinden beri GTA oynarım V GTA tarihinde oynadığım en kötü seri. Aylardır düzeltilmeyen ERR_GFX_D3D_INIT hatası ve ''Alert Your save data could not be loaded from the Rockstar cloud servers at this time. Returning to Grand Theft Auto V.'' hatasını saymıyorum bile. Bu oyun yarı fiyatından daha ucuza satılmadan almayın. Paranızı hak eden bir oyun değil. Rockstar zaten artık hiç bir şeyi hak eden bir firma değil. Hala beta sürümünde anasını sattığımın oyunu. PC'ye geliyor dediler ballandıra ballandıra trailer yayınladılar ettiler elimizde tamamlanmamış bir ürün var amk. Bu eksiklikleri bir yıl sonra filan anca tamamlanır herhalde. Oyunu PC'ye ilk çıkış tarihinde aldığıma pişmanım. İade etme fırsatım olsa ikinci kez düşünmem. Oynadığım en berbat GTA serisi V.

review: This USE to be a good game. GTA III and San Andreas were the first games of the GTA franchise that I ever bought and I thought they were great! Fairly good story only a few bad missions a lot of stuff to do in between and endless hours of fun. Around the time of GTA IV the internet became a place where gaming and player made content were starting to meet and one of the best things we saw was the introduction of Single player modding in the form of LSPDFR.Rockstar since then has Favored microtransactions rather than developing new content. Refused to actually deal with the hackers and instead blamed the modding community for their inability to prevent people from corrupting the multiplayer area (reason why I stopped playing) despite the fact that most if not all modding goes to Single player.Rockstar USE to have a great game. They need to realize they are starting to travel down the same path that Payday 2 Devs did and we can still forgive them if they stop the madness.

Bought it two days ago after a long time of hesitating and enjoyed it enough to recommend it to my girlfriend and encourage a friend to take advantage of the latest sale. Refund.Do not buy this game for online play whatsoever.

review: This game used to be great it was the first GTA to have a great multiplayer that everyone can go nuts with their friends among others doing the same.Lets face it this game is plagued with hackers as well as people who have too much time on their hands to harass other players.After a while you decide to play online in a private session with friends because if you are caught IN THE SAME SESSION with a HACKER you risk loosing your character that you have spent years (potentially) on.But it is fun playing with friends.... So you carry on.Rockstar comes out with some new content. You cant participate in it because you dont want to join a public session... Your buddies account of 4 years just got wiped for him playing in a public session... New missions can only be carried out in online public sessions. Is it worth risking loosing everything?This game has taken a sad downturn the new updates are hopelessly overpriced and the threat of being effected by a hacker is not worth the punishment. Updates are not on items that people are asking for *cough* more heists *cough* but more random crap that not even the $100 shark cards can cover for in game content. Back to grinding the same thing over and over again.... Have fun!

review: It doesn't really need to be said that GTAV is a great game. The story is great the characters are all interesting in their own ways and the character swapping mechanic is used in some interesting ways both the main missions and the assortment of side missions are a lot of fun and there's plenty of things to do in Los Santos more than enough to last at least 60+ hours without even touching online. The game even has hot swapping gamepad/keyboard support so if you want to walk and shoot with a mouse and keyboard but drive or fly with a gamepad all you have to do is plug in your pad and just use it when you get into a vehicle it even toggles the vibration on and off automatically when you switch between controllers. The PC port is pretty great overall and there are a lot of mods out there.But what really surprised me was how good the newly added first person view mode was which lets you play the whole thing in first person. They really went the whole nine yards for it it has iron sights for the guns vehicles have detailed interiors and characters in the car animate more than you would normally expect for a primarily third person game etc. I played the whole game in first person and I'd very highly recommend trying it because I think it really helps show off just how much detail Rockstar stuffed into this game's open world. Driving in first person makes much more of a difference than you might initially expect encouraging you to drive more like you would in real life and adding that little extra bit of immersion in. Playing the game like this changed it to the point that I don't know if I'd be able to go back if they remove the feature in the next game because of how well implemented it was here.

A game entirely about shooting things put into it a fast and manuverable car that's immune to bullets but allows the people inside to shoot outside paradoxically. Without fear of retaliation. You dumb dumbs. Transforms any PvE elements into a yawn fest and PvP into Rocket Launchers All the Time.

review: Never. Buy a console because that will save you the pain and frustration of dealing with modding and hacking online. I one day got so sick nd tired of reproting players and submitting video to rockstar I just join millions of random lobbies just to see how many I could join and enjoy. My tally went from 1 to 278 in 6 days. 278 lobbies I joined and tried to play on but couldn't because it was either A being destroyed by modders giving cash freezing players and spamming objects till people were forced to leave or their game would crash under all the load Or B Filled with children 13 years and under Or C filled with modders killing people blowing people up and using godmode and aimbot and saying it wasn't them and it wasn't hack. The game is so unplayable on pc The only way I could enjoy it is to find players who weren't modding and go to a Privet session. With how much I tried I could get maybe a total of 7 players in a single privet lobby before someone had to go to work or go to bed.Match making is horrible. theres no one doing anything else but hiests (If playing the missions at all...).If I want to play a mission I do it alone or suffer through it while everyone else teleports about and kills every thing that moves breaths or lights up. If I wanted to play a game with this many hackers I might go back to GTA4 or 3 Or just join old modern warfare games. Also I have tried modding online too. Not for money exploits Not to teleport about the map not to give friends money not to do anything but no collide and godmode so I didn't have to deal with hackers. Now hacking online has gone so far as to teleporting players godmoding other players framing players by killing whole lobbies in their name passive mode or not. Virtually I have given up on this game and if you plan on buying it GTA V Online is almost broken and storymode has been done by myself enough times that if I played through it again I would start ramming rusty nails into my forehead everythime I had to do another story mission or side mission other than exploring los santos. My rating? 2 out of 10Date is 1/28/16 All madders appear to be banned and I too also am banned by asociation. Also out of 15 lobbies I joined today Not a single one consited of people who werent constantly killing you for no ing reason. The community is so hostile I couldn't even do a mission without people joining and destroying everything. Right off the bat I've joined everything from gamemodes consiting of coop DM and normal vs mission to plain free mode and the enviroment of players is so hostile I couldn't even record or go about my business without going passive or just plain joining in the madness. Over the past 4 months I stopped playing GTAV online to go to work and make actualy use of my time I have had low blood pressure less grey hairs and my phyciatrist said I had changed. and NOW I literally feel like I'm going to rip 23 Select few players ing head off.PS4 PS3 XBOX 360 XBOX ONE PC STEAM PC R* launcher I have played on them all and while Others use everything different Console gaming is the most chill I've ever faced compared to PC. If you really want to enjoy the extents of this game Again as mentioned before Buy a console because PC servers are completely screwed by s and badsports. I have long videos of Horrible experiences on my youtube channel I'm currently building and it will be quite clear the actual state of the community.UPDATE 4/15/2018 So I haven't been online since the fall of OpenIV and to be honest those were the good days. For a breif time No one was modding at all. But I quit enirely a month after the modders came back. I haven't played since. But Five M was introduced to me. I played that on and off every other week when I got REALLY bored. Today marks the day I played online for the last time ever. Maybe when gtaVI comes out I may buy it. Not full price of course Wait for a steam sale or some other Sh*t. I purchased a copy of GTAV for windows and the first Lobby I join I am level 2 and go t pose an assorted number of object spawn on me and start rotating. the modder teleports to me and claims he can recover my account with millions if I paid him 15 dollars on paypal. I told him he was the reason we couldn't have nice things and to go away. So he crashed my game. From then on I played solo sessions doing only Meth'd up because thats the only mission I can play because I am so low level. I join into a lobby unaware there are others to buy ammo and snacks and get killed by someone in a 3.6b$ hovering tic tac diq P*ssy mobile. I told him he couldn't kill me on foot so he had his modder friend T pose me and spam money on me while he repeatedly killed me 5 times before smarting off and saying I was terrible and I sucked at the game. Kinda hard to fight back against a big headed when your being frozen. I got 5 million in my account now and shortly after he crashed my game. When I log back online right after I am greeted with a black screen saying I have been suspended for 2 weeks for suspected Cheating. Just Get FiveM or a console. This is the only way you will ever enjoy the game. However if your one of the s who mods and gets others banned I hope you burn in hell.

review: I loved GTA 4 but I'm crazy about this one. The graphics are fanstic and a certain Mod makes it even better. The story thus far is fun and makes sense for the most part.There's plenty to do when not on a mission. You can Free roam anywhere and explore the map via a bike your car cabs helicopters motorcycles planes trains and of course walking. You can also create havoc too by picking fights going on a killing spree and blow things up or mug people and rob stores.As with GTA 4 you've got lots of music to listen to or create your own playlist. There are 3 characters you get to play. Each one is interesting and comes with their strong and weak points. Franklin great driver. Micheal great with weapons and Trevor great pilot. They also have their own missions and story and you're not stuck playing just one of them during the game.Driving with KB/M is better than GTA 4 and can be tuned to your liking.Best place for Mods is right here https //www.gta5 mods.com/misc/most liked. I'm just beginning my Mod List that you can find on my Profile or in my group Discussions.Catch this baby on the upcoming Christmas Sale. You won't regret it unless you have a toaster for a computer.

review: I tried my best to give this game a positive review and a thumbs up but the horrible online experience is completely ruining it. (Singleplayer was amazing though honestly. The story and the characters are incredible PC graphics are really cool and there's insane attention to every little thing and details.)Every time I try to play and have fun in a public lobby a hacker will come and mess everything up.For example here's the last time that happened just a few days ago when I tried to get back into GTA Online I buy myself a nice new car from the latest update drive it to Benny's. I get in I get amazed by the insanely high prices on EVERYTHING but whatever it's Rock$tar and it's their biggest cash grab (mind the shark cards) yet so.A hacker warps into the garage spawns a ton of copies of my car. Then ejects me from mine. Gets in it drives away. Gets out warps back into the garage. Spawns a ton of my clones on my head that constantly run and scream I can't even walk around anymore. He then tries to order me to do things like getting in the car (I can barely walk around with all the lag and hacks) all in an annoying disgusting arabic kid's voice. And then he crashes me. And that's only one case of many.Yeah nice. Cool. My money are well spent.Honestly I think GTA V and GTA Online should be sold separately. $40 50 and $20 30 respectively maybe. While one is an excellent product the other is clearly a piece of garbage ruined by its own terrible community and the developer.Please note that GTA O is actually tons of fun if you've got a LOT of friends who also want to play it with you in a private lobby. The problem is not everyone has even a few.There's a ton of mini games fun custom races and missions the 5 heists are better than all of PAYDAY2 (especially since the latter now has terrible microtransactions) the game is constantly updated with bits of new content here and there.The problem is all of this can't hide the fact that the online still sucks. Hackers aren't even the sole problem in this there's actually a lot more. Insane loading times heist leavers and that's only to name a few.P.S.Take Two and Rockstar are pulling some of the shadiest stuff in the modern gamedev industry and are not even slightly ashamed of it.Sending investigators to the doors of modmakers?Increasing the price by bundling your game with useless stuff and not allowing to buy just it alone just before it goes on sale?Yeah all of that is perfectly normal apparently.

review: I didn't want to do this but Rockstar has forced my hand. I'm one of the many players that have had legitimate money taken in the recent sweep $1 671 220 to be exact. Granted I only had $2.3M before that was taken but that was money I had earned myself. I've only encountered one mod user in all my time because I spent half of it by myself in invite only. I've never had modded money dropped or injected into my account. My stats are public. Everything I've earned I've earned through time invested into the game.I opened a support ticket about this and the next day it was moved to Cheat/Exploit Report or Banning Issue. It was closed after I was given the standard copy/paste response everyone else is getting "Your shared bank account in GTA Online was adjusted to remove illegitimately gained in game money." I was put in the cheater pool just like that even after I've done everything in my power to avoid mod users. I opened a second one but I don't expect anything. I'm just not going to keep quiet about it like they want me to.Don't bother calling their support numbers either. In the US you'll get an automated message telling you to file a ticket online. Well isn't that helpful?Frankly Rockstar and their skeleton crew of monkeys can kiss my whether they fix this or not. The damage has already been done. Never before has my love for a game turned so sour so quickly. For now I can officially say that I won't be returning to Online. Maybe some day to go through my garage or play with the Editor but never to play or grind.Do NOT buy this game for Online. Only buy it for the Story Mode which is one of the best in the series. It's just such a shame that Online has made people forget that. At this time I know I won't be getting Red Dead Redemption 2 or any other Rockstar game in the future.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: BEFORE ANYONE DOWNVOTES THIS I would just like to say that the GTA V Story Mode was excellent. 5 stars (pun intended). EDIT Take Two (the publishers of this game) made the most moronic decision to ban SINGLE PLAYER mods so unless the online portion of the game has some appeal to you do NOT buy this game. However the only reasons I do not recommend this game are due to the other half of this game GTA Online which is what most people play. If you don't care about playing online with other players then you can ignore this review. Here are the reasons why I wouldn't recommend this game in regards to GTA Online 1) There are modders/hackers everywhere you go whether it ranges from simple unidentifiable aimbotting to completely adding/wiping your in game bank account and ing with your Reputation Points. I had about $2 000 000 in my bank but a modder decided to screw with everyone on the server and lower their RP and money. I had lost all of that money I earned and yes it is permanent (at least until another modder decides to with my stuff). After witnessing that modder take all of my money away I was pretty ing I am not the only that this has happened to there are many other people that have been screwed over by a bunch of dirty modders.Because of this I don't want to see all of the GENUINE players who actually PLAY THE GAME LIKE IT'S MEANT TO BE have all of their hard earned rewards be in the control of numerous sadistic cowardly modders who only live to with other people. Another lesson to be learned from this NEVER BUY SHARK CARDS! Modders can easily drain you of your money so NEVER spend any money on Shark Cards. 2) Rockstar is not doing very much (if anything at all) about the current modders situation. They are very slowly banning them but due to the popular usage of hacks and mods in this game it's not uncommon to find a modder in your session. A large chunk of the GTA Online modders still remain and continue to mess with people by spawning in weapons vehicles teleporting etc.. They completely ruin Freemode Events and many other things.Mods should not even be as popular in the game as they are now. This game has been released over 4 years ago which is a sign that Rockstar is not doing a lot to prevent people from using mods on their servers. 3) There are not very many people in the game at all. There might be around 8 people total in a few sessions but I've gotten into sessions where everyone has left and I'm practically alone. It's not very fun playing alone in GTA Online. I mean why play online when I might as well just play the Story Mode? Sure you can still get Reputation Points and money online but that doesn't mean anything when modders can just instantly take it all away. The other issue with there being fewer people is that you're more likely to get placed into a session with modders and I already shared my story on how my experience with a modder went. 4) You would think that with very few people playing the game nowadays that the servers would be really smooth but they aren't. I was in a 2 man Mercenary Mode match and a lot of my bullets did not register when I shot at the other player. In larger lobbies it can become even worse. I sometimes even lag out of sessions when there are only a few people or even nobody else on. Now I don't want to sound extremely pessimistic about the game it's just the modders in the Online community that ruin it.Here are some positive aspects about the game 1) There is a LOT of content in the game it's one of the most extensive games I have ever seen. You can fly helicopters and planes ride modded (not hacker terms) vehicles motorcycles and boats play different games modes like missions and jobs to get money and other cool stuff buy housing business buildings and even yachts! There is so much more to list but I can't list all of them in one review because there's so much content. (Literally over 60 gigabytes of content.) Plus Rockstar is always pushing out new in game content every once in a while.2) You can team up with your friends and other players by joining or forming your own club/business and working for or with your friends to complete objectives and get more money. If you're a CEO you can have your executive assistant bring over vehicles give you food and etc.. I forget which one you had to be but I believe one of your powers as a CEO (when you become one) is being able to place bounties on people and I LOVE that perk!3) Did I mention that killing civilians is amusing? It's especially hilarious hearing their screams when they burn alive. (I cannot stop laughing at some of the male civilians' screams.) Overall the game has a lot of content and is excellent to play with friends. However I am not recommending this game for now because of the little effort that is made towards stopping modders from ruining the experience for others.EDIT I was just suspended from GTA Online for reasons unknown and now my character stats and inventory are being reset so that really solidifies this negative review. I also just looked this up and people who have never even modded before have been victims of the flawed anti cheat coding of this game. In other words regular people have been suspended AND had their accounts wiped of everything. So... I highly recommend NOT getting this game until Rockstar actually fixes their poorly designed anti cheat software because modders can EASILY make multiple accounts change their IP addresses and still continue playing GTA Online right where they left off and get all of their money and stuff back while players who have ACTUALLY BEEN PLAYING THE GAME AS IT WAS MEANT TO BE are just screwed over by faulty internal anti cheat programming.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Take Two I really hope you're going to do something to ease the raging inferno that's going on throughout the GTA modding community.I love the game but I currently can't recommend it until some form of solution can be made so that modders can still freely mod the single player portion as they wish while allowing the multiplayer portion to run with fewer risks of running into cheaters.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Only get the game if it is on sale for either playing LSPDFR and/or FiveM. Other than those two options this game is trash. review: Just no. "Something's Wrong in San Andreas..." Crap story (In my opinion). I don't even know what to say it's just really bad. Mostly boring characters with very poor development anything involving Trevor The FIB or Merryweather Security comes off like GTA fanfiction. BAD FANFIC. THANK GOD Ken Penders wasn't involved. Horrible Radio music. Worthless idiot DJ's and boring ad's. Self radio lets you play your own music though (without the garbage) but only MP3's. No FLAC or OGG support. Everyone shoots with aimbot accuracy from the military to drunken gangsters holding their guns sideways. it's not unfair since you shoot with aimbot accuracy but it's a LOT more annoying then GTA IV. It's insanely annoying when you are in a car chase and 75% of the bullets being fired at you are hitting you. At least the REGENERATING HEALTH is a big help. Super clunky movement. It's somehow more awkward feeling then GTA IV. At least it looks REALLY good though. There are only 5 stars in the wanted system now despite the military being in the game. Wonky weird driving. It's like every car comes from a different game. It's not bad but far less "drifty" then GTA IV. You might like that certainly. But all of the cars still top out at 90 140 MPH. WTF? It's not even that logical either most normal cars top out at 100 ish but some sports cars go less then that. While a box van (Rumpo) and Pickup (Rebel) top out at about 110. Also super cars apparently max out at 140MPH(ish) even with $150 000 in upgrades. It's an absolute crapshoot if the game will run decently. Most of my perfomance problems went away after I started running the game at a HIGHER resolution. What in the actual f*ck? Cheaters still run Rampant online. (This is good if you like people shooting money at you or exploding you a lot) Terrible online Servers (Have "fun" failing to connect to matches and then being dumped in a random server) Terrible TERRIBLE DRM (No signing in without an internet connection it f*cks up for no apparent reason and forces you to change your password 3 times in a row the last steam update broke the launcher LMAO) Insanely overinflated prices for things in GTA Online ($25 000 for a Owl mask?) They also reduced the amount of money you get in Contact missions as well. Yay? Wait there are microtransactions? For money in multiplayer? When I have to go out of my way to avoid cheaters "gifting" me millions of dollors? Hahahaha! That's pathetic! GTA Online kinda sucks overall it's way less fun then GTA IV's MP. And the free roam is abyssmal. No choice of PVP or PVE lobbies it just throws you in with random people (without turning on the "Passive mode" either!) and hopes you will create fun on you own forgetting that most people online are so stupid they try to teamkill you IN GAMES WHERE FRIENDLY FIRE IS DISABLED. Just expect people to shoot at you on sight. In short the game is ok but there are an enormous amount of deal breakers and many stupid design choises. I shouldn't need to mention the drama that rockstar keeps causing you can see the other rewiews.

I play on 900p and all settings were medium except for (texture very high Shaders &amp Shaders detail high Population density + variety + distance scaling MAXED OUT FXAA ON MSAA ON AA 4X) and hit (50 fps walking 30 fps in busy traffic + city 40 fps driving car) Lastly I'll give it 8.5/10 Overall Score i mean yes i do recommend this game...EDIT Rockstar has fixed their anti cheat me and my crew is having fun with discord so technically This game is nearly perfect 9/10

review: If you enjoy this review please consider following my Curator page here . After a nearly 2 year wait I can confidently say that Grand Theft Auto V was worth the wait. This game ups the ante in every way possible and has the unbelievable polish that you would expect from a Rockstar game. I would say that GTA V is easily the best in the series and does everything better than the previous iterations with the exception of music and setting with Vice City.The gunplay in GTA has never been very mechanically sound before but V provides enough control options to make it very competent in this department. The driving is also easily the best the series. In previous games it always felt like you were driving on ice but this game gets driving right and makes it not just palatable but fun as well. The story is also a standout to me. I really enjoyed the mission variety and feel like the developers spiced it up more than in previous games. The three character switch mechanic is very well implemented letting you choose who you want to be on the fly. I felt that narratively this was the most cohesive entry in the series as well.As far as optimization goes I found it to be pretty good but not amazing. I played the game at 1440p with a 970 on mostly high and some ultra settings. I did find shadows to be very subpar as well as a fair amount on aliasing. That said it's amazing that they made an open world game this detailed and vibrant.This is an easy recommendation for me. Everyone knows what GTA is at this point and this entry has perfected that formula.

review: Everyone knows the Grand Theft Auto series and the basics behind the game play so I'll skip that bit.What I will say is that this is by far the best of a game franchise that I've already been a massive fan of for years. Instead of playing as one individual you play as three that you can (for the most part) swap between at will. Each character has their own skills (which you can improve through use) and their own unique special skill. For example one of the characters is extremely good at driving and therefor when his unique ability is used it allows him to slow time and pull of incredible stunts while in a vehicle.The first person view is also an exciting addition while using this the game actually takes on the full experience of a FPS gun sights and all. Though this wasn't a feature that I personally felt was needed once I actually started playing with it I realized that it was a lot of fun and the developers did not skimp out on making it a well rounded and entertaining experience.On a final note I very much enjoyed the story of the game. It had its twists and turns and I actually felt very much in tune with the main characters. Several times I got pumped up in real life as if I were actually there robbing a bank or pulling off some other incredible stunt.I would recommend this game to everyone who enjoys the Grand Theft Auto series and what that means. You might want to avoid it if you're ten years old unless you have some kind of an early warning system for when your parents are coming.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: You'll be hard pressed to find a game as detailed and nuanced as GTA V. I've played since June 2017 so I can't attest to how the game has changed over the years. However from the time I've spent I can say that GTA V is most definitely a worthwhile purchase whether it's on sale or not. I've spent the vast majority of time in Online so that's what this review will be focussed on. Pros Insane levels of customisation be it cars planes or your character. You could change the windows/wheels/interior of a car have endless clothing combinations together with mask/hair/tattoo/accessory options.Wide variety of weapons from RPGs and Miniguns to Broken Bottles and Flashlights.EVERY WEEK R* has in game sales for basically anything you can own making it more affordable for newer players.The range of activities/missions you can do in freeroam is again endless. Not only that you have access to a number of maps for TDMs races and R* own special game modes.Players are able to own businesses both passive and active helping to boost daily income. Plus who doesn't want to be a car exporting druglord? And of course the detail... not just the scenery of Los Santos and Blaine County but also NPC actions and speech which are pretty darn realistic.DLC. R* is still regularly introducing a lot of new content in the form of large updates a few times a year which is quite respectable considering the fact that the game has been out for several years now. Also all DLC is free *cough*EA*cough* Cons Of course the major problem GTA Online has is the rampant modding/hacking which not only screws with others' gameplay but risks them getting banned for spending illegitimate funds. Unfortunately there's no way to stop these modders apart from reporting but there are ways to minimise the risks of having modders in your lobby.Griefing. With all the weaponised vehicles in the game it's not difficult for some to destroy important sale missions or just repeatedly kill newer players. My advice to avoiding griefers if you're new is to find an organised crew where members will readily escort or provide backup.Shark Cards. Although it's true R* has recently been getting greedy with Shark Card sales by pricing new vehicles pretty highly which encourages one to buy some GTA$ it's completely do able through grinding which doesn't take long if you do the right thing efficiently although that may not be everyone's thing.Because of R* using a peer to peer connection instead of having a dedicated server some like me who have not so great internet connections will find that dropping out of a session can happen fairly often. Not much you can do to get around this but if you have a good internet connection dropping from a session will likely be very rare.Loading times. Can be lenthy depending on your connection speed but you can speed it up by entering Story Mode first before joining on someone in your friendslist to get online.All in all GTA V does have it's flaws but there are ways to minimise said flaws. Besides in my opinion all the things that make the game great still outweigh the problems that plague it. Pick it up on a sale if you're still unsure. If GTA Online doesn't suit you the singleplayer is still worth getting the game for.

review: Let's be real here GTA V is one hell of a fun game there's so much you can do in singleplayer and online and some of my favourite gaming moments are with my friends. (For example we all went onto some random dudes yacht and had a "party" it was more of two of my buddies humping random guys trying to make them leave ).But dear god the micro transactions and the customer support behind this game... don't get me wrong I love rockstar games but holy **** it's stupidly expensive to get started in online. And when you're a higher level like myself (only 99) to do any of the gunrunning or distribution it'll cost you around 5 million of ingame cash or $100 in real life. And the community on some servers... think of CS GO had a baby with League of Legends... ya you got the image.Now I'm going to recommend it because I love playing with my friends on closed servers because we just **** around and cause mayhem. But know what you're getting yourself into.

review: I recommend this game but only to a certain degree it's more like thumb sideways and here's why Singleplayer is probably where you will get your money's worth. It's fairly entertaining through out the whole game depending on your personal tastes and there is enough content to keep you occupied for at least 100 hours (if you are a completionist type). Admittedly the story is kinda mediocre and isn't going to blow you away with it's storytelling or big twists but the gameplay is fun and almost perfect for the first time in GTA series although previous titles had better story and atmosphere. There is also Rockstar Editor for the creative types to make interesting videos and enough mods around to keep the game relevant way past it's life cycle. Just remember to revert your game back to vanilla before going to multiplayer because mods tend to be flagged as cheats and can get you banned so beware.Now multiplayer is whole different beast. First and foremost it is very time consuming in the sense that everything will take a while to achieve. You can still have a lot of fun doing all sorts of jobs and activities with friends while being a low level with no money but you will be at a disadvantage at every corner. You need to level up to be more competent in missions to earn more money to buy stuff which is unlocked by being a high level and screwing around in free mode won't get you far. You have to literally work for your level and money which may sound discouraging for some people with little time on their hands.For that case you can buy Shark Cards in game money paid with real money micro transactions if you will. You don't have to buy them (I certainly never did) but if earning money the usual way is a grind for you then there's this. Shark Cards are also the reason for the countless free updates as well as the reason why they abandoned singleplayer for good. Heists are the biggest money makers but doing them as a low level is a sure way to fail a lot and annoy your teammates. Personally I do not recommend tackling them before reaching level 50.And of course there are hackers. Every game has them but GTA 5 has quite a few of them thanks to the shoddy network infrastructure. You see this game uses "Peer to Peer" connection meaning technically there are no servers in a lobby everyone connects to everyone. This makes for absurdly long loading times for connecting to public lobbies and transforms PvP into a chore where depending on your opponents connection it almost seems like a drop of a dice decides whether or not your shots will actually register.So with no actual servers to run checks on people to know who's hacking hackers are running rampant thanks to the netcode. That could be fixed with dedicated servers but the last modding team that tried to mod that into GTA 5 got their SC accounts permabanned so yeah... And Rockstar's own methods to remedy that by screwing with the code have instead caused a 10% 20% decrease in performance for a lot of people. The game may never run as smooth as it did on launch day (Hacking got better these days but still my advice for now is to avoid public lobbies and just stick with your friends in private lobbies instead. You'll also get the added bonus of faster loading times in private sessions DBottom line / TL DR If you're a single player person then this game has you covered with fun gameplay but with a so so story while multiplayer although fun at times requires from you a lot of time and a lot of patience to put up the bull s**t it often throws at you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So when I got the game on PC it took me well over 8 tries to get it working. Already not a good sign. After a while the prologue mission started. After changing some of the graphics settings the game ran at a really smooth FPS rate. Not much later I started getting massive FPS rate issues. There was not a second where the FPS rate was stable. At all. And this is an effect from one of the game's updates. I'm a little confused. Shouldn't updates fix issues? I'm certain that the update fixed some Online issues but the FPS rate and consistency is unreal. Changing the graphcs settings doesn't fix anything. Now I've bought the game 3 times on PS3 on PS4 and on PC. When going from platform to platform I was expecting more than what the previous version had. Was there more? Yes and no. Yes there is exclusive content and features with the newer version of the game. But to me it's not enough.I was really hoping for some expansion to the single player mode and it's story. While GTA V's story did have enough to keep me going until I beat the game the story felt a little short and boring. Don't get me wrong the game does have some more mission variety this time around. But the story could have used some more. I occasionally found myself bored with the story. Some of the characters were there for a cutscene and maybe a couple missions. And that's it. And with most of the story characters they just aren't interesting to me. The game does have memorable moments but they are very few.In terms of gameplay it's pretty good until you look deep into it. The guns can be fun to use and cars are fairly easy for beginners to use. But it's not all good. At times the guns feel so bland. They all have incorrect fire rates and they are not in sync with their respective firing sounds. Some guns have way too much accuracy. There is very little bullet spread. There are times where the cars in the game are just not fun to drive. Fully upgrading the fastest super cars in the game makes only small differences in terms of performance. Cars are limited to a really low speed. Even when fully upgraded. Most of the cars feel the same. They don't feel special or unique. There's really no special characteristics that vary from car to car. And don't get me started on aircraft. The fact that a huge commercial jet can recover from a stall with so much ease just annoys me.And the Online feature isn't that special anymore. I've been playing it since it came out back in 1 October 2013. And I still play the game. It honestly is just boring now. The fact that the rank cap is at 8 000 and the highest rank rewards unlocks at rank 135 is just confusing. The much awaited heists were cool at first but now they're just annoying. If one member of the crew is down you have to start all over. Unlike the regular missions where you can continue despite you losing your teammates. The fact that I can do a mission that involves busting a drug deal taking down professionals shooting down a plane and delivering a load of drugs to a cartel leader all by myself but I can't break a safe take out stacks of $100 bills and drive a motorcycle to a boat on my own continues to anger me. And the way mods are being handled is terrible. A mod to change the FOV slider can get you a ban. I don't see how that can harm the game. Graphics mods that make the game look prettier? Ban. Mod that lets you change the helmet you put on when on a bike? Ban. Changing the weather in the game with a mod? Ban. A mod that makes you ragdoll and fall helplessly to the floor? Ban. A mod that adds a speedometer on the side of the screen? Ban. You see where I'm getting with this? Mods that don't harm the game grant you a ban. It's ridiculous. And the glitches where players can clip through walls lose no health etc. are still present. Server issues are everywhere. Online has more priority over single player and Online is abysmal. Apart from a few exclusive things like cars and the video editor this was not worth $60. It's more or less the exact same as the other versions of GTA V and the fact that mod support and mod control is terrible I can't say much to recommend GTA V.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "Choose between a free open world with endless opportunities or a deep story mode"This game offers almost unlimited opportunities and possibilities. Whether you like escaping from the police infiltrating a military base or just hooking up with strippers this game has it all. You can choose to play in a free open world or play the story mode. Personally I never finished the story mode as I was more excited to play with my friends in the open world but what I played was very good. As almost every game this game is of course better if you play it with your mates.Now to mention some of the downsides of this game.The game is almost 60 gigabytes in size. Even with a good internet speed it takes a while to download. All in all the wait is worth it but personally I found myself uninstalling it after a while due to lack of hard drive capacity.Further I have to mention the waiting and loading time because yes there is a lot of loading. This does indeed drag down my opinion on the game.The last thing I have to complain about is the lagg. Personally this doesn t affect me but if you do not have a good pc you may struggle a lot with lagg and frame drops.

review: This is officially the platform that GTA V's gameplay was meant for. I was enjoying this game for the time that I played it and I was enjoying it quite a damn lot. You see I had this $65 knife from CS GO. What happened to this knife you ask? I traded it. For this game in particular. I found a guy he seemed quite nice but to avoid a scam for the trade I had him send me the game first. He sent it. I then sent him the knife. Happily ever after right? Wrong. A few days after owning the game (Pre ordered copy) GTA V is removed from my account due to "purchasing issues". Glitch in the Steam Matrix? Nope. The guy who sent me the game apparently bought the game via paypal and after a while of use he then recalled/refunded the purchase of the game making me lose $65 in the process. Gotta love spending $65 for 2 days of the best gameplay of your life. All in all buy this game please don't get scammed like I did... Don't get scammed out of a $65 knife. Get GTA (T)V
