review: If you are buying this for the single player I'd say go ahead and do it because the story mode is just fine. However the multiplayer portion is where this game takes a nosedive. Yes heists and some missions are fun if you have a group of friends to play them with and I probably will continue to do those missions but the free roam is infected with script kiddies who think it's hilarious to blow everyone up in the server make themselves invincible and cheat in challenges. I bought this game a few days after it came out on the PC and after about a week I stopped playing because I was bored of being killed constantly by cheaters and sitting in loading screen for way too long. When they released the Executives and Criminals updates my friends and I decided to play online again and I was hopeful that those problems from the launch had been fixed but to my disappointment they had only gotten worse. I haven't been in a session yet without cheaters in it and it defeats the fun of the new VIP missions because it's impossible to get to your objective when an invincible chrome plated helicopter kills you until the mission timer is up. I can't think of another game with this bad of a cheater problem and I'm sorely disappointed that one of the selling points of this game is rendered unplayable because Rockstar can't get its act together to stop the tampering in the game.This will be my last purchase of a GTA game if this problem is not fixed.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player gets 10 out of 10. Even with a few glitches here and there as usual the GTA series is golden fun. Open world with tons to do.I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS GAME.Online is hacked and probably always will be. That being said I don't play any game who's online service has no protections in place against cheaters and hackers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Good game. 9/10.Pros 1. Good optimization amd 7850 can run at a quite good graphic setting around 50 fps.2. Although I spent my 20 hours almost in online story mode is quite fun based what I've played in PS3.3. Online mode is quite fun to many things to do in online mode. Heist and jobs with friends is surely very fun you can also spend a day just driving around to see the sights in Losantos.Cons 1. I finished my PHD thesis while waiting to enter online mode re linking with my friends watching clouds. online experience is crap. If the online mode used steamworks this game should be a 10/10.Besides the cons of online mode I still recommended this game to those who haven't played story mode of GTA V or those who want to spend hours to watch clouds.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So as im writing this I think I've racked up 130+ Hours in GTA V so far on my PC... yeah I KNOW!!!It's either too much or not enough! )I held back my hype ALOT when the game was announced for the consoles... and even more when it was about to launch for PC... mainly well... i learned from Watch_Dogs I know... different company... but still... hype is hype non the less. Now GTA V... well it didn't dissapoint ONE BIT quite frankly now i own it on the PS4 as well so yeah... the game is marvelous the characters are well written the story is amazing and the "character switching" is well amazing.But enough about all that since well like me most of you watched the YouTube videos before PC launch.Now the game on PC runs VERY SMOOTH (compared to GTA IV when it launched) so that was simply a joy to feel watch and enjoy. The 60fps the first person well the graphics everything so far... is amazing to be honest.To sum it up... I gave into the hype and I got swallowed whole and I can admit... this game has not dissapointed.I mean come on... the detail that Rockstar has put into this... blows my mind drive your car through Los Santos park it in your garage and listen to the engine cool off sizzle or hell even the AC cool off depending on what type of car you drove. Things like that... simply are amazing and what make a game enjoyable. (At least for me)The Pros + Graphics+ Online Part + Heists+ Gameplay+ Story+ Lapdances )+ Characters (Franklin Michael &amp Trevor)+ Mechanics (Car Modding Activities etc. etc.)+ Smooth overall feel of the game no crashes etc.+ Details Details Details honestly i could list a crapton of stuff to put here.Now the cons These cons will only evolve around the Online Part of the game since well honestly... i have yet to find alot except 1 thing to stick my finger on when it comes to the Single Player part.Single Player No dating crazy women from the dating sites? D i Remember that in GTA 4 was fun. No increase in body mass when gaining strength or for that part the weight lifts at "Venice Beach" are non functional ( (Think of San Andreas then you know what i mean)GTA Online Not enough houses to purchase (High End with heist rooms) i mean come ON we wanna be neighbours to the Playboy Mansion ) Stock Market disabled ( (Kinda hope to see that back / activated) No increase in body mass when gaining strength or for that part the weight lifts at "Venice Beach" are non functional ( (Think of San Andreas then you know what i mean) The heists are fun but loose re play value once you do the Elite Challenges i hope to see more Heists either in Patch or DLC form. No animals (well then again think they got removed to reduce lag etc. but still could be fun to go hunting with RPG's P )And honestly thats about it... its a honest review with my own point of view... and ill say this... i will STILL give this a 10/10 why... simply because the game delivers to the hype it recieved... no questions about it.My Gaming/Work Rig CPU Intel i7 4770k clocked to 4.5GhzMotherboard Asus ROG Maximus Hero VIIRam 32GB DDR3 Kingston Beast 2400mhz RamHarddrives 2x 256 Samsung SSD+ 2x 500GB Samsung SSD + 2TB 7200RPM External StorageGraphics Card Asus Nvidia Titan 6GBMonitor 2x Asus VG278HE 144hz Monitor
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First thing I did was go to Grove Street. I was mortified. My bullets fell on deaf ears and I died more times that I can remember. I completed the storyline in hopes that The Grove could be reclaimed and Franklin would be exonerated from the confines of Grove Street Families' new patch. Instead I found myself prolonging the miserable life of some dreary dolt name Micheal who's life had been a constant cycle of failure.I did have some fun with Trevor the psychopath however. He almost made rednecks bareable. At least that closet pedophile Lester relocated him to a better place. Leaving his allies however was intolerable.I downloaded the Grove Street Families mod from here www.gta5 mods.com and finally Grove Street was liberated from those filthy purple dogs. Now all I need to do is erradicate the other gangs and absolve their estates and I will do so with victory.From the ashes I have risen.

review: This game is good in its own way. There's some stuff that I really hate it's the loading screen when entering the multiplayer. You see I think I've spend more time in the loading than actually playing it and earn some money from the heist. But I like the game I played the hell out of it on XBOX 360. (I didn't get it on launch though I bought it when it was on sale.) The online experience may differ from one another.The key features that I want to talk about Story The Story is interesting. I love playing it there's this feeling that I get when playing it. The feeling is like when you first started playing a really awesome story based game and you want to know what's going to happen next. Also the illusion that's the game story is long and there's a lot to cover. It kind of have that feeling if you get what I mean. Gameplay I like the overall gameplay of this game but I kind of don't love that fact that there's a like a delay when using a controller for walking and looking around and stuff. I love driving cars around the Los Santos in both multiplayer and singleplayer. Online The online is amazing if you have friends to play with otherwise it's going to get boring at some point. But of course there'll be some people that really like the game can play alone and still enjoying it. I'm not that kind of a person. I love playing the game and all but you see I love co op. Of course you can find friends online and not just some of your mate that you know well. But I'm not really that great at talking with other people. There are some hacker that I've met and don't really care. I mean as long as it doesn't involved me it doesn't matter. A lot of people wants money and I do to but at the same time I don't even thoug I'm really poor in the game right now. I tried to do a lot of heist but there's too much of a problem because it's with strangers and it's better with friends. Performance When the game first came out it have a great performance already. I can totally run it at 60fps on almost maxed out with a Geforce GTX 780. But it gets even better when they're giving out more updates. I'll give this game 8.5/10That's just the number I just pulled out of my head. I will rekommend this game if you have friends to play with or you're type of a person that can totally play by themselves or really good at making friends online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Today the sun was setting in the London of reality and at the same time it was setting in Los Santos on my TV screen. For some reason looking at the sunset of the TV was making me feel something "different" something "special" that i didn't feel looking outside of the window. I started thinking why this could be and finally i understood. The obvious beauty of the real sunsets comes from the overwhelming power of nature from the mysterious nature of things and the beautiful games of the light. It is however something alien to us something that belongs to a different layer.The beauty of the sunsets in Los Santos in the other hand is a beauty achieved by the human hand. It's like a drawing a song a poem a child of the ablity of us humanity to understand and capture the eternity and use it to create to be the hands of the same gods that made those sunsets in the sky.Such is the beauty of GTA V. 10/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I highly recommend this game. The graphics are really good even if you don't have the best card in the world. With a 970 GTX 4GB I can play on ultra with 200+ FPS. The heists are good the jobs are good the races could be a bit better but you can download other races at Social Club. My personal favourite is freeroam. From my 400 hours in game I think 325 is pure freeroam. The others hours are singleplayer and jobs. It's also really fun to go around in a car with a gun on top of it and do something like "most wanted time" so just survive as long as possible from the police. You should try it this game is 1st in my top 10 games list.

review: Let's start with single player. No words it's pretty amazing. It didn't dissapoint me at all.However I'm giving a negative review because of the "Second" gamemode GTA online.The idea is cool. It's just like the old SAMP or MTA (From GTA San Andreas) used to be with a lot of new stuff new missions etc.EDIT Fun fact MTA/SAMP's connection was so much better than GTA online's.But I just can't enjoy it. This gamemode has way too many issues with connection. I get problems 7/10 times I try to join a friend and get randomly kicked to empty rooms.No it is not my internet speed. I have 40MB and can download up to 4MB/s. I can play any game without a single issue. I tried to enjoy it I tried to look at the good side but there were just too many issues and problems connecting that I give up.Plus you get to spend the 15% of your time playing (depending on how much you play. In my case it's the 60%) watching the loading screen which by the way is a MUST for anything. Finished a mission? Loading. Wanna join a friend? Loading. Gonna switch between multiplayer and singleplayer? Loading.Oh and don't forget that if you have an accident playing Single player while using mods like accidentally try to join GTA online you get banned up to 2 weeks c
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have played Grand Theft Auto V for only 2 hours at the time of writing this but I am already convinced that the game is excellent. Most open world games do not feature first person mode and I always found myself thinking "This would be so cool in first person!" no matter whether I was playing Saints Row GTA Just Cause 2 or Sleeping Dogs. GTA V granted my wish. Just driving around Los Santos in first person is incredible. You will drive by people who are engaged in conversation marvel at the detail of cockpits dashboards and guns in first person enjoy the radio and have fun speeding down the highway with great controls and plenty of sightseeing. Do you want to do missions? Have fun. Do you want to just rob banks or try your luck in the club? Go ahead! You can do so much and it feels like you are walking around an actual city. You can fly planes as well (except getting into a plane gives you heat) spiralling across the sky looking at all the lights during the night and generally having a fantastic time. Rockstar has truly created a realistic world to explore. I have heard that the multiplayer is not enjoyable but the singleplayer definitely is. I recommend this game )

The heists the missions the deathmatches even the races have their charm. The story made is ing great i loved every part of it(expept for that towing minigame). but i do think that online is were it's and it's so great when it works but rockstar really needs to put their efforts in getting rid of the modders in game it breakes online.hope this was a usefull review

review: I for one can join the band wagon with the recent wave of bans going on i used to love this game look at the amount of hours i put into this game for rockstar to turn around and hit me with the old ban hammer for nothing i have never once cheated in this game nor will i in the future if they bring out another GTA game the story and plot were perfect and on par with a triple AAA game and the online was good from what i got to play from with most servers being infested modders and obvious hackers do they get a ban nope rockstar will sweep that under the rug and when honest players like me and others complain to rockshite about the problem ban hammer on legit players with out a second thought and don't get me started on the races fastest lap 9.5 seconds not even going to touch that with trumps hair piece but don't take my word for it just look at the countless others that have been banned for far less Gameplay 9/10Online 6/10 tar support 1/10EDIT rockstars support is poor if you plan of getting this for steam i recommend that you do not by all means don't and do not link it with your main steam account like i did and trying to get it unlinked it a pain in the ing hole every time submit a new ticket and in the space of 1 hour ticket finished with the same copy and paste i have seen many times before but if you do want to play this game do note that it is very much a cash grab with the way its run spend what ever amount of money you want on the game for it to be taken away saying that it's illegal currency or in my case ban not once but twice so take this honest review with a pinch of salt in most likely some people will take this as a "salty" review but i give 0 s but then again you could be a big youtube ucker like MRBOSSFTW and cheat openly and never get banned ...... peace out nerds

review: Edit May 2018 5 years later and no ing Singleplayer DLC. Do not buy this crap if its not on a deep sale.Sure the game is fun but I already played it all two years ago when it came out on 360 nothing has changed since then and the developers are still bags.Sure Director mode is fun but not really worth the $60 price tag.They also struck down the FiveM mulitplayer alternativeGTA V is the last Rockstar game I buy ever.Sure there will be those times Red Dead Redeption 2 or GTA VI will look interesting but I won't support this anti community content driven t.Rockstar either needs to calm the down or learn that when you support your community people will side with you and buy your not the other way around.GTA Online is still MASSIVLY broken with hackers and script kiddies running rampant in 95% of the sessions that I join.I know it's their game and property they created but to take down an improvement upon something they obviously don't support that well anyway? Do they think they are doing someone a favor other than stroking their own ego hoping that one idiot that wants Shark Cards won't find out FiveM existed?From my point of view they just want to make sure nothing GTA Online "like" pops up that's potentially better so they can make more money off of the little kids who can't afford to play the game to earn cash and buy their chromed Zentorno.I hope the FiveM team still has the dreams ablility of continuing their work at least getting a server browser working because GTA Online is suffering.Many of my friends here on steam and the some on Xbox Live have both said that it's an unplayable mess as in its not fun to be exploding every 20 seconds after it happening the last session they were in and after this stunt of R* they're most likely quitting and switching over to other games.I wish I could refund the game but I've got 172 hours into the game from Story alone.I won't tell you guys on steam how to spend your money your hopefully an adult that can make decisions on your own but SERIOUSLY consider that if you buy this game you promote this kind of behavior for Rockstar saying that it's a good thing that they don't allow alternate multiplayer mods and maybe even other singleplayer mods.Because they DID at one point ban people for using FOV mods in Singleplayer they don't now but they did. Don't forget that. The poor people that want better FOV than 65 in first person and something like 70 in third person.

review: *TEMPORARY JULY 8TH UPDATE* I'm a little upset because I haven't gotten the update yet and other people on PC have so I'm going to remain agitated until it gets fully pushed out.*This review focuses mostly on GTA Online not the base game singleplayer* GTA Online Ok I got my problem fixed so now this is being changed to a fully positive review. The game runs great even on a GTX 650 which is a couple years old. The gameplay is smooth and it is probably the best GTA PC port I have played. GTA Online is lots of fun and hackers/modders aren't as common as people think. The one thing with them is that they sometimes will throw hundreds of thousands to millions of GTA dollars on random people which can be cool but kinda ruins working hard for stuff. I got over 30 million thrown on me in one lobby! I made sure to get rid of it by spending it on useless stuff like the golden luxor and the golden swift but that only took off like 15 million. So if you are a legit player the occasional modder throwing millions of dollars on you when you haven't even earned 200k can be a little annoying but you can easily get rid of it by spending it on useless crap. To more away from the hackers... all of the online gameplay is smooth and lots of fun. I love the ability to play races with only your skill level and the ability to turn off custom cars (which when fully upgraded can be beast). You can easily make friends in it and there is tons to do from races to heists to flying around in an attack helocoptor killing everyone on the server the fun never ends. The ammount of customizability in the game especially with cars is awesome! My only big complaint is Rockstar's servers sometimes they are great but sometimes they suck.Singleplayer I haven't spent a lot of time in singleplayer but I know that the story is quite good. I usually play games for the multiplayer but I do like to just play the singleplayer once in a while. I only have about two hours into the singleplayer but it has been fun. Again I focuss on MP more but I may finish singleplayer so that I can add to this review. OVERALL RATING Pros Smooth gameplay Runs on most computers Fun MP Great graphicsCons Occasional hackers/modders Rockstar servers sometimes lick bumholeFinal Rating 8.7/10This game is worth every penny and I/m sure you will enjoy it just as much as I do.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Well for the singleplayer experience alone the game is worth getting. That is solid fun.However on PC especially since the launch was delayed compared to consoles people mostly get it for the multiplayer component.It feels like a cheesy MMO in many ways. You just grind the money. You do a lot and I mean a lot of work for very little pay compared to the prices of everything.Many things are clunky and rough on the edges. Higher level players love to bully everyone out of boredom. A lot of the missions are designed in such a way that they can be easily interruped by other player for no real benefit to them.. So people just destroy each other's fun. Plus a lot of missions are a terrible chore. Like you may not believe.There are hackers in the game not so common nowadays but it used to be a huge problem. So again no fun.And now imagine my day today I'm tired last months were tough. So inbetween all the Xmas stuff I log in to play with my friends. Nick says that I should clean up my garage and get the discounted Kuruma (armored vehicle extremely useful) and a free Hermes. OK I help him out with the missions I'll buy the cars later. And so in the evening I get into the garage to sell one of the cars I get inside and.. a helicopter spawns inside I can't get out... OK finally I buy the Hermes it says "FREE". That substracted 535 000$ from my account. So I'm 12 000 short of a Kuruma. For the last delivery mission (that's my biggest source of income) I was paid 168 000$. And I need a crew for that and hopefully an empty session. Yeeeees. I feel very done.It's some weird kind of rat race more money better cars bigger houses and the way you get there is through boredom and pain. Get a job instead. It will help you pay the bills interact with people face to face good stuff. It will keep you sane. This is like a bad job slowly drives you insane.

review: The perfect game if you wish to waste time... Even so there is a potential for good content creation if you use the world/cars correctly. The problem however is the fact that the player base has no interest in creating interesting content or even testing things. If you wish to mess around with AI the spawn pattern of NPCs or even how the physics work you will have to play solo. Even if you do play solo however the game still boils down to very simply elements thrown together with the goal of mindless entertainment... There is no challenge in this... There is nothing to be gained...In reality this game was created for two purposes and those purposes were to provide mindless entertainment and waste time. While I still believe it is possible to find something worthwhile in this game you will have to spend ALOT of time searching for it if you do not create it yourself. The main easter egg for example relies on barely strung together clues to locate the end "meaning." While puzzles and easter egg hunts usually have sense of merit and achievment behind them GTA's easter egg is too losely tied together to provide you ANYTHING. It seems like the treasure hunt in GTA was created for one reason wasting more time. That is the main point really why would you want to waste time?If you are the type of person that wants more from a game like this do not despair completely. Even though the game itself was created to pander to a lazy player base you can still create a ton of interesting and new content. The world of Las Santos is a large and populated place. There are bound to be a ton of locations that fit nearly any type of video idea that you might have. You could create a homage to Goldeneye by using the Land Act Dam. You could even create a cheesy 90s style car commercial using any of the countless cars in the game. The possibilities in this respect are nearly endless. The biggest rebuttal I hear whenever I say video games should be more than just fun is the fact that some people just want to relax after a long day of work... While this is true that does not mean you should waste your time. Try finding enjoyment in learning things. If this is not possible than at least try your best. The very moment you decide to do nothing is the very moment you are nothing.

review: Amazing so far. Great sequel to the series and finally on PC. Running on a GTX 760 at 1440p. 4k looks nice but FPS drops to below 30. Buttery smooth 1440p.Radio is very entertaining. The map has definitely changed alot since San Andreas but there are still some areas that are very close and reminicent of the older game. Cars handle alot better than GTA IV. Switching between characters isn't as bad as I thought it would be. I'm also a big fan of how the map is not locked down from the beginning such as all the other GTA games. First thing I did after the prologue was boost a car drive to the airport and grabbed the first plane I found and cruised around the map (dat turbulence). Love this game so far. Only played online for a few minutes and hit rank 3. Lots of potential and really looking forward to continuing this game. 10/10.

review: Don't get me wrong single player is fun (when it doesn't softlock that is) for most of the time. The online was a huge miss. It is an uneccessary grindfest that makes you work hours to get to the fun part. It's not even worth it without friends. As for the programming involved in this game it is utter crap. I have encountered plenty of softlocks crashes and other stuff. Sure it's a step up from GTA IV but this is the biggest game budget wise in history. We should at least have half decent programming. If you have a console play it on there you won't have to deal with as many online cheaters the game doesn't crash or softlock and many other things. Personally I would just recommend avoiding this game. The reason I keep buying indie games is because at least I'm not wasting $40 to just have a bad taste left in my mouth.EDIT After building a new $1500 PC one of the games that influenced my build (this one) doesn't launch. Bravo Rockstar. Your DRM sucks.

review: There's nothing I can say that hasn't already been said so I'll just give a brief summary of my thoughts Anti cheating The worst.Getting money Not fun but necessary to do anything.Mini games Fun the first few times but quickly get boring.Heists Band aid. Too slow to effectively money farm.Vehicles Mostly reskins of eachother with mildly variant stats. There are rocket cars but those are gatedd behind millions of dollars to buy them and a huge investment needed to start a corporation.Companies and whatnot became the entirety of gameplay shortly after release. Makes money grinding bearable but only because it's faster not fun.Community Usually the worst but sometimes you'll find a friendly guy who's fun to play with. At least until one of you gets a false positive for hacking.In conclusion this game has so so much to gain if it stopped taking itself seriously. At first glance it looks silly with all kinds of semi subtle jokes and references but they really really want GTAV to be an LA simulation. The rocket cars are a great addition but they're gated so not everybody has them. Lord knows we can't have people rocketing of skyskrapers in rocket cars. This is GTAV after all. Very serious business.

review: UPDATE 8/11/2016 I've seen reviews from July talking about hackers and stuff but honestly I havent seen many hackers at all especially since I join Chinese to European servers although I live in the US. The game is still fun but to get money you have to grind for it now. Ive only been banned once and I get reported many times by other users because I "teleport" but I don't get randomly banned or ever hear about it until looking at the current reviews. I used to get free money all the time and I haven't been banned from that. I got banned that first time from modding then I stopped doing it. All these reviews from July to now talking about hackers and getting banned randomly I'm sure those are all lies given what I've observed in game. Multiplayer isn't necessarily broken at all except for the Peer to Peer server hosting the game runs. The new CEO update isn't worth playing either because you spend 200k on crates you earn 212k back and your associates gain like 10k maximum. To earn money you have to have a competent crew of 3 people to do Pacific standard in an hour. Not really hard but its more of who you're playing with.REVIEW IN PROGRESS (2015) So far in my experience on XBOX this game easily wins 9/10 because of how fun it is. Many bugs are easy to ignore.Hackers are a bit of a problem if they arent on your side and the pro to that is that there are hackers that can make you benefit from them (because sometimes they give out money/RP (rarely))PC includes better giraffics and better gameplay (IMO) and its not fun unless you got friends to play with.The only negative reviews I've seen are kids saying how they can't buy the game itself when you clearing f*cking can if you look on the store page (6/15/15) and kids complaining about "hackers" giving them money or some ridiculous bs like that (You can obviously ask r* to remove it). NOTE Bans come in waves meaning every update people get B&amp If you see a hacker just leave them alone or report them instead ing about it.Stop letting your anger ruin the game for yourself.To be honest I fixed every problem related to this game for myself and so far its still pretty fun regardless of the gamemode.tl dr9/10 Would buy for 60$ again on a different console
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So this review is not ALL about the recent crap involving Take Two AND Rockstar (remember that Rockstar clearly didn't do anything to prevent this so they're just as much in the wrong.) banning mods. No this is a bit broader than that.My main fun factor in this game (was) the amount of stuff you can do both in singleplayer (which is clasically what GTA is all about) and multiplayer. The story was pretty mediocre the characters not too interesting and the ending pretty boring. It's the game around the main story that was exciting. I liked the heists in both single and multiplayer (I liked the single player version much more though). I liked driving dirt bikes up and down the country sides. I like robbing stores or having shootouts on rooves etc etc.However once that ran out you turned to multiplayer. Which you could do missions and complete objectives with friends. You could make racing tracks and make fun mini games out of the tools rockstar provided.It all kind of hit the fan after the Hiests were added. Hiests were expensive (in game) meaning you relied on grinding buying money via shark cards or having friends who are loaded. Thankfully I'm frugal so the starting 1.5 million went a long way.Then you repeatedly had updates for only multiplayer that required even more money to take part in. The executive offices the gun runner update the overly priced new cars and stuff. In order to play with the new toys you needed money. The only way to earn the money is to become a mule to an executive. Some were good but many were bad since they mostly consisted of hackers or people who used real money to buy the exxecutive title rather than "earn it".It just became an increasingly impossible grind to earn anything anymore. The "new" care of yesterday that you were just able to buy is far surpassed by the latest and greatest car that's twice as much. That's why mods were fun. In singleplayer you were able to drive the older new cars and build race tracks and blow up towns... All dressed like a hooker. There were gamemodes (albiet singleplayer ones) that increased replayability.TL'DR The game stopped being about fun and started becoming too realistic for my liking. It's a game not a job. I have real life stuff to do. I don't need to waste my time grinding another version of me in order to buy a virtual Jaguar. That's why mods were fun.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is obviously awesome. I had a lot of fun playing online with friends. Heists and missions are awesome as well.BUT The game crashes many times for no reason (mostly during loadings) even though my game runs smoothly without even heating my computer. Therefore I cannot recommend completely this game atm crashes made me lose a lot of money (when I crashed just before the end of a mission) and I spent a lot of time loading... Didn't I mention the loading before? Well it's actually 30% of the time you'll spend on this game.Moreover they can still improve the optimization. Even though I run the game perfectly (with a GTX580 almost 4 years old) the usage of video memory is too damn high for nothing.That said I'd still recommend you buying it but only if you plan on playing with friends online. Otherwise I'll have to admit it's quite boring playing alone and the community doesn't help (bunch of 12years old who have a lot of fun killing you for nothing).

review: I bought this game three times. THREE TIMES!I bought it when it came out on PS3.I bought it when it came out on PS4.I ing preordered it when it came out on PC.Needless to say I was pretty dedicated not only to the franchise but this game specifically. Was the PC version the great culmination we expected it to be? Mostly sure.Performance was my greatest concern much like everyone else's. With GTA4 Rockstar sort of earned themselves some negative opinions. With good hardware today GTA4 doesn't run too bad but that's not saying much considering it was released in 2008. SO what's the verdict with GTA5?Well it runs pretty good for the most part. I was getting very smooth 60FPS in the opening parts of the game but those were in an isolated rural town of the game certainly not the most intensive area. However even when I got to the middle of the city I was stunned to still see 60FPS with just about maxed out settings.There are framerate dips don't misunderstand but NEVER have I once found any situation in the game where I dropped below 45 and considering Far Cry 4 can barely manage that on my hardware I was rather impressed. This IS a very large detailed open world we're talking about.For those who have been patient for the PC version and thus haven't played this game at all gameplay is mostly familiar if you've at least played previous games in the series. It's an open world sandbox complete with a lengthy well written story where you play at 3 characters simultaneously and can switch between them when it suits you or when the situation calls for it.With the First Person mode specifically combat has become smoother and better controlled. It's rather bizarre to control the game's combat with a keyboard in mouse considering it's so accurate. It's made the games online deathmatches feel more like the next AAA First Person Shooter rather than a GTA game.First person is also as dramatic of a change as you've heard. It's essentially the same gameplay but the perspective makes the entire game much mor visceral and believable. If you can let yourself get absorbed into the game's world you will. It's gorgeous with all the enhanced graphics options. I thought the PS4 version looked pretty damn good but there's no mistaking that the PC version can look a LOT better. Higher resolution shadows higher textures better lighting more crowded streets and sidewalks this version of the game hasn't disappointed visually. There are problems though. BIG ones. Many people can't even launch the game. The launcher itself just crashes or does nothing at all when clicked. I was one of the fortunate people that didn't have any problems but my brother did. There are a couple "solutions" but some people say they don't work at all. There's this .exe file floating around but despite numerous accounts of people saying it's safe I still have no 100% proof that it is. A much safer solution involves disabling a laptops Nvidia GPU before launching the game and quickly reenabling it just as it loads. This seems to work for my brother but it's very tedious and NEEDS to be fixed now.I'd hate to say it but seriously Rockstar after two additional years and people already buying the game TWICE I did expect a much smoother launch. The game is still fantastic though. Great gameplay visuals sound story characters it's really a very well rounded game and the online mode will only keep you coming back for HOURS.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Suspensions from GTA Online due to these reasons may be temporary suspensions or permanent bans depending on the severity of the infraction. If you receive a temporary suspension from GTA Online the next infraction will result in a permanent ban. If you are temporarily suspended from GTA Online you will not be able to access GTA Online from the moment you are suspended. Your suspension expiration date is shown on the splash screen after being returned to Story Mode following an attempt to play GTA Online. In addition your GTA Online character(s) will be reset. review: let me tell you the two biggest issues with this game 1) you are either going to pay for money grind for hours on hours for just enough money to buy something or use mods so you can have a quick fun experience. I tried for hours attempting to grind for money but unless you have heavy armor and the best guns and the best squad you are getting nowhere financially. I refused to putting any money into this game just for a currency i can get otherwise. (also the game money to real money ratio is garbage). So i downloaded a mod menu to give myself money and screw around with friends. keep in mind i never used the mod menu unless i was on a private server with ONLY friends. after a specific update i was no longer able to have my mod menu in the game. whatever i knew what i was doing was against the rules even though i never affected strangers. the game worked fine after verifying game files for a while. which leads to point number 2) if you ever have a technical issue it is already over. after a specific update i could no longer play the game. keep in mind i removed the mod menu and was able to play for another 50 hours and i was NOT banned in any way shape or form. I could no longer run GTA V because an error message started to appear saying "could not find *$&amp $% 3(87&amp 865* " wtf does this even mean???? this isnt a file or even a common enough error that i could find online. so i attempted getting a refund because my game literally no longer works. i wrote i detailed reason as to why i would play for a hundred hours then request a refund suddenly. i got a denial with no reasoning. so let this be a lesson on Rockstars behalf they only want your money. they will not care about you after youve bought the game and played just long enough so they can hit you with the "played too long for refund"

review: Best version of GTA V. Just finished the main storyline and enjoyed every moment of replaying it. Didn't remember it too well last time I played it was when it released on PS3. +Great optimization+Customizable keyboard layout and controller support.+Great graphics (watching the sun set is awesome rain and weather effects are all top notch especially at night with all the neon in the city reflecting off the roads)+Driving is great+A.I. is great. Cops will use real world maneuvers to wreck you and you feel like you are actually on the run. You can dip off in an alley and if they see your headlights they will get out and investigate have them cut off and they will likely drive by if you are hidden well from sight. My car was parked in dark shadows and they drove right by.+Some funny characters story isn't the best but it does fine+Heists are plentiful throughout and fun with multiple ways of playing them making replayability higher.+Shooting and combat is top notch loads of guns+Detail in the world is amazing. The city looks and feels real and the outskirts in the desert feel just like they should+Plenty of activities such as boat races scuba diving flying planes and helicopters desert races etc+Side missions although some are boring but not horribly boring.+Online is fun and will keep me coming back to it more and more but haven't spent enough time with it to offer a valid opinion. Played the heists on xbox one and they were great from what I played. Not really any negatives for me although some people have reported having launch issues but seems they are getting sorted out fast. People just basically killing each other in free roam instead of doing something fun like running from cops.TLDR This is one of the best action open world games on PC if not the best in game world for this type of game. It's well made and deserves your attention. They spent a lot of time with this port and it shows. There are bugs but it's nothing to write home about compared to the console versions and they are getting addressed. Plenty to do and keep you coming back for GTA Online.GTA Online updates have been free too so far. Single Player DLC is in the works and on the way.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer Fantastic story arcs with great character development. This game has a cast of unique characters that are fun to explore and play as. Watching them interact with the world is a lot of fun in and of itself (cough Trevor cough). Each one has a unique approach to different situations. The story is interesting and keeps you gripped with every mission. Only few missions don't really match up to the rest of them (Scouting the Port) but they're few and far between. The inclusion of the stock market and being able to manipulate it by taking out figure heads of rival companies is also a unique aspect to the game that (if played correctly) can make you millions even billions. The problem is there isn't much to spend it on. Overall though it's an interesting and fun experience that will keep you playing for hours. Multiplayer A mess of an online game. Hackers left an right run freely and ruin everyone else's gaming experience calling themselves 'trolls'. Moderators ban the people affected by the hack instead of the hacker. Everything is expensive as hell. All the content for Gunrunning (bunkers vehicles etc.) total up to an estimated $43 million. To put that into real world money terms every $8 million in game dollars costs $140. 40/8 5 x 140 $700. Every $500k in game is five dollars. 3/0.5 6 x 5 $30. So for one free DLC all the content would cost you $730. That's ridiculous. Or alternatively you could spend 500+ hours in game spending all the money you make on one part of the game. This was done by Rockstar to incentivise people into spending their hard earned money on their microtransactions. ing scummy as hell. 12 year olds flame in voice chat NON STOP. Trying to get a contract done is absolutely impossible because as soon as someone is alerted that you're trying to move a shipment everyone in the server is chasing you down with fighter jets just to blow up your cargo and you over. Tech support is absolutely zero help. Trying to appeal bans just gives you an automated response from a rude bot and human employees are probably less help than the pre written response from bots. Money is sometimes randomly deducted for your account because reasons.In Conclusion If you're going to buy this game for its singleplayer wait till it goes on sale. It's got a great story mode but nothing to spend full price for.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: i joined an online server and my game crashed i launch the game again and its says you have been baned for 1 month.1 month later i reinstall the game i think to my self this game was fun on console so it should be the same on pc right?*game crashesi launch the game again and it says that i perma banned. you rockstar i hope you know what modders are doing to your game.DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. IT IS TOTAL Ti have never modded and this is what the game gives me in returni want my money back.

review: Singleplayer game is amazing but aimed at consoles clearly. In theory this is a very good game so why give it a negative? Take two interactive is the answer. Rockstar and Take Two are on a mission to constantly ruin the relationship between the consumer and the product that could be great but won't be because of their constant intervention to make matters worse. The game is even now years later almost full price and the B#"# S #"t that a gamer has to endure with their launcher rockstar club membership and gtaonline (which is GTA V mmo style) How can I recommend it even if the SP campaign is great? They attack modding community that only change the SP game yet do nothing about the problems that plague the online version and the only solution they offer is more microtransactions on a regular basis and tighten the noose around the consumer neck. On several weeks and occasions I have not been able to even play the game because of the rockstar social club BS that every now and then just fails for whatever reason to login you in in order to play the games you have paid for. I do not recommend any financial support to such corporations regardless how good the core game is that is if you even get to play it.

review: Ok . GTA5 is vast. well layed out with some great ideas on making money in game. The graphics are great with no lags. Many little sub games within the game making it extra fun. Could have been the game of the year but its totally over run by blatent hacking. If you want to play in the real world (multiplay) of gta5 and be visible and you dont hack your in for a pretty bad time. As you drive around the world trying to make your way you will encounter many who just regard you as an easy target. You cant play them on a even playing field cause they have every gun in the game with god mode and many hacked millions in their accounts. If they like you they may drop millions in cash on you. Rockstar is trying to ban this but the hackers are 1 step ahead. You will see luxury boats off shore and almost certainly these are all bought using hax cash. I could go on about this problem but I really want you to consider the long term play ability of this game. There is no long term online playability unless rockstar overcomes the hax issues. If you are think of buying this game for the story mode then its a great game. If you are buying this for the online experience I would highly recommend avioding this game. I understand after each patch the hax doesnt work so i suggest rockstar make weekly small patches to keep ahead of the cheats. Please please please avoid this game. Keep your hard earned real money in your pocket.

review: 10/10 Best loading simulator
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As many of you all know GTA V is a huge game. It began way back in the day with GTA 3 and ever since then has continued to get better and better. I do love the game and I have completely enjoyed every title they've released. Unfortunately there are also some negative areas too and the this is by no real fault of Rockstar to be honest as with ANY online game there will always be those few that ruin it for others. This game is plagued with cheaters/modders and whilst rockstar do their 'thing' to try to keep this as low as possible it is simply not working. At the time of writing this the game has at least one or more cheaters/modders in every session you goto. It's quite frustrating since there are a lot of rumours that claim people can get banned through the actions of a cheater/modder doing something on their end which the detection system thinks you (the innocent party) is doing and thus bans you. I'm a bit of a programmer/coder so I genuinely find this theory hard to believe and I honestly think it's all a lie but there are a lot of complaints by people claiming that this is what happened to them so I'm open to the possibility but genuinely feel they're simply lying. If this is actually true then Rockstar need to sort this out.Now putting aside the modders/cheaters the only other thing that really frustrates me is the loading times. I have neveer been in an game whereby you spend more time loading (the same map!) than you do actually playing the game. I mean unless you just stay in the lobby....the loading times are just unreal. Even going from the lobby to a mission lobby such as Races e.t.c there's a loading screen there and if you cancel that another loading screen to get back to the map that you spent 10mins loading just prior to the race. It's a joke. How can there honestly be THIS much loading required when what they're loading is the same map! I mean all missions and the alike are all loading the same map...the only difference is whether or not cops are disabled or whether certain peds will be needed and spawn at X Y Z e.t.c which doesn't require any loading... (Yes I've done some modding in GTA V for single player so I know this doesnt require loading screens) yet we still have loading screens for everything!As you can tell i play a lot of online GTA V and havent spoken much about single player.Single player is great the city really is full of life. It's a shame my R9 290x broke down and now I can't play the game in the way that I used to. Non the less the only thing I found a bit annoying was the fact that we're playing 3 characters at the same time. I think it's great to try new things but I honestly didn't like the fact that as soon as you got to the point where you started to like a character and know the storyline and what's going on and enjoy it all boom you're no longer able to play that character because you have to play as one of the other 2 characters to continue the story further....and then the same thing would repeat whereby you start getting into again and boom now must change character one again. For me this was the onlly negative thing really with the story line. I would absolutely recommend this game I've spent many hours in this game although you do get bored and stop playing for a month or two here and there you always come back for more sooner or later!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: At this point this game is basically a pay to win almost a pay to play. It sucks to see what its become as it used to be good when it first released. The early DLCs were priced to where you could easily get the items you wanted only the top of the line supercars cost near the millions. Things over the million dollar mark were insane to see back then.Now every single DLC released after ill gotten gains part 2 (the last update that last gen consoles got) is over priced to the extreme and shark cards are the only way to get these things unless youre a neckbeard beta who doesnt have to go to work every day and can play this game 24 7. The new cars cost millions and millions the lowriders have an "upgrade" fee thats almost half a million for some of them and there just so happens to be a new "special" truck that is the only one available that can customize the new flying motorcycle. See where im going?Hackers and modders pollute the servers and grief the entire lobby spawning objects on your character blowing you up teleporting you and rockstar seems to not ban these guys at all. Youtubers with billions of dollars and hacked levels not banned at all. Average people trying to enjoy the game are the ones that they ban.Customer support is a joke they ban people daily for absolutely no reason and they will not give reasons why. If it does happen you as the customer can do nothing about it thanks to the Terms of Service youre forced to agree to before playing online.What happened to the rockstar we used to know?

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player story mode is crap. Vice City and San Andreas had far more impactful stories at the time they came out.Online is another beast. I'll start off by saying that 75% of my hours logged in this game were most likely spent sitting at a loading screen. Not only are the loads long but frequent. You'll get an invite to a heist accept the invite get brought to a loading screen only for it to tell you that the group is full another loading screen for ages respawn in some random spot in the world so if you were doing something you have to backtrack.The original heists started off great ended up a painful grind. The Prison Break is actually a really great heist but it's quite difficult compared to the rest in my opinion and it's the first big heist you get to play. So you often have a lot of inexperienced players trying to do this and it is a show.The CEO and biker updates were the last I played for before going on hiatus. Both were quite unrealistic grinds for chump change that at any point during a sale could all get blown to smithereens leaving you with ZILCH. All it takes is one with some rockets to ruin solid man hours of work. It's incredible how long it takes to fill a small warehouse compared to how easily it can be destroyed top that off with the fact that it pays out a very pathetic amount of cash. The amount of cash payout in this game is ridiculously low compared to how much all the content costs.I don't have enough money to start any of the new content myself so I basically have to wander aimlessly around free roam until I get an invite from someone. It isn't very often.What pisses me off the most and this isn't exclusive to GTA O is the constant in game nagging to buy I think this is happening more after the Doomsday update. I just came back after a few months of not playing. I constantly get bombarded with calls from the various NPCs telling me to buy a hangar buy a facility buy this buy that. I'm like YO CHILL IT'S LIKE A MILLION AT LEAST FOR EACH. I'm sitting here like grinding my way past 200k. They never stop calling. And when you do finally buy a place you'll still get annoying calls from these buffoons about something or other. But bottom line it needs to not be in the game. I prefer "hey cousin let's go bowling" any day over this I get it ya'll need your money but too many games these days are heavily incentivizing buying from the in game store till I feel like they become more like a dressing room sim than an actual game.Hackers in this game are . Sometimes you get a tasteful one. Most of the time it's just annoying and not entertaining.R* doesn't know what it's doing regarding correcting hacking issues. Both my friend and I were hacked money in free roam on separate occasions. We both log in one day and see a message saying our in game balances have been adjusted. They ended up taking back more than the money that was hacked and left me with 20k. My friend logged in to MORE money. Get your together FFS.Overall if you're a GTA fan you may as well play the game just to say you have. But I wouldn't declare GTAV a pivotal release in gaming history. The music is straight until you've heard it for the 80 billionth time. Lots of good tracks though. Gotta give it up to GTA games for influencing my musical tastes over the years.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: For at least a year GTAV has been one of my favorite open world games. However this has given an excellent chance to watch this game degrade into chaos. The game itself is actually fine. The big problem is in online mode where you can play multiplayer with strangers. Ever since the original GTAV came out people have been creating mods for the game that add extra content. Since the game was originally just a single player game this was fine. However when online came out people found they could still use those mods in multiplayer. People created all kinds of mods to allow players to hack in a large number of ways from just 20 minutes of work. In addition to the usual such as aimbot invincibility and teleport players can drop unlimited amounts of money and pick it up themselves or give it to other players. I personally spent about 50 dollars on this game so i could start ceo work when it came out. This made me very angry when it got to the point you could find a money dropper after just a few lobby hops. Some other mods(hacks) include instantly killing players from anywhere making them unable to spawn crashing their game spawning in any object or scripted vehicle including hacky super yachts that can fly and shoot missile hackers even have ways of making it appear that another player is hacking so that the blame goes on them. That brings me to my next point which is that rockstar games has a very ineffective way of dealing with modders and hackers in online mode as well as disruptive players in general. Players have the option to go into the online menu and report a player up to 2 times for things such as disruptive behavior on chat or on the mic exploits griefing and a few more i cant remember. However these reports do very little. Even if a player recieves upwards of ten reports in a single session it is unlikely that their account will be terminated or suspended but instead it lowers their "reputation" which makes them more likely to be put in lobbies with other players that have bad reputation. however bad reputation can be obtained in a number of ways including blowing up peoples cars which is an integral part of the game. Not only is the system in place ineffective but many players blatantly turn a blind eye to hacking and money dropping and many even encourage it. Often times if you speak out against a hacker and encourage others to report him you will be met with replies of "HE'S NOT DOING ANYTHING WRONG" or "WE'RE JUST HAVING FUN" and you'll even see players asking in chat "who's the modder can i have a money drop i'm poor" and if you go long enough you'll find your game mysteriously crashing. This makes for a game where people are helpless against modders and hackers and anyone who opposes them finds themselves public enemy number one. Rockstar if you're reading this modders are cutting into YOUR profits by causing lazy and unmotivated players to seek illegaly made money instead of buying money from the ingame store. Rockstar is one of my favorite game developing companies and i want the best for GTAV but as of right now it is near unplayable and players who have worked for months and months to get where they are in their 4 story penthouse watch lazy undedicated players shoot to the top sitting on a pile of fake money. Anyone who is considering this game please consider this review before you make your purchase. Rockstar please consider this review when you decide whether to work on improving the disciplinary system or add more types of alcohol to GTAVI and modders who read this please consider that you are actively ruining a long lived franchise filled with dedicated players and incredible communities who are being forced out of this game by people like you most likely never to return. You are the problem but you can still help fix it. All you have to do is delete your mods folder.If I find that the modders and hackers problem is resolved or repaired such that the game is significantly more playable I will replace this review with a positive one.Note since i wrote this review i had my level set from 165 to 13 by an unusually salty hacker. When I applied for a support ticket on rockstar's website I was pleased with the response. Within 48 hours of submitting my ticket i had all my levels back the way they were. This incident has shown that rockstar is not entirely ignorant of the hacker problem. Although this alone is not enough to change my overall opinion i will consider this if i ever consider changing my review to positive.Update I have just heard the news about Take two banning the distribution of OpenIV which is a modding software. At first i was grateful they were taking more action to get hackers out of online even after i stopped playing the game. But then I read mroe about the situation. OpenIV weren't the kind of people who forcably gave a whole lobby 50 million. They understood the damage modding does to online and use of their mods in online was already not only banned but disabled. They werent kicking money spawners out of online lobbies. They were disabling people who just wanted to mess around in singleplayer where their actions don't affect other players. I've always supported modding outside of online but now rockstar has once again screwed themselves over by setting fire to one of the most cherished aspects of the game that they spend so much time to milk for just a few more shekels. I am disgusted at the actions of rockstar and take two and i can promise everyone reading this i will never spend another penny on any games or merchandise realised by this corrupt company. There is currently a petition going around that requests that Rockstar and Take two immediately reverse their decision about banning the distribution of OpenIV software here https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openiv I doubt that rockstar will change their policies just because of one petition but hopefully it will show them how many of their loyal customers are on the verge of leaving permanently due to their poor decision making. We are only 20 000 signatures or so from our goal of 75 000 please do some good and sign this petition now for the sake of all things criminal.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Part 1 Ok so this thing says to "be polite" when reviewing games so i'm going to do my best...here we go...To say that I have a deep hatred for this game and Rockstar as a company solely because of this game would be an understatement.. If you have not purchased this game yet let me do you a huge favor and say unless you are buying this game SOLELY for the story mode and have 0 intentions of playing online DO NOT WASTE YOU'RE HARD EARNED MONEY ON THIS TRASH! Don't waste GIFT money on this trash! Don't even waste stolen or money you just found laying around on it! Seriously...First thing's first...some positives about the game. You can steal cars drive around shoot stuff go to the strip club upgrade cars purchase military vehicles and buy a rather nice looking house or yacht to live in. Also the single player story mode has an interesting plot that's engaging with a huge world to explore and some in depth nuances a person could play "game theory" with. And if i'm being honest that's pretty much about where the positives end. When I first started playing this game online I ran across a hacker. He was a benevolent one though..I was low level and he helped me out by giving me a ton of free money and his reasoning for why or should I say his warning I never forgot. He warned me then there were plenty of s that I would run in to playing this game and so he figured he'd do what he could to at least give me a fighting chance starting off. Boy was it much needed so much more so than I could realize. With that said on to the negatives.First off there are a number of different ways to earn money online ALL of them suck. Here are your options you can either do heists which you HAVE to purchase a house with a 10 car garage first to even be able to host heists. Once you spend a huge chunk of your change you likely saved up from helping other people do their heists to get your house now when you host you gotta sit there sometimes for 30 minutes 45 minutes it's not uncommon to even be sitting there for up to an hour or more waiting for people to join your heist. But lets say you get lucky and you ONLY end up waiting about 15 minutes..then you start the heist fail about 5 times because some swears they know better than you and wont listen to instruction or plain old doesn't speak your native language which i assume to be english if you're reading this review or they just keep foolin around until finally someone gets fed up with doing the same thing over and over and never passing it and they leave. Now you've wasted another 30 to 45 minutes just trying to complete ONE setup mission. You're already in an hour and some change and have nothing to show for it..and now you have to load the lobby back up and do it all over again...and speaking of loading...dear God I have NEVER played a game with longer load times than this one. I've timed it before and literally no kidding again another 10 15 minutes sitting at a black screen or a white screen or whatever loading screen waiting to get online..then waiting to join a new lobby after a mission or heist...then waiting to go to a new session because the one you're in is littered with dickbag hackers but more on them later. So if you aren't heisting your next option is CEO missions which can either be done as the president of a motorcycle club a shady warehouse owner selling drugs jewelry weapons and the like or bunker missions where you have to buy a bunker or as a VIP and a few other options. The ONLY one that doesn't involve any risk to your assets is VIP but of course it doesn't pay as much as the others and there's a timer on the missions so once you do one you have to wait before you can do another. If you want to fill up your ceo warehouse you have to first buy a warehouse which is expensive af because gta's economy is ..40 000 dollars just for a dam color change on your gun..50 000 dollars for a silencer or extended mags or a useless scope that doesn't seem to do anything but make your gun less accurate if you try to use it in first person view...10 000 dollar shirts and that's on the cheaper end..anyway you gotta buy a bunker then you gotta place an order for supplies. The cheapest you can go is 2 000 but you'll spend FOREVER trying to fill up a large bunker buying 2 000 supplies every time. So most people opt for the most expensive choice of 18 000. Once you purchase the supplies now you gotta go pick it up but of course that's RARELY ever simple. More times than not you have to fight a ton of npc's guarding it when you get there then after you kill them and collect it more times than not it's in a slow van or truck that damn near any other vehicle in the game can run down with ease and you have to transport it half way across GTA's huge map with MORE npc's chasing after you trying to kill you AND other players...because you know Rockstar thought it was a good idea to say "hey! why don't we notify EVERYONE in the lobby that this person is minding their own ing business trying to collect supplies for their business so they can make money and reward people for stopping them and destroying their stuff! We'll even make them show as a big bright red dot on the map so there's no way you can miss them!" Inevitably someone swoops in with a jet or runs you down in a car blows you up and now your 18 000 dollars worth of supplies is gone and you've wasted your money and your time. I would go through the nitpicky details of each ceo mission type but for the sake of not writing an entire book for a review just know that it's basically the same thing for the other ceo mission types. And lets say you FINALLY managed to fill your warehouse and you're ready to sell and collect on the big bucks! Welp if you've gotta large warehouse you're gonna have to "hire" other players to help you drive all the vehicles you'll be given because of course you can't choose to the drop off spots. And of course everyone in the lobby will again be notified and rewarded for destroying your precious cargo that you've undoubtedly spent literal actual hours trying to collect. Not only are you now even more concerned about other players but you've gotta be concerned about the people you hired. Lets say they're not the best driver or the best pilot..i've literally been in the passenger seat as I watched a plane carrying 1.2 million dollars worth of cargo a full large scale warehouse that was packed out in it go down and explode because the pilot didn't know what he was doing. Imagine how mad the completely uninspired to play this pos game you'd feel knowing it literally took you weeks to fill that thing playing here and there in your off time. I could go on and on on just that subject alone but lets continue there's so much more to talk about!Secondly you can't sell your guns houses warehouses bunkers clubhouses yachts or specialty vehicles! You were scrolling through the guns in Ammunation and accidentally bought a gun you just wanted to look at? Too bad! It's yours now! No sell backs and even worse you can't even permanently drop it and just leave it on the ground. The only way to at least get it out of your inventory for any solid length of time is to buy the gun locker upgrade which is about 3/4 of a mil if i'm remembering correctly for your ceo business. And even then it ONLY applies in free roam! If you pick up a heist or a mission all of the guns you've ever bought are in your inventory which means when you're looking for one specific gun you've got to cycle through about 30 other guns before you finally get to the you want and that's every...single...time...you load into a new mission..It's like Rockstar keeps putting out updates for more cars more aircraft more missions and that's nice and all but fix the you already got! Let me sell the guns I'm not using anymore

review: Grand Theft Auto Enter The JobAs of 6/21/2015 I can heartily recommend the singleplayer. The multiplayer is not worth it however.Let me preface by saying I usually am very forgiving of buggy game's. I have braved Skyrim Oblivion and Morrowind's bugs as if they are no issue. I take GREAT fun in many of them. The caliber of GTAO right now is akin to downloading 100 Skyrim mods without reading anything before installing ignoring load order et all then trying to play the game.Let me also preface by saying that I have been on Rockstar's side for waiting on the game and for it's overall good attempt. I figure with its unique engine that it is impossible to flesh out the expanse of a game without some serious bug fixing.However whether i'm on Rockstar's side or not i've come to a collected agreement that this game feels more like a job than a game.1) The hacking situation. What do most people do in open world games but kill one another? Open world no need for any Dayz need for survival. Have at ye! Except how many of these games do I get to kill someone before they retaliate through hacking or i'm already in a server with a beloved hacker.Since the update particularly the situation is so bad that there is a surplus of beggers in game asking for the hacker's to drop money. There's been points where missile's are falling a split second behind each player in the game to where it feels like you're in Fallujah.I'm sure someone has a grand explanation for this. I'm not entirely sure why Rockstar isn't using Valve Anti Cheat. I heard Rockstar state that they would separate hackers (whom were caught) so that they could only play in rooms amongst one another. The problem peaked that any sort of posting photograph's and whatever is implemented is not working. Furthermore modder's for single player are getting banned.2) DRM. The social club is a nightmare. I see why it's there since you can communicate cross platform transfer characters etcetera. It still has way too many hiccups ending up as something more clunky than Steam's in browser setup by a long shot.Frequently and I mean every hour one of my friends ends up showing offline through the social club. Mind you these players showing up offline are all in the same house as me.I'm sending invite after invite when my friends are "showing up" online. Did you get the text message? Nope.I always resort to using Steam for sending out invites.3) Cell phone matchmaking. Short and sweet. It's a joke. Unless you have 3 or more friends playing consistently it's unplayable to consistently find good games without a crew. I don't know anyone that even listens to the text messages sent to other people's phone's. It's like looking at spam.I've spent hours waiting for a player to join for a heist.Overall it's a very unsociable game. I'm sure this is different on consoles since more trolls are willing to use their microphone's. In short I don't blame Rockstar for that. However the difficulty of finding a good group for having people to screw around with in the open world back you up sorting a heist takes SERIOUS effort from the user in organizing. Despite all the waiting I heartily recommend people not playing without friends a crew or a canon of charisma and networking ability. I have spent a significant quantity of time jaded by this one experience until I started going out to Reddit forums google etcetera in finding good groups and crews.I'm ranting here but everyone else I play with that communicates at all is all just "on the job" just like me. The combination of waiting here and the joblike set up really interferes with the whole open world mentality toward approaching the game.4) Disconnect's Crashes and Loading and Stuttering. Not sure where to start here. I'd say a disconnect happens between 3 of us every 30 minutes. A crash happens about every hour. Loading takes about 2 minutes average when starting up 1 minute joining to a new server sitting through matchmaking or worse hosting while no one joins because of a connection bug. Stuttering has become a more recent issue.Anyway's do the math and see how it adds up.As a note since initially playing I have changed around every component on my PC reinstalled GTA V reinstalled Windows checked every driver on my PC tried setting up alternate connections through LAN WiFi to the same results.It's Sunday night and I have spent 1/2 of my game waiting debugging avoiding hackers among other things (this includes friends computers). To have patience with the game is a massive understatement.It's not one issue bringing the game down. It's the fact that i'm spending my day resetting my connection avoiding hacker's dealing with the wait time from disconnects rejoining from crashes sitting through loading screens failed loading screens returning me toward single player resetting games anticipating different results. Like a job the game has become obstacle management.At the moment i'm using 16gb of ram a 970 and an Intel i7 from the last year.Since the beginning I see Grand Theft Auto throwing money at player's.Yet I can't help feeling like i'm at my cubicle spending every day contemplating quitting my job. I'm looking over at the dirt bag's whom don't work cheating (hacking) their way as if surfing upon the economical carpet floor. I'm looking at the door. For a while now I can just walk out the door.But there is nothing like this game... My friends need me here. I sit around. I toast in the air conditioned oven.Hours of waiting moments of fun. Hour's of waiting. I walk to the door and a million dollars is coming my way.Oh this will go toward retirement......Would not work for again.

review: I picked this game up on Steam because all the trailers and promotional videos made it look very enticing.I don't have a full start to end review of this game because there is so much to it and so much to play. There is also the GTA Online game and the video editor that I haven't toughted yet either.Once I get to experience the entire story mode I will try the GTA Online and review them in full. Until then here is my first impression of the game.GTA 5 is defiantly an action adventure type game due to how open world it is and all the places to explore and things to do in the game. I enjoy doing all the side missions before doing the main story line.When I first loaded up the game I found that the action was intense right of the bat. No slow buildup of your character coming over on a ship to meet his cousin and start a new life nope you were right in the middle of a bank robbery and from there the intense getaway while shooting your way out left you holding he controller playing more and more.If you find yourself getting easily agitated when lots of noisy things are going on with shouting yelling and screaming then the start of this game will push your buttons and get you going. Its that intense I found.The game plays just like you would expect any GTA game to play and works just fine with a Xbox360 controller on the PC.I did find that on my Ultra Wide monitor that during the loading screen there was the black bars on either side but once the game play started then it went away and you got the full gaming screen.No matter what you pick the game up for it is worth getting if you like the GTA games.Pro'sOpen WorldIntense startXbox Controller compatible Con'sIt takes a high end system to max out the graphicsCVGAnton's Ratingːfirst_starːːfirst_starːːfirst_starːːfirst_starːːfirst_starː

review: This review is for GTA ONLINEI want to leave good feedback on this game for the quality of the single player but unfortunately the online has left me sour. GTA online is a clunky mess of hackers griefers and what seems to be continous load screens between missions and trying to party with with crew members. They make it incredibly hard to start off for new players. Most existing players have so much money and replenished ammo and guns that make it nearly impossible to counter them. When griefing gets too serious you can opt in for passive mode that makes you a ghost so you cant crash or interact with other players. There are ways to still grief a player while he is in passive mode. You can shoot out store clerks from anything they try to go into or shoot out the tires of any car they are trying to enter. A lot of the missions require team work to complete to make any decent money. Without the missions there are small objectives you can complete in free mode that give you petty cash. With all this being said without a group of friends to play with the online community is very toxic and childish. The best option to get away from the crappy lobbies is to join a new session. From the several online hours I put in so far I feel like I have entered that loading screen enough for a month of gameplay from joining new sessions trying to find a decent non toxic lobby. The grouping system "crew" is the clunky part i spoke about. They make it very confusing just trying to play with a friend. If all these problems pertain to you don't worry you can just spend real money or GTA online cash to overpower other players trying to earn the cash in game. PAY TO WIN! There needs to be an online matchmaking system that matches you with players based on the money you have spent and what is in your bank. The only saving grace this game has is the incredible Story mode and voice acting. Rockstar has never failed by that. I can definiely say that I am enjoying the single player 10X more than online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
