review: Grand Theft Auto VDeveloper Rockstar NorthPublisher Rockstar Games ( &amp Capcom in Japan)Released September 17 2013 PS3 &amp XBOX 360 November 18 2014 PS4 &amp XBOX ONE April 14 2015 PC Grand Theft Auto V is a great game... At least in single player GTA there's a story structure if you want it offering a larger goal to work toward. In GTA Online there's no greater purpose to fight for and you share the world with other people who also have nothing meaningful to strive for so the result is a nihilistic world in which life is dirt cheap with players constantly gunning each other down for no reason whatsoever. (There are warnings that bad behavior will result in players being pegged as bad sports who are relegated to playing with all the other miscreants but in a game designed to encourage murder and mayhem it's hard to discern where the line is between fair play and being a jerk.) If there's a meaning to be found in Grand Theft Auto Online it's in the way that through depicting a society with no opportunities to do anything constructive or meaningful it underscores the things in our world that actually are meaningful.Sometimes you might be going about your business trying to steal a car for Simeon or maybe just going to buy some new clothes but instead you get stuck in a loop of getting murdered respawning and getting murdered again. You can turn on passive mode so that other players can't gun you down though you can still be a victim of vehicular manslaughter. Violence breeds violence you end up seeing any nearby players as threats and pull out your weapon ready to gun them down before they gun you down. It becomes an unending cycle of pointless slaughter that pulls you away from what you'd rather be doing. Even if some material goods are the only source of meaning you need to motivate you in Grand Theft Auto Online you're in for some frustration because earning money is an arduous process and everything in the game is so expensive. You can easily blow a hefty chunk of change just outfitting yourself with a reasonable assortment of weapons and ammo at Ammu Nation. Saving up for a modest house or a luxury sports car means many many hours spent stealing cars and doing jobs. They say crime doesn't pay and the shockingly small payouts for so many jobs in GTA Online only enhance the feeling that sinking time into a life of crime here is pointless. The meager payouts are likely designed to nudge you toward buying in game cash with real cash. At the low end three bucks nets you $100 000 which doesn't go very far in GTA Online. At the other extreme you can shell out a hundred bucks for a cool $8 000 000 in online dollars.Jobs may not pay much but they do offer an opportunity to escape the insanity of the unstructured life you find on the streets. But you might try to launch a race mission or other activity only to find that no other players will join you preventing you from having the GTA Online experience you want to have. You can also wait for invites to activities from other players or use the Quick Job option to hop right into an activity with other players but you don't know if the activity you'll be tossed into will be a well designed race created by Rockstar or a sloppy event tossed together by another player. There are some good user generated events in GTA Online too like a novelty race I competed in that had us speeding down the highway using huge ramps to leap over train cars that had been placed in the middle of the road and Rockstar is highlighting the better user created jobs with a "Rockstar verified" designation but the Quick Job option doesn't seem to discriminate between the cream of the crop and the garbage.Still there's enough of a chance that you'll have a great experience in GTA Online that playing it is worth the gamble. Time and time again the gameplay the setting and the music of Grand Theft Auto Online combine to lend your car chases and shootouts and other in game actions the look and feel of something out of a cinematic crime classic. I love speeding away from another player in a car Simeon wants while the sax solo from Gerry Rafferty's "Baker Street" plays or clicking with a team of criminals to efficiently steal a shipment of drugs from some non player characters and then making a clean getaway.There are moments of tranquility too like when you just take a leisurely drive up the coast as the sun sets over the ocean or parachute over the Alamo Sea. Grand Theft Auto Online's greatest assets are still its incredible setting and soundtrack. Los Santos is a city that's ugly and beautiful in the way that real lived in cities are ugly and beautiful. But Grand Theft Auto Online's performance sometimes interferes with your appreciation of the game's best qualities. You might be caught up in the heat of the moment racing against other players as a great song plays on the radio only to have the game hitch up for several seconds.And even on missions other players are as likely to spoil your fun as to contribute to it. On one mission a player screeched and swore at me over his headset to get in the car with him even though it was a sporty two seater he was driving and both seats were already occupied. On another job my teammates and I needed to hijack a boat from the shipyard. I hung back to cover them and pick off some enemies from a distance and they thanked me for my help by speeding off in the boat and leaving me stranded. I didn't mind this it's the sort of betrayal you see happen in any number of crime movies after all but when in a bit of karmic retribution they got killed out at sea my only options were to try swimming my way out to the boat or to just quit the mission and be scolded by the game for my bad behavior. Grand Theft Auto V is never a boring game. I never know quite what the next five minutes will bring and in any given moment I might be thrilled or frustrated or both but I'm always engaged. But because everything is so chaotic and disjointed I can only spend a little time in its world before I need to leave Los Santos behind and return to a place where I feel like my actions might actually mean something. IGN REVIEW

review: For a game as praised as this Grand Theft Auto V is surprisingly unexceptional. While I did not touch the multiplayer aspect of the game the story mode is very average and not particularly good at anything.The story itself is forgettable. The characters are made cliche and obscene in an effort to satirize American culture. Whatever the game parodies is painfully obvious from beer to torture. Arguably how GTAV handles many topics is lowbrow.Across the board the gameplay is bland outside of a very few missions. There are games that handle arcadey shooting driving flying etc. much better than GTAV. The game's economy i.e. the stock market and properties has almost no depth. The amount of customization in the game is unimpressive and there's little reason to try most weapons and vehicles.What Grand Theft Auto V offers is a mediocre open world with a lackluster story and lots of uninspired gameplay. There is nothing special in this title to recommend but it's not a bad game. For comparison Red Dead Redemption has a compelling narrative and Saints Row nails the absurd gameplay. Grand Theft Auto V is in the middle lacking either craziness or maturity.

review: I could write a novel on this game but I'd really rather not waste my time on something that only a handful of people will ever read. What it comes down to is this GTA V really comes in two parts GTA V Storymode and GTA V Online. If you're playing for the story be prepared for a letdown. Most characters are either flat and forgettable or are so poorly written you'll be cringing for the majority of the game. There's a total of about 3 or 4 heists that you ever do through the game and while the game tries to make it seem like you have options available for how to complete them it's really all novelty and facade. Almost all of your heist profits end up going to some forgettable antagonist of the week anyway so there's no sense of reward or accomplishment when you complete them other than progressing the game. The ending is so tacked on and anticlimactic it triggers my gag reflex just thinking about it.If you're playing for the online please just save your money. The game has become "grind the same missions repeatedly to make enough money to buy a jet so you can fly around servers and kill everyone with little chance of retaliation." Those who play the game nonstop will get to a high enough level to be able to buy things like miniguns rocket launchers and .50 cal sniper rifles all of which can be used with little to no skill and will tear apart anyone that actually works a regular job and can't spend their lives leveling up their online character. All heists are either boring or endlessly frustrating with few redeeming qualities at all. With the introduction of the "Armored Kuma " players can now play through the game from the safety of a near indestructable supercar. Even if you destroy player vehicles you are forced to spend money to fix it which with the introduction of some of the newer cars can rack up charges of $20 000 which is about how much you make completing a high level mission. Oh but don't worry too much about money. Rockstar has made available Shark Cards which allow you to spend real life dollars to purchase GTA currency. Not only that but they've made every possible attempt to make sure that players cannot share their money with anyone else for any reason whatsoever in order to ensure that they sell more Shark Cards.This whole game is . Do not give Rockstar more money.

review: This review is solely about GTA Online.RATED UP when I read the Gunrunning update details on 13 June 2017.Hooray the fake cash will be removed from my account! And I'll get back the 11 million I lost to hackers! Playing this game will have purpose again.*loads game*You've taken all my *legit cash* even from simple car sales at LSC. And haven't restored the cash *stolen* by hackers.RATED DOWNContextPS3 player since launch with over 2 000 hours on that platform. GTA fan since 1997 (yes *7*) after playing first MS DOS release of Grand Theft Auto. Helped run various GTA online communities over the past 20 years.Yes 20 years of fandom have finally ended as R* have lost control over this most recent edition's economy. It also lacks the final 5% of quality that a AAA title should have menu system on PC still has pagination glitches first introduced on PS3.They even managed to send the wrong release notes e mail to announce the Gunrunning update. Then they sent the correct one. Twice.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pros 1. the single player mode is excellent character developments are great each characters are unique almost all the campaign missions are very fun.2. lots of stuff to do in single player many side missions most of them are pretty fun. 3. lots of properties and cars you can own very nice looking tons of customization.4. you can go to strip club and see boobs.Cons Most of the cons are mainly for online content1. connection sucks. ever since the import export DLC update i have been experiencing constant connection issues. i opened all the ports R* tell us to open and turn off all the fire walls when playing game still constantly DC from session. currently i still cannot find a way to cure this problem. and based on xfinity speed test i have over 260MB/S download and 70MB/S upload.2. online session is full of hackers modders and trollsbecause the server is peer to peer and there is no administration in a session therefore it is very hard to control hackers. there was a big ban wave during Christmas but now the hackers are reappearing. hackers controlling your cars and crash you to death. modders spawning tanks and jets in the city and blow you up just for fun. and trolls that had nothing else to do but do everything they can to stop you from finish your missions.3. online items are ridiculously expensiveif you want to play online get ready for a grind fest. a mask which cost 35 in game credits in the single player mode all of a sudden cost you over 10K in online session. i understand that a mask is not a essential item but this price is a little bit ridiculous. 4. it gets repetitiveat first you think the online session is fun because there are so many things to do all the different races all the different heist all the different mission and etc. but soon you realize the only way that can give you guaranteed money income is heist. because in heist people can't rob you and there is no friendly fire. and after the heists it only takes seconds to put the money into your bank account. doing heist is currently the most secure way to get income if you want to buy a big ticket item such as a luxury condo or a brand new super car. Or you can do the missions that R* had created however the highest paid mission Roof Top Rumble only gives you 13500 in 4 mins. so if you want 1 million which is nothing you need to grind the same mission 100 times. unless you are a high level player who already has a ton money saved up at the beginning you really need to grind these missions in order to get what you want. 5. import export DLCthe new DLC brought in a lot of content but also trouble. when you are importing and exporting any goods or cars people can come kill you and steal your stuff. i know this is GTA you are suppose to be killing and causing mayhem but that creates a problem and the problem is you have to have people to play with you in order to protect you during transportation. in reality if you are a real mafia you will never let anyone know what where and when you are trafficking you products. but this is 1 way that R* use to make your life difficult so they can force people to buy their crappy shark cards. so for people who don't have lots of friends to play with all of a sudden import and export doesn't sound all that effective. 5. import export is not for everyone import export DLC requires gigantic upfront cost you need 1 million to purchase the cheapest office YES the CHEAPEST office but the good thing is despite their price all the offices have the same function. then you will need to buy a dedicated car warehouse to store all the cars you have stolen and the cheapest warehouse is 2.3 million. so in total you need to have 3.3 million just that you can start import and export. and each top range car you sell will only net you 80K because you need to spend 20K just to modify the car and the final pay out is 100K. that's assuming your car take absolutely 0 damage during transportation which a lot of time it will be impossible because there will be other players who will try to destroy your car or steal it from you. so assuming you do everything perfectly you still need whopping 40 top range car to recover the initial cost and only after that it is pure profit. ConclusionR* pretty much made this game in the way that you have to play online because the single player content is not enough the missions are pretty short and after you play couple of times you get tired of it. the only way to find new fun is to play online. but as you can see there are lots of problems when play online. I'm not saying online is worthless trust me I do have some fun when playing online. but it's just that the cons outweigh the pros.

review: I used to be the sort of person who bought every Rockstar game at launch. I somehwat enjoyed the singleplayer portion to GTA V (I completed it in roughly 60 hours and have never felt the need to go back) and I HATED the online portion. so much grinding with none of the roleplaying elements hinted at in the original trailers. What made me put almost 400 hours into this game however was mods. There was a great community making extraordinary mods for GTA V. I found the roleplaying elements I wanted. Features from previous games were restored! I was excited as hell and prepared to play this Rockstar Title to death. Now Take 2 and Rockstar say mods are a illegal infringement of thier publisher rights. If this isn't rectified I honestly cant see myself ever re installing this game nor can I see myself purchasing future titles from this publisher. I simply relied on mods too much to enjoy this game in SP.

review: First I owned the PS3 version then bought the PC version lured in by some gameplays on youtube.I already finished story mode in the PS3 version (finished as in I got bored by the bland characters without any agency other than "gotta make that paper brah" and stopped playing the game because the world was boring and the cops were killing any and all fun to be had) so I basically bought this for online mode.The good things first OptimizationThe game runs great. The Framerate seldom dips. GraphicsIt looks pretty good.Now about the negative aspects. GTA online is a boring grind. I told myself I'd not care about money and levels but it turns out you have to and you have to grind the same few jobs over and over and over to get money and rank points to level up because EVERYTHING is hidden behind a pay and rank wall so tall Trump would tell Rockstar to take it down a notch. The payouts are really poor so it takes you forever to save up money for something you'd like but can't buy because your level isn't high enough. Now I wouldn't mind this if the races were fun but all I get is the same boring supercar race (looking at you congestion charge) over and over then maybe some "muscle up" perhaps one or another offroad race but they're all equally dull.Where the hell are the oddball races? Taking rusty tractors down Mt. Chiliad? Racing golf carts on a runway which planes are taking off and landing on? Cycling on the freeway in the opposing lane with traffic on? Helicopter races through the wind mill farm? Faggios through a cow farm? ANYTHING ELSE THAN ANOTHER "DRIVE THIS EXOTIC SUPERTURD ON THE SAME COURSE YOU'VE DRIVEN ON COUNTLESS TIMES JUST TO GET THAT MEASLY PAYOUT?"Oh" you'll say "Just make these races yourself and then host them".Yeah I'll make them and then grow a nice beard waiting for even one soul to join. Sounds like real fun.In the end this game feels like nothing but a skinner box to make people buy shark cards.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After 3+ years of playing GTA V on both PS4 and PC and putting in hundreds of hours into the game Rockstar unfairly banned my account and reset all of my character progress. I had to grind and grind to make money because Rockstar wants players to buy their vastly overpriced Shark Cards and I along with other people with high cash balances was unjustly banned and lost it all.Support tickets I submitted were ignored and met with the same copy and paste responses repeating their ban policy. After this ordeal I am never going to buy another Rockstar affiliated product. They don't care about their players or customers. They only want to make money.

review: Product received for free. MODS ARE BACK
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: UPDATE 5/26/2017 This game is filled with hackers and Rockstar/Take Two do nothing about it. Most of the game is spent watching loading screens tons of missions are bugged and impossible to complete and the entire racing scene has completely died because there is no point. This game is terrible and anyone who likes it should be drug out into the street and shot. I wish I could get my money back for this garbage. I hope anyone who supports Rock Star and Take Two in the future by purchasing their games dies of cancer them and their whole family.Original Review I bought this game specifically to use mods and contribute to the modding community with my own creations. The online mode sounded very appealing to me as well when reading about it but the actual experience of the online mode leaves much to be desired. Granted this is the first foray into official multi player for the series and as long as it mostly worked I would let it slide. My favorite of this series of games is still the first two before they started forcing clichéd story lines and character arcs down our throats and for the most part the online mode of GTA 5 is a return to that style of gameplay. I'll focus more on this before describing my dereliction from Rockstar altogether.I couldn't jump straight into multi player the game forces you to complete the intro of the single player story for no apparent reason before letting you go online even though the intro doesn't segue or connect in any way to the online experience. This is a poor design choice even for rookies in multi player. After about 15 minutes of single player rushing and skipping cut scenes I was finally able to go online and create what would be my in game persona. Dear god every human you can possibly create looks like an in bred mongoloid. This is because you don't actually create your character you're forced by Rockstar to believe in evolution and choose your parents who all look like apes wearing clothes to form what would be a genetic representation of your character. After this you're given extremely limited tools to fix the disaster that is the belief in evolution and perhaps dress your character to look like some cliched persona (there are plenty of fedora's by the way more evidence that Rockstar wants to force its belief in atheism upon you). There are no body modifications you aren't allowed to gain muscle or weight. Originally I thought it was a default slate and they would let you alter this by working at it like in San Andreas but no you're stuck being an out of shape un evolved caveman or if you choose a woman you'll look like a crack addicted harlot with saggy breasts.The online gameplay is pretty much a grindfest for cash. Race in various ways against other players that don't know how to turn off the default rubber banding so the less skilled players get to cheat by slowing you down They haven't improved the driving since the last game so you either get the car with no traction or the car with traction there's no in between. You can also have shootout death matches with other players in a very under developed battle system. What to do with cash? buy cars that you can steal anywhere but now you're able to paint them and add lights on the bottom. If you grind enough you can upgrade the performance very slightly. You can also get an apartment or condo if you save enough cash to uhh... Actually I'm not really sure what the feature is supposed to be for I guess it's a place to hide from other players but you can just go offline to do that. In fact the only thing worthwhile to do is watch TV which Rockstar poured a ton of effort into. They have full length animated shows on TV. I wish they would have used those resources to put more actual content into the gameplay. If Rockstar wants to make TV shows they should do that instead. They've worn themselves out too thin on this game and it shows. I became bored very quickly online. All the players in the open world are extremely cut throat. The world feels empty even with all the pedestrians and traffic. There's no depth to anything. The heists are fun but the novelty wears off fast and becomes another repetitive task to earn cash. I guess I was expecting more of a "grand theft auto" experience. Something like where I could start a gang with some players go steal a car out of the garage of a rival gang's leader and then challenge them to a race for it or have them perform a heist in exchange. Or use our gang's resources to take over a territory of the city for our drug trafficking and prostitution and try to expand it through gang wars with other players. Give me something risky to do let me put something at stake. Let me race some proctology patient for the pink slip to my pos car. Hell I would love perma death in this game it's not like I am very fond of the truck stop harlot I was forced to use through the abysmal character creator.I was a bit disappointed by GTA Online but this is PC. I waited about one week after release to purchase the game because I wanted to give the community some time to develop some very much needed modding tools. My prayers were answered in Mr. Alexander Blade's notorious Scripthook V release. There was so much joy to be had running around the streets of SA as a husky mauling anyone who looked at me funny or taking a swim in the ocean as a dolphin. The latter conjured up ideas about a mod I would love to create based on the old Ecco the Dolphin games. With renewed vigor I happily installed various mods including a bodyguard script which allowed me to spawn npc's to follow me around in the open world and the most fun of all the pedestrian riot mod which simulated an end of the world scenario in which every citizen has gone mad and gets a random weapon and kills anyone and everyone in a frenzy. It is quite literally chaos and the most fun I've probably ever had in a game I can remember. I made a mini game out of it by trying to survive while crossing the map. I had hours of fun with this but it came to an abrupt end when Rockstar pushed out a patch which broke scripthook.I didn't bother loading the game back up. I decided to wait for the next iteration of scripthook and give a few more days for people to release even more mods. Today I saw a video of a guy that made a gravity gun mod (Half life 2 yeah I know what you're thinking. It's ing awesome) and also that Rockstar is now banning people for using single player mods. Rockstar is banning people for using single player mods. Banning people for using single player mods. Kill yourselves Rockstar I'm done. I won't disseminate your company any more you've become another corrupted developer/publisher like EA Activision and Ubisoft welcome to the club. I'll never purchase another Rockstar game in my life unless you reverse this and publicly apologize. I'm also going to attempt to get a chargeback from my credit card for this purchase changing the EULA after purchase should be illegal.I hope everyone who works for Rockstar gets their cars stolen and then run over by them. Do not buy Grand Theft Auto V/5. Torrent this game and wait for private servers to be available if you want to check out the online experience.

review: Rockstar is a horrid company. If not for mods this game would be complete trash. 300+ cars are pointless with terrible physics i.e. off roading a truck or a Super car means nothing. The Police are stupid and completely un realistic the world although pretty is dead and lifeless the online is full of idiots and 12 year olds outside of the story there is not anything worth doing the civilians are and insane and like I said mods make the game. Now the game would be ok with mods but Rockstar manages to completely screw this up as well. The CONSTANT USELESS UPDATES break mods and make the one thing that makes the game fun for more than 10 minutes broken! The NAZI like Social Club is another horrible addition.....it FORCES YOU to login and if you can't then it destroys your entire game. I personally hate online games and like to play single player and with Rockstar NOPE! They force you into some tie with online crap. I hate this company I hate this game and I will NEVER buy another Rockstar product again because this new direction they have taken will be the norm now.

review: Paid $60 for the game and put nearly a thousand hours into my online account only to be banned out of the blue today. No reason given. Wasn't doing anything suspicious. Never modded cheated hacked or received modded money in my life. I was level 282 I had it all so why would I start modding now? Customer support ticket I filed was instantly closed and I was told that all banning 'decisions' are final and cannot be appealed. Great. Thanks guys.To top it all off it seems that their banning system is banning more legitimate players than actual modders. Fantastic.Singleplayer is fun.Online can be fun with a friend or two but the community is absolute You will be killed or blown up for absolutely no reason by someone with a bloody VTOL warship. Avoid online if you don't have people to play with.TL DR Customer support doesn't exist online is a show unless you play with friends only and singleplayer is fun.

review: This Game is pretty good optimized. I completed the game on my 7 year old PC without any problems with stable FPS. Dunno about GTA Online.But let's move onto the Story Graphics and Gameplay. Graphics are amazing with mods even better nothing more to say. Gameplay is pretty awesome too you can do countless of things it's extremely realistic and fun. The story is great.I downloaded the game in 9th class when a new girl came into my class. I fell in love with that girl. As the time progressed i tried on that girl but she didn't show any interest in me. One night i saw on her snapchat how she's hanging out with another boy and being very close with each other. I bet they had s*x that night. At that night i was playing GTA 5 and the mission was where (SPOILER ALERT) Michael catches his wife in bed with another guy. I felt like whatever was happening in the game happened to me in real life kind of. While i was driving around Los Santos i've been listening to sad songs that include Love Hurt and it really touched me. Like this game was especially made for me. Now everytime i hear the songs i get reminded of this girl. She made me suffer by always posting snapchats hugging flirting and cuddling with other boys but GTA 5 was here for me. I've found comfort and peace here. Michael Franklin and Trevor were like life teachers talking more about life while me 16 years old had no idea what would come in future. But now 1 year after i finished GTA 5 and got over that girl. I'd still like to get in game put on my favorite radio station and listen to those songs that gave me so many emotions just to feel that pain again. The pain that made me feel like a real human being. For me this is a best game ever made. I will never find another game that will have the ability to touch me emotionally like this one did. Thank you Rockstar for making this really awesome game!! At the end i just want to say something. ( Anita f**k you you f***ing s**t for f***ing with my feelings! )

review: In itself GTA Online is fun to play whether you're hanging out with friends or grinding it out on your own. The issue I have with Online is the sheer volume of hackers/modders ruining the game for others be it through farming kills on noobs by switching in and out of passive mode or dropping ridiculous amounts of money into innocent players' accounts. The recent slew of bans on innocent players with no option for appeal too is definitely not helping with that part of the experience. I have friends who worked hard grinding into a pretty nice setup that were banned for no reason whatsoever while hackers and modders still roam free. Pretty move especially since I've heard customer service is pretty bad as well. Apparently people who've just gotten the game and have only played for a few minutes to an hour have been banned too so it's definitely got to be an error in their detection. Overall I won't tell anyone not to play the game... just do so at your own discretion.

review: Chicken mushroom and leek pies( serves 4 )Chicken mushroom and leek pies Photo by Tam West12345Ratings No ratings yet51Bite21/8/2017Sid SahrawatAdd to favouritesmake a comment Print print this recipeIngredients1 Tbsp Olive oil20 g Butter1 Leek cut off the top green stalk use only the white part trim slice in half lengthwise and then slice finely100 g Mushrooms cleaned and finely chopped800 g Chicken thighs diced1 Tbsp Flour1 handful Sage leaf finely chopped200 g Creme fraiche2 Tbsp Dijon mustard2 sheets Flaky puff pastry we used Paneton1 large Egg beaten + add to shopping listDirectionsHeat oven to 200C. In a large frying pan melt the oil and butter then add the leek and mushrooms. Fry gently until the leeks soften. Transfer the leek and mushrooms to a bowl. Put the pan back on the heat.Toss the chicken with flour and some salt and pepper. Next add the chicken to the hot frying pan and cook until all sides are golden brown. Add the sage creme fraiche mustard and mushroom and leek mixture.If you have individual pie ramekins turn one ramekin upside down on the pastry and using a knife cut out the pastry to create a top for the pie. You can skip this step if you are making one large pie.Divide the mixture among 4 individual ramekins or one baking dish. Cover with puff pastry cut outs or roll the sheet over and seal on top of your baking dish. Brush the egg wash on the top of the pastry. Cut a slit on each pie (4 slits if using the large baking dish). Place in the top half of the oven and cook for 20 minutes until the pastry is golden.

review: T2 pushing to criminalise single player modders in an attempt to keep the micro transaction cash cow lactating (GTAO) is a sad watershed moment for all open world games... Not just R*'s.It opens the door for publishers to force players into leaving the SP space after exhausting the scenarios provided by the Dev's and leaves the player with a small selection of options.... 1 Leave the game behind and move onto another game (T2 hope another of theirs) 2 Grind online with the hope of affording the latest DLC vehicles buildings or clothes... (cosmetic horse armour anybody?) or Take 2's number one entry into the company's secret wish journal 3 Chose that new DLC car you cant afford?.... MICRO TRANSACTION Chose that new penthouse with a giant wall safe?... MICRO TRANSACTION Choose life. Choose a job. Choose a career. Choose a family. Choose a ing big television Choose washing machines cars compact disc players and electrical tin can openers. Choose good health low cholesterol and dental insurance. Choose fixed interest mortgage repayments. Choose a starter home. Choose your friends. Choose leisure wear and matching luggage. Choose a three piece suite on hire purchase in a range of ing fabrics. Choose DIY and wondering who the you are on a Sunday morning. Choose sitting on that couch watching mind numbing spirit crushing game shows stuffing ing junk food into your mouth. Choose rotting away at the end of it all pishing your last in a miserable home nothing more than an embarrassment to the selfish ed up brats you have spawned to replace yourselves. Choose your future. Choose life . . . But why would I want to do a thing like that? I chose not to choose life I chose something else. And the reasons? There are no reasons. Who needs reasons when you've got MICRO TRANSACTIONS?But what do i know.. I'm just a filthy modder performing crazy illegal acts like... Adding better filters and weather effects orAdding RL cars like the one i own into a single player game only i play....Thats basically the same as hacking multiplayer sessions to add xp or credits to my character and greffing other players.. right?The same as using god mode in an online deathmatch?I guess I'll have to settle for playing Bethesda games and modding the glitches away... I can hear the macho dragons calling even as I type *ooooooo yeaaaaaa*

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a great game rich story interesting characters fun missions. It's got it all Truely a great game. Which when combined with the amazing community mods available has made my 600+ hours in it pure action filled fun.Grand Theft Auto Online however is a microtransaction filled turd. The prices for these "micro"transactions are absolutely ridiculous. 75 for 8 million in game dollars? That's like a hangar and ONE plane. For SEVENTY FIVE Euros SEVENTY FIVE. Completely insane. Also the rewards for missions and activities are so painfully low for example you just finished in first place in a 10 minute 16 player race? Oh have fun with 35k. Or you just spent 30 minutes sourcing and selling a car? 80k. Spent the last hours planning and perfectly executing a heist on a big bank? 1 million oh wait no you have to split it four ways. It takes A WEEK to even make enough money to buy ONE car. And seeing what the last few updates have brought to the table you will probably be looking at months of grinding to buy whatever t rockstar has put in their next "free" DLCUPDATE Rockstar removed one million of my money that I earned from races I'm done with this game.

review: If you had the "Grand Theft Auto V Launcher has stopped working bug " a recent patch has fixed it. Game works for me now. Good PC port. If you're hoping for a decent online community though you won't find it here. People will shoot at you randomly and run over you and call you racial slurs but you can turn on passive mode to prevent them from doing that. The first two things anyway they'll still call you racial slurs. But whenever you have passive mode on you can't even pull out your guns to rob stores. And there's not much to do in the game besides heists but the core designs of the heists are really Your team only has one life. If two people die in the heist ever you have to restart. And for all the heists after the first one you need four people. So unless you have three friends (Who must be good at the game mind you or else you'll keep failing) you're stuck with pubbies that will usually screw up badly.

review: Overall it is a good solid game with many fun and interesting aspects. Has plenty of things to do to occupy your time with friends or by yourself. Good for people who play with mouse and keyboard or gamepad. The only issues I really have with the game is rockstars lack of punishment and vigilence for hackers or rather modders. People using mods to hack special vehicles buffs or levels and the like to utterly ruin multiplayer sessions. I am all for modded servers that add a special bit to peoples gameplay experience but when someone spawns themselves a super buffed tank or plane and goes around killing people for the lols it ruins the entire experience.Then those same people turning right around and getting pissy when people calling them out for it and using their mods to kick people from the server or lock them in invisible boxes or otherwise screw with peoples ability to play the game. I'll never understand why people do that. They may as well be playing by themselves at that point.So until rockstar cracks down on the hacking I cannot in full consciousness recommend the game to anyone that wants to play open multiplayer. Otherwise I would highly recommend the rest of the game. private sessions with your friends or the campaign are all great.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What a Pity.Up until very recently (yesterday or thereabouts as of this posting) this was a game I would often excitedly encourage my friends and family to purchase and play. Despite being shy of being released 4 years ago and still retailing at full price I felt that the experience warranted the cost consider the single player This game was/is essentially the Don Rickles of its kind/time. Nothing is safe nobody no social circle no profession no fad or meme escapes its ridicule and that ridicule was so very very smart. It speaks to the quality of the voice acting the writing and the story overall that once this game is said and done you feel as comfortable as you do with the sociopathic narcissists that occupy the game's sprawling rogues' gallery. It was dark gritty often filthy but never in a way that wasn't self aware or lost its sense of fun.The multiplayer compounds the value of this game threefold as far as I'm concerned. Think about it you've gone through a campaign that can take anywhere from 30 60 hours (depending on how many extra missions and events you choose to explore and complete) if you're like me you sat down and watched a few of the in game TV shows or listened to Dr. Ray DeAngelo Harris "Ommmmm" his way through abusing Cheryl on public radio time and again and then Online opens up and it's beautiful I can honestly say it was everything I'd ever dreamed Multiplayer GTA could be.With a ragtag group of malformed bastards looking like something from a Hammer Horror Multi Creature Feature my friends and I robbed convenience stores broke into Fort Zancudo and requisitioned Fighter Jets to wreak havoc on Player and NPC alike! We took bike rides up mountains and found holdfast locations to incite sieges and slaughtered LSPD Officers in their hundreds we beat other players to death with golf clubs then took those golf clubs and played 9 holes at the Country Club near the high rise condos we'd purchased. We one upped each other with car mods did the co op missions the races and the deathmatches.And then like a bolt of lightning Heists. Ho lee she it. We robbed banks we robbed Private Military Compounds we broke a guy who was basically Walter White out of prison we got into raging gun battles with biker gangs we robbed drug dealers and then to top it all off we robbed another damn bank except a big one and rode and died and died and rode and shot and were shot at on a high speed pursuit across the damn map before finally jumping off a ing cliff and parachuting into a river to get into our escape boat. . What a rush!Then it started to happen the cracks started to show a bit. First came the announcement that there would be no more heists www.digitaltrends.com citing the amount of 'effort' a "huge undertaking" which I took to mean "money" which was funny because they were keen on selling those Shark Cards for in game fun bucks. 8 Million in game for $100 USD was/is the best possible exchange rate. That's about the time they released the VIP content and then eventually and many patches later the CEO content and then the Bikers and now as of a few days ago Gun Running.It was a slow decline but it was damn steady. Two years in and the content shifted from the traditional mission based co op with a twist of overworld mayhem to a fully two fisted overworld brawl everyone and their dog trying to sell meth or boost cars or perform assassination missions and everyone at odds with everyone else new vehicles with ridiculous advantages being released nearly every major patch it became an arms race the overworld was chaos.And it was a grind to get the reward a major grind and the only person who really profited was the guy who owned the business the people who helped him got a nominal fee at best and the chance to look at or sometimes play with his toys. Two years in and we're still selling the game at full price. Two years in and they're still hawking those God Damned cards. I just wanted a new heist but I guess those were too expensive to make.Despite all of this I was still recommending the game I still loved Franklin Michael and even Trevor. I still loved replaying the single player heists and I still loved the writing and the different voice acted versions of conversations you might hear on the way to/from a mission and every once in a while they would give online a shot in the arm Cunning Stunts was a favorite of mine and had me reliving childhood fantasies of being a Hot Wheels race car driver but it always boiled back down to that same old monetary formula and this last update the same as the two before it changes nothing.Here we are new content patch and it offers new destructive expensive weapons and vehicles that you have to grind for with a minimum buy in of something like $4 6mil in game to even get the full benefit of the expansion and the overzealous nerfing of everyone's bank accounts because of the hackers/modders who protest spammed money into everyone's hands that they possibly could and of course this happens right as the new expansion drops. But hey you can always buy a Shark Card right?Between the news about Take2 claiming we're not giving them enough money and of course the policy www.vg247.com concerning gamerant.com mods in singleplayer as an obvious attempt to shut down the massive waves of free money that the aforementioned hackers/modders spammed into Online I can't recommend this game anymore. I'd gladly pay for new expansions I'd gladly pay for a season pass hell I'd pay episode per episode for new heists!But I cannot and will not support a company who claims we're not giving it enough money 4 years in charging full price and outright demanding I either grind my off or pay to skip to the reward in their previously glorious yet increasingly online experience.I'm uninstalling and I'm keeping it uninstalled. I have no further interest in this game and am not likely to support future releases from Take2 or Rockstar.

review: Single player is still awesome but Online is very very weird. Loading times are absolutely rediculous taking minutes where my PC is doing nothing at all and the only status is "loading...". My connection is reliable at 200mbit so that shouldn't be a problem. Items are at least 10x as expensive online for no apparent reason and it's entirely unclear how to achieve anything beyond quick wins and many deaths. Kind of weird if you're good at the game offline and online is just so slow and frustrating. They apparently keep adding game mod(e)s and apparel but the basic interface is excruciatingly unfriendly and slow. Try going to the shooting range and selecting another gun/challenge without quitting waiting for about 2 minutes and then starting again. Cannot recommend this if you're curious about the online bit. Story mode is obviously still amazing! But frankly that part of the game is already old and not worth the pretty massive price anymore.

review: Enforcing modding prohibition is bad for the health of your game you should let your players express freely their creativity with the software they are purchasing.As for the game it's a good game. I have played around 300 hs most of them have been using singleplayer mods. Why? Because once you finish story mode the singleplayer gets very boring but you can add almost unlimited new content to enrich your singleplayer experience with mods.About online let's better not talk about it. 35% of the time playing are just waiting for loading screens. Once you are in a session you have a very laggy gameplay only to be disconnected from your session with no apparent reason 10 minutes later. And this happens always to me.Want to pilot a cool plane? Or ride a nice car? Sure just play 10 hours of missions you don't want to play in order to get the ingame money OR pay T2 for those ridiculous "shark" cards. This is why i needed mods in my game in order to make it enjoyable. If i want to pilot a plane i want to pilot a plane i don't want to play missions.

review: This is what happens when the gaming community bands together. I bought GTA V (for the second time) on PC so that I could mod the single player and Take Two think that as a customer I haven't paid enough? Any time spent in GTA Online came after my time modding the game. This review is part of the stand against the talking heads at Take Two.Another side note upon the release of the new gun running DLC I recieved a message as I loaded into the game telling me to 'stop cheating or action would be taken' I have never cheated however have had money forced upon me by hackers (whom are a completely different thing to modders). Sort the hackers out and don't threaten your loyal customers when they have become victim to a hacker. You don't threaten me with action when a hacker teleports me to him and kills me repeatedly for 10 minutes so don't threaten me with action when I am teleported to a hacker who then credits my account with GTA $$$ for 10 minutes. I don't have a choice in either situatuon!

review: I would only recommend this if you get it cheap and intend to do little more than mod around in SP. Many people loved the story and missions but I found too much of it lacking. The extent of your experiences within the game never really make anything more than a cheap imitation of immersion. It is a world full of great detail and promise that is wasted on too many shallow experiences. MP was a grindy sort of fun in the beginning but every new update takes this closer to the grind/price scheme of your dime a dozen mobile game. If this game was made before selling in game currencies became "de rigueur " it could have been a respectable experience. While you don't ever have to buy anything new and fancy everything is priced so excessively that the grind necessary to achieve any level of "success" is catastrophic. Rockstar seems to be doing everything in their power to sell you Sharkcards. As it stands now a new player to MP would have to spend several million dollars just for the opportunity to marginally take advantage of the newer updates. Money earned on CEO missions is very poor for the CEO (who fronts significant money) and embarrassingly poor for his associates. On top of that Rockstar encourages PvP activities between rival companies and random players to further reduce the money earned. You don't have to do any of that though. You could just buy a $99 SharkCard and get 3 cool cars instead...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Easily one of the best games I have ever played in my life. A great game that becomes legendary when cruising Los Santos with your crew of friends killing other players and enemies alike. Both the singleplayer campaign and the GTA online aspect are amazingly well done and offer at least hundreds of potential hours of gameplay. Owning property a fleet of cars aircraft an armada of vessels and an arms cache that rivals a US military surplus in an online environment beautifully crafted by a masterful developer such as rockstar RUNNING AT GLORIOUS 1080p+ 60fps+?Seriously whats not to love?

review: Bought This game for a seccond time on PC (Orignally had it on Xbox 360). Storymode is great. Online is fine although "Shark Cards" are being basically shoved down peoples throats at this point. Good Sides to Singleplayer Good Storyline Good Gameplay Good Sides to Online Its freaking multiplayer GTA. (Though limited due to the heavy increase in the need of shark cards to really do anything anymore. )Bad Sides to Storymode Bland after you complete the story really. Mods have been called "Illegal" by the games publisher and they have even went so far as to shut down singleplayer mods entirely by killing OpenIV.... Bad Side of Online Microtransaction HEAVY (if you dont want to spend your life grinding missions on loop for days on end making around 9 15 k when mostly everything cool costs like 8 9 million GTA$.. "Thats $99 for a 8 million GTA$ shark card By the way.... ") No mods (Not even in private sessions) Little to no replay value once you are high level Rampant cheating.. All and all. i have to just say one thing.. b Please. do not buy this game until take two gets their head our of their backends. /b

review: EDIT (as of 6/07/2017 DD/MM/YYYY) Apparently Open IV is back. However I stand by my opinion and I'm going to leave my review as negative. GTA Online remains a cash cow that is whipped by Take Two and Rockstar regularly for money. It is still riddled by s that just want to ruin your day. The gunrunning DLC looks really cool not going to deny that but as mentioned before I am not buying $17 000 000 in shark cards or grinding for hours on end for that. It's just not fun.Rockstar and take two get your together guys.EDIT They removed Open IV support. Remove that... remove my positive review. Shame on you rockstar for bending over to take two.Take Two AND Rockstar have taken all this milking of the cash cow that is GTA Online too far. $17 000 000 minimum for all the vechicles in the new update. In shark cards that is worth another 3 copies of the full game. This is unacceptable we paid $60 for this game I do not expect to pay another $180 dollars for vehicles in a new update. Remember when you could actually WORK for the new items and $700 000 was expensive? Yeah I don't.Shame on you Take Two for ruining what was an excellent game shame an you Rockstar for allowing this to happen.ORIGINAL REVIEW (From 23/08/2015 DD/MM/YYYY) If you don't mind the extensive amount of hackers on the online servers who can remotely control you and ruin your game then this game is just purely awesome.Even though its quite a hefty price the amount of gameplay you can get out of this game is substancial. I have already completed the single player but I can still get alot of fun out of it and when you mod single player its a hell of a lot of fun.Online is also fun when you have friends to play it with. And even though it is tuff to get a good amount of money without buying shark cards playing with your friends in races and freeroam is really fun.All in all I think the game is worth the money but only buy it if you KNOW you will put alot of time into this.

review: The cease and desist sent to the creators of OpenIV make it clear that Take Two Interactive (The publishers of Rockstar Games) don't care about its fanbase and will gladly throw out the baby with the bathwater. This is coupled with a lack of post release single player support and updates to "Grand Theft Auto Online" that boil down to forced attempts to cajole players into wasting money on microtransactions known as "Shark Cards" in order to access the content they add. The newest update (as of the time of writing this review) Gunrunning has "research" times which cost upwards of 8 million ingame dollars. This amount of ingame money roughly translates to One Hundred (!!!!) Dollars of microtransations in the real world. In short I wouldn't bother buying the game. There's other stuff out there that's worth your money.

review: GRIND FOR EVERYTHING
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is addicting as hell and was fun when it released but it has so much potential that hasn't been reached. It's a shame.This review is from the perspective of someone who has played almost every game in the series (1 2 3 VC SA LSC VCS IV EFLC V) and has sunk tons of hours into most of the major releases. I've been playing this game since launch preordered on PS3 and PC and at this point I only play to hang out with friends and race / collect cars.Story Story is weak IMO if you want a great gritty story play IV and EFLC. I adored those stories especially with the how the expansions tie in to the base game. V's story feels tacked on like they designed a ton of cool missions but had no idea how they would impliment them into a cohesive story. They probably heard people say IV was too boring compared to SA the game that came before it and went over the top in the other direction.Missions The missions are the highlight of the singleplayer they make great eye candy for trailers and are super fun the first time around. Don't expect massive replayability though because the game kinda forces you to switch characters in a lot of the cool shootout missions so the experience ends up not being as varied as one might assume. The main reason to replay the story is to try out the heists in whatever option you didn't try the first time around but I think you can try that from the "Replay Mission" feature after you beat the game so you might not have to go through the whole story again.Driving The car physics are great and provide a very good platform for serious racing. There are physics bugs like curb boosting in the game and the "Mid Drive Speed Boost" but they don't spoil the driving too much. If I do have a complaint I think the cars are a little too arcadey and too easy to drive fast. Complete polar opposite of IV. There are some cars that are tough to push to their limits like the new Issi Classic or the old Dominator Racecar and the Elegy but many of the cars feel a bit too easy. The bikes are a pile of twitchy death and garbage. IV's expansions made the best bike physics of any GTA game to date but V's bikes have way too much grip and most of them are too twitchy except the big sports bikes like the Hakuchou and the choppers.Shooting The guns feel like airsoft or something similar they don't have any real powerful feeling to them but the actual shooting mechanics don't feel dated yet. I will always love SA but I'll admit the aiming and movement while shooting feel dated now and that feeling is starting to creep in with IV too. Plus you'll find if you are online the only guns people use are the minigun and explosives or the heavy sniper so I guess shooting doesn't really matter. There are a lot of guns with tons of customization especially in Online but you won't really use them because they aren't "meta".Flying IV had much better helicopter physics than V and they were the best in any GTA to date. V's probably come in 2nd but the severe limits on how far you can lean your heli are really annoying. You'll find that if you need to fight ground targets in most helis you have to fly above them and jerk the heli back then forwards until you can shoot straight down on them. Also they feel too arcadey compared to IV's helis. As far as planes go of course IV doesn't have planes but R* still did better back in GTA SA because there is much less turbulence and interference from wind in that game making planes more fun even if it's less realistic. Also in SA the camera didn't tilt with your plane which made stunt flying much less disorientating. Why can't we turn that off in the settings?Graphics On a good PC when you crank up the graphics the game still looks amazing and even after 2 100 hours on the refined PC port of the game (Old gen looks much worse than current gen and PC) I still am in awe sometimes of the beauty of the game world.Map The map is large sure but it sure as hell isn't designed with the same inteligence they had in GTA SA. This map is many times larger but much less dense meaning large areas of the map are far under utilized. Like unless you're driving around an offroading truck nobody ever goes to the mountains to the east of Los Santos even though the terrain is gorgeous. Most of the area outside of Los Santos consists of straight up mountains which is boring. The Alamo Sea also takes up a good portion of the map although it is a pretty cool area. The desert is too small same with the forest. The mountains make it a royal pain trying to fly by helicopter or drive to Paleto Bay and back so nobody ever goes there. SA has a smaller map and is a decade older but you should still buy it and at least check out how much more diverse that map is. Not only was the desert and forest(s) larger it has many more towns and 2 MORE CITIES. Also there are not as many cool interiors to enter than GTA IV and unlike IV the ones that are there are not always open Online which means you can't just enter all of the singleplayer's interiors with your friends for a shootout. There are some like the bank but not all of the SP ones are open.Online Don't play online unless you can get hundreds of millions from a kid with a mod menu or unless you want to stick to private lobbies with friends and do co op missions until you have the cash to take on the 5 mains heists.Heists The SP heists and Online heists are fun and definitely worth doing but they (Online) get boring if you need to grind them for cash. Enjoy doing them once with friends and maybe once more for Criminal Mastermind but if you grind them enough you'll get PTSD every time you get an invite to Prison Break Finale on your phone. Never do heists with randoms. Even with 2 friends and only 1 random they can still it all up for you.Doomsday Heist If you do decide to play Online and like it you'll want to do the Doomsday Heist eventually. Once you work your way up from being a liquor store robber to being a hired gun car exporter gun smuggler airborne terrorist etc you and your friends will want to do this set of 3 heists. It's the most fun you can have outside of random messing around with friends in freeroam. I played it on hard mode all the way through with 1 friend and it was a blast and a real test of if you were actually good at the game or not. I loved it. It was extremely satisfying to complete. Economy This is why the review is negative. GTA Online being the place you spend most of your days has an economy that pushes microtransactions in a full price game. Then they inflate DLC vehicle clothing and weapon prices every update (A top tier supercar in a 2014 dlc pack was $550k $725k now it's $2.5M $2.7M) and they have the audacity to try to shut down singleplayer modding and add shortcut packs for like $100 for a full price title... Remember in 2012 or so when Battlefield 3 did this and people lost their minds? I haven't heard any outrage from people about it now.. Luckily on PC you can have modders give you cash if you know where to look but those poor S.O.B's on console are stuck with this awful economy and having to grind for days for a new damn car. It's a travesty. GTA Online with the economy it had in 2013 maybe with adjustments to payouts would be a great game even with all the new vehicle combat and military gear that has no place in a multiplayer GTA title..All in all if you want to buy it for the singleplayer go ahead when it's on sale but you should try other GTA's too because I feel the stories are better when the games are set in a time period. The outlier is IV which was set in present day 2008 and is the best story of the bunch IMO. SA set in 1992 and VC set in 1986 also have great stories based on pop culture from the time.If you want to buy this game mainly for Online do your research and see all the shady R* does and see how toxic the game is..

review: The game play is very clunky You would think that after it being out for about 2 years it would be running smooth. Boy was I wrong for assuming that. The game runs very laggy mostly due to tons of hackers controlling the servers. Game play with friends is very difficult. For example there is a 50 50 chance of getting the invite to join your friends game and if you want to click on their name to join their game 50 50 chance of the game telling you they're off line even though they really are online! Hackers will kill you over and over again and again and you will be stuck in a circle of death for their entertainment or until you just log off the game. If you are still trying to play the game there is a very good chance that you will get banned for hacking just by alt tabbing out of the game to look up something online which was the case with one of my friends as well. Play at your own risk. I do not recommend this game.

review: All of what Rockstar Games meant to me is kinda going out the window. Since gta 5's online situation ( hackers wise ) the game is slowly being ruined. Every attempt to stop people from using scripts or whatever programs they're using to bypass R*'s 'security' seems futile. The cheaters bounce back every time. The micro transactions heaven also didn't help because after I paid 60 Euro for a AAA game the next logical thing to do is to spend more and more money on in game currency with artificially inflated prices for items that make the game more enjoyable. This is mine and others' fault for encouraging this type of business practice but the gaming industry is slowly going down the pooper so there's no surprise there.The last disrespect towards the old and new fans of the franchise is the OpenIV ( possible no mods allowed ) situation that is currently happening right now ( June 2017 ). Seems like a slap over the face to people that actually enjoyed the single player only experience and as well tried to make it even more enjoyable with the addition of mods. This particular modification had no effect on GTA online since it doesn't allow the player to connect to any online sessions thus the devs making sure that the players could only play single player version of the game. ( in other words they weren't hurting anyone )From a business point of view I understand what's going on here T2 CEO wants more people to join online and thus being tempted to spend more money on 'Shark Cards' and thus increasing the company's profits but even so I don't like or agree with this tactic ( seems a bit aggressive to me ) since I doubt people will now think to themselves " Hmmm... no mods eh? Maybe I should join online and see what's that all about. Oh this car costs i.e. a ridiculous amount of in game currency so I must either grind the game or hey look micro transactions... nice". I doubt people would have this approach. ( maybe some will who knows )Also another thing to point out YouTubers that are making a living out of modded gta 5 gameplay videos are also being affected if not now then in the long run.I might be wrong about everything I just wrote but even if that's the case I can say with a clean consciousness that I won't be playing online any time soon ( unless they somehow rectify this situation ) and even then I'll stay away from the micro transactions.That's all I have to say about this. If you made it to this point in my review then thank u for reading my wall of text ( or semi wall ). Cheers.

review: Rockstar's banning policy and lack of follow up is unacceptable. On March 23 numerous players had their accounts banned from GTA Online for one month with no explanation and no updates from Rockstar. The popular theory is that some new anti cheat code was flagging ALL players in a session if one player had been using modding software. That was 7 days ago. To make matters worse Rockstar has a no appeal policy regarding banned accounts and will not provide details as to why an account was banned. For all the details please see this Reddit thread https //www.reddit.com/r/gtaonline/comments/86q5lj/032318_gta_online_ban_wave_what_we_know_so_far/?sort new

review: Unless you are rare few who's buying this to run through the story mode you should move along.Story missions are of a high quality and freeroaming in story mode is fun while it's still unexplored and filled with random encounters and events.If you played previous GTA titles and thought that GTA Online should be just like a normal GTA but with other players you are pretty far from the truth. There is very little of actual traditional PvE content and almost all of it is of a low quality. All what is left is ever unsatisfying racing and a empiric toxicating PvP.The only way to have fun is to buy cool stuff play around with it for less then an hour get bored and then to wonder why you even bothered wasting your time or money to earn it.Even if you decide to just play with friends and to hope to have some fun together then I sure hope that all of you are playing from the same location because peer to peer system makes even pleasent evenings with friends into a frustrating cluster of re connecting loading screens.Glue together a PvP nature of the game and peer to peer system and you get yourself an envorement in which it is almost impossible to track on who is really using hacks and who is just a victim of said hacks. And thanks to early Omnipotent Orb* unlocking (Kuruma(armored)) game managed to recruit enough underaged players who lack needed gaming skills and instead trying to compensate for them with hacks and mods. Actually "enough players" is a bit of an understatement. GTA Online is actualy infested with cheating players.If you expect for your account to survive through as many hours of Online as mine you will either end up in a very tight crew who tries to controle public sessions with sheir numbers of legit players. Or if you not a sociable person you will end up exploiting OS firewall settings to block yourself from the most of other players in online. If you will risk it and go out and play GTA Online the way it meant to be played in Public Sessions then your account probably won't survive even for a two weeks.Rescue of a drowning person is a responsobility of a said person. This is what mentality of the people behind this game. Banning both. Cheaters and victims of said cheaters. And after so many years nothing is changed. They did not make any investments nor any proper developments for a better anti cheat system. And that isn't even the worst part. Even if you are just a victim you still going to be treated as a cheater by the technical support team if you adress your problem as being unjustfully banned by their automated system. So don't expect any help from people in power unless you are some sort of media platform celebirty who promotes their stuff.It is unclear who is behind this. 2k Take 2 or The Rockstar themselves but story mode support was cuted off completely after moving into current generation. Leaving players with no choice but to play GTA Online if they want to taste some new content. Sadly latest content rased prices on in game goodies and introdused more spoilsporting ways of earning a good score. That resulting into players getting into naturally frustrating situations that induce violent behaviour towards each other and a desire to simply buy in game money with some real money. Combine this with cheater infestation and you get yourself one heck of a scum ride.Considering all of the above in current state game is simply not worth it to be picked up unless you played previous games and just want to play some story mode.*Omnipotent Orb effect term originated from a Persona role play game. Omnipotent Orb item is a treasure gained from one of the hardest challengies in the game contains the power to make the user immune to about 90% of all attacks in the game. Said item meant to be used to ease the grinding process. The effect of "Omnipotent Orb" on a player is an interesting one. It is basically a very desired item for new players thanks to how overpowered it is. So it motivates them to move forward and to try harder to obtain it. But by the point when players suppose to get their hands on it they are already masterfull enough that they don't need help of this item to be good at the game.

review: They got rid of character transfers so that they could have more money in their pocket I blame their parent company more than Rockstar. And honestly the single player is very good and this is a well handled PC Port.But because of the sheer scummyness of character transfers being taken out of the game I'm gonna downvote this because that is so stupid. I recently got a good PC and I played this game for over 500 hours back when it was active on the 360 500 hours may not seem like a lot but put into perspective this was on the 360 and I probably spent 200 hours looking at the ing loading screen so that's 700 hours 700 divided by 24 is 29 so that's basically a month of my life wasted playing this ing game on my xbox 360 not to mention all the shark cards a bought for that character so around 3 years later I get my pc and I want to get back into GTA V I boot up the online and GUESS WHAT? the ing character transfers are taken out. Now I don't want to hear any t like "oh they did that because modders will bring their modded accounts from the 360 and ps3 to the next gen versions of the game." because that's ignorant and ing stupid my cousin plays GTA V on pc and I have friends who played this game on next gen and can confirm there's modders regardless and if you still don't believe that Take Two Interactive did that so that you would have to restart your online mode and dump more money into this atrocious online mode these are the same ing people who tried to take down a single player mod loader from the game because they thought it was for modding the online mode. I have purchased this game 4 ing times spent hundreds in shark cards and I can't even get a small favor such a transferring my ing character from another platform so I can save money and time in my life? So glad that Take Two cares about their consumers so much. I'm putting all the blame on Take Two and not Rockstar because I want to believe that Rockstar is still the last good Triple A company I want to believe that more than anything. Also the online mode is just disgusting by itself even without my personal problems with my character it's like GTA is trying to become a damn saints row game but that's just more of a nitpick.

review: TakeTwo's recent devision to give the modding tool OpenIV a cease and desist order means that I no longer recommend buying this game or supporting rockstar in general. The modding community has always been huge in GTA and it is sad to see all of the hard work put in by these modders go to waste. After exhausting all single player content mods can breathe new life into the game and banning them will seriously affect the longevity of GTA once primary development ceases. Presumably OpenIV was shut down to get rid of modders dropping people cash and turning people away from Shark Cards. The is ridiculous as OpenIV wasn't even used to get mod menus into the game. Shark Cards and micro transaction in general are a cancer on the gaming industry and I will never be purchasing any Rockstar products again if TakeTwo continues this attitude against modding.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First look at how many hours I have in this game. I have spent a lot of time in it with friends. However there is no way I can recommend this game. I'd like to start off by saying I've been playing since the original lauch on Xbox 360. I had technical issues there with the single player and when I contacted their support about it it somehow became my router's problem that I was getting disconnected from GTA Online. "Fine" I thought "I'll just play single player" that was until the game would crash any time I left the city (which was where my story missions were). After dealing with bitter support agents I finally got it to work and I played on 360 until the pc version came out and I used it to push my newly built pc (980 ti i7 6700k and 16gb of RAM). All of that said the single player is pretty fun for one or two playthroughs but it gets old kinda quick.That's where I thought either multiplayer or mods would help increase the lifespan of this game. Let's start with mutliplayer. At first it seemed rather fun. That was until I tried to steal a car that was deemed "too hot" to add to my garage. Um it's called Grand Theft Auto why can't I commit the crime the game is named after just because of the value of the car in question? Then there's how the game punishes your actions by judging your "mental state" which would be fine if it didn't treat player kills and npc kills as the same. Yes the game will label you a psycopath if you're gunning down NPCs who are shooting at you or passive NPCs that you're just mowing down and/or if you're killing players letf and right or even if you're just trying to defend youreself from another psycopath! To GTA Online it doesn't matter which IS a problem. Of course they do offer free dlc every so often and the updates that add new missions are...lackluster at best. They usually involve bad writing and no variety as to how you as a player can approach them (which considering how much variety there should be in a game like this is laughable). Some missions are built up as taking a "stealth approach" but no matter what you do you get caught so what's even the point of trying to be stealthy? That is assuming you're doing this with friends like I did. God help you if you want to try doing this with randoms. They don't just add new missions though they also offer new vehicles and properties to buy that is assuming you're willing to shell out hundreds of real life dollars on their shark cards because let's face it there's no way that you could earn that much money grinding it through missions and it still be worth it. I've lost more money trying to grind because of the way the game incentivises other players to ruin your multimillion dollar investments just for a few RP points. All in all the multiplayer is an unbalanced mess that wants players to buy into their microtransations scam.Great that's mutliplayer out of the way. Now that we know it's garbage let's try out a few mods...and as I'm sure you've heard by now Take Two Interactive sent a Cease and Desist to OpenIV (which is a very prevalent modding tool I've not really seen any mods that DON'T use it to be honest). I'll say that while it's not exactly unexpected that they would do this it was far from a good move on their part. From the start of the pc port they said that they would not support nor condone modding however they wouldn't do anything to stop it so long as players kept it in single player (think content mods or graphical changes) they would be fine heck rockstar even said they liked a few of the mods. Jump to recent news and apparently even that is a no no according to Take Two Interactive because "using mods disracts players from our shark cards how else are we supposed to gouge players for money if they're not playing our terrible multiplayer?"Lastly I'd like to say how bad their support agents are. For instance I was in a lobby where a player was clearly hacking. After I reported him my game slowed to a crawl and then crashed. When I tried to log back in the game it told me I was banned for hacking. I tried to contact support about having a technical issue (because my game orginally started running very poorly before crashing). Even with my system specs IN HAND the rep asked if my pc could even run the game! Dude of course I can play the game at this point I already had like 200+ hours in steam and they make you give them system info in the initial contact. What's the point of giving you my system info if you're going to completely ignore it?! Then after finding out that I was banned by an automated system the rep forwarded me to an automated email reply that simply said I had to wait out the 2 month banning period.TL DR This game could've been more fun if the executives were more open to the community and willing to focus more on balance instead of money. Only buy it for the vanilla story mode NOTHING ELSE.Edit speling and gramr
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So when I bought GTA V it was when it had declined a bit. At the time I bought it modders were rampant in Online griefing or dropping money on people without consent Rockstar's systems seemingly only ban the innocent due to this. The singleplayer had nothing of the Online ported to it making it seem way worse on top of the grind that is required in the Online to get anything.Though there was a constant fear of getting banned due to a rogue modder or getting my account with all of its effort reset the fallback to this was being able to mod the singleplayer if anything went wrong so yeah that's gone now.Around E3 where little would notice Take Two ordered a cease and desist for a SINGLEPLAYER ONLY MOD a mod that is the staple (like SKSE for skyrim) of all mods in the Singleplayer.They later claimed that it "enables recent malicious mods" to be used in the multiplayer which is naturally wrong as the devs of Open IV put effort into not affecting the Online in any way.Though moves like this to get people to play the Online has been done before this is a step too far as many including me bought the game on PC perhaps after owning console copies JUST for mods.BTW if you also disagree with this post a negative review yourself it may seem like a flash in a pan but it is the most effective chance of Rockstar acting as the negative review score is really what they care about.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
