review: After 60 hours of playing through the single player campaign and the multiplayer I would recommend getting this game on PC and here is why. Perfomance and Optimization Firstly I'm gonna talk about performance and optimization for this game. I remember picking up a copy of GTA IV when it was finally released for PC. Good luck trying to get that to run higher than medium at the time on a decent rig. After numerous patches they kinda fixed the framerate issues to that game. This time around Rockstar actually learned their lesson from GTA IV and hired a team of people dedicated to working on the PC version of their games. It really shows with GTA V. The current rig I'm playing this game on is a GTX 770 2gb VRAM and I can run everything at high/ultra at 1080p 60fps. Rockstar added a ton of graphical options to the graphics settings that you can tweak around with to get the game to look great and run nicely on your rig. And if you have no idea if a certain setting will impact the perfomance of the game they do have a video memory slider that shows how much memory the game is going to use of your graphics card. If you are clueless at all about how to optimize your game if you are running an older rig I would look at this video. It actually goes into detail about what each setting does and which settings you should adjust and why. Click here One thing I do want to mention is the loading times. Those are a kind of a turn off especially when you are trying to load the multiplayer. They take quite a long time and I have no idea if they are ever going to fix that but it's quite annoying when you load into multiplayer boot up a heist with friends then load the heist do said heist then have to sit in a loading screen to load back into the multiplayer again. Loading times on average take about a minute and a half and that's the multiplayer. The single player's loading times for me seem to load a bit faster than the multiplayer's. Single Player Campaign (No Spoilers) I actually held off on playing this game on console because I wanted to experience everything the game had to offer on the PC. The story features 3 characters that you can switch through to do story missions or whatever you want. I mean it is an open world sandbox game. The story was interesting and Trevor and Michael were fantastic. Seeing the struggles they both go through with each other or with family and friends kept me interested and the voice acting was top notch. You may ask well you never mentioned Franklin? What about him? Honestly unless I was super tired when playing the game as Franklin his character was a little lackluster. He also had very few story missions compared to Trevor and Michael that made me not have a stronger connection to his character and when I did do the missions he just didn't seem that interesting to me. Overall the story between the 3 characters is really well done and very interesting. Multiplayer/Grand Theft Auto Online Multiplayer is a giant open world sandbox where you can pretty much do anything you want with random people online or friends. You can go do team deathmatch or racing or parachuting or even golfing. Now after a while these do get boring really quickly and repetitive. Rockstar added heists to the multiplayer which actually spice up the game quite a bit. Think Payday 2 but where it's actually a lot better and more fun than Payday 2. I've only played 4 heists in the game so far with friends but I will say that it will keep you entertained and test your friendship especially if you put the difficulty setting to hard and you only have one chance otherwise if you die you have to start all over again. The multiplayer has that huge grindfest where if you want to be a certain level you need to do a ton of grinding in deathmatch/racing/etc. Since they added heists to this game those actually give you a pretty big boost in XP but still tons of grinding. Now I should mention that there are a ton of bugs/glitches in the multiplayer. One of the biggest ones I can think of is when you are doing a heist and you fail the mission and the game reloads the mission you are stuck looking at your character and the screen is frozen but you can hear the game still going on in the background and if you move your mouse you can even see the map rotating but the rest of the screen is frozen. The fix to this is ALT+Enter twice to put the game in fullscreen then back to borderless windowed mode. Myself and a lot of my friends have had this problem and it gets kind of annoying everytime you have to do that fix. Rockstar Editor Now I've read a lot of Steam reviews for this game and even looked online and nobody has given a detailed description or even a review of the editor that Rockstar added to the game. I messed around with it for about 20 minutes and it was enough to understand how it works and what my pro's and con's with it are.At first I couldn't even find the damn editor but basically you need to go into the single player first then go to the pause screen scroll all the way to the right until you get to the editor. Once in you find that you can edit clips taken in game and a director mode where you choose any character/animal you want to be. You can change the the time of day the weather if you want to be invincible whether you can get a wanted rating or not if you can fly. There are a ton of settings here that you can adjust so you can load into the single player world with said character/animal of your choice and start making a movie. Now I kinda had a different idea of how the editor was going to work. I thought it was going to be a more user friendly Source Film Maker but I was wrong. You just either record a clip in single player/multiplayer or the director mode. I was really hoping you could add multiple actors to one scene and make a movie or some kind of machinima thing. Now someone can correct me if I'm wrong keep in mind I did only dabble with the editor for about 20 minutes and it was just to make a quick video to get the achievement in the game.What I did do with the editor is go into single player load up Michael went to the airport stole a plane while the cops were chasing me and flew it away. I told the game to record my clip and the game splits each clip into about 1 minute segments. Once you feel you have good footage you stop recording then go to the Rockstar Editor. In the editor there are options to add a clip from the clips the game recorded for you add music add text to a scene save the work you have done and export the video so you can upload it to YouTube. When you add a clip you can edit the clip by manipulating the camera. Now with the camera you can't have the camera too far away from your character which kind of sucks. So in my clip I edited I just had the camera kind of rotate around the plane I was flying. What I really wanted was to show the cop cars chasing me but the editor kind of freaks out and goes back to following the player actor. Now you can add music to your clip and off course my first thought was "I'm flying in a plane from the cops of course I'm gonna use Danger Zone even if I'm not in a jet." Nope. I don't know if it's a copyright thing but they don't have every single song from the radio in the editor. When you go to the rock station that you hear Danger Zone on in the game's radio it only had about 6 songs and Danger Zone was not in the list which kind of disappointed me.Overall I'd say the editor is a decent tool for people who want to make movies or just some kind of Machinima looking video but don't expect something super detailed and in depth. Also if you're looking to add a song that you liked from the game don't get your hopes up yet as to how they don't have every song added. Here's the clip I made

review: I've owned and played GTAV on PC for almost two years straight now. It is a mixed bag to say the least and if R* would pull their heads out of their posteriors on certain things it could be far better than it is now. That said even with its shortcomings I will recommend it with the following pros and cons Pros Large vehicle pool spanning a variety equally large enough to be able to satisfy almost anyone's desires. Equally large variety of clothing that should satisfy most people. A mountain of free content spanning (in reality) 3 years since its console launch that you get for as said free. As of both the Finance and Felony and MC updates it's easy to make money hand over fist especially with a group of friends.Cons Hackers/Modders. Everywhere. A toxic community with a fetish for stickbombs. R* connectivity issues.The cons can /usually/ be circumvented by doing an invite only session bringing in a plethora of friends to combat them session hopping until you find a quiet one or by bugging your own session out (Google it.)Even with these drawbacks I've sunk almost a full 1 000 hours into the game and have far more pleasant memories than awful though the awful do stick out. R* are planning on releasing a new paid expansion that is rumored to contain three new cities so getting in now (especially at a low price) would be wise so that you're prepped for the new content. But above all just remember that if you don't like the game for its online functionality there is still a solid single player campaign that is worth the money alone (even if it won't be getting any expansions now.)

review: Earlier this year I gave a negative review to this game to join the rant band wagon. Now I am going to give my honest review. However I will only touch on the online a little because that IS NOT GTA.THE STORY I am by no means a fan of single player games. I prefer online co op killing action. With that being said GTA V NEVER failed to grab my attention with the story. You are given plenty of options throughout your playthrough (such as killing someone or leaving them alive) that impact the game. The characters are without a doubt some of the greatest voice actors in recent video game history. There is not a character in the game that isn't unique and each one has an incredible backstory that you learn more about when you progress through the game. There are also random events throughout the game that keep even the most basic driving exciting. If it was from story alone this game would EASILY get a 10/10.THE WORLD When it comes to the design and detail of Los Santos I can promise that there is not a better open world in the gaming industry. The colors are vibrant the world feels alive and the designs of certain areas are pure perfection. Only games like "The Witcher 3" can compare so if that is something that you have played you will be able to appreciate this world. The parodies are a major bonus as well.THE GAMEPLAY I consider this the weakest link of GTA. The hand to hand combat in the game is a major down grade from GTA IV but the guns are a major improvement. Everything feels very smooth for the most part during combat. The cops function very well and work as a cooperative unit. The cars all feel amazing and have unique traction and speed. CUSTOMIZATION From clothing items to paint jobs GTA does not fail to embrace the freedom of choice. You can completely change cars that you buy from the vast Internet that was created.THE ONLINE GTA Online feels almost nothing like the actual game. However it is still one of the best open world games you can play with your friends. It is not nearly as fun without friends though. The Online also fails at producing a fair market. The amount of money that you earn is not nearly enough to purchase what you want and it has been a major complaint from the beginning. It is a shame that they have not yet added more housing or heists but there is still plenty to do. Shark cards are ridiculously overpriced so I would recommend staying away from them. Hackers are also very common.THE VERDICT GTA earns a 9/10!The base game is absolutely amazing and the game is definitely worth the purchase. IF you are going to play online make sure to grab friends!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Adding my voice the displeasure over removing OpenIV. It's been instrumental to the success of single player (SP) mods for GTA IV and GTA V and removing it has wiped out an entire community of SP GTA players. As long as Take Two insists on stomping on this community's creative aspirations I will not recommend this game to anybody for any reason.The game itself was already fairly "meh" especially when 100% of the development focus went into GTA Online and no new single player content was added. But taking away the ability for others to add meaningful single player content to the half of the game Rockstar decided to toss by the wayside? That's the last straw. I resoundingly do not recommend this game nor do I recommend supporting the publisher Take Two or any of its subsidiaries like Rockstar.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Never buy GTA V. Not even on salePC gaming is all about modifications. Why? Because the modders are the people who actually play the game. They are the ones who notice the problems in the game's design. Even better they are the ones who fix it. For free. Take Two is trying to destroy that. They ship a broken game and don't allow the community to remedy that. They complain about hackers in the game but hackers are only a problem because they have made the money in this game so difficult to get. The root cause of their problems is themselves.Playing GTA Online is a microtransaction filled pile of everyone's least favourite emoji. The most expensive of the microtransactions cost more than the game itself. And they have absolutely ruined the balance of the gameplay. You could get a minimum wage job and buy the in game currency and have more in game money than somebody who plays the game. And if you do have an actual IRL job you probably have the monetary sense to realise that paying for the in game cash is a complete waste of time and that you should just keep your earnings or buy a better game. Don't buy this game. You will regret it just like me and every other reviewer on Steam.

review: Edit July 30 2017 My GTA Online experience has been getting much worse. Takes me around 20 minutes(Not exagerating.. i timed it) to join a session.. and then half of the ing time it turns out i'm joining an EMPTY session.. WHAT THE Original review I'm sorry but I m obligated to give this game a negative review. Don't get me wrong I love the game but the banning system is unacceptable and must be fixed.The banning fiasco starting around a year ago I believe... They started banning everyone who used any sorts of mods mercilessly... Forums were flooded. I was a victim of this massacre and got some of my assets lost and most of my money from what I recall. Now one year later and this is still an issue. I haven't personally been banned again but a quick look at the forums and you will see hundreds of cases of people being banned with no way to even appeal them... It's not like their system is flawless or anything ffs... At least give a reasonable way to appeal it.They don't give any technical information on their banning system (I don't really blame em though) but them banning constantly players is really inconsiderable. I don't believe banning people for cheating in your game is a proper solution the problem when anybody can grab a cheat menu in a few minutes and cheat in your game. You should consider fixing the vulnerabilities in your game. Don't ban you re paying customers who may as well be using your game to do illegitimate things but still your hurting your legitimate customers as well. Quote from this article ( https //support.rockstargames.com/hc/en us/articles/229514247 ) "In addition your GTA Online character(s) will be reset. All GTA Online progress property and inventory will be reset. All GTA Online suspension and banning decisions are final and may not be appealed."People still complain constantly on the forums and their almost completely radio silent on people's support tickets on this matter. It seems that a lot of people are also complaining about them getting banned for being given a lot of money as well. But if they get rid of their issues with the banning system this is probably one of the best games that currently have an active community to be honest. The game has gotten some new content over time and heists are pretty fun and can be done repeatedly and not be considered repetitive.

review: Product received for free. This more so isn't for the game quality entirely. Partially though. But why I am downvoting is because last night I was roaming around a public lobby when I got banned out of no where for ten days. I checked to see if I got a ban report and the report said "I have a complaint regarding a ban" (That was from the rockstar automation at this point I did not try to contact support) Then I went to make a ticket regarding the ban and as soon as I posted the ticket an automated bot posted about basically them not even bothering with temporary bans unless you recorded basically your entire GTA session proving you did nothing wrong and closed the ticket entirely and made me wait 12 hours to make another. When I could make another it did the same thing again with not even an appeal topic. So again will have to wait to make another. Tried at least 7 times to get a hold of the twitter support but that system seems HORRIBLY inactive and responds to maybe 1 random question every 30 minutes to an hour. Negative review is more for the terrible anti cheat and support. Twitter should not be used for a live support and bots should not automate ticket questions relating to that. Gameplay can be extremely fun don't get me wrong with friends it's one of my favorite stress release games. But again anti cheat and support are garbage. Let's the innocents get banned and cheater roam freely in game. (And this is just an assumption is was based off of I was in a hacked lobby and didn't even know it at the time. Because I still never got an answer to why I was banned)TL DR Anti cheat and support are garbage. Got banned for no explained reason. Support is no help.Edit Finally called the Rockstar support line. They said there was just a violation. That's ALL it said. No reason or anything. Tried asking if it could of been Xsplit in the background hooking into GTA. The guy agreed but still said Rockstar can not unban people. Then why is there an appeal part on your page? Rockstar please... Get a better support program it's absolutely terrible.

review: First things first lets get the "mixed reviews" part out of the way. Now you might wonder what made this game that had "very or overwhelmingly positive reviews" on steam suddenly take a hit. Well this was because of the publisher of the game tried to curb modders/ modding. And the modding scene in gta is one of the biggest and people didnt take this very well and rightfully so hence a lot of folks decided to change their reviews from positive to negative. So this stupid facade was recalled and everyones happy again.Onto the game this is truly one of my favorite masterpieces in terms of singleplayer. If youre solely getting this for SP you wil not be disappointed. Great characters great story a fair amount of choices for a Gta game amazing visuals and graphics good physics highly detailed environments so much stuff to do the missions are well laid out and driving around Los Santos is just breathtaking and the list goes on and on all combined with the classic GTA formula.The singleplayer was well worth the complete price if not more so look no further if you want to get this game for the offline story. The modding scene will get you hours of fun when you just want to fool around as the hulk or if you want to make the game look like a supposed Gta 6Now multiplayer is GTA is kind of a mixed bag its not bad but surely could be done better. You will not run out of things to do very soon since R* constantly pushes out content updates for the game. But unfortunately with each update the prices of the items from that update are highly inflated now this would be fine if the jobs would pay out more as well but they dont they give you almost the same amount of money. Hence the grind to get any of the new stuff is infuriating. Then there are the occasional K/D warriors who kill you and then go into passive mode so that you wont be able to kill them and random in hydras waiting to bomb the out of you when youre delivering goods. I know its part of the game to be a but these constantly love killing that same person/ new player over and over and thus create a bad experience for him.All in all great game highly recommended!

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: My GTA V review. StoryI won't be spoiling anything but I can tell you the story is more like San Andreas' story far less realistic than GTA IV's story. It's also noticeably meant to be more comical and not taken very serious. There isn't much emotion in the story which is kind of dissapointing but also a tad logical since Los Santos isn't your gritty depressing city like Liberty City was. There isn't really much to tell other than that it's not very believable but still entertaining. More meant for 'n giggles than a deep story. GameplayGameplay wise the game is really strong. Everything moves in a very fast smooth manner which is really nice definitely more fast paced but less realistic than it's predecessor GTA IV. Cruising around with your car feels fluid. Aiming isn't difficult at all neither is driving but flying in my own eyes is a bit. Concent &amp MPLet's talk about this game's content. There is soooo much content it'll take weeks before you've seen it all. This is really nice and it's a fact they release DLCs (free) once in a while which add enough content to make the game interesting again. Especially in multiplayer which Rockstar Games has done in a brilliant manner. There are so many activities jobs etc to do there's always something to do. Just cruising with friends satisfies my needs already enjoying the eye candy while driving on the coastal highway is definitely entertaining.TL DR Worth your buck.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player of the game is highly recommended and is a lot of fun.Online bit on the other hand is not recommended. It has three major issues.Issue 1 GTA online has turned into a massive grind. If that wasn't enough the things you buy after the grind require you to grind even more to be useful. Effort Reward relationship is completely messed up.Issue 2 Half the time you'll spend online will be spent watching loading screens especially if you are playing missions or doing heists. Joining friends' lobby takes forever entering their houses takes forever setting up a heist takes forever...Issue 3 If you aren't doing missions you are in a free roam lobby which is relatively free of loading screens... and instead full of modders of one type or another. Cars can randomly blow up cash may rain you may be teleported around start burning and or just die for one reason or another caused by mods. It's just a giant waste of time to join a free roam public lobby (which is where you need to be to complete a lot of the new missions brought in by the updates...)Game itself is fun but getting to actually play it properly with decent equipment takes ages online. It rarely ever feels rewarding.Leaving this as Not Recommended as many who get GTAV now are getting it for the online bit. You'll spend a lot of time on it like me and end up with stuff that require you to spend even more time to be slightly useful.If you are here for the single player by all means buy it. The issues I've mentioned don't really apply there. It's a pretty fun experience.

review: Mods keep games fresh and alive. More often than not they reward us with endless hours of entertainment and reward the studios ultimately with sales. They grow communities and make the game something bigger than people would've ever imagined. They spread word of good reputation which is technically free advertisement too.Yea let's stop that Take Two. Let us remember Take Two interactive as the publisher who allegedly made $700 000 000 off of GTA V Online last year? review: This game has been left to the wolves by the developers. Cheaters can take all of your money and reset your character to rank 1 erasing almost all progress you've made even erasing money you bought from the developer. They could also stuff your wallet full of money and set your rank extremely high making most of the game pointless and making you look like a cheater to others. For any other game developer cheating this severe (ruining someone else's account) would be a critical flaw and they'd take matchmaking servers down while deploying a hotfix but rockstar has ignored it for weeks and their support staff often turns down requests to fix the damage done.I'd recommend avoiding this game until (if ever) they get their act together and start supporting it. Those of us with a lot of time spent in it are now having to file support tickets every other day just to be able to continue playing. And all indications are it's going to get even worse from here.EDIT 2017 06 13 I've just had all $25M of my legitimate money deleted by the developers by their failed attempt to correct account balances for all the fake money that was stuffed into our accounts over the past two months since this review was written despite being extremely careful in following their guidance on the matter.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Its a great game both when we are talking about singleplayer and attention to detail. But if we are talking about multiplayer that is a different story. Multiplayer+ Extremely fun (Racing Co op if you dont mind repetitive missions)+ You can meet really good friends+ Track editors+ Customization+ There is a great game under all the t I never got banned so atleast that is a plus +. Weapon balancing is bad no recoil 1 hit kill anywhere sniper rifles miniguns sticky bombs and homing missiles rule. All other weapons are not viable and suck compare to them. Playing freeroam is really cancer sometimes. Helis suck anyone can carry a stinger with 20 rockets and ultra fast locking + you dont have flares so you are almost always dead. There are ways to dodge rockets but yeah good luck when you dodge 1st he has 2nd already in the air. Unstable sessions P2P connection FTW boyzzzz ALOT less hackers now. There were times where you got out of garage only to get killed by a windmill or changed to a toilet or christmass tree. Multiplayer could be something great aswell but unfortunately it is burred under a rug of long loading times. Stupid sessions system (where when you accept an invite to lobby it dissconnects you out of your own lobby and then attempts to join the lobby you were invited to. But it doesnt check if there are any free slots left before it disconnects you. So most of the time you will get session full message and then it will force you into another loading before it will find an another freeroam session) Infinite loading glitch still present (Still 2 years after launch) Hit detection is terrible (You cant even find your own ping) Multiplayer is a big grind. You can either play PVE or PVP for lousy 20k a game if you are lucky most of the time it ranges from 5 18k depends on player count match duration (Btw pvp is dead all their "Super fun modes are mostly dead mainly because of the lobby system which doesnt work fast enough to get enough players into 1 lobby"). Or you can play 4 different heists from which only 1 is viable (Pacific 375k per hour if 20% payout and all setups) and pay is good enough so after 4 5 hours of the same missons. You finally will be able to buy that mad 2m super car that you wanted. Only to find out it costs another 350k to fully upgrade. When playing heists you need to get a good crew you never want to play with randoms or they will destroy your sanity mainly because of the terrible checkpoints. (Leavers griefers idiots noobs kids this game has it all). Many of the items are insanely overpriced. If you complete all the heists challenges like I did. Some of them really long like play all heists no deaths in order hard difficulty. You will get something around 14m cash to spend that is really not alot when you want to buy some of the more nice fun things like fighter Jet 3Mil Tank 1.5Mil Some High end apartments lets say another 1.5Mil clothes 50 200k for single piece of clothing no problem Capitalism has you here aswell. Some super cars like (Its a car game ofc you will spend money there) thats like 6 mill here EASY with upgrades etc ... AND puff your money is gone Annnd you can start grinding pacific again... The DLC missions (Lamar and CEO stuff Bikers) again you need to invest ALOT and it will take yet another 10 20+ hours to even get some sort of a reasonable profit.I could rant here for ever but I think I will stop here. After all I will still give positive rating bacause like I said there is a great game hidden there but My love &amp Hate relationship is real.

review: Honestly its unfortunate that gta V and gta online are connected to the same steam listing and reviews. The story mode is brilliant. I've played this game for hundreds of hours on singleplayer including my old account. I would 100% recommend this game if you're looking for an amazing gta singleplayer experience even if there's no sale. However the same can't be said if you're interested in multiplayer. Oh boy what a pile of steaming excrement. In total I'm about 50 hours in and besides being incredibly slow to load anything getting anything done outside a private session seems to be almost impossible. I now have stopped playing because I returned to the game only to find a frecking christmas tree stuck on my head 30m high wtf.To "fix" this I had to end the game and rejoin (a real fix would be to actually make it impossible for anyone to put anything on me including money. To give me some icing on my shait cake I joined a new game and returned to my bunker (after some 15 minutes of joining) only to find that I cannot register as a VIP because of my recent behavior. What? The game has been out for four(!) years now. Some guy can put a giant tree on my head and I get punished for it? How can they take real money for in game currency when a random encounter can ruin your game?TL DR Do not sink money in this unmaintained pile of garbage.tks for reading

review: I remember playing GTA3 when I was a kid all the while dreaming with my friends how cool it would be to play this game with one another. Well it's here and Take Two and Rockstar took one potentially amazing experience I know we all shared and shoved it right up a cashcow's Yeah you thought GTA online would be fun? Well it would if it didnt consisnt of countless repetitve hours and I mean houuurs of grinding in instanced minigames over and over again just to afford basic things like cars and apartments. Why is this grind so tedious? Well let me introduce the Shark Card. What's that you ask? Don't want to grind GTA minigames like a full time job? Well just spend your hard earned cash on in game money. GTA V Online is a blatent cash grab in the worst possible way. The single player was what you would expect was fun but all in all they've shifted all dev time to their cash crop the online. No single player DLC and all the online DLC that comes out is available for tens of millions online which most of us who can't stand to grind for 40 hours a week are forced to buy shark cards to access the DLC or forgo the experience all together. I'm seeing a lot AAA gaming these days go for microtransactions and I can not recommend a game that supports this so disgustingly. Really taking advantage of your playerbase guys not cool at all.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: (Review Including Mods)The whole point of me buying the PC version was for offline modding and letting myself be creative with retextures....a lot of PC people don't care about online. Sorry it's the truth. Take Two taking too much. If star ratings could go it would here.There is a huge community for GTAV modding. It's massive. Don't throw away your allies. Watch your step because actions now will have implications on the future and your future products.(Review Excluding mods)I don't recommend this game unles you want offline. Althoguh offline does not have all the DLC vehicles buildings weapons clothes and more it still is a base for a lot of fun. Random events messing around better crash and ragdol animations/physics and some of those missions offline are timeless and fun. When you complete offline there is that sense of I can mess around AND I'm rich!! GREAT!!...But you will eventually increase boredom. Just like any other game. That's gaming for you. I can't blame them much for not adding DLC from online. It would be nice if they aded the least/2nd least expensive vehicle from each new DLC to offline. Plus it may inspire people to get something more expensive online and have that more unique car feel. As long as it's not the same cost as my bus for a week ticket. Which is starting to push the limits. In the end. It's a business and they NEED to earn money. I just think their strategy could kill them in the future if a competitior to GTA isn't as money obsessed and has an equaly or similar appeal and longetivity.Online does offer great modes and missions and it can be further improved with friends. Some cars are also great too. Same for all types of transport to be honest. BUT...After 3 years of online (PS3 PS4) I can say there are major issues. I understand that the DLC needs to be expensive and grinding can be rewarding. I remember grinding crazy with Rooftop Rumble for my Infernus. It was fantastic! But there is a limit. GTA surpassed that limit in my opinion from the Yacht DLC onwards. Furthermore the griefing and constant mayhem is not great in public modes. Always have to watch your map. I understand that it's a free world but haha you'll see when you leave LS Customs in an exploding fireball from sticky bombs mines THAT jet...etc. The passive mode does need improving though it is a good system already. Such as another player can explode an AI car next to yours and you can get damaged/die from it. Missions....AHH NO! Standard missions have had their prives cut massively compared to the older days. Want proper money? Heist it and grind those or do a CEO or Biker equivalent etc...Which involves public lobbies. You could spend ages doing your best earning a load of money and some person decides to Hyrda or throwable explosive you for no other reason they can. Well sometimes there is a reason like they own a business themselves. You get the idea. You know whats fun?! Stress and denile of hours of work!!! $$$When I play GTAV I always go into friend/closed sessions. Public sessions are for mayhem. Friend sessions are much nicer and enjoyable. Unless your friend goes completely crazy or something or you decide to headbut your TV/monitor for no apparent reason. You CAN meet nice people in public sessions. But it's much rarer than it used to be. GTA for new players online is horrible and attrotious. I've met people who find sessions to blow up less that level 10 people. This is our community now? Though so many people play GTAV that you personally could meet all the nice players and enter the right lobbies. It's too vast for straight comparison.GTAV marketing and almost the entire point of GTAV is GTAO (GTA Online).GTAV If this was a 1 10 star system I'd give 3 as a guide for someone new to the game who's interested in both sides.For me as someone who's had GTA for 3 years I'd give a 5. Because of the old memories from PS3 and early PS4 days. Yes that far back. I can't deny memories. Both good and bad.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I originally bought this game for the Xbox 360 on September 17 2013. I started my online character on October 1 2013. I bought the game again on April 14 2015 for the PC. I have sunk a lot of time into this game across multiple platforms. I've had a lot of fun and very frustrating times with this game. I do not regret the time I have put into this game. It was far from perfect but it was still a good game. I was ok with how Rockstar introduced microtransactions. They gave everyone access to the dlc for free but you had to either pay real money or grind a lot of missions to be able to own the content. Unfortunately microtransactions are here to stay and this was a more palatable way to introduce them. I feel that this method was implemented improperly though. They priced the new content extremely high and kept the mission payouts low so modders felt the need to "help" everyone. Modders runined the online community by giving out large sums of money to players. So to keep up with this you either had to pay more real money grind more missions or become a "cheater" by accepting this money.I decided to say online and went back to single player. I wanted to spice things up with LSPDFR. I had a lot of fun and there were a ton of different car skins. I have had a lot of fun with it. I'm not leaving a salty review because to kid blew up my drugs with a Hydra. I'm leaving a salty review because of what Take Two did. you Take Two.http //gtaforums.com/topic/889348 openiv/EDIT Sign this petition https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openiv

review: Grand Theft Auto V follows the story of the Payday Gang in their early days. You take control of 3 of the heisters know as Dallas Chains and Wolf and watch as they perform heists for the Not FBI their old pal Bain and Hector. Each heister has thier own story and motive that make them very different from each other. Overall the story is a very nice prequel to Payday The Heist and would recommend playing the story mode before jumping into Payday The Heist or Payday 2

review: Over the years I have had some fun with this game. First bought and played on the console before the PC release then bought on the PC to continue enjoying GTA Online. We were away for quite awhile but started playing again these last two weeks. There are a lot of cool fun features but require a decent amount of in game cash to buy the properties to unlock the new features. In a way that is a decent way to release new DLC folks can grind out the money or buy Shark cards to gain access. I won't go into the debate on just how expensive the new content is in game but hey we were enjoying the game so we bought some Shark cards. Last night we get home from going out to dinner and find out I was banned for a month and my character will be wiped. All but one of the support tickets I opened were instantly closed with "all bans are final deal with it". On the one "other" ticket I opened I was told that the money from the Shark cards will still be on the account when the ban is lifted but the character will be wiped. No information on why I was banned so I cannot make any changes to prevent it from happening again. Most likely the ban will be lifted then will just happen again and be permanent.I had fun with this game but due to what seems to be faulty cheat detection software and a draconian customer support organization I will not buy a Rockstar game again.If you only care about single player go for it.Online expect to grind out cash in game or buy shark cards and have it all possibly taken away due to a false positive in their cheat detection software.I did have a lot of fun over the years with this product just wish that I didn't spend the money I did recently in Shark cards just to lose the ability to play the game. Maybe one more negative review to join the others will help someone out there not waste their money.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Like many I had high hopes for this game which were dashed by the delayed PC release. I did not own consoles at the time so just wrote it off as a game I might watch someone play but not invest in myself. Eventually the game did release on PC and by this time I had little to no interest in it.Fast forward a couple years I eventually decide that if I can catch it on a decent enough sale I would get it. As chance would have it I was able to pick it up for relatively cheap during the most recent winter sale. The singleplayer for GTA V starts out incredibly strong establishing well rounded characters that are not just defined by a quirk or two and is reinforced by fun gameplay and an engaging storyline. Sounds great right? Well this is how the game goes for the majority of the singleplayer until you get about 2/3 through it. At this point the missions become very repetitive almost as if Rockstar didn't know where to end it. This is passable as like I mentioned the characters and gameplay are great. That being said for players who enjoy 100% ing games the side missions in this game feel VERY unrewarding with the plot lines going nowhere and the side characters being proven as meaningless for the overarching plot. I played through the first 2/3 of the game doing all of the side missions before eventually ignoring them due to how pointless they felt and how repetitive the whole story was becoming. Instead wishing to just hurry up and get it over with.If your intentions are to just play the singleplayer I would say get the game when it is on sale otherwise perhaps just watch a streamer/youtuber play it and save the money. Despite the strong start I don't believe the singleplayer is worth the normal $60 price tag.This brings me to the multiplayer. Where to begin. One of the biggest factors that kept me from buying this game for the longest time were the reviews about the multiplayer. First the mass hysteria of hackers running rampant and innocent players being banned for no apparent reason. These two alone were big enough to put me off. Eventually the reviews shifted from this painting hope on the desolate scene of GTA Online the hackers are being choked out and the random banning is a thing of the past. How wonderful to hear. If only it were so. The new negative reviews began pouring in. Seemingly by getting rid of their hackers Rockstar got rid of a big portion of the populace that made this game profitable for them on PC. This along with the dark tide of seemingly every video game in this era needing some kind of microtransaction prompted Rockstar to introduce the dreaded Shark Cards and significantly bump the prices of everthing in GTA V up. My initial reaction to the reviews was skeptical assuming the people that were complaining about unfair prices were just too lazy to grind a little and wanted everything handed to them instantly. Sadly this is not the case. Items that you can buy in the singleplayer for say $500 can end up costing $10k or more. This is extremely offputting from a new player's perspective especially considering the leveling system that is require to even have access to most items. There are definitely some serious balancing issues between new players and those that have spent real life money for the shark cards and just makes for a distasteful experience if you are the former. I highly recommend you take your money elsewhere if Online was the main reason you planned to purchase this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Story mode is enjoyable but storyline (mission list) is very very short not anywhere near you would expect from a virtual free roam World of this size. Takes around 3 4 days to complete... petty much the same amount of time ages old GTA San Andreas would require.Now why only 1 star and "Do not recommend" after you will pass rather disappointingly short storyline mode you will want to see the On line mode.Do not rush to It takes ages to load from 5 minutes (like once in 10 times) till 30 40 minutes (15 20 minutes is closer to average). After waiting for half an hour it sometimes 'surprises' you with session initiation error Sometimes after connecting starting up a session and before starting up a round it may still freeze (for no reason) and subsequently crash in a few seconds Toxic community A lot of 'all I wanna do is play day and night' skilled teenagers with super skills that will be your rivals (could use some sort of primitive balancing or anti PvP feature when in free roam mode) Oh and did I mention it takes forever to load and you are likely to shut down your PC before the On line mode loads because you can't just sit and wait all day and night?I've read somewhere it is due to GTA On line's 'specific' p2p network layer implementation.But the game is far from new. Developer had like YEARS to fix the problem... It's obvious THEY DON'T CARE.And you should not expect more from them after super LAZY short storyline.I've been a series fan since GTA 1 GTA London etc... A bit old for those games now but still GTA V is a HUGE disappointment.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I wish you could give games a star rating instead of a binary good or bad. If I could give it a star rating I'd give it 2/3 and please allow me to explain.I bought the game on release day and the single player campaigne is absolutely outstanding. 5/5 without hesitation. However online play is now the bigger and more saught after part of the game which is why I rebought it for PC and I found it to be very grindy and devoid of many worthwhile rewards. You have to play for hours and hours just to afford even the most basic stuff like a mid end sports car or something like that. The missions are boring and repetitive (except for stunt races in my opinion but they hardly give any payout) and a large pecent of the time I was dealing with someone else in my game who was lagging and therefor kinda ruins it for everyone else.I would say if you want this game for the single player campaigne do it no doubt about it. But if you're interested in it for online play maybe watch some youtube videos and do some research to make sure you're prepared for what you're spending your hard earned money on.

review: I really don't know what to think of this game. So I'll just break it down.Is it fun? Sure. Better with friends of course if you're playing multiplayer. Heists are pretty fun arguably has some of the best racing gameplay even amongst racing games shooting is simplistic but satisfying character movement is very awkward and clunky you will always move a little too far or too little or perhaps in the wrong direction of what you were aiming for I personally found it a nightmare to deal with. Air vehicle combat is a bit messy as are some controls for a few of them.The game itself is very hard to have fun in if you have no money and are a low level since most weapons and upgrades have level requirements. Ontop of most "fun" vehicles being very expensive and unless you spend an entire day grinding with high level friends who will carry you through heists you will not be able to afford anything.Does it run well?For a port I guess. Lots of stuttering when moving quickly incredibly long load times even with an SSD. Constant lobby connection issues constant issues in minigames constant saving issues constant glitches in heists. Singleplayer runs alright I guess probably because it doesn't have to deal with R's crappy servers as much. So to sum up No.Are there a lot of modders/hackers? Oh absolutely. Though I will say this game has far more modders than people give it credit it's just not all modders are the ones actively trying to ruin your day. I'd be very surprised if there were many people over level 120 in a lobby who actually obtained that level entirely through their own volition by grinding. Or perhaps it's some level 30 with an Office Hangar Bunker Facility doing bombing runs with their maxed out Avenger then jumping out in their maxed X 80. You get the idea.Do I recommend this game?No. I can't recommend this game. I've had fun with it but the amount of times I haven't far outweighs those experiences. From all the connectivity problems the in game performance issues the copy&amp paste of a lot of its content the constant mindless cashgrab vehicle updates R's lack of care about anything other than money constant distruptive modders who have nothing better to do other than spawn cages or go invincible and kill everyone in the lobby the complete mindless grind that this game is if you don't spend hundreds of dollars on in game cash and to top it off the awful anti cheat. It is not only letting modders get away with pretty much anything (you would not believe the stuff I've seen reported and nothing come of it) but if a modder spams RP or money onto you YOU are the one who is banned. I have been banned Twice I've never been able to get over level 100 because of this and I'm just exhausted.If you want this game even despite all this maybe your friends are egging you on to buy it wait until it's at the very lowest sale price because it is without a doubt not worth this price.

review: 476.0 hours. That's the hours I've put into JUST the PC copy of Grand Theft Auto V. And every last second of it was modded. I paid the full $60 price tag so I could play MY game the way I wanted to and I didn't bat an eye at it. It was worth every cent. Until now.By sending a C&amp D to a mod that has allowed more to the SP side of GTA V than the developers have in any of their updates since the launch you have alienated a group of players not just from V not just from Grand Theft Auto as a series but from every game that Rockstar and 2K Games have a hand in. Mods made this my favorite game of all time. And now like so many others you will not see another cent out of me until a reasonable replacement or solution arises for this problem. Hopefully the t microtransactions are worth it.On behalf of the OpenIV Team and peeved gamers everywhere you T2.

review: Well this game is in alot of ways good but in alot of other ways it pretty bad. First of the storymode is great...The first time you play it the second time just feels kind of boring since you have already played it. Taking for consideration that the online feature is the main part of this game from my point of view this does not really mather. However. The online incudes alot of buyable stuff that you will have to own to get a decent expirience of the gamemode. This inlcudes a propper apartment so you can play heists alot of fancy car a yatch and aircrafts. All this is my opinion necessary to get a decent expirience of the game. DLC's are free. Well this means that you can download them for free but the content costs a fortune in game and its ceeps adding on. You could purchase sharkcards but you will feel less scammed buying a dead rat. So do i recomend it? Consider that i have played this game for nearly a 1000 hours (on two acounts) i do. Even if you would eventually get bored and the pricetag might not be worth it so i recomend buying this game on sale.

review: GTA V is not really all that fun. Buy this game on sale if you want to enjoy the story or if you have 3 other friends to enjoy this game with. Otherwise you'll spend 1 5 minutes waiting for GTA Online to load login to server with people level 500+ and a penchant for killing people who aren't in passive. Trying to find a lobby with people to finish a heist is next to impossible when people either leave at the sight of a lower level or less than perfect performance and with little incentive to stick around I don't blame them. Constant begging for shark card purchases everything in the game is locked off by extravegant amounts of money that are only possible with (as mentioned earlier) 3 friends who are willing to work together sheer luck hacking and buying shark cards. Online races are essentially just renditions of TrackMania user made content with sudden inclines and busted track design. Do yourself a favor and play San Andreas or stick to the story mode in this game. If all the above isn't an issue for you then go for it.

review: The game is a blast. Really fun and a good time sink.The single player is amazing very good story and fun to play and had some great laughs. The only problem I have with the game is multiplayer or GTA 5 Online.I enjoy Online using friend invites or solo mode but the problem with online is rockstar and modders. Rockstar has no real anti cheat detection to ban just the modders. So modders will go in and give free money and do others things which can get normal playeras banned for no reason and even if you didn't do anything rock star will perm ban you or ban you for 30 days either way you lose your character and all you worked for online.So be cautious when playing online in a public server. Even if you didn't do anything you could still get banned.Also make sure to check for graphic card patches in some case in the early days of the game people with MSi GPU's would get banned for something and couldn't get online but still able to play Single player.

review: I sent this to Rockstar's feedback email but they'll probably ignore it so. "First of all advertise your feedback page more because I didn't know it existed until I looked it up and I've been playing the game since it came out for Xbox 360. That was in 2013. Anyway back to the game. You guys must have forgotten that back in the day Ads for GTA V teased info about gambling and maybe even casinos in fact there is still a casino in game the says "Coming Soon" even though more than three years later it's still not active. The same goes for the stock market in the Online portion of the game. Also why are there so many things in GTA Online that are not in GTA V and vice sersa? For example if I would play GTA Online and accidentally blow up my car I call my insurance and pay some money to get it back no big deal. But If the same thing happens in GTA V then I just lose the car entirely and have to buy or steal a new one. Then we get to the shark cards. Did you know the fastest way to get the majority of players in a game to hate it and stop buying it isto add an option to pay real life money to acquire in game money? The reason for that is that it causes massive inflation. That means that when a gun costs say $150 before the option to buy money the gun will cost $200 or $250 instead. And yes I know Rockstar is making massive amounts of money on this but let me show you what this really does. I had a character in GTA Online for a while and transferred it to PC the earliest I could and worked on it to try to obtain as much as I could but also have fun. The problem though was that to have fun in GTA Online a player has to spend TONS of money. Now this is pretty normal but then you look at the average job and see that even though a player can buy a SINGLE plane for $10 million the average pay is only a few thousand. Then if you calculate how much money it would cost to obtain everything (Assuming the player fills all garages buys all Pegasus vehicles which is around 88 and buys all real estate with the highest pricespossible) he or she would spend upwards of $300 million. I ACTUALLY TESTED THIS. Then if you calculate how much that would cost in real US Dollars to buy the shark cards it would cost $3 750. Do you honestly think someone will pay that? The game is broken."

review: Grand Theft Auto. A series from my childhood in which i cherished forever ...Until now.Since the launch of GTA V the experience has been slowly getting more annoying awkward and repetitive. Rockstar Games has shunned off the modding community since the beginning and fail to realise that THAT is a huge reason why people buy the game on PC in the first place. No longer. I have been playing since day 1 on the PlayStation 3 and later PlayStation 4 before upgrading to PC racking somewhere around 2 to 3 THOUSAND hours across the board. Hear my words as a veteran of the series as well as this game itself...Rockstar Games has started to think with their bank rather than their brains. They've made billions off this game alone and has STILL been charging microtransactions on GTA Online for years as well.Making it impossible to play and earn money huge paywalls into new features for updates slowly catering to a community of children and trolls who just want to ruin any fun you might have in Online by launching features and weapons that are so overpowered (and again behind a paywall so those who cant afford it are helpless and those who have them are ego driven trolls) to the point where they've entirely ruined the storyline and feel of their well put together game into what is bascially the equivilent of Syria. Tanks APCs armored vehicles cars with guns on them all driving around and creating chaos. Free Mode is ruined and so is this series now.Pros Good cars somewhat decent fun in private lobbies with friends fun to hang out and do dumb $#!T on.Cons Community is trash huge paywalls in features mods are dissappearing the game has turned into a third person sandbox version of Twisted Metal and Call of Duty mashed into one horrible game.Money will be better spent on PC parts food... You know what you're better off putting the money in your mouth and swallowing it than wasting it on this. At least cotton paper has some nutrients.

Theres a lot of things to do in freemode too making an organization buying a yacht and defending it and many other things.The game is fun but not really fun without friends because you can do much more stuff with friends and have fun when you play with randoms you're kinda more competitive and you dont see how fun the game actually is when you play with friends you dont take the jobs as serious so you have more fun.I strongly recommend this game 11/10 IGN . If you have money and a good PC you should buy this game have fun!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm done with this game. 500 hours and nothing to show for it. Never took money from a modder so maybe its my own fault because friends who have played less than 100 hours have 2x 3x the high end stuff like armed vehicles and new bunkers/club house crap because they had money spawned on them by modders.Unless you want to grind the same lame heist over and over or fork over $$$ for shark cards don't expect to have anything. Every new update adds lots of new cars sometimes new guns but you can't even access some of the newer content without $10 million gta$ because modders spawning money has inflated the price of ANYTHING released post "next gen" GTAV. Quickest/most efficent heist will hardly net you $300k/hr and thats only if you don't fail which getting a good team that actually talks is almost impossible. And as ever hackers/modders are rampant and I've heard that recently that its possible for modders to make it look like YOU are cheating and get your character reset.So summarize I love the game. Its a blast. But its not worth $60 or 500 hours. I hate that its a boring grind fest to unlock new content. I hate that Rockstar would rather inflate the prices of new content to deter modders rather than fix the problem at the source. Because lets be real about it modders don't hurt Rockstar's bottom line they improve it. They can justify inflating prices because of modders and anyone who plays legit can either grind keeping GTAV up on the list of most played on steam or buy shark cards which in turn makes Rockstar money. They really don't give a I won't buy the next GTA unless I see that it has proper anti cheat post release. Same goes for RDR2 which I guess will be an indicator of how much Rockstar actually cares. Below is a review that was posted when scripthookIV ceased development I actually thought that it would curb the number of cheaters boy was I wrong. At that point I had about 300 hours tells you how much of a sucker I am. On behalf of everyone who was tired of mod menus in online thank you rockstar.On behalf of all modders out there you are a rockstar but that's your usual MO as far as mods go.On my own behalf I don't give a so long as the cheaters stop. GTAIV has had rampant cheaters for far to long and sadly people should realize OpenIV and ScripthookIV were the first to break the lame "security" rockstar put in. It wasn't until people started getting dropped that they made the single player only requirement and even then there's tutorials to get AROUND that and still use scripthookIV to load your stuff. Hell menyoo used a modified (or nearly identical) DLL to scripthookIV to load.

review: The game's great don't get me wrong. It's a really fun game and a great improvement from IV and San Andreas. But most of its loading is hell and could take up to 30mins (+patience). This one really taught me not to mess with the NPC and they'll get yo boi. Truth is I've bought the game mainly for its online mode so I can be the gangster with ma homie. but that's the real problem. Rockstar could really be unforgiving to cheaters but if the game hates you you're out. There's this random banning going on still since earlier this year (2018) and it's still hot. I was one of the victim. I knew the risk of it but I thought man what are the chances right? With my buddy still swinging round town gunnin them Ballas and robbing big cars. I contacted the Rockstar support live chat but he almost sounded like a robot. Bans are unappealable and undiscussable. Final and all. I understand that they take it seriously but I believe they should at least hear us out. Though that makes their life misarable with exploiters and cheaters faking it (damn them really). The banning system is pretty unpridictable and unforgiving wiping people off the server as Thanos wills it. I hope they would try to find out what is going on with the banning as I'm pretty sure it is unfair as it may be. I have not modded not griefed and certainly not alter any scripts. Well about the cheaters oh damn they could set you on fire on their command. Spawn you a campfire and you're the walking camp fire now. That sounds fun I've always wanted to light the way.Well if this seem like a review off topic it is because the online service is the problem and not the actual game itself. Loads like a charm and controls are pretty smooth. You can do heists (most of the time are 4 man team) buy properties and be a CEO of a company shoot people shoot cops steal cars and beat people up. But it's just got to be that. damn. banning. system.

review: GTA 5 online modeThe only issue I've encountered to date is that GTA 5 online kills your internet connection thus rendering it useless for other applications. The game is not optimized to share bandwidth and hogs the TCP application layer. Rockstar will persist the issue is the customers issue and that you'll need to use PortForward your private network... that is a bogus statement to start with yet packet sniffers note otherwise. It's very clear Rockstar has not troubleshooted their application nor has any intention in resolving the applications constant barrage of dgm requests caused by GTA 5.It's been an issue since GTA 5 has been launched and still thousands of customers complain about it and Rockstar does nothing to resolve it.I do not recommend GTA 5 to anyone until Rockstar resolves this issue. GTA 5 offline modeRockstar will ban any user using mods for offline use. This is unacceptable. All customers who purchase the game are entitled to use mods to enhance and add to their enjoyment. Rockstar ought to have implemented a way to block mods which would verify the file integrity of valid files upon launching online mode thus present a *warning* to the customer that they have modified files within the GTA 5 directory and or launch the game and placing these modified files in a seperate directory allowing the customer to run GTA 5 in a verified mode online while keeping the integrety of the users modifications for their and friends personal use. I'm sure there are other way's to accomodate this but Rockstars blatent neglect for this is both irresponsible and unprofessional. Rockstar was and has been well aware that customers will use mods for offline use as it's been a popular feature in previous titles. Either way if you mod and enter online mode you risk the option to be banned and by reading other reviews Rockstar does not care and does not resolve issues. Clearly this presents a legal matter.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar's most recent patch has put game performance before multiplayer in an attempt to confuse modders which has contradicted Rockstar's statement of supporting single player modding. Not only that but the way they are trying to rid of mods is ridiculous inwhich they infected the game with junk code that has caused severe FPS drops for everyone alike. All of this for some pricey digital car that Rockstar wants you to spend shark cards on. The game itself is fantasic nontheless but the poor attempts to salvage the crappy mulitplayer and prevent modding which makes the game whole leaves me with this negative review.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There are a REDICULOUS amount of hackers on GTA Online. So much so that there is little point playing in public lobbies or public jobs as you are guaranteed to get at least one hacker ruining it for you. Rockstars stance is that they don't care as long as you arent hacking to give yourself in game currency they could be selling to you through shark cards.Other issues include Excruciatingly long load times online (even with a SSD and 50mb/s internet speed) which is by far the worst I've experienced on an online game ever. Poor performance in certain areas of the game Large amounts of game breaking bugs which will kick you off online or crash your game altogether. Latency and network issues leading to high pings and teleporting all over the map during missions/jobsAs much as I like GTA I can't recommend it until rockstar does something about the insane amount of hacking going on in multiplayer and fixes the other issues I mention above. It's just not fun.

review: You cant enjoy what you cant play. The problem i am having is that you cannot play the story mode offline without having an internet connection. I am completely uninterested in the online gameplay social club stuff ect. I work on a towboat so for six months out of the year I live and work on a boat with no internet connection aside from my phone where cell service is crappy at best. The only form of entertainment that i bring with me is my laptop. The offline feature requiring a internet connection is utter bulls**t. I paid money for this damn game i should be able to play it when i want. It says you need to sign in at least once to play offline. That would have been no big deal but them saying that is simply not true. You need a internet connection Every. Freaking. Time. Needing to have an active connection to play without a connection every time is just idiotically stupid. Rockstar apparently does not understand or care that they are pretty much screwing over fans of the game who live in rual areas or because of their job have to live without an internet connection most of the time. Telling me that i only have to sign in once to play offline is a out right lie and as far as i am concerned it was a lie told to me and others simply to get my money. Tried looking up solutions for this problem now that im home and this has apparently been an issue for a while that they refuse to correct. Until Rockstar pulls its head out of its a$$ and removes the restriction that prevents me from playing a game that I paid for a game that i would not have paid money for had i known about this issue that they flat out lied about i cannot recomomend buying this game. I wish I wouldnt have.

review: A great game completely ruined by microtransactions and corporate greed. That's a complete understatement. For Take Two the biggest money maker is the Online portion. By a vast vast amount.And Take Two is so greedy that they pretty much actively sabotage the singleplayer just to get people to play multiplayer and buy their crappy disgustingly overpriced microtransactions. You can't even get the Hydra a fan favourite jet of the series in singleplayer without the use of mods. Which brings me to my next point.Take Two has sent a cease and desist to the developers of the biggest modding tools for GTA IV and GTA V. Basically saying "Stop doing that or we'll sue." They just want more people to play multiplayer instead of singleplayer and buy their crappy microtransactions because everything costs to much. Do not buy this game. Do not support this crap.Update Even though they retracted the cease and desist the fact remains is that they did it in the first place. And the game is still being ruined on purpose. I will still play it because I already own it and because it's still fun at times but I will never spend another cent on this game.

review: Review Multiplayer is utter garbage the whole thing is a grind fest due to this the limited number of missions is quite apparent and how often missions are recycled but just with a different goal e.g. Lamar s missions where the 2nd and 3rd mission is just drive from A to B then shoot incoming waves of enemies from different places preplanning feels like a waste of time with no purpose but just to serve as an AGL.The game constantly tries to shove it's Sharkcards down your throat by making EVERYTHING really ing expensive and by using the equivalent of "pop ups" in the form of reminding you every 2 minutess that they have a really cool expensive base that costs min 900 ing k or more from which you can access the new missions which I've heard are quite a pain to do as you have to do some of the preplanning in freeroam . *NoteThere are also a ton of script kiddies in multi you can avoid them if you turn passive mode on BUT if you pick up money that has been spawned by them you have a high chance being banned. You can also get banned for leaving any mods in from sp. when joining a session even if that mods is just a texture mod/overhaul this just shows how the "Anti Cheat System" in place is.During the 2 weeks since I've purchased the game the servers were down for hours but when checking the official R* site about the status of course it still said that the servers were up despite the fact that people were complaining on the formums. I've had constant issues with lagg and latency issues when playing with others in a session taking a clip or so to take down a single enemy with headshots often registered as hitting in the chest or not registering at all however this all quickly changes when you are alone in a session the number of bullets to take down an enemy noticeably decreased and headshots registered twice as often. I also checked whether the problem was on my end or not (it was not) and found that it didn't make a difference whether I was hosting the heist/mission or some random the issue was still present leaving me believe that the issue must be with the servers not being able to handle the bandwidth or something.Loading screens would often take way too long after missions ranging from 3 to 25 minutes IF it load at all as I had quite a few ones where I just gave up and restarted the game. Joining would often take twice as long to join multiplayer than sp even though it doesn t need to load in that much more again leaving me suspect that it s the servers that are slow. Conclusion The multi still has problems latency issues script kiddies loading times and many other things I ve not mentioned despite being out for over two and a half years (2.7 at the time of writing) and if they haven t fixed it since they never will.I would only recommend it for the sp or if you have a friend (or friends for a better experience) to play with and a load of free time however it definitely does not worth the 40 asking price wait till it s on sale or avoid it if possible (it s probably better if you do so). Notes Text Explanation sp singleplayer multi multiplayer AGL "Artificial Game Lengthener" *Note I recently discovered that you can view stats on e.g.. total income which for me over a little less than 40 hours was just a wee under 1 million which just goes to show how much you have to grind in this game. Even if I kept it all and not spent a dime I could just blow it on a SINGLE VEHICLE but I had to spend on guns to be capable taking on more difficult missions meaning that early on you have to spend on guns then later on some armoured or gun mounted vehicles become a must for these missions.

review: Rockstar and Take Two are horrible when it comes to pleasing their fans. At first I thought they were great for releasing all the free DLC that they did. But then enter the cash fixes... Modders are in every lobby some teleport around and kill you while others just drop money on you. If you receive the latter Rockstar eventually will end up taking away ALL your money even the portion that wasn't from modders. This happened to me recently. A modder dropped a ton of money on people via CEO bonuses or whatever they're called in portions of 500k per bonus spamming it probably 3 times per second. Obviously that adds up really quickly. I don't necessarily care that they adjusted the banks of modded money but where I get off is where they take away ALL your money for something that is out of your control. It's not like there's a function to remove or drop cash so how am I supposed to get rid of the modded money? The answer is you don't and that's the worst part about it. Because they will punish you for something someone else did to you. I even wrote them a ticket to ask them for my 8M of legitimately earned money back to which they replied "We adjusted all illegally gained money" and quickly closed the ticket without letting me respond. That is hands down THE WORST customer service I have ever seen. I have gotten better customer service from McDonald's... And then my favorite part is when Rockstar puts Shark cards on sale immediately after taking away everyone's money. It's like they're not even try to hide their intentions any more. Rockstar has once again chosen the road that is profitable over the road that keeps their fanbase happy customers. It really is sad as I have sank over 350 hours into this game 95% of it online. One other thing that really bothers me that goes in hand with their customer service is the fact that Rockstar doesn't listen to their fans when developing new content. Some things players have been asking for a long time such as lobbies to freely use mods and other things along these lines would have been so nice and a great gesture from Rockstar that they really are listening to their fans. I personally think that this strategy is why games companies like Riot and Blizzard are so successful because not only do they listen to their community but they value their input. Being a part of the creative process really makes a fan want to play more! But Rockstar seems to have gotten it backwards as they don't seem like they would give a rat's about what their customers and fanbase have to say. It's bad business and it's going to come back and bite them in the I would have easily recommended this game to friends had Rockstar not been the company they are turning into. I probably won't be buying GTA VI when it eventually comes out and probably not buying Red Dead 2 either. I will give my money to a company that values its customers. It's a shame to see such a formerly great company become the worst in a matter of months.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
