review: Well I have to say it s an amazing game with bunches of playable contents and eastereggs lying through the storyline. Both GTAV and GTAOL is fantastic as I never have to worry about what I can do in Los Santos. However for palyers who are in mainland China you have to suffer a lot for 1 distant servers located in Japan of American and you will find yourself struggle to connect to Rockstar s servers 2 Terrible mechanism of anti cheating as I found many of my friends got banned for no reasons ranging from a week to a month while real cheaters or hackers were still in game 3 aggressive gameplay for GATOL as newbloods are often vulnerable to those experienced players while the latter usually tends to be much more aggressive.GTAOL features dozens of missions. However most of them are actually the same with the only difference being characters locations or what to steal especially for hesist missions. I do hope there could be an update with several new missions which I could have fun with my friendsAnyway it s still a good game.

Time to start grinding for hours and hours and hours or shell out a ton of cash for shark cards.And now the thing that really forces me to leave a negative review on one of my favorite games Take Two are trying to gut the modding community. OpenIV possibly the greatest tool for a GTA modder has been shut down by Take Two. Going after multiplayer mods may be understandable but this hurts singleplayer mods just as much.This is one of the greatest games ever and one of the best selling as well but that's not good enough for Take Two. They're going to take your $60 and they're not looking to stop there.

review: That's great Rockstar told TakeTwo to back off of OpenIV. TakeTwo has still destroyed its reputation of course. Apologizing and reversing actions does little to repair the insight we've gained about the company's motives. Its heavy handed approach and ignorance of the modding community shows that its only goal is to maximize the money in its bank account. Whether or not people liked OpenIV or that it was singleplayer only was irrelevant. If it posed even the slightest threat to TakeTwo's bank account it'd sic its lawyers after the creators.You are this company's cash cow whom they feed shark cards and from your swollen udder they milk your money. It's still reprehensible that such a well known and well designed game stooped low enough to charge you money for the base game turn around and force microtransactions in the form of shark cards down your throat and then follow up by releasing DLC ONLY for multiplayer where their shark cards are effective. In fact these two companies care so little about your online experience that the only thing that GETS patched in online is money cheats. That's it. Not car spawning not exploding other players not infinite off the radar. Just the only thing threatening their shark card sales. Whether or not a cheater comes by and s up your day is irrelevant to them.They wouldn't give a if cheaters could blow up your computer and kill you with the resulting explosion as long as they had a clause in their EULA that let them own the contents of your bank account upon your demise and a way to avoid the PR fallout. Hell they'd probably even try to make it easier for cheaters to do it.The only reason those microtransactions are there is because YOU yes YOU buy them. It is effective for TakeTwo to muscle in microtransactions through Rockstar's game because you are being WEAK WILLED and making the tactic WORK. Giving in to their manipulation is the surefire way to ensure these ing disgusting business practices are in the next game and the next game and the next game.Don't like it? Don't buy it. Vote with your money you weak willed piece of Basically singleplayer was great at first until we realized all DLC was going to multiplayer which is a festering cesspool of microtransactional manipulation. Would be a 10/10 game otherwise. Microtransactions just ruin it and turn everything into a giant grind that anyone with more money than you can just skip and flaunt to you. P.S. FiveM is a popular alternative to GTA Online multiplayer. You can get all that cool stuff and more without having to empty your bank account into the creators' Bahamas vacation fund in exchange for a useless yacht and some fast cars in an online game. PS WHATEVER Rockstar doesn't pay jack to host GTA Online servers at least not on PC. It's all peer to peer meaning you're hosting their services for them. They just have to host moderate traffic to authenticate players and that's it. You're literally paying them to host their servers on your computer and use your internet connection.

review: Well.... You finally did it. You tried to push your micro transaction content every way you knew how. You killed all single player expansions. &lt Your first merry f*ck you to the community.You restricted lots of Vehicles which were already game content to your multiplayer platform. &lt Your second f*ck you to the community.You made it nearly impossible to farm your way to anything beyond mid tier content due to ridiculous prices. &lt your third f*ck you to the community. You allowed hackers to ruin the experience for others while really pushing down punishment on the wrong people. &lt your sign that you really couldn't care less about your community and your fourth f*ck you. And now since you don't have enough people buying your microtransactions you thought to yourself How can we make the single player experience even worse in comparison to force people to purchase our currency? Well .... LET US FORBID SINGLE PLAYER MODDING! As a passionate modder of many games I can only say... Bravo ... Your earned my Boycott and my reccomendation for further boycotts by all the people I can reach.

review: When I first got this game and played with friends I had mixed feelings. Truthfully I loved the game overall. It had it's issues such as enemies spawning out of fat air (in view too) a terrible menu system that's clearly just ported over from consoles and some other stuff too but I could look past it because of the fun I was able to have with my friends. I loved playing online and just doing stupid stuff with my friends maybe working towards the next cool car or something. Over time however they started introducing new content which sounds like a good thing right? I thought so too but I always had a bit of a problem with the pricing of their new online content. Say they introduce an awesome new vehicle for a couple million in game dollars. You have the option to farm up this money at no cost of your own (aside from a tremendous amount of time) which is great but as someone with a full time job I feel like I can't keep up playing the game this way. So maybe after so many hours it's time to drop some money? After all I've received HOURS of entertainment from this game whats a few more dollars? Unfortunately the price of their "shark cards" (the way to buy in game currency) is just ridiculous. Take a look at the wiki which shows the prices for these cards http //gta.wikia.com/wiki/Cash_CardsI recall when they introduced all these amazing new vehicles I wanted to try like the Ramp buggy or the Rocket car each of which costs you around 2 to 3 MILLION in game currency. Not only that but you'll end up spending a couple million on buildings that you'll need to house this stuff and warehouses you'll need to earn more in game currency. I look on the wiki here and see that 3.5 million in game dollars costs $50.00 USD... What? Is this a fun way to play the game? I want to say that I believe more people would purchase these cards if the prices were more reasonable but I can only say that for myself. The game has quickly become stale for me and I place a large amount of blame on the terrible choices for pricing on all this new content. And with the newest debacle of mods being under attack by the game's publisher it has become more and more clear that the people in charge of this game care more about filling their pockets with your money than they do about making a good product. Maybe that seems normal to some people I know you can't build a business on generosity but I know there is a middle ground and I refuse to support this. If I feel what they are trying to sell is grossly overpriced I will not buy it ever!

review: This is the best GTA game yet in many ways. If you loved earlier GTA games chances are you will enjoy this one. Personally I've always felt like past GTA games have had poor gameplay and writing. GTA V has mediocre gunplay and decent writing so that's a step up but it still suffers from the same problem that makes all GTA games dead boring to me most of the time is spent driving from point A to point B. That's the reason I almost didn't finish Watch Dogs 2 and that's the reason I'll never finish GTA V. GTA Online can be fun with friends but more than 75% of the time is spent in menus and loading screens. If you're playing alone it's going to be painful rather than fun.Steam needs a 'meh' option for reviews. This isn't a bad game but it definitely isn't a good game either. If this had come out 5 years earlier it would have been much appreciated but as it stands there are too many high quality games out there to spend time on this lackluster product.

review: Excellent game however Rockstar have completely ruined online. It becomes mind numbingly boring very quickly yet you want the new shiny stuff they keep bringing out so you subject yourself to doing the same things over and over. Then you get banned mistakenly and Rockstar Support is utterly useless. If you have ever managed to get hold of a human on the other end of Rockstar Support then you should try and find a Master Ball and capture it quick because that's even more rare than finding someone on this game who doesn't behave like a BECAUSE THEY CAN.Everything is ridiculously expensive yet jobs yield very little and unless you have some very good friends who can actually play the game you won't find a random player willing to Heist with you. And when you do they are ten levels of utterly suck. You'll rob a bank for $1.25 million and come out with 3 cents because they kept walking into the line of fire and losing all the money you just spent hours trying to get. In conclusion if you haven't got any friends this is the game for you. Play singleplayer and mod the hell out of it. If you dare play GTA Online prepare to waste many hours before finally realising what a load of garbage it is and returning to a game which does not revolve around microtransactions ( 60 for a shark card are you kidding me Rockstar?). By the time you get enough money to buy something new and shiny another update is released and your million dollar car is redundant. Repetitive boring tedious and utterly pointless.Singleplayer 9/10Multiplayer 3/10Rockstar Support 1/10

review: I don't tend to use mods in this game since I do enjoy online races and creator mode and the like but I can't in good faith sit by and watch Take Two try and drive the modding community out of the game presumably an attempt to get more people to play their horribly balanced multiplayer and force them to buy the microtransactions you essentially require to access most of the new online content at this point without hours and hours of grinding. It's worth noting that OpenIV the tool that T2 are trying to take down can't even be used to mod public multiplayer sessions if T2 thinks they can justify their actions by pinning the blame on the mod menu problem that plagues GTA Online they're sorely mistaken.I usually don't buy into the whole 'leave negative reviews because of developer/publisher actions even if the game itself is good' thing but in this case I can't even call the game good anymore. It's hard to believe that the first content updates used to be completely free and were available in both single player and multiplayer when we're now forced to pay upwards of $2mil just to buy the PREREQUISITES for accessing the new content. Single player hasn't had a single update in almost 2 years if you absolutely must buy the game and don't want to play multiplayer a pre owned 360/PS3 copy will have almost all the SP content of the current gen version for a fraction of the price. Don't give T2 any money whatsoever.EDIT R* has convinced T2 to back off single player mods. Regardless I still can't recommend this game for full price online mode is still bad and single player isn't quite expansive enough without mods to recommend.

review: As a person who bought this game almost solely for the modding opportunities I am seriously disappointed with this games management. For those whom aren't aware TakeTwo the games publisher sent a Cease and Desist notification to the developers of OpenIV a modding tool which allows users to replace and modify files in Rockstar's special archive format ".rpf". This means that the future of the game's modding is in question as files for vehicle models player models peds voicelines and various other game files will no longer be accessible to modify. This could hinder the benifits of model replacements ever wanted to change the models of police vehicles into realistic CVPIs? Not anymore. Wanted to change the models and environment to look like it's from another country? No longer possible. The direct consequence is that the player or modder can no longer create or install these mods an open world game like Grand Theft Auto is ideal for modding. These have no impact on online play (as the anti cheat system would block you from accessing GTA online) and this decision mostly has its affects on the players who want to enjoy single player with something more than just the vanilla game whilst most cheaters in online play get off free. This decision affects the modding community at its heart and is not something I will condone. Fair enough people who cheat in online play should be banned but the developers who change the game in single player or the players who use the mods where it does not impact on anyone's gaming experience except the player enjoying the mods are not cheating. This was a terrible decision to make and if you don't redeem yourself now by withdrawing the Cease and Desist order GTA VI will not be a record breaking hit on the PC again.TL DR TakeTwo Interactive sent the delevopers of a vital modding tool a C&amp D notification. This will harm the modding community therefore I and many others am angry.If you believe that OpenIV should continue to operate please sign this petition. I am not confident that it will make much of a difference but it's something https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openivEdit There is a clear difference between modding and cheating. Modding is changing the game or your own experience in an environment where it doesn't affect anyone but yourself. Cheating is where one changes the game to give themselves an unfair advantage over others. So for those who say that this shoots down cheaters you're wrong.

review: Scam.Devs promise you money for the newsletter and they don't give it to you.How can a company that can literally print their own money be THIS greedy and Literally everything in the game is completely worthless.Glad that i mostly just cheated in the money by being afk duping stock and getting up to 1.3 million every time i drive an invincible truck for 7 miles.I pretty much own everything in the game and you can't use any of it anywhere EXCEPT in freemode.This is one of the most ridiculous scams i have ever seen. The game has literally like... FOUR missions in it."Steal the coke!" (Literally 50% of all missions you are lucky when the coke is not deadbolted to a 10 mph car... Also i just count every "steal" mission towards this because seriously does it make a difference if you do ECACTLY the same mission but in 1 it says "steal the coke inside a plane by stealing the plane" and in the other "steal a plane"? No! It is EXACTLY the same thing!)"Kill the guy!" (Yea sometimes they could not even put a real objective in so... like 25% of all missions are JUST killing faceless npc... who can outnumber you by like 50 to 1 and auto aim in the dark...)and... uhmm... What other missions were there again? Thinking of it... even the last heisst i did was ONLY "Steal the X!" and "kill the guys!" missions... The ONLY difference is that there is this npc that just won't stop talking through the entire mission otherwise it's EXACTLY the same stuff you always do except that the location is a tiny tiny tiny bit more fancy this time. I.e. instead of killing someone in the middle of the city you now have to walk up 10 stairs in some military building and THEN shoot a guy! Isn't that SUCH a different mission? Instead of killing a guy you walk stairs and THEN kill a guy WHILE listening to that ing INSANE NPC???I can't wait for the next update on the game! Can't wait for the one where we get all the normal missions again but this time while playing the mission there is just a huge picture of a dog turd on your screen so you can't actually see the game! Man that would be SO COOL because it is DIFFERENT!10/10 hope everyone who ever bought a shark card just drops dead for supporting those... ing below human developers... don't even know what to call them... seriously... What do you call people who are literally worse than Adolf Hitler?

Some vehicles in this game are unbalanced like too overpriced or just completley unbalanced. Also there is modders that is a problem with the online I haven't been seeing them that often though since Rockstar recently shutdown one of the most popular mod menus out there so I can't really say much about modders. The playerbase in general on the other hand aren't that nice they like blowing you up and want to stop whatever you're trying to do supply mission or just trying to have fun with your friends. Well anyway I have to give GTA 5 singleplayer a 9.5/10 and Multiplayer an 8/10.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is a very technically impressive game especially considering it launched three seperate times for 5 different platforms. With the pc version being the last to come out Rockstar/Take Two has only kneecapped themselves as the game progressed. Very nice driving physics and fun third person gameplay cannot excuse the absolute cash grab that is the multiplayer. For a mode originally tacked on akin to goldeneye for the n64 Take Two has put a lot of faith in the continued longevity of GTA Online. So much so that they have neglected the single player and refused to release single player dlc. It's a hard truth to accept but Take Two/ Rockstar has given up on the game itself to shill thier moneymaking desires. As GTA gets older in my opinion it is becoming less of a game and more of a job. And I believe games should not aspire to be jobs first and foremost games should be for the enjoyment of the players. And I have enjoyed myself as much as possible with this game. Even with the interests of take two interfering with the balance of the online mode and the neglect of the single player GTA 5 is still a damn good game and you will definitely get your moneys worth on it. Just dont expect to have extended fun with this game.Edit Due to Take Two's decision to send a cease and desist letter to the modding communtiy I cannot reccomend this game anymore.Edit2 Due to the recent ban wave on March 24th 2018 DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Rockstar has shown little regard for anyone banned falsely and resets characters with thousands of hours for false reasons and I will not support any more of their games in the future.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I really loved this game in almost every aspect just based on the hrs I got on this game. But online mode is a joke I've managed to get perma banned just by trying to play online over and over again all because of some hacker giving me money I never asked for. It's a shame that my 1000s of hrs into this game just go to waste do to some algorithm as well as awfull Costumer Support. I have tried almost 10 times to contact Rockstar about trying to be unbanned but they won't do anything other than just tell you some automated message. I've even tried calling an actual person to talk about this issue but they just instantly deny talking to you if they here you've been banned. I use to love playing this game with my friends but it doesn't matter anymore because I've been perma banned for nothing.

I understand where Take Two Interactive were coming from however they have targeted the wrong people to reduce online hacking etc. Personally I play GTA for the moddability brought to us by OpenIV and the huge array of mods available for single player of which unfortunately will no longer be able to be placed into the game to make many more hours of playability. Out of the 287.3 hours I have played I think around 50 of that was playing Online. Yes I had it on console prior to PC but that mostly was driving around in a police car imagining myself stopping vehicles etc. Modding gave the capability to actually do that and unfortunately that will no longer exist.

review: Take 2 has a very interesting way of thanking the most loyal members of it's community. Modders and the people who enable them are perhaps the biggest fans of any given game and to see them treated like criminals is disgraceful. These people don't care about you. They don't even really care about their game. The only thing they care about is profit. Shame on them and shame on Rockstar for tacitly letting a publisher alienate their player base.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So I had a decent review for this game when I first got it years ago Then I changed my review due to the removal of mods and the ability to mod the game. But now I deleted my previous review and this is a new one why?As far as I am concerned a cheating system is there to keep away cheaters from the actual legit players wanting to enjoy or in this case atleast try to enjoy the game.I downloaded the game AGAIN after i deleted it a year ago because of the new updates in online which got me excited who doesn't want to buy a new flying car to fly around the city? Now I try to grind a bit and play online and I open the game not 5 minutes from writing this review to find my account suspended for a month till the 16th of June 2018.So here's the question. What in the actual happened? Is this game's cheating system just a bunch of random bans to anybody who was playing? And I didn't even find a modder or any cheater within my game when I was playing hell I didn't even do anything but missions and races.So? I'm off not because a non fair suspended my account where in this case other people are also getting banned left and right for no ing reason. But because I didn't get a chance to actually play the online of the game.And for someone who was dying to get their hands on the new cars of the new update or even having a property in game and these kind of stuff this is seriously ed up to prevent someone from the experience they paid for their game.So for an actual review the game's singleplayer is good. online is trash because if you think you won't cheat or meet a cheater at any time this can happen to you for no reason.Don't get it for the online. And even for the singleplayer the 60 dollars aren't enough for it alone. What a ed up situation.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Superb game (single player) which has had me wasting a great many hours just exploring the city shooting everything in sight and avoiding the cops!I've made a small amount of progress playing the story mode quests but it's too easy to be seduced by the city and mess around.Why the negative vote?Until recently I wouldn't have considered it possible for me to vote against this game. That was until I got a random ban due to playing the online version of the game for an hour.I've probably only clocked about 10 hours of online play since I bought GTAV when it came out. It's not something I really get a kick out of and amassed a "fortune" of about $4500. I don't mod my games and my PC system is clean (I'm an IT pro with over 30 years PC experience so I *know* my system is clean).The night I (somehow) got the ban I logged in on a whim wandered around a bit bought a jacket in a shop (accidentally) and then found someone sniping me. I died a few times before I spotted where they were and returned the compliment. It was pretty even on the kill/die count after that. I then went into "observation mode" to go look at my assailant before I shut down for bed. Went over for a nosey then exited the game. That hour was probably the most fun I'd had in the Online version of the game.A week later I get the urge to go on again and found that I'm a week into a 30 day ban! No idea why. No feedback just the dire warning that a second ban would be permanent!I have no idea why I received a ban. None whatsoever. Has to be their anti cheat software raising a 'false positive'. If I play it again I could be permabanned but I haven't a clue what happened the first time so that I can investigate and correct it.There's no communication from Rockstar. I tried raising a "bug" report but nothing back from them. It's a ridiculous way to treat paying customers. I absolutely *hate* game cheats they have ruined some of my favourite online games in the past. I just wish I could help Rockstar to debug their system communication is essential for that.Sadly this will be the last game I buy from what used to be my favourite developers...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game itself is utterly amazing singleplayer is great looks amazing and what not. But Online is a mess unbalanced payouts nothing done against kiddie scripts who are just out to cause chaos and think they're tough stuff by using a menu to mess with you.The dodgy business practices that the game has also sadly taken part in around a steam summer sale the games price was increased a week before the sale and was discounted for the same price before it was increased then the next day the only way to get GTA V was bundled with sharkcards which meant if you wanted to buy the game as a gift for a friend you had to pay full price.FiveM was a mod way back which was going to allow you to play storymode with friends as the different main characters so what happens is Take Two send some private investigtors to the homes of the modders to get them to stop development of FiveM and I beileve this also happened to the team of GTA M which is shady as .Recently around 2017 June Take 2 basically stated they aren't milking the GTA Online community enough of money for a full priced game they've already paid for which you can only wonder how well that went down with every and then during E3 they send cease and desist letters to the OpenIV more than likely hoping gaming news would blow it over and keep it on the low down.Now OpenIV was more than likely never used to be fiddling with Online however there has been a couple of stories that this banning was more than likely an attempt to bully single player users into going into Online so they have to suffer the grind and then T2 pray for them to have no back bone and buy lots of sharkcards.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: At the moment there is a huge banwave banning ppl who I trust never modded or cheated. At this moment I dont recommend Online to nobody. Now I make public the current state of Online I want to expand my last review. This game gave me so much happiness and frustration. By the amount of hours I played you can trust me that both V and Online are amazing games. V has an amazing history and plot. Not the best and can be a little boring here and there but you enjoy the game. And the graphics are very well done. For a 2014 game is ageing well. The introduction of three characters is a good concept and for me works very well. The game has its flaws dont get me wrong but its a game worth picking in discount of 25% or like now at 50% just for single player.But Online is a different thing. I did and still enjoy the game till this day. The frequent updates keep the game fresh ish. The friends I made and the amazing crew I been introduce to make me play even more. The amount of things you can do are tremendous. Heists races tune cars modify your PC at your liking and a lot of more stuff that gives a sense of freedom in a game that sometimes shocks you with high prices.This game is great but no for someone new. Unless you have friends who already play or you are a ppl person you wont enjoy Online. Too much overpowered vehicles roam Public Lobbys making the experience frustrating for new players. Trying to do things with randoms can get you kicked most of the times for being low level.Almost forgot. Shark Cards are made so tempting when you are new and need that boost.If you are new keep in mind what I said please.Final veredict. Sp is worth if you like the history or plan to mod the game. It has a great community with mods and things like that.Online only with friends or a friendly crew or have the temperament to play with randoms. If not dont even try Online.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: In light of the recent scumbag move from Take Two suddenly not allowing single player mods I'm now finally giving this a thumbs down. Aside from already buying this game twice at this point (once on console again for PC) I feel the way TT and R* have treated their playerbase is dissapoiting and has ultimately tarnished the reputation of a company beloved by many including myself.The game had it's problems early on the first big shock was the scattergun banning of users online for using mods which was poorly handled with many users who didn't use mods getting their access stripped away with no explination. This was a sign of things to come as R* and TT were quietly paving the way to shoe horn microtransactions into a $60 game post launch. This was to alleivate the deliberately grindy nature of the online experience turning what could have been a fantastic comminuty platform experience into a pay to progress model with only the prospect of a formidable grind over the same handful of heists and missions as the alternative.Single player had been neglected with no fantastic Stories from Liberty City type DLC to speak of. For the majority of single player users the feeling of abandonment from the developer was palpable instead favoring any development time concentrating on the small portion of the gaming community willing to pay for shark cards.The only saving grace had been the stellar single player modding community which had kept this and many previous R* titles afloat and active with thousands of wonderful and creative mods fixing many of the Single Player's gutted features and lackluster elements.Now however TT (and perhaps R*) have decided we haven't spent enough of our money and are now going after the very same community which have helped rise their games over the competition. For shame. Biting the hand which has fed them for so long in favour for short sighted arrogant greed.Don't support a CEO who shows such obvious contempt for their client base. To him we're nothing but a bunch of desperate kids cunning theives and braindead whales. Vote with your wallet or these practices will become commonplace.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As an avid Grand Theft Auto fan my opinion is that this game tries too hard and falls too short. The story is filled with too many cliches and it tries too hard to be a Michael Bay movie or something. Having a game set in present day as opposed to a certain era as has been the case with many previous games doesn't translate to nearly as interesting story or setting as it should. You can clearly see how much emphasis was but in the Online section and how the singleplayer suffered from that approach and that is not fine in my books. Playing Online is an endless grind unless you're willing to open your wallet for some ridiculiously priced in game cash or dare just go and outright hack by spawning money.Take Two's approach to hinder mod and third party multiplayer development is the last nail in the coffin in this sinking ship.

review: If you don't want to read a little skip to the end.I am appalled by the modding scandal. "Why cut a feature from a game that only furthers the life of the game?" a lot are asking well its because shark cards. Since you're enjoying yourself in story mode you aren't buying shark cards and then Rockstar isn't making money but why does money matter to them they made more than 2 000 000 000$ off the game (from an article done 3 years ago the number is probably 4 6 billion). In short they removed a feature that adds life because they want more money although they're game is one of the most successful titles in history. Honestly why does it matter to them.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This recent cease and desist order from TakeTwo to the team developing OpenIV finally pushed me to write this review. If you play GTA for the mods do not purchase Grand Theft Auto V. TakeTwo Interactive the publisher of GTA recently shut down development of the community mod OpenIV. This breaks the company's promise to leave the developers of single player mods alone "the modding policy in our license has not changed and is the same as for GTAIV." In order to push more players to play GTAOnline TakeTwo killed a core component of modding in GTA. This is unacceptable. TakeTwo clearly does not care about their players' enjoyment of their game so long as they are joining online and buying shark cards. In the years following the game's release. Rockstar has never released a major content update for the single player portion of the game like they have numerous times each year for multiplayer. Grand Theft Auto V is only worthwhile as a single player experience and without mods this value decreases greatly. Unless TakeTwo withdraws their order to the creators of OpenIV GTAV does not deserve your money.

review: PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! When a young street hustler a retired bank robber and a terrifying psychopath find themselves entangled with some of the most frightening and deranged elements of the criminal underworld the U.S. government and the entertainment industry they must pull off a series of dangerous heists to survive in a ruthless city in which they can trust nobody least of all each other.Grand Theft Auto V for PC offers players the option to explore the award winning world of Los Santos and Blaine County in resolutions of up to 4k and beyond as well as the chance to experience the game running at 60 frames per second. The game offers players a huge range of PC specific customization options including over 25 separate configurable settings for texture quality shaders tessellation anti aliasing and more as well as support and extensive customization for mouse and keyboard controls. Additional options include a population density slider to control car and pedestrian traffic as well as dual and triple monitor support 3D compatibility and plug and play controller support. Grand Theft Auto V for PC also includes Grand Theft Auto Online with support for 30 players and two spectators. Grand Theft Auto Online for PC will include all existing gameplay upgrades and Rockstar created content released since the launch of Grand Theft Auto Online including Heists and Adversary modes.The PC version of Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online features First Person Mode giving players the chance to explore the incredibly detailed world of Los Santos and Blaine County in an entirely new way.Grand Theft Auto V for PC also brings the debut of the Rockstar Editor a powerful suite of creative tools to quickly and easily capture edit and share game footage from within Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online. The Rockstar Editor s Director Mode allows players the ability to stage their own scenes using prominent story characters pedestrians and even animals to bring their vision to life. Along with advanced camera manipulation and editing effects including fast and slow motion and an array of camera filters players can add their own music using songs from GTAV radio stations or dynamically control the intensity of the game s score. Completed videos can be uploaded directly from the Rockstar Editor to YouTube and the Rockstar Games Social Club for easy sharing. Soundtrack artists The Alchemist and Oh No return as hosts of the new radio station The Lab FM. The station features new and exclusive music from the production duo based on and inspired by the game s original soundtrack. Collaborating guest artists include Earl Sweatshirt Freddie Gibbs Little Dragon Killer Mike Sam Herring from Future Islands and more. Players can also discover Los Santos and Blaine County while enjoying their own music through Self Radio a new radio station that will host player created custom soundtracks.Existing players on PlayStation 3 PlayStation 4 Xbox 360 and Xbox One are able to transfer their Grand Theft Auto Online characters and progression to PC. For more information please visit rockstargames.com/gtaonline/charactertransfer.PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE! PC MASTER RACE!

review: I never leave reviews but after seeing that this game has mixed reviews now after all the issues that it has had with Online profile transfers etc I feel the need to justify how good of a game this is.If you have played any of the older GTA's well you are in for a treat like no other. Massive map with such great detail that you can spend hours doing nothing but walking around and observing a world that moves as if you werent there.The story itself is probably 50 60 hours plus dozens of hours more from all the side missions that you can do.If you are paying 59.99 full price 29.99 on sale you are getting a good deal either way.I dont get how people can complain and give the game a negative review when they have over 1000 hours play. Jesus you got 1000 hours out of something that you paid 60 dollars for I think that is a fair deal.

review: Welp I've been pushed over the edge into writing this review in lieu of recent events which can be read in any other review posted recently. This review will cover actual issues the game has instead of chewing out take2 (though they do deserve to be chewed out but at this point I feel anything I'd say has already been said).I will begin by saying this game was entertaining for a short while. It has nice graphics pretty fluid gameplay and they like to keep online updated which they've done for free instead of having you pay for dlc so I commend them for doing that. Unfortunately that's all the praise I have for this game.I will begin ripping this thing apart with single player mode. Unlike other GTA games I've played (mostly Vice City and San Andreas which are arguably the best 2 in the series) the game is a cakewalk. When I play GTA I want to be challenged to the point of rage quitting then coming back to it a short while later (anyone remember Demolition Man from VC? or what about the damn RC plane mission in SA?). Not to mention this game feels smaller than SA with only 1 city and the countryside. The story is decent some of the characters are great but all of that is overshadowed by how easily one breezes through the story. This isn't a GTA game it's got the look and some of the humor of a GTA game but it lacks the soul crushingly difficult mission(s) that gives each of the other GTA's I've played their unique charm.Now on to the real killer for me online mode. Online mode is a great concept but horribly executed. It's nice to be able to play with others and progress from having your first vehicle you stole to having a few houses a business multiple full garages full of customized cars etc. It would also be nice if that were possible in a reasonable amount of time. Unfortunately it's not. If you're like me and refuse to do any microtransactions so you end up grinding the resourses online takes eons. They price things so exorbitantly high that most players just end up buying the shark cards making it one of the cardinal sins of gaming pay to win. Online at this point has become just a money grab. Additionally online mode is riddled with players who bend the rules. Some of these people are nice but most I've come across are just trolls. Then there's the seemingly endless supply of rule abiding trolls. Those who don't circumvent the rules with additional tools but rather use their equipment to wreak havoc on honest players. I understand that some of this is fine fun even but when it's every server then it makes it unbearable. Also you can forget about acomplishing anything in your own private server the freeroam events are disabled thus forcing you to play in a troll riddled hellhole of a place just trying to accomplish anything to make some decent cash so you don't have to spend real money on those damn shark cards. As far as running the MC or CEO stuff most people don't want to bother with it unless they get the highest cut so everyone runs their own stuff rather than working together. So many of the practices with online mode are very anti cooperative play which is in direct contrast to the real world of crime where you have people working together to achieve things. So even as a crime simulator this game fails.Now to break my own rule I gave myself at the beginning of this... talking about the Take 2 legal action against a certain modding tool.Mods are what made single player mode bearable. You could make it difficult quirky grimey and downright weird. But that's the beauty of mods in games. Companies like Take 2 think of mods as ways to break rules and ruin their games but that's not what modding real modding is. Modding for all intents and purposes is a way for people to enjoy the product that the company has released long past its vanilla playability allows. Furthermore it's a form of creative expression allowing people to view the game as a wonderfully built canvas to unleash their creative desires and share with others. Modding brings me back to the good 'ol days of gaming before all the extreme budgets corporate buyouts playing it safe with releases (which this game is... dumbed down to appeal to the widest audience). All gaming is nowadays seems like it's about making the most money rather than providing quality entertainment. I remember a time when games used to be innovative groundbreaking even people used to push the limits take risks succeed and fail. But that was the beauty of it. If a game failed it was because it was a bad game not because they didn't spend enough on marketing (in the beginning anyway... this did eventually become the reason many games do fail). Modding allows people to do what those crazy fools did back in the day push the limits cause paradigm shifts and create quality entertainment. Many of the games which have brought massive loads of cash in for some of these companies began as mods for other games so it's sickening to see companies doing things like Take2 has done to the modding community. Basically what they're saying is "Your ideas are trash allow us to give you what we say you want" rather than being a decent company and providing us with what we actually want. We get the same 15 games every year because it reaches the widest audience mods are there to make the more nuanced alterations that fit smaller segments within the market allowing us to turn the game into what we want. Some may claim that it sullies the original work my response to them is to wake up and realize that it's just a money game now when it comes to the big companies.Back on topic a bit Take2's legal action against a certain modding tool is appalling. They claim it's to prevent modders online which would be fine since it's their servers people may have conflicting mods there's no way to manage them all among other issues. However this particular tool doesn't allow for any sort of online modding (not to mention the modders who are online are rarely punished anyway). So why is it they claim it's to prevent online modding when clearly it's not? The answer is simple long ago they said that they'll allow modding in offline mode it's your game so you should be able to turn it into something you enjoy playing. They say it's to prevent online modding so they don't have to go back on their original promise though actions speak louder than words and it's clear they have indeed gone back on their word. Why do they want to eliminate offline modding? Well that's a simple question to answer. As stated earlier mods allow players to enjoy games long past their original playability value. In the case of GTA5 once you beat the story and quests there's nothing left to do so naturally you head online. Mods allowed peole to continue to play offline long after the story ended which was no good for Take2. Once you remove the Mods the playability factor is gone thus forcing people to play online. Once online they realize the exorbitant prices for most things and either quit playing the game altogether attempt to grind it out or in the case of most people buy the shark cards.This kind of anti consumer behavior cannot stand. Not to mention the game isn't even that spectacular and is riddled with issues that they don't appear to care enough about to fix. So no I do not recommend this game.

review: Let me split this review into 3 sections. One for the Online mode One for the Single player and one for the Modded RP side of things.Online At first I loved Online and I love Rockstar but they have just riddled this game with micro transactions and their "Shark Cards". Its pretty much just a huge circle that goes as follows They announce a new DLC that has the new fastest car that everyone wants and adds some kind of gimmicky vehicle that you'll enjoy for 20 minutes then either sell it or let it collect dust in the garage. Next the brand new fastest car costs a fortune and you can either spend a week to try to get enough money to purchase it or to buy a "Shark Card" to instantly get it with your real life hard earned cash. Then in a few days or maybe even a week you will get burnt out until they announce another new DLC which is exactly the same as the last one but with a new skin on it. With the brand new fastest car and that new gimmicky vehicle that they have to add. + its riddled with hackers and cheaters.Singleplayer The singleplayer storyline is FENOMINAL. I can't even describe how great it is when a young poor criminal (Franklin) meets up with an old ex criminal under witness protection (Micheal) who tries to help the young poor criminal get some ill gotten cash which then the old ex criminals partner who is some twisted redneck (Trevor) figures out where he lives to get revenge.Im bad at explaining things but its just great and it is a somewhat lengthy story aswell which is always a plus.Modded RP The modded RP scene is still in development but so far its great and its all fun. It already has a lot of the functunality of SA MP (San Andreas Multiplayer) and if not more. It seems very promising and I can't wait to see what it leads to.Overall You could buy this game for the Single player and/or the modded RP. but Rockstar just can't stop milking their game of micro transactions and it also doesnt help that the publisher of this game Take Two tried to take away pretty much the whole modding scene but thanks to the community that didn't happen.5.5/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have fun only because of the cars. Some sound better than Forza games. But no way to test drive them or hear the sound outside of youtubers that won't stop talking. Now lets get to the game. Every feature in MP that was exploited they just remove instead of trying to patch. Giving money. Mechanic driving car to you vs teleporting it in. Apparently even the armored cars in freeplay are gone now. Only way to find them is if you had an old character that had them unlocked.Game is such BS with the anticheat too. I've personally had a car with no visible player in it following me around. Suddenly I start exploding out of nowhere. Try to kill the car nothing happens. I get TP'd to fort zancudo suddenly the car is behind me. I end up driving away at one point and I get flung into the air completely controlled by said . Now I get blamed for hacking as it's in clear view of all the other players.Oh and how unfair the game is to new people. It has BS weapons like the minigun that players just use whenever because it takes no skill to spray rounds with it. Higher level unlock of course. Now couple that with the FACT that higher levels have access to better armor AND as you level up your health permanently increases. How the is that a feature? I have shot these minigun douches in the head because some of them suck but they survived it because they are max level and have more base health than me.This ing game...OH OH OH just remembered something real good that Rockstar pulled. The past TWO times before this last event where you "buy shark cards and get x amount of money back" they never gave people money. The last two times before now you buya shark card and 2x the money as in you buy a 3mil card you get another 3mil free. I would say a large majority never got that money. Now this last time of course it was only 30% of what you paid for so of course they gave that out. ing cheapskates. NEWEST EDIT So apparently all the money they scammed off people and earned isn't enough. So they shut down OpenIV which has nothing to do with their multiplayer so they can force all the users to the MP. Maybe if they'd release singleplayer DLC and make the endgame not suck they'd get the money they want. I'd literally pay if they implemented lspdfr into the game. But they don't do cool stuff like that so we mod it in. Only we can't now.

review: I have this game on xbox one and decided to try it out on my gaming laptop I recently got. The cracked version actually worked (go figure) so I went and bought the game when it got on sale......big mistake. For some reason my launcher kept crashing before it could even log in found out it was something to do with my graphics card...only way for those of us who have Nvidea cards to play this game is to DISABLE YOUR GPU before you start the game. Next re enable the graphics card before it launches the client. Needless to say I am DEEPLY DISSAPOINTED by this problem and rockstars lack of support I had to dig around on steam forums to find a work around however if you don't own an nvidea gpu its a fun game and amazing single player mode (for what little I got to play).

review: The driving gameplay is probably some of the best feeling I've ever experienced outside of racing games but on foot the KB/M feels a bit sluggish unresponsive and unintuitive. It's like trying to escort a drunk friend home. You might run into an infinite loading screen bug like I did but the hour it takes to resolve that you'll be rewarded by getting to access the GTAV Online where you'll be armed with a 12 shot pistol and experience the joy of being spawn killed by people toting machine guns in souped up vehicles. If this happens when you were trying to reach an objective no worries you'll (very helpfully) respawn 100 000 years away from your waypoint and build character and patience by being killed (again) on your way there and spawning across the map (again).Despite this the game is still loads of fun. Or I would assume it is since people are still playing it. I wouldn't know because after playing online for about 1.5 hours I logged out. And about two hours after that Rockstar sent me an email telling me I was banned for a month. If it happens to you and this early on you won't be able to post for help at Rockstar's Social forums (your account will not be at least a month old) but you can still entertain yourself by talking to R* "support " which is actually Cleverbot's much dumber cousin.

review: Take Two. Modding keeps this game alive Online is the iest cash grab I've ever seen. I'm confused that they managed to make a virtually perfect singleplayer with it's amazing detail characters breathing city graphics etc and created such an awful clunky pay2win online platform. Singleplayer is where it's at and mods keep it alive. Handling mods overhauled the arcade driving graphics mods made it look EVEN better L.A. Roads totally changed Los Santos' road textures into something beautiful. AI enhancements helped police chases vehicle &amp weapon mods kept it fresh with countless new mods being released everyday. Ragdoll physics were all overhauled too making bodies flop in an even more hilarious manner all created because of OpenIV's easy to use platform. But for somereason Take Two don't want us to enjoy the game unless we're spending 300+ on ingame currency to fly around in a chrome shitbox with red tyre smoke. you Take Two.

review: I've been a loyal R* player for years and have enjoyed many of their gamesfor taht time from Smuggler's run to GTA. The single player content for this game is fun San Andreas is fun to explore and the sotry and characters are brilliant. So why the negative review? GTA Online.GTA Online never mixed well with me because I'm no exactly an MMO player and it's built very much like an MMO and there's so much promise and potential with it. New content is released constantly but making money in game to actually have fun is tiring espicially if modders make it impossible to do. Some modders are great as they just spawn really dumb stuff and give you lot's of money but most just kill the players with commands and it's really ing annoying. Not only that but the servers generally have bad connections and lag most of the time. If you could get all the online content for single player this game would be amazing but they tie and constrict us to multiple microtransactions servers and players.singleplayer 9/10Online 2/10

review: I struggle to recommend this game anymore for the last 2 years the updates to the online mode have progressed to charging far more than its worth in in game currency . to buy everything in one update you'd either have to play hundreds of hours of the same heist doing the same setups and the same final without variation. Or just spend 250 and have enough in game money to buy it all. Even when you opt to play the heists the community (if you could bring yourself to call it that) only wants to play the final . For you to play your own heist there is an hour "cool down" in which you cannot start a new heist but if you only search to join a heist final this does not apply to you. the payouts are tiny compared to the cost of a dlc car to buy 1 dlc super car you can expect to have to play the hardest heist 3 4 times depending on your cut.I would recommend the single player but compared to a newer game it is not worth the asking price alone. so if you care enough about gta's drive here shoot this gameplay I'd wait for a half price sale because the story or fun vehicles/ weapons are not up to the standard of gta San Andreas a game that was a DECADE old on the initial release of this game.

review: After a few months I decided to give Gta5 a go again. So I install a 3 GB something update go into Gta Online and fire it up. It's been a while I think to myself maybe all the hate has died down and maybe its not as much of a hole as it once was. And lo and behold the first thing I see is that rockstar has "adjusted" my account.....by removing 1 million something dollars. The lack of stuff added to single player the horrendously overpriced content in Online P2W elements with the shark cards the whole anti mod catastrophe and now this? I can't recommend this game. I just can't. If you still care about your fans Rockstar get your together.

review: Alright Single Players is good. Buy it if you want a pure good SP game but the real time is spent in MP.Online is a blast (with friends) until you realise that it's entirety is crap. Such as A) It's cash cow filled with repetative grinding B) It's only really enjoyable with dedicated and trustworthy friendsC) It Contains blatent and dilerberate player un friendlyness (such as the only way to get certain clothing items is via glitching and instead of adding a way for players to obtain these very obviously wanted items they ing patch the harmless glitches) D) Near zero support outside of more one off 'content' which costs dozens of hours just to unlockE) Ignoring the community and their feedbackF) Implementation of 'content' with little regards to how it'll affect the online playspace (such as the ing MOTORCYCLES WITH ROCKET LAUNCHERS and MASSIVELY POWERFUL (and expensive) MILITARY VECHICLES)G) Very unfriendly for playing with friends also very unfriendly for playing without friends. Probably spent more than a quarter of my time in this game TRYING to get together with friends but having to deal with randos disconnecting and ing up the entire lobby by sending you back into the 'freeroam' (because THAT was a brilliant decision by their designers!) the long loading times the clunky interface the complete lack of a party system which means that you and your friends are constantly being seperated ect ect.H) Very obvious copy+paste run back and forth point A to B to C then back to A grinding 'missions ' only to then wait for ing hours to TRY to sell it (which ANYONE can it up with a single rocket because the game encourages people to be complete and absolute cancerous to barely make a bit of money to try to get the money back for buying the requirements to get these missions to turn hours of time and grinding after grinding into some notion of profit for an OP vehicleI) Did I mention how unfriendly the game is in general? It's ing terrible. So many terrible design decisions.J) Cancerous community actively encouraged by the gameK) Rampant and blatent cheatingL) There has been dozens of dozens of reports recently of inocent players having money taken away from their account because of t automated systems which detected it as 'modded moeny' and having support tickets that's just 'You modded we took it away you're our . Ticket closed.'M) (Continuation of L) For example there's a challenge in GTA Online to do each heist in order without dying. As you may imagine it is a VERY difficult challange and nets you 10million of their in game currency as a reward. People who have completed this challange recently have had that money taken away because the game detected it as cheated money.N) Oh you know how I said that the community is cancerous? Look at how many of the positive reviews lists 'It's fun interfering with the gameplay of other players in a way which in other games would be a bannable offence' as a pro of the game.O) The game is one which constantly encourages you to play with friends but then only has activities which benefits one player while screwing the rest of them out of their time and effort. While said one player a fair monitary amount for their time their friends who helped them gain it get nothing but a penny.P) The entirety of the 'shark cards' which is the way R* monitizes the game isn't worth even half of the price it gives. As the game has more dlc added the prices of the new content goes up creating massive inflation which the cards haven't been adjusted to since... 2013. $100 is not worth 8 million in GTA$. 100$ is more like 25 million GTA$ worth.Oh and that's just the start of it. There so many more issues with it. Take Two.

They come back in a random car and try to throw a sticky bomb at me but blow themselves up. Two of them survived (don't know how) I shoot the survivors and run away and climb on a roof. THEN SUDDENLY SOME RANDOM PLAYER MODELS START SPAWNING ON ME AND I HAVE TO LEAVE SO IT WONT CRASH MY GAME? Man that's pathetic. Can't play the game fair. They got mad because I won. That's no reason to ruin someones playing... So for now it's nope for me... Come on Rockstar ban the hackers.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: In September 2013 Rockstar released GTA V. It was impressive in some ways disappointing in others. The open world was satisfyingly detailed and the main characters were entertaining to spend time with. On the other hand we were never given much incentive to explore the world the structure was all a bit sloppy (the flying school for example is never brought to your attention unlike in San Andreas) the main story never really went anywhere and there are only two talk radio stations (the fewest in any GTA I can remember). None of the characters learned anything or changed in any way. On the whole worth 30 but it never could hope to reach the heights of the Ballad of Gay Tony. All a bit slapdash and carried the air of a product with a few too many people working on it and which consequently lost its focus.The PC release added some novelties and it's a good port but nothing fundamental has changed. I've played a lot more BoGT than GTA V on any platform.All in all GTA V was a solid effort and great grounds for future expansions. Unfortunately we're never going to get those expansions. Two or even three single player DLCs were planned which would have fitted into the game beautifully and given us a reason to go back. Alien invasions and zombies check out the Mount Chillad mystery reddit for details. Unfortunately Take Two cancelled these in order to focus on the microtransaction cash cow that is GTA Online.Plenty of other reviews detail the problems with GTA Online. I played it for a while with friends when it was first available on the 360. We rapidly lost interest though as there wasn't really anything to do that other more focused games couldn't do better. And that was before T2 started focusing all their efforts on more microtransactions in lieu of doing anything about the omnipresent cheaters and hackers.So no single player DLC to give after sales support and multiplayer isn't worth a damn. So why would you buy the PC version? Mods was the obvious answer. However T2 have now decided to oppose modding. That thing which the fans were doing better than them adding value to the GTA V product. By shutting down OpenIV T2 have made it much harder to get the majority of mods running and they won't stop here. They don't want you to have fun with mad stuff that the community makes up. They want to engage you in constant psychological warfare in order to drain your wallet with microtransactions. Apparently being the fourth or fifth bestselling videogame OF ALL TIME not including the HUNDREDS OF MILLIONS OF DOLLARS they make from microtransactions ever year simply isn't enough money.I feel bad for the devs at Rockstar. Once upon a time they made videogames new story campaigns worlds and characters for us to explore. All creatively fulfilling work. Now they're expected to feed the microtransaction machine by adding the occasional new gun and new vehicle. I understand that Rockstar's already started to lose staff and I wouldn't be surprised if some of them were simply bored out of their skulls making this crap and decided to go and do more interesting work. And when T2 finally get bored of making all the money in the world and want a new GTA game...well the talent base passion and experience has already started to leave.Adequate but flawed singleplayer which Take 2 don't want anyone improving not even for free with mods. Worthless multiplayer. Don't buy or for heaven's sake don't buy it new or at full price.

review: Awesome game !Indeed this game has everything that you could hope for If you loved how those previous GTA titles stories were then you're gonna love this one. The story is really fun deep and entertaining. They managed to put the story to be well served by the gameplay you have while playing one of three protagonists. Michael Franklin and Trevor are really very well designed and their voices acts are marvelous.Now for the graphics and atmosphere what could we say more than just MARVELOUS! FANTASTIC! Damn i'm most of the time suprised to wanna take pictures just of the scenery from some places. Just incredible how REALISTIC they made it !For the NPC wandering around they tend to reinforce the realistic feeling you have they wander around go shoping do anything a real person would do in a place like this. Just AWESOME !The musics and sounds are as awesome as the rest they match really well the feeling you get from a realistic world from the engine of you car cooling off with a "tik tik tik" to birds and wild animals sounds. Nice.My personnal only wish is that ROCKSTAR made such an AWESOME and LIVING world that i sometimes find it a shame not being able to interact more with the things from it. You know sit on a bench talk to pedestrians (beside the only ANGRY talk we can have with them) ... To put it short i would really like to get more involved in this huge place but it's my only personnal feeling about it.Regarding multiplayer it's really well made the only thing is that even though you could play online on solo mode you'll find it more enjoyable to play with FRIENDS and friends only as the random player you may find WILL want to shoot you dead as soon as they see you.

review: With the gross amount of money that GTA Online pulls in from the sad few who give in to the purchase of microtransaction cash one would think the publisher TakeTwo Interactive would think anything to ship more copies to potential whales would be great. WRONG! Strauss Zelnick the man in charge of those idoits continues to show his active distain for the gaming community. Not only commenting on how he feels he is "undermonitizing" GTA Online now his company has the gall to punch the entire PC community in the face by going after mods. OpenIV was issued a cease and desist shutting the beloved service down for a period.To be fair to the game itself the singleplayer is amazing and the gameplay itself enjoyable. Like other GTA games the amount of fun from running around in the sandbox was enough in my opinion to warrent the purchasse. Unfortunately the online portion of the game is where it suffers. The overall community is a cluster of the worst people you can find playing online games. This is made even worse by the newer updates that have encouraged negative behavior by rewarding players who ruin others fun. The online was never meant to serve the players that much is clear and was clear early on. On the long list of reasons I would say to avoid this game going after singleplayer mods takes the cake. Zelnick is a greedy little man who has more in common with a bank vault than a human being. For this reason I can no longer justify purchasing anything from Rockstar due to the actions of the publisher that contuines to show EA and Ubisoft are saints when compared to publishers that are actually evil.Even updating to refect having OpenIV back up I still cannot recommend due to the actions of Take Two. I just can't see that as okay in any fashion reguardless of the eventuality that was the tool being restored.

review: Rockstar and Take Two suddenly decided to ban all mods from the game. While I dont play the game with mods myself this is definately NOT okay and should be considered a very ominous move on the developers behalf. Mods keeps games alive and interesting and good mod support as the biggest strength of countless games.Would Skyrim still be played as much if not because of the countless mods it has? Definately not. Rockstar is moving on risky ground here and we should do what we can to make them realize their stupidity and force them back onto the right track.Also the mod was banned on false grounds. The statement says it allowed players to mod the online experience while the mod never supported online features and actively BLOCKS you from entering online mode if the mod is installed. And the online servers are still full of hackers just like always so this did exactly NOTHING to reduce the amount of cheating in online and thus the only people losing here are the modders and the users of them.Rockstar you greatly dissappoint me _

review: Boring "whack a mole" style third person shooter gameplay coupled with an uninteresting story staring 3 of the worst protagonists in GTA's history. Nearly all the cars handle and drive the same your character stats barely even make a difference and the guns function similarly. Don't even get me started on the awful wanted system omniscient cops that will start chasing you even if you're sneaky cop cars/helicopters popping up on the minimap out of nowhere it takes way too long to lose a wanted level. Ultimately the world is very boring and there's little to do besides crappy minigames. Good luck having fun when your character has almost no health and cops will chase you with little provacation(fixed by mods though).

The map has become severely overcrowded and even trying to connect to a server on a good connection can be a half hour long struggle. I'd recommend this game but due to the cracks that've opened up in GTA Online it mostly outweighs the positives of offline mode.

review: This game has a lot to bring to gamers so I'm going to make this in depth review of Grand Theft Auto V so just sit back and see if it will relate to you.Game modesGrand Theft Auto has a lot to bring with modes as they have team deathmatch races but every so often in updates they will add a new mode with a new map which helps this game out in the online department talk about about Online. The online multiplayer for this game is quite fun as you can go along robbing stores racing about in your brand new sports car or you can do whatever you can imagine. The main game mode that I would recommend is heists as they have a lot of story to them but the main reason people play them is probably the money as it goves you thousands of dollars to spend.Online free roamThe free roam aspect is good you have many options on what vehicle you want to use or what type of home you want to have. The free roam experience is quite nice the game is very pretty and has many sight like the hills and a lot of things.In free roam the best thing to do is drive your luxury sports car and gloat to all your friends how you spent all your time farming money to buy a million dollar sports car. StoryThe story is fantastic as it has a lot of drama and action the first levels are you playing as Franklin driving around and escaping people. The story introduces 3 new characters Michael Franklin and Trevor which incorporates a lot of characters and they each have different personalities.Trevor absolute psychoMichael Miserable bastardFranklin Lives in the hood smokes weed. IdolOverallThis game is amazing apart from a few gripes with how you need quite good hardware to run it along with some bugs and stuff I think anyone could enjoy this game unless they play on a toaster.

review: This game is fun for a while I've certainly had some great moments with it but the devs do not care about the community one bit. Online is filled with hackers at all times and is a total grindfest to get anywhere of interest without paying real money to get cash in game. Singleplayer is great but there's content that should be accessible (like specific vehicles) which is only available in online. Then Take Two decided to pull the plug on modding by cease and desisting the most common base mod. Modding is the lifeblood of gaming it shows people have legitimate interest in a game and in making it better removing mods just tells the player that their contributions to the community aren't wanted and that the game despite some big flaws is perfect as is.Take the STALKER series for example. If those games had zero mod support they would likely have died long ago due to rampant technical issues/bugs alone but today they are rising cult classics with hundreds of mods that can completely change the game. These are diamonds in the rough. GTA V is arguably a very well cut gem by comparison but nothing is perfect and everyone has their own vision of how to add something that would complete an experience for them. Denying that expression is wrong.

review: There was a time when GTA 5 was fun. Then Rockstar's greed killed it. You can't do anything in this game without paying and everything is extremely overpriced. It is impossible to get in game money without buying Shark Cards. This game is pay to win and pay to enjoy.The hackers in online mode are out of control. Rockstar can't even set up a proper anti cheat system. I will admit that I had a mod menu but only to give myself money because I wasn't going to let Rockstar scam me. I didn't abuse my mods but everyone else abuses theirs. They seriously need to be dealt with.Singleplayer is probably the only decent part about this game but it gets old after a while. You could mod it to get more fun out of it unless they ban singleplayer mods again. In the end this game is garbage. Not worth the money and trouble. If you must buy it get it on sale like I did.

review: Take Two Interactive not only sent private investigators to a modder's home but sent a Cease + Desist on the backbone script extender mod that was used to be able to mod both GTA IV and V because people used it to play singleplayer (where there has been no new content since the game released) instead of multiplayer. They actively want to push you onto the boring MP so that they can force more microtransactions and heists down your throat and pull your wallet out of your esophagus. For the longest time Take Two has been anti consumer. From actively preventing mods to overpricing games (and extra so for Australia!) to withholding key features that make a game whole and complete to then sell you back at $40 a pop (looking at you Civilization...). Even if they withdraw this Cease and desist I will NEVER buy another 2K game so long as I live.And to Take Two Maybe you should take a second look at yourselves.Edit on July 8th It came to my attention that they lifted the Cease + Desist on OpenIV due to community outcry. Which is good. But there was something my mother always used to say "A tiger can't change it's stripes." I still do not trust Take Two one bit.

review: completely inferior to gta 4 story is not as good as the other games map is very small online is a grind unless you pay for shark cards rockstar does not actually care about modders they only care about banning money droppers (i am not even joking) shorter story than the previous games matchmaking is terrible takes forever to actually load in (unless you have a beast pc) no military response at 5 stars highest heat level is 5 stars not 6 stars like the previous games the reason why we did not get read dead redemption 2 back in 2016 less interiors than the other games neither do the slight rpg elements from san andreas or the amazing physics/game mechanics from gta 4 return in this game at one point modding in this game was illegal trash soundtrack radio selection not as good as the previous games (especially gta 4) most of the interiors were cut from singleplayer and put into online (basically a "sqrew you" to people who prefer the singleplayer rather than the multiplayer) modding in singleplayer can get you banned cant hang out with friends at food joints bars comedy clubs bowling alleys etcin conclusion if you are going to make a game with a giant budget in one of gamings most known franchises can you please not make it worst than the previous games its very sad since rockstar had more time to develop this game (this is including time they were given to add this stuff into the next gen versions of the game) than gta 4 yet gta 4 had more player freedom and better physics its honestly quite sad since most kids that play games on the current gen consoles have probably never experienced red dead redemption or the other classic rockstar games this might be the only experience they have had with a rockstar game which just makes me feel bad for them that they only played this mess of a game instead of the other masterpieces this company has crafted4/10

review: I've been playing this when it first released on the PS3/Xbox 360.The game has gotten far since we first saw the reveal trailer back in November 2011 to now.First let me just say this TL DR GTAV is Great Game GTA Online is not.Grand Theft Auto V is a perfect game. Great story gameplay and graphics. Hell I played the Story over 6 times. Totally recommend 110%Grand Theft Auto Online however is a different story. Back in 2013 it was just a better online mode that was in every way better than Grand Theft Auto IV's. Granted it was buggy but it worked...we got the Beach Bum pack and it was heading in the right direction. All the content was free and it was a test dlc as you will. Future DLC didnt follow this such as the later Business update but the prices were fair. Many DLC's later they discovered SHARK cards....these is when they become greedy. Look I get having free content post launch requires some form of Microtransaction but this is just stright up ridiculous. The inflation is so insane online (i.e. An old 2 piece suit would cost $2000 as a newly added one would cost $100k). They add ways to make "money" but its practically nothing and they add BS cooldowns and ways to make it more difficult and tedious. Rockstar and Take Two have just gotten so greedy almost as Greedy as PUBG. Now with this said that dosen't mean you cant have fun with the game. Racing is fun Missions are a blast with friends Heists and Free Roam. I enjoy Online and I will continue to play it but they need to fix the economy it.I am also very upset that they just abandoned the Single Player aspect of the game in focus of Online...hopefully Red Read Redemtion 2 and the next upcoming GTA wont follow in this path.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

From going on a Yacht to racing around the city there is a lot to do in this game and it is still getting better.

review: I've put many hours in Grand Theft Auto 5 with only about 50 of those hours being purely vanilla. I would've abandoned this game long ago if it weren't for the extremely active (and surprisingly very high quality) modding community surrounding it. Take Two's decision to cease and desist the most popular modding utitlity for the rage games has absolutely neutered their audience. This action will not only hurt Take Two's (and unfortunately Rockstar's) appearance but will absolutely destroy revenue generated by people purchasing these games with only the intent to mod them. If you're one of the few that has yet to purchase Grand Theft Auto 5 I would hold off purely to send a message to Take Two that this arbitrary stance on software modification is unacceptable. FYI everyone and their grandmother that has this game downloaded has a copy of OpenIV installed. Ask around and you're sure to find a copy.

review: The quality of the game suffered all because of Shark Cards instead of enjoying the online in public lobbies you are met with people who cheat drop money and have everything you don't. GTA Online is a grind fest unless you have the money to buy extra shark cards or have someone drop money for you. RockStar is a joke when it comes to policing this their main focus is releasing "free missions" and expensives cars so they can milk more money out of you. Main reason I bought this game was for the single player which is actually good.Plus with the recent stance Take Two is taking against mods is absurd. Its one way to say you to the mod community. I could understand if some people are abusing the mod in order to gain benefits online play but Rockstar could deal with it if they put the effort in but again it all comes down to what effects the sales of shark cards which is idiotic. Overall GTA Online is a cash grab and single player is great.
